hints.mnemonic: This is obviously a flower sprouting from a rice field, and means "rice seedling" in Japanese. My problem is keeping this kanji distinct from 圥, which Heisig dubs the "rice seedling" primitive (see land (#1513 陸) ff.). It might help to keep in mind that 圥 is a rare kanji (not used in Japanese) meaning "mushroom," so I will call 圥 the "mushroom seedling".

hints.author: cmayernik
hints.mnemonic: All the flowers in the field started as seedlings.

hints.author: Chocobonstrife
hints.mnemonic: Pikmin have FLOWERS growing out of their seedling BRAINS.

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: When your wife's LEGs get huge hairs on them it is surely a bad portent for things to come.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: A bad portent makes the hairs on your legs stand.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Two persons turning their backs is a bad sign. Hint

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The actual derivation of this Kanji is a pictograph of the cracks on a heated turtle shell which was used in divination. The way the cracks occur on this turtle are a portent of evil bad luck.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: To me it looks like a "black angel" or something (four wings and its human-looking legs). Maybe seeing it is a bad portent?

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The pits of a peach tree look like turtles.

hints.author: JetSetArnett
hints.mnemonic: King Koopa consistently captures Princess Peach. Eventually he's going to run out of castles and just set her in a tree.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: If you gave the meaning "a person's back" to the primitive in portent (#235 兆), you can easily discover that a peach tree is the tree with butt-shaped fruits.

hints.author: jettyke
hints.mnemonic: If you used the story about hairy woman´s legs for portent, then

hints.author: sutebun
hints.mnemonic: It's a little known fact, but when the ninja turtles were young Splinter actually made them follow rigid diet. Those turtles actually ate nothing but peaches. In fact, the turtles even planted a peach tree in their hideout not only to decorate the place with a tree, but because they were eating nothing but peaches.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Sauron's One fiery eye stare at Frodo and it is a sign of portent. Evil will become whomever the eye is staring upon.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: People stared, eyes wide, at the girl in the bathing suit - she had extremely hairy legs!

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: You lost a staring contest with a turtle because you blinked your eye before he did. (The contest wasn't fair, because turtles have nictitating membranes, and don't need to blink so often.) Eye comes first, because stare is most associated with eyes. And compare with challenge (#658 挑) where this same obstreperous turtle challenges you to a finger wrestling contest. (Sibyl's story with some notes that helped me).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: If you gave the sense "a person's back" to the primitive in portent (#235 兆), you can easily discover an old-man staring at a good-looking girl

hints.author: kaminix
hints.mnemonic: Litterally this kanji reads "eye of portent". Imagine an old lady starring into the crystal sphere trying to portend the future.

hints.author: LucidFaia
hints.mnemonic: A large dog, dripping drool.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: If we remember large (#107 大) as a man with his arms outstretched, the drop represents man's best friend - a dog.

hints.author: basch2020
hints.mnemonic: An average dog is made to look like a little drop next to a St Bernard.

hints.author: Christine_Tham
hints.mnemonic: A LARGE ST. BERNARD DOG with a DROP of saliva.

hints.author: cryonic
hints.mnemonic: I don't know why not one single person before me has seemingly thought of this, but when I first encountered this character, it just seemed SO natural for me. It looks just exactly like a guy throwing a stick for his DOG to bring it back to him. Or am I really the only one seeing this picture?

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: It was left to the turtle to make right with the dog and thus maintain the status quo..

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A turtle mounting a chihuahua clearly disrupts the status quo.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: After beating the hare in a race, the turtle is now acknowledged to be the fastest animal. But the chihuahua is challenging the status quo, demanding a new race. And look - the dog is on the right, meaning he's passed the turtle! Hope he doesn't take a nap.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: If you gave the sense "a person's back" to the primitive in portent (#235 兆), you can see that a dog, wanting to preserve its status quo among its pals, tries to bite the back of a poor postman.

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: The STATUS QUO was broken when the TURTLE and the DOG got married! You should have see the offspring... Dogs with shells on!!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The computer won't stop beeping, which is making the chihauhua bark, and it's driving this guy insane. The only solution he can come up with is to throw them both on the fire and finally enjoy the silence.

hints.author: Wakela
hints.mnemonic: Your neighbor is so sick of you playing Led Zeppelin that he takes your copy of the song Black Dog and burns it. Finally, silence in the neighborhood.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: A scene of calm SILENC

hints.author: kalamies
hints.mnemonic: Silence is a paramount for any black ninja dog.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: HINT

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Flesh of a dog over a cooking fire = "hotdog". There are all sorts of things in hot dogs. Believe me, you don't want to know what sort of things . Visualize the hotdog curling as it cooks, to remember the unusual way the flesh primitive curves in this kanji. (tweaked version of ziggr's. Thanks!).

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: There are all sorts of things in hot dogs. (I use hot dog for this primitive (meat of a dog over a cooking fire). I swear I can actually see the 月 here as a hot dog, with its slight curve and grill marks.).

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: Putting the flesh of a dog on a fire is the sort of thing that will get you arrested.

hints.author: vxnine
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the flesh of a dog roasting OVER a fire. Gross. I'd never want to eat that sort of thing.

hints.author: Sonofswin
hints.mnemonic: The moon in the evening is the sort of thing that makes a dog howl as if on fire.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: REEDS are the only FLOWERS that WILD DOGS like to FIRE up and smoke while they are playing poker.

hints.author: sindhikara
hints.mnemonic: A reed is a flower that looks like a hot dog.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Picture a Gary Larson cartoon of a pack of dogs sitting around a campfire. They misunderstood something they overheard, and can't understand why they're not getting high smoking reed. In the kanji, you can actually see the dog smoking the reed in a crack pipe held over the fire. (Thanks, chamcham!).

hints.author: snagger
hints.mnemonic: Reeds

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: pack of dogs hanging out by the fire smoking reed flowers.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Actually when hunting it may be a good idea to use a pack of dogs as your personal guard.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: After a pack of wild dogs hunt some food, they will guard it fiercely.

hints.author: tstuhldreher
hints.mnemonic: In every prison escape movie, the hunt for the escapees involves a pack of WILD DOGS unleashed by the GUARDS.

hints.author: samesong
hints.mnemonic: In Duck Hunt, that dog is damned lucky the game protects him, or I'd shot him by now.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: Imagine

hints.author: Christine_Tham
hints.mnemonic: The cat hid in the FLOWERS of the FIELD from the WILD DOGs.

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: Dawgs always wanna put their seedlings in pussies.

hints.author: Kvaien
hints.mnemonic: It looks like a cat. The flowers are the ears, the field is the face, and the dog is the tail.

hints.author: srothroc
hints.mnemonic: Packs of wild dogs will chase a cat through flowers and fields.

hints.author: jezerey
hints.mnemonic: The crafty cat hid from the pack of dogs among the seedlings.

hints.author: Georgi87
hints.mnemonic: A cow tried to climb up a vermilion tree, but in doing so, it broke its two bottom branches off.

hints.author: dannyfartmaxwell
hints.mnemonic: Mooooooooooooooooooo!!!!

hints.author: LoneDeranger
hints.mnemonic: A cow bleeds vermilion when you cut off two of it's legs.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: No matter how many times you roll over the cow with a steam-roller, it will still be two strokes short of looking as vivid red as vermillion pigment.

hints.author: Silwing
hints.mnemonic: This is a cow... Cow - How you say? Imagine a cow which has just been run over by a steamroller. Now you see, the head to one side, four legs and the tail backwards. Yes that is indeed a cow.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: Think of not special people, but special animals. The sacred Hindu cows are special - they can wander around the temple without fear of becoming roast beef.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The Church Lady is traveling through Japan and notices with distaste a sacred cow relieving itself inside a Buddhist Temple. "Well, isn't that special".

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: Cows at a Buddhist temple are special - they are holy cows! Sadly a few days later I find the same cows' meat on special at the supermarket. Holy Cow, what have we done!?

hints.author: Dualta
hints.mnemonic: Cows are special when left in temples.

hints.author: thegreatkaizo
hints.mnemonic: Mixing up Hinduism and Buddhism, the cow ended up as today's special at the Buddhist temple.

hints.author: pageturner1988
hints.mnemonic: The revelation makes the cow's mouth drop down, "Hamburgers are made of what?!".

hints.author: Ningen
hints.mnemonic: In ancient times, the words from a primitive cow's mouth were considered a REVELATION because they were the "udder truth.".

hints.author: Christine_Tham
hints.mnemonic: When you get a revelation, you may drop to the ground with your mouth wide open.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Ask an enlightened Zen monk for a single word of revelation, then go and ask any cow for the same thing. You"ll probably get the same answer-- "Muuuuu!" Spiritual revelation coming out of the mouth of a cow.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The revelation makes the cow's mouth drop open. "Hamburgers are made of what?" Think of a Gary Larson cartoon. (Slight tweak of pageturner's).

hints.author: gaijinda
hints.mnemonic: I've never seen a cow with human legs before!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Nasty story but it keeps the meaning true to the kanji. "BEFORE you stick it in a COW and SPREAD the legs (the bottom stroke of this cow looks like two legs) make sure she has HUMAN LEGS"-------------sorry, I'll remove if I get enough reports, but will keep if I get more stars.

hints.author: LorenPaul
hints.mnemonic: Before Human Beings Existed.. Minotaurs Ruled The Earth! Their Top Half A Cow And Their Bottom Half Human Legs! Also

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: I've never seen a cow with human legs before! (from gaijinda) I keep mixing this up with in front (#290 前). Remember that before sounds like "beef or", so it must be the one with the cow in it.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, you always wash with water from the shower before you enter the bathtub.

hints.author: undershaft
hints.mnemonic: You wash things with WATER to get them back to the clean state they were in BEFORE.

hints.author: stephjapan2004
hints.mnemonic: WASH with WATER BEFORE doing anything.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: You need water before you can wash.

hints.author: Melamelachan
hints.mnemonic: In 1525, the city of Salzburg was occupied. Legend has it that there was nothing left to eat, except for one cow. To trick the occupying forces, people would paint the cow, and send a human (with human legs) and the cow out for a walk, clearly visible to the enemies. Then, they would use some water to wash the cow and paint it with a different colour and so on. Seeing there were still plenty of cows left, the occupiers finally gave up. The people of Salzburg are still called cow-washers.

hints.author: LucidFaia
hints.mnemonic: The two strokes at the bottom look like a J and I, which stands for "jammed in.".

hints.author: alkulp
hints.mnemonic: Two people jammed in under an umbrella. A woman with a dress and a man (straight). It's always me that ends up getting wet.... but the tail of the skirt is this time!

hints.author: Yozora
hints.mnemonic: J and I are "Jammed Into" an UMBRELLA.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The beach umbrella is jammed into the sand using two poles instead of one, so it's extra steady. I was a little rough though so I accidentally bent one of them.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 介する 【かいする】 (vs-s,vt) (1) (See を介して ) to use as an intermediary; to mediate; to assist; (2) to worry; to mind; to care. STORY

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: One Japanese farmer I know is so small minded that he thinks the entire world is JAMMED IN the borders of his little RICE FIELD.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: A famous philosopher once said that his world consisted of all the things he could jam into his brain.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: If you fit everyone in the world into a rice field, they would be pretty jammed in.

hints.author: tsenita
hints.mnemonic: The world is just one big ol' RICE FIELD with billions of people JAMMED IN.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: This is a pictograph of a MISS WORLD. She was the only contestant with a BRAIN, and the curved stroke is her bent leg (think curtsy) or her sweeping elegant dress.

hints.author: wreckz
hints.mnemonic: Some people think drinking tea is boring and quaint. That's why I spice mine up by adding a cocktail umbrella, which of course is made from a wood-en toothpick supporting a paper umbrella with flowers printed on top.

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: When I drink herbal tea I like to drink it under a parasol. If it's too hot I go "ho, ho, ho !!" (katakana ホ).

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: Tea is made from flowers dried under a canopy held up with wooden poles.

hints.author: activeaero
hints.mnemonic: The "flowers" of the "umbrella tree" make the best TEA.

hints.author: ChieShorts
hints.mnemonic: That sexy ho (ホ) under the flowery umbrella is just my cup of tea.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: "Look", says the teacher in biology class. "The spinal column holds your flesh together, just like the metal rod of this umbrella (he demonstrates this with an umbrella covered in I-Ching symbols) holds the umbrella together".

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: A pictograph of a spinal column. The umbrella representing the shoulder blades, the I Ching as the shoulder muscles and the part of the body as the spine itself.

hints.author: FutureBlues
hints.mnemonic: The spinal column functions in the same way the rod does in an umbrella... To hold one's umbrella of flesh together, much like the I Ching does for the universe.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: In a horrific accident, a body part got jammed in the grill of my car

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: When my Korean girlfriend (from the I CHING symbols on the Korean flag) stands under an UMBRELLA and stretches her BODY, you can see the outline of her spinal column.

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: I wouldn't mind a meeting of mouths with her, she's really fit !

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: He had such a big mouth that he could easily fit one whole umbrella in it.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: Meeting of mouths! We fit together so well, darling ;).

hints.author: kendobc
hints.mnemonic: This umbrella is so small you can only fit one mouth under it (one person).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Only one mouth can fit under an umbrella. (If you don't believe me try to fit two and see how they will get wet.).

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: In order to build a pagoda in this small Japanese garden everything has to fit

hints.author: xeyes
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph-o-rama. This is a corner of a Japanese garden, with a small mound of soil on the left, and a little concrete pagoda in the front with flowers behind it. (To my eye, the fit looks a lot like a little pagoda anyway. This may or may not cause confusion for you, though...).

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: The ground next to the pagoda could barely fit all the flowers the empress wanted planted.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: Thankfully I was in a pagoda when I, ummm, soiled myself, the flowers covered up the smell and the mess fit out one of the holes in the side while no one was watching...

hints.author: Yasser
hints.mnemonic: A pagoda is a place of harmony in Japan. This means that even the "soil" where "flowers" are planted must "fit" together (good for remembering the order of writing).

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: To be king you have to be a real crafty one !

hints.author: negreality
hints.mnemonic: A King is one（ 一 ） who rules over the land （ 土 soil）.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: The king unites heaven and earth. (imagine heaven being the top line over the soil).

hints.author: nwatkins
hints.mnemonic: Everyone made fun the king because the end of his scepter had three pancakes on it.

hints.author: salokin
hints.mnemonic: In a card game, king is 13 ( 十 and 三 ) together. i.e. queen is 12, jack is 11....

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...and he hangs left! (I always screw up the direction of the "drop").

hints.author: indiana23
hints.mnemonic: I can tell you that there is only one thing that Japanese people think when they see this Kanji, and that's BALLS(no joke). Kintama, or gold balls, means testicles. Funny story, we met a European girl not to long ago who had this as a tattoo, and she thought it actually meant JEWEL. But as I said, the Japanese guys wanted to know why she liked BALLS so much. lol (True Story).

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Only Kings can poop jewels.

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: King dropped his pants to reveal his jewel.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: On treasure island is a single house - where all the  jewels are stored.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: Put a "roof" (lid) on your jewels and voila! You've got a treasure chest.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: I have treasure

hints.author: noushina
hints.mnemonic: If Wealth and Savings aren't confusing enough, we now add Treasure. They all have House. Savings account had a nail and a shell. While Wealthy had the Wealth primitive in it. In this case, our Treasure is a HOUSE full of JEWELS.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: The treasure chest houses the jewels.

hints.author: Christoph
hints.mnemonic: The king of the Oysters produces special Vermillion pearls!

hints.author: quety101
hints.mnemonic: King Vermillion is a little queer and likes to wear pearl necklaces.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Usually pearls are white, or black. Only a very rare, very expensive pearl is vermillion colored. Such a pearl would be fit for a king.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: The king made everyone turn a bright shade of vermilion when he showed up wearing a PEARL necklace. (Tweaked for positioning purposes. Thanks ngoli1).

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: I gave the princess a pearl necklace and the king (#255 王) turned a bright shade of vermilion (#221 朱) when he saw it on her.

hints.author: mimiko
hints.mnemonic: The KING ... can SEE clearly the PRESENT state of affairs in the land. (maybe he hees them in the crystal ball on the left?).

hints.author: indigo
hints.mnemonic: Hey, I want my money back! This crystal ball is out of order, I can see the present instead of the future!

hints.author: lmcrtk
hints.mnemonic: Many people claim that Elvis (The KING) has been SEEN walking around in the PRESENT.

hints.author: lucianreign
hints.mnemonic: The king came...the king saw...thus, the king was present.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The palintir shows only what's happening NOW - the present - to the all-seeing eye of Sauron. Unfortunate overlap of keywords. I sometimes write 贈 presents (#503 贈) when given this keyword for review.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The ball was the only thing that people at the beginning of time had to use as a toy. Poor cavemen.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Even the king played with toys in the beginning.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: And so it was, the ball marked the beginning of all the toys that were to come.

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: 玩 depicts one of the most ancient TOYs known to mankind

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Mnemonic "toy boy" - From the days of the garden of eden boys have used their balls as toys.

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: Oh no ! A pack of dogs has bitten the king. He has turned into a rabid lunatic !

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Think of King Nebuchadnezzar, who for 7 years lost his sanity and had to live like a wild animal.

hints.author: Jaunty
hints.mnemonic: The wild dog king (Red XIII) had an awesome limit break - Lunatic High!

hints.author: jonobugs
hints.mnemonic: Only a lunatic would use a wild pack of dogs to protect the king.

hints.author: atomiton
hints.mnemonic: The Dog king was a lunatic. In fact, he was a laughing hyena. Use the lunatic hyena(dog) in the Lion King if it helps.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The Sun King (Louis XIV) was known for his effulgent reign.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+katsuo] This is the Sun King. Sayeth Wikipedia

hints.author: Woodsei
hints.mnemonic: The sun is the effulgent king of stars.

hints.author: montecristo73
hints.mnemonic: The sun is the king of effulgent bodies in the sky.

hints.author: amillerchip
hints.mnemonic: Eeffulgent? I'll never remember that. Renaming this full of vigor. The king always started the day full of vigor, ready to rule his kingdom like the nobles of old.

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: Ancient Rome had Emperors instead of Kings, and they wore white robes. Thus an emperor is a king in white. (make sure you picture a roman emperor not a japanese one and you'll be ok).

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: I don't think the Japanese would be happy if their emperor was a white king...

hints.author: lucianreign
hints.mnemonic: The white dove descended on the king and he was promoted to emperor.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: An emperor is a holy king. In Japanese Shinto white is the holiest color.

hints.author: vxnine
hints.mnemonic: Whenever I think an Emperor I always think of Emperor Palpatine from Star Wars. He is the king of all the white stormtroopers.

hints.author: Georgi87
hints.mnemonic: The mouth of the king is displaying his bling.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: What a pathetic display! The king is sprawled on his throne, head back and mouth wide open, fast asleep. We should never have let him drink so much at that banquet last night.

hints.author: jezerey
hints.mnemonic: The mouth of the king displayed what a fool he was.

hints.author: Twentytw0
hints.mnemonic: Think of an evil museum that displays the mouths of the previous dead kings. Imagine the tour guide dressed up in sinister clothing saying, "And on display here, we have the mouth of King Henry VIII".

hints.author: thatkidpercy
hints.mnemonic: The original court jesters had a terrible job, if the king's mouth yawned during your DISPLAY, it was the end of you.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The fat king hogs the whole space under his umbrella. (tweaked version of radical tyro's story. "fat" makes a more vivid image for me.).

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The king takes up the whole space under his umbrella.

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: King Arthur united the whole of England under his umbrella. (The umbrella methophore works pretty good here, due to England's miserable weather).

hints.author: baldy514
hints.mnemonic: You need a king sized umbrella to keep your whole body dry.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This is similar to radical_tyro's story, but has a few points that help me. Whenever it rains, the king hogs the whole umbrella, and we can't do anything about it (because, after all, he is the king).

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The fat king under his umbrella offers useless advice to the workers. "You'll need the whole tree to plug that gap". Imagine a grossly fat, incompetent king under a parasol giving annoying advice to sweating workers who know what they're doing. (I always have trouble bringing up the "whole" primitive. This story reminds me how to build that part. ).

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: To plug the hole, you need to use a whole piece of wood - like a cork or something.

hints.author: wreckz
hints.mnemonic: Best example of a plug is a cork. A piece of wood that covers the whole opening (else it would leak).

hints.author: Jared
hints.mnemonic: Trees and umbrellas are some king sized butt plugs. Ouch.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: To plug the hole in the dam, use the whole damn tree.

hints.author: Birdsong
hints.mnemonic: The king of LOGIC is the computer.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: Computers are ruled by logic (it is the king of computers).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: If you used the meaning "House of the Parents" for ri (#173 里), you will know then that, as logic dictates, the King must rule on his own Kingdom (the House of his Parents).

hints.author: fjolnir
hints.mnemonic: The king of logic is the computer!

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: LOGIC reigns king at my parent's house = no bullshitting my wise mom or dad with silly stories!

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: A lord is a little drop down from King in hierarchy.

hints.author: Spoonz
hints.mnemonic: A lord only has a drop of the king's power.

hints.author: Murjab
hints.mnemonic: Although this kanji's meaning hasn't caused me much trouble, I've had problems remembering the direction of the drop above king, since drops at tops of kanji often seem to appear in different directions. To remember this one, I think of the placement of the drop in jewel (#256 玉). Both of them use the king primitive and include a short drop stroke going from the top left to bottom right.

hints.author: trevlaw
hints.mnemonic: Oh lord! someone spat on the king.

hints.author: MidoriTori
hints.mnemonic: The lord wants to DROP something on the KING'S head so he can become king himself.

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: Visualize an idiot trying to figure out how to extinguish a candle. He sees a glass of WATER and decides to pour it onto the CANDLESTICK to put it out. Water spills everywhere.

hints.author: Calchas
hints.mnemonic: Like water the hot wax poured down the side of the candlestick.

hints.author: pgp27
hints.mnemonic: "WATER, my LORD ? I'll pour".

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: When you pour you are the water lord.

hints.author: Guoguodi
hints.mnemonic: The lord always pours for the king.

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: The main pillar in a house should be made of the biggest and strongest tree - the lord of the trees.

hints.author: potempkin
hints.mnemonic: "Why has this pillar been carved in the shape of a giant penis?!" "You said that 'it should be made of wood', My Lord.".

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: "Wood Lord, what a pillar!", she said.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: This wooden pillar is like the lord of the house... (remove it and the whole house will collapse).

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a pillar that looks like a huge kingly candlestick with a flame at the top, that is leaning to the left about to set a tree next to it on fire.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The fat king taking up the whole space under the umbrella actually isn't fat - he just has two big gold bars hidden under his clothes.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: Under the umbrella's shade, the king sang, " Drop it to the left, drop it to the right, give me all the GOLD in sight!".

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: The king (#255 王) walks under the umbrella with a bag of gold on both side.

hints.author: namakemono
hints.mnemonic: King Midas shelters from the rain under his umbrella. Every now and again he reaches out with his hands to turn a couple of raindrops into gold, and puts them in his pockets.

hints.author: hugh2323
hints.mnemonic: Give me two DROPS of gold and I will give you my WHOLE body.

hints.author: wzafran
hints.mnemonic: Pig iron is basic/crude metal, that is, before it has been processed.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Pig-iron is crude metal ( 金 ) before ( 先 ) it is refined. If you have trouble with this character, envision a big minotaur (cow head with human legs) as a blacksmith, smelting metals and making swords for war.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: 100% of Japanese university graduates claim to have never seen this character, so impress them by remembering it, Pig-iron is metal before it has been processed. (Just a copy of the most common used story but with this little fact added, really impress your japanese friends or teachers by learning this one).

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: PIG-IRON is the condition of IRON BEFORE it has been processed.

hints.author: Lazerbeat
hints.mnemonic: GOLD BEFORE an alchemist touches it is pig iron.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: This is the BOWL of an alchemist

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: If I was begging with a BOWL, I would want GOLD and BOOKS.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: I actually picture a book made of gold that's been warped (due to the malleability of gold) so that it has a dent in the middle that can be used as a bowl.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: This is a great way to learn a lot of knowledge in a little bit of time. You get a metal bowl and throw in as many books as you can! Keep'em coming! Once you have every book you can think of that you have read or want to read in that bowl grind'em all up!

hints.author: applesuki
hints.mnemonic: The winners of the super bowl get gold rings, while the losers just get a mention in the record book.

hints.author: kaminix
hints.mnemonic: I can't believe no one has used this one yet

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Copper is an excellent conductor. In other words, it's a metal for which the voltage is the same everywhere. That's why it's used for wires.

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: A metal that looks the same as gold is COPPER.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Copper and gold are in the same column of the periodic table. And now what am I going to do for 銀 silver (#1459 銀)????

hints.author: Sevenhelmets
hints.mnemonic: Copper is a metal, the same as gold.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: All the people that go to the Japanese festivals to catch fish part time are suckers. Me? I'm a pro. I bring a big-ass golden ladle. I'm a true ANGLING professional.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: The easiest angling is pulling goldfish out with a big ladle.

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: Imagine an effeminate Roman 2000 years ago angling with a golden ladle instead of a rod because it matches his eyes and hair better and it impresses the boys. (Why a Roman? Because 'angling' is just the roman-derived way to say 'fishing' - use this to distinguish fishing from angling.).

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: Angling is not fishing (avoid fishing (#172 漁)). It is the art of bending golden ladles into lures which which you catch the fish. But the fish aren't that important (and do not appear in this kanji). only the golden ladle matters.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: I use a gold ladle when I'm angling, the golden reflection in the water draws the fish straight to it, who needs a hook and bait when you have this!

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: Remember the story of the needle in the haystack. Why would someone even look for a needle if it wasn't a GOLD NEEDLE?

hints.author: sprutnik
hints.mnemonic: A golden needle is worth ten times more than an ordinary needle.

hints.author: sutebun
hints.mnemonic: The golden needle is the true needle.

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Needles need to be metal (or they'll break).

hints.author: Spoonz
hints.mnemonic: Final fantasy reference! If you've been petrified by one of those damned monsters, get a team mate to use a golden needle on you!

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: A piece of metal with a name on it. Well, this is basically the definition of inscription.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: I imagine ancient Egyptian inscriptions

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: The gold ring I gave her had an old girlfriend's name written inside. Here's hoping she doesn't notice the inscription.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: INSCRIPTIONS are done on GOLD plaques by writing your NAME on it.

hints.author: skellyfish
hints.mnemonic: If you've got some METAL and you want to put a NAME on it, you've got no choice but to use an inscription - everything else will rub off or fail to stick in the first place. (Imagine a bunch of people trying to write on metal with pencils, pens, etc. and then one guy with a Eureka moment thinking of inscription).

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: Tranquilize - using a metal syringe to get the truth.

hints.author: tomusan
hints.mnemonic: Enough gold can tranquilize the truth in anyone.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: James Bond was tranquilized by Goldfinger before trying to get the truth out of him. Picture James Bond waking up on the table with the laser.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: No need to tranquilize... enough gold will get the truth out of anyone.

hints.author: viphe
hints.mnemonic: To tranquilize your wife, you give her either gold or the truth.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: When we go out on the ROAD-WAY, we often risk our own necks (that's why I take the train! ).

hints.author: whistler11
hints.mnemonic: Watch as a villianous fiend stretches a poor damsel's neck over a dusty road. Her ear pressed to the ground, she can hear the rumble of a carriage thundering down the roadway. Will the hero save her in time? Or will her neck be ground into the road, spilling it's precious contents into the dust?

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Good keyword selection by Heisig

hints.author: kaminix
hints.mnemonic: I have a very abstract view for this one. Remember when the kanji for neck (#70 首) was first introduced to us it was compared to a great moose head, cut off by it's neck and hung on the wall? As we all know, mooses have very long necks; if you imagine widening and stretching it a little you'll probably be able to picture yourself taking a stroll on the hairy 'neck-road-way' of the moose. It's a very abstract mnemonic, but I swear, I was not high when coming up with it!

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: You're going to break your neck on the road way!

hints.author: jez321
hints.mnemonic: For guidance on the road-way, glue a GPS unit to your car.

hints.author: cosby
hints.mnemonic: Good guidance will help you stay glued to the right path.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: I will glue myself to this roadway before I go to an all guy dance (guy dance = guidance

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: In his quest, our hero comes to a river of glue that he cannot cross. Desperate, he prays for guidance, and a roadway magically appears over the glue.

hints.author: alatown
hints.mnemonic: His guidance was simple

hints.author: aevangelica
hints.mnemonic: Cross-road.

hints.author: tanaquil
hints.mnemonic: This kanji appears in the remarkable compound, 辻斬り 【つじぎり】 (n)

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: A crossing is where the ROAD makes a CROSS with another road. Easy.

hints.author: vinniram
hints.mnemonic: Why is there an extra drop on this website, but in the book there is no extra drop?

hints.author: hotkiller123
hints.mnemonic: Cross-road --> CROSSING The extra drop is a drop of blood on the road because of the many accidents that happen there. (Addition to aevangelica's story to explain the extra drop.).

hints.author: jezerey
hints.mnemonic: The car went too swiftly through the crossing and was hooked by the cops.

hints.author: mbagsh55
hints.mnemonic: In the Heisig version of Frogger, you can image ten giant fish hooks sweeping across the road, with our hapless hero 'froggy' forced to make a swift crossing or end up as fish bait.

hints.author: KANJI
hints.mnemonic: Indy Jones imperative

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: If you spread fishguts all over a crossing, people will definitely want to cross over it very swiftly to get away from the awful smell!

hints.author: cellophane
hints.mnemonic: You cannot simply walk across a busy crossing - you must be far swifter than that to avoid being squished by the traffic. Instead, you need a piece of Link's gear - a fish-hook-shot, to grab onto a railing on the other side and pull you across in time.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: A cow creates a road by eating all the grass on its path.

hints.author: saleem
hints.mnemonic: CREATION is the ROAD to REVELATION (if you're feeling artsy)

hints.author: krungthep
hints.mnemonic: Creationist say that the universe was created as it is now. This is the "way of revelation" or 'bullshit-do'.

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: Like Jack Kerouac, you create by having revelations on the road.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: A revelation that comes to you on the road lets you create something brilliant.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: When you have the URGE to go to White Castle, you know it's time to hit the road.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: When you start down the road of cocaine, you're sure to feel some pretty bad URGEs soon.

hints.author: graham6565
hints.mnemonic: White lines on the road are there to urge you to stay on the correct side of the street.

hints.author: applesuki
hints.mnemonic: If you have a unrelenting urge to pee while on the highway, you have to cross the white line and pull off into the breakdown lane.

hints.author: ouroborosatx
hints.mnemonic: The two paths one can take in life are the white road and the dark road. I urge you to take the white road.

hints.author: Georgi87
hints.mnemonic: I used my pants to make a rope, which I then used to escape from prison; hence the naked, hairy legs running along the road!

hints.author: atomiton
hints.mnemonic: MARIO KART

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: When your wifes legs get hairy (portent (#235 兆)) its time to hit the road and escape.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: A scene right out of a 30's Cartoon. A tortoise in black-white striped jailsuit is making his escape from the prison, sirens howling and lightthrowers searching the road, where the tortoise in painful s lowness walks away looking scared.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: If you used the meaning "a person's back" in portent (#235 兆), you will have it easy here. Adopting Georgi87

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Caution

hints.author: mdspencer
hints.mnemonic: To protect the environs around their village, samurai would travel the roads with their swords.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means area, vicinity. Such as this or that area. STORY

hints.author: grubin30
hints.mnemonic: Caution

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Protect the environs by patrolling the road with your dagger. I tend to mistakenly put the abbreviated version of the sword primitive in this kanji.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The cops don't PATROL anymore - they just flood the road.

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: The Venice cops patrol on river roads.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Crime has increased so the police have been recruiting PACMAN's to PATROL the STREETS. Here we see THREE of them PATROLLING around with their MOUTHS open.

hints.author: mdspencer
hints.mnemonic: A patrol of rescue workers arrive to help clear the flood in the road.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: This should be easy. Imagine any news broadcast that shows the PATROL of police and national guard after the ROADS were FLOODED. Just to rescue the needy and stop the looters.

hints.author: Twentytw0
hints.mnemonic: My car is so fast it can go through ten rice fields in ten minutes.

hints.author: saranich
hints.mnemonic: Actually, this is a 10x10 car that can get you through a rice field.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: Rather than hobbling along with a walking stick to cross through a span, it's much better to use a car. (Imagine an old man with a walking stick creeping along a span of road, and you, in a car, whizzing right by him. It's funny 'cause it's true.) Also, it's important to include the word "through," so you know the walking stick goes right THROUGH the span.

hints.author: hotsw4p
hints.mnemonic: The travelling time span is cut in half if going by car. / The car allows you to cut your travelling time span by half.

hints.author: nycity
hints.mnemonic: My car cost me the equivalent of 10 rice fields .. 10!!

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: When you put your car on the road you should always take along a few friends. Don't confuse with carry (#303 運).

hints.author: Ji_suss
hints.mnemonic: This kanji also means "linked" or "series" so I've changed the kanji meaning to "GO ALONG (WITH EACH OTHER)." Well, a ROAD and a CAR certainly GO ALONG with each other. And the CAR will help you to GO ALONG the ROAD. This Kanji is the "Union" in Soviet Union and the "United" of United Nations (the countries that "go along with each other" at least some of the time).

hints.author: Lizzie
hints.mnemonic: When I am on the road I always take along my car.

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: The difference between transport (#289 輸), take along (#287 連) and carry (#303 運)? Transport 輸 = when your car moves big items, like meat and sabers for that one butcher's hut. Take Along 連 = when you take a guest in your car on the road. Carry 運 = the luck you carry when the king's carriage is out on the road, tossing gold coins to bystanders.

hints.author: Mesqueeb
hints.mnemonic: [Borat] I want take along many garls in pussymagnet (=car) on my road back to Kazakstan.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: My car got so stuck in a rut it required nine people pushing to get it out again.

hints.author: Verdana
hints.mnemonic: My car got so stuck in a rut it required a baseball team pushing to get it out again.

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: I got my car stuck in a rut ! I'm gonna have to call 999 !

hints.author: Twentytw0
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a broadcast over a police radio saying, "Car nine is stuck in a rut... I repeat car nine stuck in rut. All units please proceed to car nine".

hints.author: MeinKraftDinner
hints.mnemonic: Hitler gets his CAR stuck in a RUT, so he yells "Nein! Nein! Nein! Nein! Nein! Nein!!!!..." Also, the Kanji is made up of NINE strokes.

hints.author: jmadsen
hints.mnemonic: The car is a cattle-car, used to transport animals for the butcher's meeting - a convention on new butchering techniques. Hear the screams of the animals as it pulls up in front of the convention hall, where the butchers are waiting with their knives out front.

hints.author: pageturner1988
hints.mnemonic: The vehicle transports animals for a meeting with the butcher.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: When flesh and saber meet... it's probably time to find some transport to the hospital. A car maybe?

hints.author: Wisher
hints.mnemonic: In the movie Star Wars

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: The difference between transport (#289 輸), take along (#287 連) and carry (#303 運)? Transport 輸 = when your car moves big items, like meat and sabers for that one butcher's hut. Take Along 連 = when you take a guest in your car on the road. Carry 運 = the luck you carry when the king's carriage is out on the road, tossing gold coins to bystanders.

hints.author: Themistoclaus
hints.mnemonic: Metaphorically speaking, all the equipment in your mouth is basically just a meeting of butchers, designed to pulverize whatever meat you put in there.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: Metaphor

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: Metaphor

hints.author: aaroncp
hints.mnemonic: A meeting of butchers is a perfect metaphor for the supposed secret talks(mouth) between Hitler and Stalin.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 喩え ( 例え ), 比喩 , 隠喩 , 暗喩 , 直喩 , metaphor (#3009 喩) ユ( 輸 ), たとえる, たとえ ... Parts

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: When I get horny my flesh sword sticks out in front of me.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: If you stand in front of a bull's horns, you are asking for your flesh to be cut (or butchered if you prefer).

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: IN FRONT of the BUTCHER shop, there is a sign made of HORNS.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: At the bullfight, the matador stands bravely in front of the bull's horns. With his sword, he'll dig into its flesh..

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: The bullfighter stands IN FRONT of the animal's horns while he pokes its flesh with his sword to rile it up.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: In many asian restaurants, meat is roasted right in front of you over flames.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: At the roast, they make the roastee sit in front of everyone else, over the flames to speak, as the comedians roast him a new one!

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: "I'm going to roast you over a fire , お前 ," the angry gangster said.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: They would roast marshmellows in front of an oven fire (as no fire place was available).

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 煎餅 , 煎茶 , 煎る =炒る, 煎じる , 二番煎じ roast (#2548 煎) セン(cf 前 ), いる, せんじる ... Parts

hints.author: penne
hints.mnemonic: Son, I've never told you this but each woman has a second mouth between their fiiiiiine walking legs.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: Each and every one of us walks and talks differently.

hints.author: miki76
hints.mnemonic: Each person is gifted with a mouth to get us into trouble and a pair of walking legs to get us out!

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: It's easier for me to remember a concrete object. This combination occurs often enough for me to make it a primitive element. Walking legs and mouth combine to give a "walky talky" or mobile phone. Imagine one of those old big ones which looked like refridgerators. Mobile phones are so popular that each of us seems to want one.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: EACH of us learns first to use our legs to walk and then to use our mouths to talk.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: "Ranger! I want you to go check the status of each tree." "Errr, Each tree sir?" replies the ranger looking out over the vast forest. "That's Right, I want the status of each tree! Move out!".

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: A man measures his own status by the size of his woody...and compares it to each one he sees. 性格 (せいかく)

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: I find I need a more concrete image for this. EACH TREE has it's own STATUS. For example, the Christmas Tree is holy, the Willow is of high class while the lowly Bonsai is of low class.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: A person looking for status wants a tree of each kind in his garden.

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (カク, コウ) In Japan, where land is so precious, each tree you have helps elevate your status in society. Unless you are Kumi KOUda and can actually afford to buy lots of trees, the only way you will get them is if you KAKU them.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: It might sound simple to bribe someone, but then you have to graft the guy above him and the guy below him, and soon you're just giving shells to each and everyone!

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: When I was caught by the police doing some graft (graffiti), I gave each cop some clams and told them to be on their way. 賄賂 【わいろ】 bribe.

hints.author: hunchbag
hints.mnemonic: Graft

hints.author: doviende
hints.mnemonic: Graft is like bribing. You have to give MONEY to EACH person. There's a guy with a briefcase full of money and a walky-talky, and he's going around asking on the walky-talky about who he should give money too. "This guy gets money? Roger.".

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: I take this to mean the verb graft, and so simply see a bunch of shellfish being grafted onto each other, each to each.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: There are so many abbreviations and acronyms nowadays that no brain can remember each of them. Mnemonic

hints.author: whistler11
hints.mnemonic: A very anal farmer wants to catologue each grain of rice in his rice field. Imagine him scribbling a tiny abbreviation of his name and a number on each grain.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Each landing field has it's own abbreviation; e.g. BNE for Brisbane, SYD for Sydney, DRW for Darwin etc.

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: My brain cannot remember each ABBREVIATION I see. There are just too many!!!

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Each field has it's own abbreviation - no brain could remember each one! My brain can't remember each of the readings for this kanji! My foray into this field will be abbreviated if I can't walk the talk!

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: Each person under my roof is treated as a guest.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: In my house I welcome each guest.

hints.author: kaminix
hints.mnemonic: Quite a rude guest walking around talking in his walky talky in someone else's home!

hints.author: pgp27
hints.mnemonic: If you are my guest, under my ROOF you can open your WALKING LEGS and I'll put my mouth down there to please you, that's hospitality !

hints.author: atomiton
hints.mnemonic: each (#291 各) is given the meaning KEITAI (Mobile Phone). I hate it when guests answer their Keitai in my house.

hints.author: Kurisu
hints.mnemonic: Sign the guestbook page with your forehead. (Picture a guestbook full of forehead prints like thumbprints).

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: In New Zealand, people welcome guests by touching their foreheads together.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Thankful guests bow so much, you never see their entire heads, just their foreheads.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: The guest lowers his forehead as he turns the page in a guestbook.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: As a guest in Japan, being too tall for their standards, I have to bow my head every time I enter someone's house, or else I'll smack my forehead.

hints.author: Birdsong
hints.mnemonic: In SUMMER you are hot from the top of your head down to your walking legs.

hints.author: rachels
hints.mnemonic: One drop of sweat runs into my eye, when I go walking on a hot summer day.

hints.author: ouroborosatx
hints.mnemonic: I personally think it was too confusing to try and use head as the primitive. (How am I supposed to remember that the animal legs are replaced with walking legs instead of human legs?) Rather, I think have the image of a hot summer and you want to keep oneself under a ceiling not out jogging around.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: whistler11
hints.mnemonic: The heat of summer is so powerful, it swells your head so big, you need a bigger set of walking legs to hold it up.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: The best way to dispose of a nasty bit of wind is to let it go and use those walking legs to dissapear. Nobody will ever know it was you.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: To dispose of rubbish you should walk it to the bin not throw it to the wind.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: Contrast this with discard (#655 捨). Disposing of something implies a degree of care, whereas discarding something is generally careless. You want to associate this with a careful way to get rid of something. You throw a piece of garbage into the wind to get rid of it, but remember that you should dispose of it responsibly and your walking legs carry you off to fetch it.

hints.author: Pete171
hints.mnemonic: To dispose of something you can either kick it away with your walking legs or you can wait for the wind to blow it away.

hints.author: NyahK
hints.mnemonic: I thought to dispose of my wind secretly, but it appears I 'left' a trail behind whilst walking away.

hints.author: Kurisu
hints.mnemonic: They all say they have a TREE between their WALKING LEGS but most only have a TWIG.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Don't confuse with branch or bough - think of snapping twigs. A twig is always the kind of wood that snaps when the hunter's walking legs just barely touch it, making a snapping sound that alerts the prey to the hunter's presence.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: I don't believe this means twig as in a tree twig. 条 【じょう】 (n) (1) article (in document); provision; (2) stripe; streak; line. STORY

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: (Doesn't mean twig!) I read an article in the Weekly World News about a walking tree.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: I once read an ARTICLE about a guy who shoved a TREE between his WALKING LEGS. he was pulling out TWIGs for a long time.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Water each flower or the petals will wither and fall.

hints.author: pm215
hints.mnemonic: [It's been suggested on the forum (http

hints.author: Yasser
hints.mnemonic: "Flowers" need "water" "each" day or they'll bend and fall over (helps with the order of writing).

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: The flowers FALL over the water each hanami season.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: "each" is impossible to visualize, instead I picture a guy falling down with his mouth open in a scream and his walking legs above him flailing as he's falling. Works well for this kanji if you imagine him falling from a waterfall. At first he's holding on to some flowers, but they finally give and he tumbles into the water below.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The king's crown was blown off by the wind. "Oh well," he said, "it's just a superfluous symbol.".

hints.author: emanalo
hints.mnemonic: The court jester wears a crown and is full of wind with bad jokes. He is superfluous to the King's court. This kanji is read as "JOU" and commonly used to create the compound for jou-dan 冗談 (jest or joke) hence court jester. Also jou-go 冗語 (redundancy) and jou-in 冗員 (useless workers) 員 -employee (#56 員).

hints.author: tanaquil
hints.mnemonic: Trying to put a crown on the wind is like gilding the lily

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: The wind bags who wear the crown are almost always SUPERFLUOUS to the governance of their countries.

hints.author: TadghD
hints.mnemonic: Instead of just fluous, like the flow of the wind, I crown you superfluous.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: The beast of hades one day will wear a crown, and the number of the beast is 666.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: In Hades you have to work six days a week before crowning it with something vaguely resembling a weekend. Oh wait, that's Japan.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: In Hades, as punishment, souls are forced to wear crowns as hot as the sun for 666 days.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: If you can survive Hades for six days they give you a crown as a reward.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: It's dark in Hades, for the sun is covered by a crown. Oh, yeah, and the number six is just a wee bit popular down there.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: British army cars are at the service of the crown.

hints.author: RickN
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a crown is the hood ornament on every army car.

hints.author: Cirion
hints.mnemonic: The army has cars that are under the command of the crown - in ancient days these would have been chariots. (NB

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: A vehicle crowned with a turret is a tank -- and obviously a tank belongs in the army!

hints.author: yukkuri_kame
hints.mnemonic: There is an army of taxi drivers in Japan driving the Toyota Crown model of car.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Rays of light emitted from Apollo's chariot = radiance. Don't put the sun into this kanji. The rays are coming from the chariot directly!

hints.author: erlog
hints.mnemonic: Radiance is an army of rays.

hints.author: anroo
hints.mnemonic: Radiance isn't just a few rays, but a whole army of them.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: When I think of radiance I think of the greek god Zeus - picture him throwing rays of lightning (hence the extra jaggedness of the character) from atop his chariot riding through the heavens.

hints.author: brendanmacdonald
hints.mnemonic: Ray's little legs joined the army - so Ray-did-a-dance (radiance).

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: Don’t confuse it with “take along” (287). In that one, there was a car so you could take along your friends once you found them on the road. In this one, there is an army chariot just to carry military supplies (sorry no room for you).

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: Roads carry armies (in contrast to seas carrying navies or skies carrying air forces).

hints.author: kinkypete
hints.mnemonic: "swing low, sweet chariot, coming for to carry me hoooommmee.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: In the past, roads were established mainly to carry the army.

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: The difference between transport (#289 輸), take along (#287 連) and carry (#303 運)? Transport 輸 = when your car moves big items, like meat and sabers for that one butcher's hut. Take Along 連 = when you take a guest in your car on the road. Carry 運 = the luck you carry when the king's carriage is out on the road, tossing gold coins to bystanders.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: Remember the SUPERFLUOUS CROWN that flew away in the WIND? Well now the king is saying "i should have had the thing GLUED to my head from the BEGINNING".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A crown, from the beginning of the new king's life, is glued to him. He must inherit it.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: That crown was glued together from the beginning...I swear!

hints.author: pinnine
hints.mnemonic: Crowning is when the child begins to emerge from the vagina, covered in gluey mucus.

hints.author: Samchan
hints.mnemonic: I liked wasurenaide's story, but the superfluous and wind bits just confused me, so changed it a bit

hints.author: mameha1977
hints.mnemonic: Last night's date with Miss Sweden was like a dream. She even laid flowers over my eyes to crown the perfect evening.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: In the movie American Beauty, Kevin Spacey liked to DREAM about his daughter's friend and have a rose petal fall onto his eye from the ceiling. He did this lying in his bed each evening. You can almost see him lying in his bed in this kanji.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Sweet dreams like flowers for the eye are the crown of a perfect evening.

hints.author: dbooster
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, "flowers over your eyes" is a metaphor for falling asleep and dreaming (just as the sandman is in the West). So we can make a little poem

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: I like to think of the sideways eye as a cyclops, either the monster of Greek mythology or the X-Men character. The primitive reappears in demolition (#400 壊) and others. So

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A whirlwind digs a hole in the ground throwing out lots of dirt until it ends up with a giant pit.

hints.author: Wahlin
hints.mnemonic: Tazmanian Devil whirlwinds a pit into the soil. Note

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: All the soil was thrown to the left as the Tasmanian Devil's whirlwind swirled out a PIT.

hints.author: shimouma
hints.mnemonic: Down in the earth, there's a pit where you'll find miners in top hats constantly breaking wind.

hints.author: Alunalun
hints.mnemonic: A pit is cut into the soil by a magician archaeologist. He uses a whirlwind. (and for the primitive

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Two little aliens in a trenchcoat and top hat, trying to look TALL. The bottom one, in the glass helmet, is under the coat. The top one has his top hat pulled down in disguise, so all you can see is his mouth.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Here we have TWO MOUTHS each wearing a different hat. The top one is wearing a TOP HAT which is know to be as a TALL hat. The bottom one is wearing a SPACE HELMET which is known as an EXPENSIVE hat. (this kanji means both).

hints.author: atomiton
hints.mnemonic: Woody and Buzz-light year. Woody (in the cowboy hat) being Taller than Buzz ( in the space helmet) both with big mouths. Thx Minlawc! (adjusted for clarity).

hints.author: Alunalun
hints.mnemonic: This is the classic two children trying to be tall enough to get on a fairground ride. The lower child hides under a cover while the upper child stands on his shoulders and talks like he's an adult. But they're still not tall enough! So the top child gets a top hat which j-u-s-t pokes above the 'you must be this tall' line. (and they both have hungry mouths for eating candyfloss once the deception is complete).

hints.author: Yasser
hints.mnemonic: A cowboy (here represented by a "top hat" revealing only his "mouth") looks always tall against a ninja wrapped up in his "hood" that reveals only his "mouth".

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: In basketball however, tall children receive all the attention.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Tall children receive all the attention. They also make great receivers in football... this kanji also means 'catch' (therefore a football receiver is a great image).

hints.author: Dragonslayer131
hints.mnemonic: Kinda weird but I remember the weird ones best

hints.author: Chaze
hints.mnemonic: A word of warning

hints.author: cefreddffo
hints.mnemonic: Usually in yaoi couples the short guy is the one who "receives". But here we see how the tall boy is receiving and he enjoys it ( 享楽する ）. RTK2

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Welcome to our cram school

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: "You can receive a well-rounded education if you study at our cram school" says the advertisement. "Just come to our school grounds and check it out yourself!".

hints.author: trurlo
hints.mnemonic: In cram schools tall kids treat the round ones like dirt.

hints.author: pageturner1988
hints.mnemonic: Tall children who are well rounded play on the grounds and go to cram school.

hints.author: Amhran
hints.mnemonic: Tall and Round kids go to Cram School on Saturday. I use Saturday instead of ground in this one since it is the first part of 土曜日 【どようび】.

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: Imagine tall children sitting round the fire toasting marsh-mellows.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The cram school (309) tortures its students - especially the tall and fat ones who need to grow up - over a fire until they mellow. (Note that here the keyword 'mellow' only means to mature, ripen, or acquire skill; not the colloquial meaning of 'chill out').

hints.author: metacall
hints.mnemonic: Mello, from Death Note, was the more fiery student at the cram school (#309 塾)-like orphanage. He received a well rounded education there, in order to succeed L.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: Even if mellow, shy children receive a well-rounded education, they too will have a chance to burn brightly and succeed.

hints.author: JohtoKen
hints.mnemonic: Thank goodness, the cram school's on fire. Life is all mellow and stress-free once again, now that the stress of cram school is over with.

hints.author: Henke
hints.mnemonic: The tallest Pavilion crowns the street.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: The Pavillion on crown street is the tallest I have ever seen.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: The upper pavilion of Tokyo Tower is very tall. Godzilla attacks Tokyo Tower, wears the upper pavilion of Tokyo Tower as a crown, and then uses the rest of the tower as a spike to skewer some other monster. Avoid pagoda (#254 塔)

hints.author: yLaguardia
hints.mnemonic: The king's PAVILION is easy to notice. It's the TALL one with a CROWN nailed at the entrance...

hints.author: vinniram
hints.mnemonic: The tall PAVILION crowns the street.

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: Tokyo, capital of Japan

hints.author: Cirion
hints.mnemonic: The capital is where the powerful act formal wearing top hats, open their mouths, and get little done.

hints.author: ibardell
hints.mnemonic: Both the tall and the small are found in the capital.

hints.author: WithLoveFromExIA
hints.mnemonic: The capital letter in a word is the tall one, the one that's higher then the other little letters.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: Kyoto ( 京都 ), the old capital

hints.author: aboros
hints.mnemonic: When you're a tourist in the capital during the heat of summer, finding a water fountain is oh, so refreshing.

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: The water from the capital of Japan, Tokyo, is so refreshing!

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a British guy praising his drink. "This water is absolutely Capital! .. How refreshing!" NOTE

hints.author: indigo
hints.mnemonic: It is a well known fact that the most refreshing water of a country can be found in the capital.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This means REFRESHING and COOL (such as temperature). STORY

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Imaging the sun rising over the capital--classic postcard scenery.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: Anyone who's been to Kyoto doesn't need to think too deeply into this Kanji! Imagine a sunny day in the old capital, and there's no better scenery.

hints.author: Aouwra
hints.mnemonic: There's no scenery quite so nice as the sun setting over China's ancient capital, the forbidden city.

hints.author: Akeiko
hints.mnemonic: The sun shining over the capital is a nice scenery indeed.

hints.author: Gibbun
hints.mnemonic: When the SUN rises over the CAPITAL, the SCENERY is just amazing.

hints.author: tanaquil
hints.mnemonic: If fish were cities, the whale would surely be the capital.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: When the whale was first discovered it was the biggest fish people had ever seen. Stories exaggerated its size - people said it was as big as the entire capital city!

hints.author: Dakoina
hints.mnemonic: When you're saying a whale is just a fish, you're making a capital mistake!

hints.author: ceeeps
hints.mnemonic: Remember when a whale swam up the Thames. Everyone thought there was a big fish in the capital, but it was really a whale.

hints.author: mtheory7
hints.mnemonic: A whale is like a fish (#171 魚) except it is as big as the capital (#312 京).

hints.author: ibardell
hints.mnemonic: The cottage is so small - it has an umbrella for the roof; soil for the floor and room for only one mouth.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: Picture a lidded crock full of tasty cottage cheese... yum! Now all we need is an umbrella over it to protect the cottage cheese from the sun.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The homeless man stuck an umbrella over his lidded crock in the country side and declared it his cottage. It looks just like a shack (しゃ) though! Under local government legislation, after 7 years, the "cottage" and land were his.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: I call it my cottage, but it's really just an umbrella over a dirty hole in the ground.

hints.author: elitentity
hints.mnemonic: To further Heisig's explanation, imagine a cottage made out of a giant lidded crock and an umbrella. The mouth can also represent a door.

hints.author: hanako1975
hints.mnemonic: If my LIDDED CROCK has the same CIRCUMFERENCE as my head, I like to use it as a HELMET.

hints.author: mdspencer
hints.mnemonic: When the ground has an opening (a hole), you need to cover the entire circumference or you will fall in.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: You're at a motorcycle store looking to buy a helmet. The only way to check the circumference of your head is to put increasingly larger lidded crocks on your head until one slips on just right. Now you know what size helmet to buy.

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: The CIRCUMFERENCE of the Earth's soil surface ( 土 ) has been the same ( 同 ) for a long time.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: There's a hole (mouth) in the ground, so the men at work have put a barrier tape (hood) forming a circunference, to prevent people from falling into it.

hints.author: jschekkerman
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a road built so well that it takes only a week to travel the circumference of the earth.

hints.author: axelb
hints.mnemonic: Actually the week is like a never ending road where we travel in a circle through the same seven days again and again, the circumference is always the same. circumference (#317 周) also means circuit or lap, so that also makes think about the rotations of the moon, sun and the earth -- all important for measuring all kinds of time periods.

hints.author: stshores24
hints.mnemonic: This city is so big, it takes a week to travel around its circumference by road.

hints.author: activeaero
hints.mnemonic: It takes a WEEK to walk the "circumference" of this "road".

hints.author: johngwk
hints.mnemonic: The circumference of Japan would take at least a week on the road to navigate.

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: What a handsome gentleman. Standing up so straight, and broad shoulders too!! He's like a modern samurai!

hints.author: mightymiff
hints.mnemonic: A gentleman has broad shoulders and doesn't soil himself.

hints.author: Ameyama
hints.mnemonic: The gentleman stretches his arms wide to balance so he doesn't fall onto the ground and get mixed up in it.

hints.author: AdamLeliel
hints.mnemonic: Gentlemen are the opposite of dirty.

hints.author: Yasser
hints.mnemonic: A samurai gentleman starts a duel with open arms to show he has no personal grudges against the challenger.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The samurai's wife gives him a (uhum) before battle for good luck.

hints.author: jonobugs
hints.mnemonic: A true samurai gentleman will always mouth, "Good luck" to his opponents before a match.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: A gentleman going into a hole = good luck. Think about it. (nudge, nudge, wink, wink).

hints.author: Ji_suss
hints.mnemonic: From the cow's mouth came a revelation. From the samurai's mouth comes just "Good Luck!".

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Tom Cruise - the best samurai evar - with a shoop da woop mouth saying "GOOD LUCK" just like that robot voice does before every mission on Star Fox 64. Then of course he fires his lazer.

hints.author: bendyarm
hints.mnemonic: The image is a robust green bulging-muscle cartoon turtle. A TMNT with hachimaki. turtle-samurai.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are robust gentlemen aren't they?

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Turtle samurai are more robust than regular samurai, because of their shells. (I'm trying to avoid TMNT here, because I tend to get the order of the primitives wrong. It's TURTLE SAMURAI, not Ninga Turtles).

hints.author: zodiac
hints.mnemonic: The back of a samurai is very robust.

hints.author: Cirion
hints.mnemonic: A hairy leg is a good sign that a gentleman (or samurai) is robust with plenty of testosterone.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: A villa is fancier (decorated with flowers) and more robust than the average.

hints.author: eieneverafter
hints.mnemonic: The teenage mutant samurai turtles live in a villa with flowers on the roof so that the neighbours don't get suspicious.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: The villa was full of many gardens of flowers, and was guarded by a robust samurai with his turtle-shell shield.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The beautiful flowers make the VILLA look quaint and beautiful, but the robust samurais guarding it reminds you that this kanji also means "feudal manor.".

hints.author: GenPDP7
hints.mnemonic: The wealthy owners of the villa only plant robust flowers.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: The samurai happened to find an extra large crown that he wore as a belt on his waist, just above his legs. I wonder if he will sell it to me?

hints.author: Yasser
hints.mnemonic: A "samurai" will never sell his "crown" (king), even it meant having both his "human legs" chopped off!

hints.author: gwadonna
hints.mnemonic: The victorious samurai sells crowns and human legs.

hints.author: RachelleUdell
hints.mnemonic: The SAMURAI was down to his last CROWN, so he hiked up his kimono to show off his shapely LEGS in an attempt to sell himself!

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: A samurai sells small Miss World statutes. (Miss World = crown/mini skirt + long human legs; this combination appears several times).

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: In the school house there are kids always studying. (BTW, atomiton, this is NOT 字 ).

hints.author: gwadonna
hints.mnemonic: Children in schoolhouses are there to study, nothing else!!!

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a schoolhouse full of thousands of children in a deadly trance studying japanese style...repetition.

hints.author: munkiipoo
hints.mnemonic: A child in a schoolhouse studying. His brain is sparkling with knowledge!

hints.author: kanjidummy
hints.mnemonic: A school house is a place for a child to study.

hints.author: NooNoo
hints.mnemonic: In a schoolhouse in class

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: You'll never memorize all the kanji by seeing them in a school house. You need Heisig and RtK!

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Imagine you had the ability to speed read like those people who claim they can read an entire book in like 10 minutes. Then everything you see in the schoolhouse can be memorized instantly - you'll never have to take notes again!

hints.author: mdspencer
hints.mnemonic: When you are in the schoolhouse you must memorise what you see.

hints.author: Cirion
hints.mnemonic: In the Heisig School of learning Kanji we memorize how to write the kanji by seeing a story in our minds.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: The TREES FLOURISH in the CLASSROOM, a little too much perhaps, there's no room for the students any more.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: Students are like young trees. They tend to flourish in the schoolhouse.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Within the schoolhouse, the tree of knowledge does flourish.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Knowledge can only truly flourish when it is taught openly and freely in the schoolhouse, and not guarded and kept secret like the forbidden tree of knowledge.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: This is a very special schoolhouse, were trees are taught how to FLOURISH. It is important to imagine the image of trees sitting down and taking classes on FLOURISHING in a schoolhouse. You could even use an actual schoolhouse to make your mental image more realistic. You would even imagine the graduation ceremony of a class of sakura flowering all at the same time while holding their diplomas.

hints.author: jinka
hints.mnemonic: Make sure you practice writing kanji with a brush every day before the sun goes down.

hints.author: gaijinda
hints.mnemonic: The calligrapher had a peculiar habit

hints.author: zer0range
hints.mnemonic: With a brush, it takes all day to write anything.

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine dipping a brush into an inkwell full of the sun, so that what you write can be seen at any time of day.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Rita Skeeter, from Harry Potter, has a magic brush that writes anything that comes from the tongue wagging in her mouth.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: A brush laying in dirty water is a haven for bacteria.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: The haven for a BRUSH is in WATER.. Otherwise they get dry and withered and cant be used?!

hints.author: elitentity
hints.mnemonic: A toothbrush with some water moisture kept in a nice temperature is a haven for germs.

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: With his brush, Link draws a route over the water to a safe haven. (phantom hourglass).

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: A haven is somewhere you can pull your boat out of the water and use a brush to repaint it.

hints.author: roderik
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a taskmaster giving a cow the command to "start breeding, and start doing it now!", except that the cow takes his advice a bit too literally and starts chasing the taskmaster to carry out this command! instead of finding another cow to breed with. Hence, you see the taskmaster running to the right, trying to stay ahead of the cow.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: I think of Hitler for the taskmaster primitive. This has worked really well. Hitler can be the real person (and works well for kanji such as 激 violent (#497 激)). Or it can be more comical, such as a homosexual man dressed as Hitler for a costume party. As in, a homosexual Hitler has no hope of breeding. (Here you imagine him wearing leather bondage bands). *Also, the taskmaster primitive seems to generally be on the right side of kanji in this book.

hints.author: Hashiriya
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a taskmaster giving a cow the command to "start breeding, and start doing it now!", except that the cow takes his advice a bit too literally and starts chasing the taskmaster to carry out this command! instead of finding another cow to breed with. Hence, you see the taskmaster running to the right, trying to stay ahead of the cow.

hints.author: mrgrimm
hints.mnemonic: The cow is forced by the taskmaster to breed.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: AGGRESSION is a well-honed craft for any decent taskmaster.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Aggression is the craft of a good dominatrix.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: If the task master hits you with an I-beam... I'd say that's aggression!

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The special craft on which Hitler relies is AGRESSION. Without it, they never would have taken Poland, France, etc.

hints.author: erlog
hints.mnemonic: Aggression is the craft of the taskmaster.

hints.author: akira
hints.mnemonic: If you end up in failure, you give money to the taskmaster to train you.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: The shell who was defeated before (defeat (#63 負)) is being chastised by the taskmaster for his failure to win.

hints.author: Jupiter
