hints.mnemonic: Failure occurs if you let money become your taskmaster.

hints.author: annabel398
hints.mnemonic: Remember the TASKMASTER who was trying to breed a cow? With a LOBSTER in the same position, it was a terrible FAILURE.

hints.author: alkulp
hints.mnemonic: FAILURE to pay the taskmaster will result in FAILURE!

hints.author: applesuki
hints.mnemonic: The taskmaster is a strict bathroom monitor who hands out only one sheet of really rough, splintery toilet paper per person. You can see the wood fibers.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: This taskmaster is the bathroom nazi

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: The mean taskmaster declared, "You sheet on my tree, I keel you.".

hints.author: Wahlin
hints.mnemonic: The taskmaster whips sheets of paper off the tree.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: The poor trees are processed by the taskmasters of industry into sheets of paper.

hints.author: Deborah
hints.mnemonic: An OLD TASKMASTER is no happenstance (coincidence). The older you get the more rigid in your ways.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: Need to disambiguate from enemy (#443 敵) as it's easy to mix up antique and old here. Let's think of an accidental president -- he is an old taskmaster who has managed to win the election by happenstance .

hints.author: binky
hints.mnemonic: Only an old taskmaster uses a stupid word like "happenstance" instead of the many less pretentious synonyms for luck or chance.

hints.author: dogray77
hints.mnemonic: It's not just a happenstance that the taskmaster looks old before his time.

hints.author: meredithcat
hints.mnemonic: I recently ran into my old taskmaster purely by happenstance.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The flowery phrases of keigo ( 敬語 ) with which you must address the schoolmaster.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 敬 【けい】 (n) reverence; respect. 敬語 【けいご】 (n) honorific; term of respect; (P) STORY

hints.author: Lowther
hints.mnemonic: Hitler's flowery phrases held the nation in awe.

hints.author: Beartron
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, the culture says that one should in be awe of one's TASKMASTER, thus we are expected to use FLOWERY PHRASES when standing before them.

hints.author: eightbitbanzai
hints.mnemonic: If you're a girl you can try to woo your taskmaster with flowery phrases to get an awesome grade.

hints.author: jinka
hints.mnemonic: A pictogram of someone saying a four letter word from their mouth after the censors have gotten a hold of it.

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: This is simple a pictogram of a mouth SAYing something. The lines are soundwaves. No need to complicate it.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: This is such a hard one for me to remember in stories so I use Socrates to personify say since he is an orator. Just make Socrates the subject of your stories and whenever Socrates shows up you'll know this character should be written. Just picture him in his toga with a hand up in the air looking philisophical. You can try some other well spoken individual as long as they bring to mind speech, words, or say.

hints.author: matstc
hints.mnemonic: Before you say something in chinese, make sure you master the 4 tones that can come out of your mouth so that you don't embarrass yourself.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Facciamo quattro chiacchere...

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: To admonish is to enforce awe by means of words.

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: Watch in awe as mom admonishes the rude clerk with words that you've never heard her use before.

hints.author: caeliean
hints.mnemonic: Japanese police officers prefer to admonish perpetrators by aweing them with their words. You've never had a talking down to, until you've been a Japanese high school student caught littering in a small Japanese town. Just imagine the talking to that kid would get! Incidentally, this kanji is the first kanji in the word for police.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: I will now admonish every person here who used WORD as a keyword in this story. There is no WORD ( 語 ) in this kanji! I know Heisig himself teaches it that way. Doesn't make it right, does it? This is about SAYing something that inspires AWE. You will regret it when you get to word (#347 語)! ;)... 警察 [けいさつ] 、警告 [けいこく] warning.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: To ADMONISH is to simply say& a lot of awe*ful words (excuse the liberties taken with spelling).

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: A plot is a summary of a book that can be given in ten words.

hints.author: gaijinda
hints.mnemonic: Say-ten's (satan's) evil plot.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This does NOT mean a "summary of a book." It means plan, project, or to measure. STORY

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: It took only the words of ten men to plot the downfall of Caesar.

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: I have only ten words to say about this kanji

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Words that tell you the results of the whole story really elucidate.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: Elucidate me. Tell me, in your own words, the whole story.

hints.author: Goldom
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a grumpy old guy wishing those darn kids would elucidate their texting discussions on their cellphones by writing in whole words. Of course, the kids don't even know what "elucidate" means...

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: The whole words of the trendy name of the new Chinese dating service, elucidate.com, are 'electronic lucky dating service company'.

hints.author: oharawinter
hints.mnemonic: Saying the whole thing should elucidate it for me...

hints.author: f98plow
hints.mnemonic: The wild dog family visits their cousin in prison. They exchange words over the interphone at the visiting booth.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The only thing keeping the new chihuahua inmate from being 'initiated' by the pack of wild dogs were his quick words in prison.

hints.author: scuda
hints.mnemonic: Prison is a dog-say-dog world.

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: PRISON is a place where WILD DOGS SAY "DOG!!" to eachother and fight like animals.

hints.author: Erubey
hints.mnemonic: Where men talk like beasts and fight like dogs.

hints.author: mattoc_g
hints.mnemonic: Revise, revise and revise until you have all the words nailed down.

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: Remember how Martin Luther revised the words of the catholic church and nailed his 95 Theses at the door of the church in Wittenberg?

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The signmaker first carves all of his words. He then arranges them. But he will only nail them into place (thus making them final) when he has had the chance to sufficiently revise the message.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: You must revise your speech until you've nailed it.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Keep revising your words until you have what you want to say really nailed down.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Obituary. As a famous man lay dying, the media were already preparing the words of his obituary until a magician, with a wave of his wand, restored the man back to health.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: In the Harry Potter world, obituary's are magical. If you wave your wand over them you can hear the person's last words. Creepy!

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: obituary

hints.author: gyouza
hints.mnemonic: If you know how people talked about someone before his death, and then read the words in his obituary, it seems as if by means of a magic wand their opinion of this person has changed over night.

hints.author: manubear
hints.mnemonic: Harry Potter can bring people back from the dead by reading the words on an obituary while waving his magic wand ( 訃報 ).

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: I said some bad words, and my mother chastised me by washing my mouth out with glue instead of soap!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: In Colonial New England, people who committed adultery had words glued to them. A famous example is the "A" worn by Hester Prynn for committing adultery (i.e., not being chaste). In this way, words glued to you are supposed to chastise you and prevent further breaches of chastity.

hints.author: NickCooper
hints.mnemonic: If you chastise someone correctly the words will stick like glue.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: I said some bad words and my mom glued my mouth shut to chastise me.

hints.author: stephjapan2004
hints.mnemonic: Chastising words stick to your mind.

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: The best type of Japanese INSTRUCTION is full immersion, which consists of going to Japan and swimming in the stream of words that surrounds you every day.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Listen carefully to the words of instruction before you try swimming in the river.

hints.author: markjohnquinn
hints.mnemonic: The best teachers and those we remember most are those that are most patient with us, their WORDS as gentle as a STREAM.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: (technical) A stream of words (byte pairs) carries assembly instructions that are executed upon reception.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: This is the first half of the kanji combination with obey (#129 順). Watch at the person's words, their instructions, turn into a stream which then can be put into the subjects head for them to obey (#129 順).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The mnemonic "words to seduce the masses" was just too vague and I kept forgetting it. So now instead I picture a seductive female reading aloud the imperial edict to the masses, thus "seducing" the masses.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: The emperor did not need an imperial edict; his words were more than enough to seduce Anakin to the dark side.

hints.author: RachelleUdell
hints.mnemonic: The WORDS of an IMPERIAL EDICT are meant to SEDUCE the people and make them obey.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Palpatine's imperial edict is a propaganda speech to attempt to seduce the masses to the Dark Side. (If you need extra help to remember the seduce part, think about some sexy photos of Darth Vader being included in it as well. The resulting image should be seared into your mind forever.).

hints.author: dusmar84
hints.mnemonic: The Patriot Act is the modern day version of an imperial edict. It uses a lot of fancy words to seduce people into giving up their freedoms.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: WORDS of GOOD LUCK are PACKED into fortune cookies.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Nowadays, grafitti comes pre-packaged. The factory takes a bunch of words and aerosol cans and then makes sure the words get tightly packed inside. All you have to do is spray and everything takes care of itself!

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Words packed into an aerosol can

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Sayings of good luck are packed into little things like fortune cookies.

hints.author: alatown
hints.mnemonic: Once the samauri had packed his things, his wife would say "Good Luck".

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: Tales are always spoken, not written, and because of this, words fly out of your tongue, rather than your pen.

hints.author: Rivvie
hints.mnemonic: Tales are spoken words, passed on from person to person, eventually being spoken by a thousand mouths.

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: Tales are words from the tongue.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: Tales are Told from Tongues (TTT mnemonic).

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: Beowulf is an epic TALE composed of WORDS in a foreign TONGUE.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: If you study some words for a recitation, there is a good chance they will be stuck in your memory for all eternity.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Listening to the words in a recitation of Vogon poetry is worse than spending an eternity in hell. [Note

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Don't confuse with poem (#346 詩). Focus on the re- part of re-citation

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: [for catholics only

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: For me, the keyword suggests something not as pleasant as in James's Heisig story. In my mind, a recitation is when someone reads out loud something that they have read, without the slightest bit of improvisation or impersonation, in a very monotonous, and extremely dull manner. Hence, a recitation is a long-winded speech that seems to go on for an eternity (because it's so dull and you're so bored).

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A poem is a temple of words.

hints.author: kashikoi
hints.mnemonic: I'm saying this poem just for you, I built this temple from dirt and glue.

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: WORDS used in a TEMPLE must be very well chosen. That's why most people will speak using a poem if they are SAYING something in a TEMPLE.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: A poem isn't made up of words that come from nowhere; they are derived after deep meditation at your local Buddhist Temple!

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: Reciting a good poem is like saying a prayer in the temple of language. 悪魔の詩 (Satanic verses). 英詩 (English poetry). 狂詩 (Kyoushi, Edo era humorous poem). 詩を作る (compose a poem). 詩才 (poetic genius). 詩想 (poetical imagination). 詩文 (poetry & prose). 詩的正義 (poetic justice).

hints.author: rosie
hints.mnemonic: The simplest word to say is I.

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: Jesus said, "I am the WORD.".

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: May I say a word about that?

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: The rap group, the Five Mouths, always go around saying "word".

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: I, the perceiving subject, need all five senses to learn the WORDS and language of Japanese.... holistic learning, not just rote memory work!

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: People will say ( 言 ) almost anything to make a sale ( 売 ); don't believe everything you read ( 読 ).

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: Read the WORDS used to SELL things.

hints.author: j0k0m0
hints.mnemonic: Extra! extra! Read all about it! words for sale here.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: Most of the words that we read are meant to sell something.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: I'm a freelance journalists, so the words I sell are the words you read.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: To tune an old-fashioned radio, you turn the dial the full range of the circumference, until you can clearly hear what's being said.

hints.author: canji
hints.mnemonic: words  +  circumference The most catchy tunes are words the go round and round the circuference of your head and you can't get it out of your mind.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The words to this catchy tune run around the circumference of my head.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji also means "to investigate, check up, to search." STORY

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: This is the song that never ends, yes it goes on and on my friends! Some people started singing it not knowing what it was, and they'll continue singing it forever just because this is the song that never ends... The words go around in a lap in this tune, in case you didn't notice...

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Think of an online discussion group where misunderstanding someone's words leads to flaming. An angry discussion = inflamed words.

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: Internet discussions often involve inflammatory words. Flame war!

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: Discussing politics on the Internet always leads to heated words and flame wars.

hints.author: annabel398
hints.mnemonic: When people DISCUSS politics, the things they SAY often shed more HEAT than LIGHT.

hints.author: RachelleUdell
hints.mnemonic: I hate to DISCUSS religion or politics because people's WORDS always become INFLAMED.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: The words of the very young are useless without CONSENT from their elders.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Delores might say, "Yes!", but she's way too young give any legal consent.

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: Consent is words given to the young.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: You may get her consent if you say romantic things and she is too young to know any better.

hints.author: Levence
hints.mnemonic: Picture a cute loli holding flowers in her right hand, and you want to go over and talk to her, but you need parental CONSENT otherwise you will go to jail.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: A PETA activist speaks at a meeting of butchers to rebuke them.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: I imagine Socrates gate-crashing a meeting of butchers and REBUKING them

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: I had to SPEAK to the MEETING OF BUTCHERS and REBUKE them for mad cow disease, e-coli, and the bird flu.

hints.author: jshield1
hints.mnemonic: To rebuke is to take what someone says, and butcher it.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 諭す 【さとす】 (v5s,vt) to admonish; to persuade; to warn; to remonstrate; (P) STORY

hints.author: kiisu
hints.mnemonic: Each Indian tribe crafts their arrows in a certain style..

hints.author: shirahime
hints.mnemonic: The latest style is shirts crafted out of arrows.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: To say someone has STYLE is to say they craft their image as sharp as an arrow .

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: Legolas mastered the CRAFT of shooting ARROWS, so shoots with style.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: When you've crafted your look to be as sharp as an arrow, then you've got STYLE, baby ;o) !

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: In an essay test, you are judged on both your choice of words and your writing style.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese oral exam was a test of my speaking style.

hints.author: matstc
hints.mnemonic: Think about rap

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: atomiton
hints.mnemonic: Your speaking style is NOT tested on the JLPT (the JLPT is a little more concrete as a test for me).

hints.author: PeterJD
hints.mnemonic: II (older form of writing 2). After shooting one arrow (the dash top left), I have 2 arrows left in my quiver (bottom left).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Once you have two old arrows left in your quiver, you better start running...!

hints.author: Remember
hints.mnemonic: II

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: For some reason i'm using the kanji for I to remember the II kanji. Its just Arrow + single stroke under the arms, there is no 'quiver' stroke, why? because you dont need a quiver to hold ONE arrow. As a result of the above explanation for the old kanji for ONE (which is never used) you need a QUIVER to hold 2 Arrows. http

hints.author: tomusan
hints.mnemonic: II Roman soldiers carry two quivers..

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: An astronaut lands back at the launch range, kisses the earth beneath him with his mouth, then heads off to a fiesta to celebrate a safe flight.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: Instead of Heisig's "Fiesta" I use "Spear". Why? A spear is just a DROP extra on an Arrow. 域 , range actually means range as in limits/boundary/border sort of range(In a box it was the old meaning for Country 國 (581). Ok way too much etymology here, but back to story. With your SPEAR standing in a HOLE on the FLOOR with SOIL to its left9as you dug some out), you can see the RANGE of the spear in attacking a possible enemy (re Diablo and other RPGs, spear's have range).

hints.author: jHerbin
hints.mnemonic: When the land was within range, the pirates kissed the deck and had a fiesta.

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: Dora and her party must travel over the range of earth, find the mouth of a cave on the ground, and then enter within to get to the fiesta. Remember

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Dirty mexicans like to kiss the floor at the fiestas on the range.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: Burglars... those guys!!! Burglars only want money (clams) so that they can get needles (drugs) and party (fiesta)!

hints.author: twincy
hints.mnemonic: After the fiesta, we found out that some burglar had stolen our money, probably breaking in with a lockpick needle...

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: The burglar tried to steal my money by using a lockpicking needle, so I impaled him to the wall with my spear.

hints.author: jamestaverner
hints.mnemonic: I had trouble remembering if this was during a fiesta or a parade / march - so I've pictured the burglar escaping from the scene of the crime in a clapped-out old Ford Fiesta.

hints.author: RachelleUdell
hints.mnemonic: The BURGLAR tried to steal my CLAMS so I impaled him with TEN SPEARS.

hints.author: PrettyKitty
hints.mnemonic: The plantation is where we get our Christmas trees. We pick them out at Thanksgiving to be sure we get a good one.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: During Thanksgiving, all the trees on the plantation celebrate the harvest. It's a good time for them, too.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: During the harvest festival, all the trees on the plantation celebrate what a good job they did producing fruit.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: All ten trees at the plantation rebelled and destroyed their human owners. They then had a festive celebration for their new found freedom.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: On Thanksgiving day Kunta Kinte tied to a tree being slapped because he tried to flee from the plantation while the master was distracted with dinner.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: After eating a big Thanksgiving dinner, you have to be careful in the car ride home not to drop a load in your pants.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: After 'Thanksgiving' dinner, my girlfriend gave me a BJ on the drive back home. I blew my 'load' and 'soiled' the 'car'. But it was LOADS of fun! Please report this story if this makes you feel uncomfortable

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Load the crops into the wagon in preparation for the harvest festival.

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: Every November I load my car with turkey, ham, sweet potatoes, dressing, cranberry sauce, mashed potatoes, gravy, corn, rolls. There's so much food, it sticks out the windows. I drive to my family's house for--that's right--a Thanksgiving dinner feast!

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a thanksgiving dinner where a car is loaded onto the table instead of turkey.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: The gay parade looks astonishing, as if overgrown with flowers.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: When your garden gets OVERGROWN, it's like the plants are mocking you. Here, you can see the roses actually parading around the yard, wilfully choking out the other, more docile plants. Then they actually go and parade down the street!

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: At the flower parade, (hippies' parade) all I can see is walking masses of overgrown hair!

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: It's important that the word overgrown leads to the elements, rather than have the elements lead to overgrown as I see too often in the other examples. So I turned one of the other stories around. STORY

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: I use scythe as a primitive instead of parade. A scythe is like a spear (see [356]) whose tip has been bent to use for scything. When flowers have overgrown your front yard, use a scythe to cut them!

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Your half-uncle is leading a parade of your relatives. (Note

hints.author: FoxintheStars
hints.mnemonic: (Using the RTK1 supplement so I haven't had "uncle" yet.) When you take visiting relatives to a parade, hold the little ones up above so they can see over the crowd.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Your uncle organizes a parade of all your relatives, which he himself is only half in because he's busy taking pictures of it.

hints.author: ghinzdra
hints.mnemonic: All my relatives seems to be here .They even organized a PARADE for me .Wait a minute

hints.author: wio_dude
hints.mnemonic: People carry their small relatives above their shoulders so they can see the parade.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: It only takes a single stroke of a dagger for a parade to TURN INTO a bloodbath.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: The gay parade suddenly TURNED INTO a DAGGER throwing fight.

hints.author: jonobugs
hints.mnemonic: The peaceful protest parade turned into an ugly riot when some idiot pulled out a knife and started to threaten the police.

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: Let us beat swords into plowshares and turn daggers into scythes. (see my story for overgrown (#360 茂)).

hints.author: colonel32
hints.mnemonic: The glorious socialist parade turns into a knife fight between Fidel and Raul Castro after they both give 3-hour speeches.

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: The sand castle is just the soil (#150 土) that turns into a castle.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: "Someday this mound of dirt here will turn into our CASTLE", the ants think to themselves when scoping out a new ant hill.

hints.author: Rivvie
hints.mnemonic: Sand sculptors can turn even the most ordinary soil into the most beautiful castles.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: A castle is just land that has been turned into something else

hints.author: akira
hints.mnemonic: A castle is built on the ground where a parade was turned into a bloodbath.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Sincerity happens when what you say actually turns into something.

hints.author: gwadonna
hints.mnemonic: Sincerity is turning your words into actions.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Words turning into actions is a sign of true sincerity . You do what you say (せい) you will. Marco and (まこと) his Brazilian friends need to learn this - they say they won't smoke pot inside anymore, but still do it -- that's not being very sincere.

hints.author: mdspencer
hints.mnemonic: When your words turn into something of true meaning, that is sincerity. [Not sure why this was reported twice... 'words' is perfectly OK here....].

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: Socrates said " If said with sincerity, words can turn in to anything". Very similar to "castle", #362.

hints.author: bigloui
hints.mnemonic: The march of women - against intimidation in the workplace - is pretty intimidating in itself!

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Interesting that this kanji also has the meanings of "dignity" and "threaten." I can see how a march of women in Japan would be seen as intimidating by most men.

hints.author: Nekesu04
hints.mnemonic: A one woman parade? How is that supposed to intimidate me?

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: I use Grim Reaper instead of march for the primitive, because he's the one holding the scythe (see [360]). Now imagine a female Grim Reaper - that's even more intimidating!

hints.author: kaeru
hints.mnemonic: A group of feminist WOMEN are MARCHING for their rights, theyre so ugly it's INTIMIDATING.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Water flows down to destroy the march of fire.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Use a water cannon to destroy a line of marching fire monsters. I keep mixing this one up with disaster (#167 災) and demolition (#400 壊). Remember, you DESTROY monsters (think of the Godzilla movie "Destroy All Monsters!"). Fires and floods are natural DISASTERs. And DEMOLITION is something you carefully do while wearing protective garments. (vaguely based on stefanot's balrog story).

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Lord of the Rings

hints.author: RickN
hints.mnemonic: Use water to prevent the march of the fire before it destroys everything.

hints.author: gibler
hints.mnemonic: I mix this up with 壊 demolition (#400 壊) alll the time, so i need to say

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: When WATER was tossed on the PROTESTORS (a march of mouths), the numbers began to DWINDLE.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: When water supplies dwindled, the population became a horde of dry mouths, marching to seize the water in the neighboring kingdom.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: When water supplies dwindled, one mouth raised a cry and led a march on the city!

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: As the water supply dwindles, the Grim Reaper (see [364]) looms over the thirsty mouths.

hints.author: erlog
hints.mnemonic: The water dwindles as the parade of thirsty mouths goes by.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: They gays were reviled by society, so they put flowers above their eyes and marched around.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: The gay pride parade (flowers + march) was going smoothly until it caught the eye of the religious right, who reviled the demonstration so much that they tried to interrupt it.

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Flower, eye, march

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In Northern Ireland, bitter religious groups revile their opponents by marching defiantly under their very eye, holding flowers that symbolize their beliefs.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Japanese festival floats are often so tall they need wood scaffolds to be completed. (http

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: You need a SCAFFOLD made of WOOD to build a FLOAT if it will be several stories high.

hints.author: RachelleUdell
hints.mnemonic: HINT

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: Not using Heisigs float. im extending the meaning of my Spear (see previous kanji).Think a VERY LONG SPEAR/TRIDENT (Trident as this is like an ARROW with 3 spikes) or, a LONG SPEAR because its just a SPEAR with TWO extra arrow lengths. STORY

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: A scaffold is where you hang witches. In order to know whether they're witches or not, you put them on a scale to see whether they whether they weigh more than wood, a duck, or other things that float, like very small rocks. (Monty Python

hints.author: Squintox
hints.mnemonic: Interesting fact

hints.author: PParisi
hints.mnemonic: Political hopefuls in Rome threw gold COINS from floats when they were campaigning for office.

hints.author: quety101
hints.mnemonic: Gold coins will not float.

hints.author: Spartan1841
hints.mnemonic: Think of the gold coins floating in Super Mario games.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Picture a large golden float...you know, made of gold. Every year when they bring this float out there are people waiting at the sides of the float to take their coin shaped hole punchers and punch out some very valuable gold coins.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: The water can't be too SHALLOW if you expect to float.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The water isn't shallow enough to ford (#372 渉). We'll have to cross by float!

hints.author: certain
hints.mnemonic: The water is too SHALLOW to float in it.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: A parade float full of devout Christians is attempting to recreate Jesus' walking on water phenomenon. They claim to be able to do it because of faith, but only reason they are managing to do it is because the water is shallow.

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: When you encounter water and can't find a shallow spot while driving a float, you will find out if it can float!

hints.author: brunosprak
hints.mnemonic: If you find in the ground a walking stick with a magic wand, STOP! Maybe it's some kind of macumba/black magic/voodoo bad thing.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This looks like a little police officer sticking his hand out (first two strokes) signaling for cars to stop as a schoolboy/girl is following behind (third stroke). The final stroke is the road.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: If you don't remember this one from the 10,000,000 STOP signs on roads all over Japan, you're beyyond help!

hints.author: alkulp
hints.mnemonic: STOP! I put my foot down.

hints.author: EmiBD208
hints.mnemonic: Gandalf took his magic wand, which looked like an old walking stick, and stuck it in the ground, before bellowing, " STOP! YOU SHALL NOT PASS!".

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: When walking your pet, you must stop a few times along the way when nature calls.

hints.author: Delina
hints.mnemonic: When you learn to walk, you take your steps a few at a time. Picture a clumsy but happy toddler who falls every few steps but keeps getting up to try again.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: When you take a walk you should stop a few times to smell the roses.

hints.author: drivers99
hints.mnemonic: When you walk you leave a few footprints.. not as many as when you run.

hints.author: kaminix
hints.mnemonic: To walk is to stop a little now and then while going somewhere. (not exactly true, but that made it stick for me!).

hints.author: ngoli1
hints.mnemonic: The new Ford Jesus. It can do everything except WALK on WATER.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: A ford is a place where one can walk through the water, a place only a few footsteps deep.

hints.author: Lowther
hints.mnemonic: Fording is simply walking through water.

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: Did you hear about the new ford model out? They're calling it the "Jesusmobile" -- It's able to walk across water!

hints.author: Renaissance
hints.mnemonic: The new Ford Jesus. It can WALK on WATER. (edit on ngoli1. I think negations make stories hard).

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: I repeatedly walk around hoping this kanji will come into my head. I repeatedly walk around hoping this kanji will come into my head. I repeatedly walk around hoping this kanji will come into my head. I repeatedly walk around hoping this kanji will come into my head. I repeatedly walk around hoping this kanji will come into my head.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Are you familiar with the joke about the ditzy secretary who repeatedly walked back and forth forcibly over all the pages of her boss' most important letters. When confronted she just says "Well you said they needed to be stamped before they're mailed.".

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: FACT

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Notice a pigeon how it walks. Its head bobs up and down repeatedly.

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: “If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stomping [walking] on a human face [head] – forever [repeatedly].” – George Orwell, Nineteen Eighty-Four.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: A secret agreement between a covert gov't agency and aliens states that we will not step foot on the moon again in return for alien technology.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: NASA and Armstrong made an agreement

hints.author: ambrokusa
hints.mnemonic: The peace agreement put a stop on the fighting for a month.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: Neil Armstrong had an agreement with NASA

hints.author: earlneath
hints.mnemonic: Vegetarians are in agreement about stopping the flesh trade.

hints.author: yukina
hints.mnemonic: Mary Poppins floated down with her umbrella to undertake the job of stopping the children's misbehaving.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: In Resident Evil, you UNDERTAKE a mission to STOP UMBRELLA from infecting the country with the T-Virus.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The Undertaker is an evil WWE wrestler - he beat his opponent with an umbrella until he stopped moving.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: I will UNDERTAKE this project

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: Think of a crowd of people, standing under their umbrellas at a funeral in the pouring rain, honoring a friend/relative whose life has stopped. For extra reinforcement think of undertake as coming from undertaker.

hints.author: Ninjasha
hints.mnemonic: A CURRICULUM is a calendar that replaces days with reasons to stop having fun.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A little like a calendar, your CV records your footsteps through time.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: A curriculum (vitae) is similar to a calendar except that, instead of mentioning every day in your life, it only mentions the main stops. (Compare calendar (#213 暦)).

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Stop underneath a grove of trees by the cliffs to sit down and write your CV.

hints.author: TwoGoats
hints.mnemonic: When the school CURRICULUM started covering TREES that grow in cliffs, I decided to STOP attending.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: ONE-ARROW can STOP a warrior.

hints.author: RickN
hints.mnemonic: A great warrior can stop any 0pponent with one arrow.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The traditional warrior carries a quiver of ARROWS. But the warrior must never forget his real purpose

hints.author: eatyoda
hints.mnemonic: Remember the story of "Achilles the Warrior," who was put down by one arrow (the drop in the quiver) among many quivers which hit just above his foot.

hints.author: Buronzu
hints.mnemonic: Lord of the Rings

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A warrior stands guard at a bridge collecting shells as a levy for any who want to pass.

hints.author: lb4269
hints.mnemonic: "Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry. And those good old warrior boys, drinking whiskey and rye, said pay up the clams or you'll die. Pay up the clams or you'll die...".

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: A levy is money collected to fund kingdom's warriors.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: "Gimme some clams" said the warrior, collecting his levy..

hints.author: nintendomaniac64
hints.mnemonic: Bush always used the excuse that the money from the Iraq levy was to support America's warriors overseas.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: If you do it correct on the first attempt you can stop.

hints.author: tom2000
hints.mnemonic: My (Japanese) wife tells me that Japanese people use this kanji to tally up numbers (instead of 4 vertical lines and a diagonal across). I remember this one by writing the kanji while counting out the strokes to myself and saying this is the correct way to tally numbers.

hints.author: burritokun
hints.mnemonic: The correct way of learning Japanese? First, stop everything you're doing. Then, go pick up a copy of Heisig's book and work from there.

hints.author: muddyhill
hints.mnemonic: The correct way to tackle any problem is one step at a time.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: You want a correct answer in one stop? Google is your friend...

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Your words must be absolutely correct if you plan to use them as evidence.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: "If what you say is indeed correct, we could use use your testimony as evidence".

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: The evidence you find at the crime scene is misspelled WORDS scrawled everywhere-- think of Se7en. But you can't resist, and you have to CORRECT their spelling.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Evidence proves that your words are correct.

hints.author: ninjagaijin
hints.mnemonic: Evidence proves that what you say (#335 言) is correct (#379 正).

hints.author: nagisa
hints.mnemonic: Those involved in politics are always trying to elect the correct taskmaster.

hints.author: cosby
hints.mnemonic: Insane political correctness on the left, and facists taskmasters on the right- thats politics in a nutshell right there.

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: The Left is careful to be politically correct in speech. The Right whips people into a frenzy of outrage!

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: Insane political correctness on the left, and a fascist Hitler on the right – thats politics in a nutshell right there.

hints.author: Pangolin
hints.mnemonic: I like immacolata's "chief whip" (helps if you are British!) as taskmaster. But let us not forget policital correctness. The taskmaster (chief whip) is there to see that party members observe political correctness at all times, especially in a socialist party, correctness is on the left!

hints.author: jrothenberg
hints.mnemonic: In The Karate Kid, the boy must prove his determination by MENDING his teacher's HOUSE in various ways.

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: Prior to buying a home, the home inspector will come into your house and determine everything that needs mending.

hints.author: hanako1975
hints.mnemonic: People who decide to renovate (ooh, that's a fancy word, let's say "mend") their houses must be very determined DIYers. (Using DIY helps me remember this story when I see DEtermine).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 定める 【さだめる】 (v1,vt) to decide; to establish; to determine; (P)The primitive "mend" is too arbitrary and I can never remember it. New primitive meaning

hints.author: davcarruth
hints.mnemonic: The Determinator Arnold Schwarzenegger has determined to get out the ladder and the tools and start mending the roof. "I'll be back - after mending the roof," he utters dramatically.

hints.author: ngoli1
hints.mnemonic: Even if you lock up your GOLD, a DETERMINED thief will get it in the end.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The best stories for this kanji tend to have a thief in them, which always makes me confuse them with the kanji for burglar (357). So, let's try this one

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: A LOCK is metal that is determined to keep intruders out.

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: A lock is a piece of metal that will determine who can or can't get in.

hints.author: hoolan
hints.mnemonic: A METAL LOCK DETERMINES who can get in.

hints.author: Samchan
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: poseid0n
hints.mnemonic: The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been RUNNING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up.

hints.author: jonjimbo2000
hints.mnemonic: The soil needs mending after the cross-country run.

hints.author: fjolnir
hints.mnemonic: If you run 10 miles you'll need to mend your socks.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: With ten things to mend, you've got to run to get it all done.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: A successful marathon runner needs to be able to transcend seductions, such as the possibility of rest, shelter from the rain, or a cold beer.

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: To transcend to a higher path you need to run from the seduction of earthly desires.

hints.author: lb4269
hints.mnemonic: To transcend oneself is to reach a higher plane of reality. A head shaven monk is telling me this. We are in a Tibetan monastery. He was once an athlete, a runner. He used to run everywhere, until one day, he saw a beautiful cheerleader along his path. She tried very hard to seduce him, but he forced himself to transcend his urges. He did reach his running goal, and he has became a lonely monk. He wishes now he had just broken down back then and....

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: Pamela Anderson was able to transcend the Television world and become a superstar after her years of seductive running on the beaches of Baywatch.

hints.author: Nandaro
hints.mnemonic: To transcend life you must run from anything that seduces you.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: "Don't run into trouble," Dumbledore tells Harry. "Proceed with caution with your wand out.".

hints.author: tstuhldreher
hints.mnemonic: You go through airport security. "Proceed," mumbles the guard after he wands you. You run like crazy, because you're late for your flight.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: While running, my magic wand tells me where to proceed.

hints.author: Erubey
hints.mnemonic: I've got to run and take a piss before proceeding.

hints.author: stephan
hints.mnemonic: In a relay race, the baton (wand) must proceed from one runner to the next.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: The person in charge of running the parade surpassed all our expectations (by just a extra drop...).

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The parade of runners are all trying to SURPASS each other - and they end up running all the way to Vietnam (note that this kanji is also used for the country of Vietnam).

hints.author: hoolan
hints.mnemonic: A RUNNER will always SURPASS a PARADE.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is read the same way as # 385 "transcend." The difference is that this kanji talks about surpassing or crossing over a mountain (or the like) while 385 is used when surpassing or transcending a amount of money, an expectation, etc. STORY

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: To make the marathon more challenging for the runners, they made them try to out-run (#384 走) a parade going down the same path. The runners must come out before the parade, and SURPASS it, to win a shopping spree at Mitsukoshi or a trip to Vietnam. Oddly, this is a kanji in Mitsukoshi Dept store ( 三越 ) and Vietnam ( 越 ).

hints.author: Brad_Thomas
hints.mnemonic: 'Sun' 'Mend' - It just so happens that sunshine can mend your gloomy spirits.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: My image here is of Fabrice (the guy who runs this website) spending all day obsessively mending the code so this page looks just so....

hints.author: brendanmacdonald
hints.mnemonic: I spent all day mending to make things just so.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: It takes me aaaaallll flipping day to mend these stories so they're just so!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 是 【ぜ】 (n) righteousness; justice; right. 是か非か 【ぜかひか】 (exp) right or wrong; 是非 【ぜひ】 (adv,n) (1) (uk) certainly; without fail; (2) right and wrong; pros and cons; (P) STORY

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The "TOPIC" of the day's newspaper must be placed JUST SO at the top of the PAGE to attract attention.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: You spend ALL DAY, mending your socks JUST SO. Then you have a look at the HEADING of the newspaper. The topic---FREE SOCKS TO BE GIVEN AWAY!!!!

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The TOPIC is written as the heading of the page just so readers know what the article is about.

hints.author: Yonosa
hints.mnemonic: This topic is just so boring turn the page...!

hints.author: Yenniku
hints.mnemonic: It JUST SO happens that girls giving HEAD seems to be the number 1 TOPIC of high school gossip.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Making a dike is all about arranging the soil just so....

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The little Dutch boy has his finger stuck in the dike, and that's the only thing keeping his town from going under. He really really needs to go to the bathroom though, so he devises a plan to carefully add a bit of dirt - there, place individual bits in just so - there, I think it's good enough. Pull it out -----yes! Success!

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Indiana Jones replacing a gemstone with a small bag of soil. If he doesn't weigh the soil just so, a huge dike behind the wall will break, washing him away.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Dikes are just so dirty.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: The dike was very close to breaking. The people worked all day bringing earth/soil to mend it.

hints.author: sutebun
hints.mnemonic: Build is easy to remember if you can remember that archtiechts have two steps in building. 1. Take a brush and brush out the blueprints. 2. Get a visual image of the blueprints all rolled up like they usually are. The second step is easy, it's just the architecht stretching out the blueprints and showing it to his clients.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: A construction worker's classic morning. Stretch, brush his teeth, and then start to build.

hints.author: opie226
hints.mnemonic: To build a skyscraper, you have to stretch it upwards until it brushes the sky.

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: To build your Kanji ability, you must brush away the cobwebs from your head and stretch your imagination.

hints.author: vicnet
hints.mnemonic: Building seen through the architect's eyes

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The metal thing you need in order to enter things you build is a key.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 鍵盤 key (#2761 鍵) ケン, かぎ ... Parts

hints.author: francajun
hints.mnemonic: They use metal to build keys.

hints.author: jusenkyoguide
hints.mnemonic: In Zelda, the gold key will let you into any building.

hints.author: ZxHIROxZ
hints.mnemonic: Many have tried and failed in seeking the key to El Dorado, the land of golden buildings (Imagine if El Dorado kept up with modern times).

hints.author: Ameyama
hints.mnemonic: Stretching correctly prolongs life. Even the top part of 正 is stretching...

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: If you want to prolong your sexual encounters, the best way to stretch them out is to stop your orgasm after just one drop has come out. (with inspiration from gorgon).

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Here's a great mnemonic

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The inquisitor prolonged the torture because his victim didn't answer the question correctly. He turned the wheel stretching out his limbs even further.

hints.author: johanvg
hints.mnemonic: To prolong means to stretch time for a drop (a little while) because you do not want something to stop.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Nativity = born, being born. Think of birth as a painful and prolonged event. And of course, all the words and curses being yelled at the soon-to-be father for doing this to her!

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: When you are being born ( nativity ), your mother's WORDS are PROLONGED. (Thiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiis huuuuuuuuuuuuuurtss a lottttttttt~!! Owwwwwww!!!).

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: The nativity story

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: At Nativity (christmas), the priest says more Words (sermon) than the rest of the time, Prolonging mass duration.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 誕生日 【たんじょうび】 (n) birthday; (P) 誕生石 【たんじょうせき】 (n) a birthstone STORY

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Features like stones and groves of trees are the cornerstones of a happy zoo.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: A zoo which is still under construction is already full of animals. At the moment, only the cornerstone has been set in place. To temporarily keep the animals from escaping, a closely-packed grove of small trees is planted around the stone. (Note that this zoo needs some serious mending.).

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Stone Grove Zoo is the new cornerstone in animal exhibits! If you love animals you need to check out Stone Grove Zoo!.

hints.author: jshield1
hints.mnemonic: How am I the only one who doesn't see how mend turned into zoo with one stroke.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: To make room for the new zoo, they use dynamite sending all the grove's trees flying in the air. That big stone on the left now serves as cornerstone. (Variation on ziggr's story, with more emphasis on placement that was giving me trouble).

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The virgin bridegroom tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman's body - but with little success. It's a zoo down there! (primitives placement

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The only reason anyone talks about a bridegroom is if they're about to or have just gotten married. Of course, then you have to go on your honeymoon. So you take your woman to the zoo for a month. Pretty cool honeymoon.

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a bridegroom having his wedding with his woman in a zoo on the moon. That will impress her! Fill out the details with the bride and groom floating with a menagerie of animals with astronaut helmets floating, bumping and attacking one another.

hints.author: munia
hints.mnemonic: How did the eccentric bridegroom convince the woman to marry him? He built a zoo in the surface of the moon just for her!

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: The bridegroom will take his woman to the zoo for a month long honeymoon. (Simplifying dihutenosa).

hints.author: indigo
hints.mnemonic: The only garments allowed in this club are top hat and scarf.

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: The garments most commonly associated with the craft of a magician are the top hat and the magic wand. (It's a stretch, but the way I remembered this kanji is through that phrase. This way you can remember it through using primitives we have already learned.).

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Dr. Who always wore a TOPHAT and SCARF, his most memorable GARMENTS.

hints.author: crocker
hints.mnemonic: A TOPHAT and a SCARF form a GARMENT that makes you barf.

hints.author: catJapan
hints.mnemonic: A snowman wears a top hat and a scarf for garments.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The tailor was hard at work making sure all the pilgrims were dressed in their best garments for thanksgiving.

hints.author: Buronzu
hints.mnemonic: The tailor worked hard after thanksgiving to alter garments so they'd fit people who'd eaten too much at their thanksgiving dinners.

hints.author: jwy2k2
hints.mnemonic: If you can make ten garments then you qualify as tailor and we will have a party to celebrate. Congratulations! You are all invited to the TenGarmentFiesta.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: My TAILOR made me 10 garments for the upcoming fiestas.

hints.author: Wisher
hints.mnemonic: The TAILOR was invited to THANKSGIVING so he could sew up the turkey after the stuffing was put in. Too bad his GARMENT got dirty during the process. They should have killed the turkey first.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: The TURTLE SAMURAI needs special GARMENTs for his ATTIRE since his body is much more ROBUST than others.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The ninja turtles tried to go eat at a fancy restaurant, but they were told to come back after their were dressed in proper attire. However, it's too difficult for them to find proper garments because they bodies are so robust! (sannomiya + drwarrior12).

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Attire is more robust than a garment.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Only a robust garment is worthy of being called attire.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: The TMNT tried to enter an expensive restaurant wearing nothing - they were told to come back with the appropriate attire. Not understanding the word attire nor how to wear clothes, they put on some clothes and, instead of buttoning stuff up, they put on a tire to hold their clothes up (inspired by synewave's story).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The computer had carefully dressed up in clothes to look human. It was n't until I looked at the back and saw the cables and stuff that I realized what it was.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Can computers be gay? I'm not sure, but mine always wears a top hat and scarf, and for some reason its back door port is always open...

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: I'll be back ! says the computer Terminator, disguised with a top hat and a scarf.

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: The COMPUTER wore a TOP HAT and SCARF to hide it's cables at the BACK. ( 裏 うら　bottom/back/reverse).

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: I was looking at porn on my computer and my roommate came in the room, so I hit the back button on the browser and pretended to be shopping for top hats and scarves.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: If you stand too close to a DEMOLITION site, the dust might sting you like NEEDLES in your EYE and get your GARMENTs all dirty.

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: Since that needle eye thing turns up a lot, I turned it into Darth Vader. It kinda looks like him to me, with the eye being his metal mouth piece thing. So, Darth Vader swings his cape (his garment) demolishing a nearby building, leaving nothing but a pile of dirt.

hints.author: lukearns
hints.mnemonic: During demolition, dirt and debris can feel like needles in your eyes if you're not wearing ther proper garments.

hints.author: eightyd
hints.mnemonic: The dirt to the left is all that remains of the WTC on 9/11. On the right we have george bush wearing a perfectly clean and expensive suit/garment putting eyedrops in his eye to force an emotion over the victims of 9/11. He has to fake this emotion since 9/11 was a controlled demolition.

hints.author: ew8049
hints.mnemonic: The demolition expert doesn't want DIRT in his 10 EYES, so he covers them with a SCARF.

hints.author: Asgard
hints.mnemonic: One of my friends with a crazy sense of fashion loves to wear a tophat and a scarf so that you can't see his whole face but only his mouth. He thinks it's cool. I think it's pathetic.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: A poor, homeless child like Oliver Twist, with a hungry open mouth, is pathetic-- in the original sense of the noun "pathos." The tattered tophat and scarf he wears only adds to the pathos.

hints.author: jwy2k2
hints.mnemonic: Other definitions include grief, sorrow, pathos, pity, and sympathize. IMO the english word pathetic is often used nowadays to mean a sort of "contemptuous pity" but I think we need a more compasionate definition to understand 哀 , now and especially later when it starts being combined with other words...So, here's the top part of frame 308 享 (receive) but where the child was is now replaced by a scarf. Whatever fate befell the child is up to your imagination. grief, sorrow, pathos, sympathy, pathetic.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: That tall guy with the scarf is just so pathetic! (I can't help but see "tall" when I look at this kanji).

hints.author: DeadLugosi
hints.mnemonic: A hat, a mouth and a cloak, I think that's all that beggar owns. How pathetic!

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Keep distant from a lidded crock on the road wrapped in a scarf. It might be a bomb.

hints.author: eieneverafter
hints.mnemonic: When traveling to a distant land, what better way of keeping warm on the road is there than carrying a warm lidded crock and wearing a scarf?

hints.author: ojousan
hints.mnemonic: (NOTE

hints.author: whistler11
hints.mnemonic: In a game called 'spin the lidded-crock', contestants see how far distant they can roll a crock down the road by wrapping it in a scarf and spinning it like a top; the only rule is that the lid must stay on the crock. Picture a referee measuring the distance on the road to see how far distant you've spun the crock.

hints.author: anthropic
hints.mnemonic: It is best to stay distant from the dirty mouthed wino with the tatty scarf laying on the road.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: The MONKEY likes to play hide and seek with the PACK of WILD DOGS by hiding in the LIDDED CROCK. But he is easy to see because the SCARF he always wears is at the base of the LIDDED CROCK.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: To catch a monkey, chase him with wild dogs into a lidded crock, then tie it with a scarf.

hints.author: koiulpoi
hints.mnemonic: Honestly, I hate the "Lidded Crock with a scarf" metaphor. It makes no sense, and I just can't get an image that "sticks" with it, at all. Besides, it sounds retarded. The original meaning of the whole right side of this Kanji is "Long Kimono." So, put a wild dog in a kimono, stand him on two legs, and you've got something that looks like a man but still feral - a monkey.

hints.author: Supraman
hints.mnemonic: We should be starring the 2009-- stories, The 2006--2007 stories totally have a monopoly. GIVE THE NEW GUYS A CHANCE! ;) All you new guys star this.

hints.author: mickymay
hints.mnemonic: The upper right part means long kimono. 袁 is not in Heisig list, but if you remember it, you have an easier time later on. "Long kimono" is easier than "lidded crock with scarf." For its story look at Kanji 34945. Story for 猿

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: "This is the first time we've been out of the Shire, Mr. Frodo!" Says Sam, covering himself with his cloak and clutching his dagger.

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: On his FIRST TIME, he cloaked his dagger with a Trojan.

hints.author: Captain_Thunder
hints.mnemonic: Not only did I put on my robe and wizard's hat for my first time, but also my cloak and my dagger. That's when she walked out on me.

hints.author: Codewolke
hints.mnemonic: Your GF can get pregnant even on the first time... so from the first time on you should put a cloak on your sword (condom).

hints.author: Atomik
hints.mnemonic: The first time I tried on my new cloak, I discovered the inside was lined with daggers. There was no second time.

hints.author: hknamida
hints.mnemonic: If it looks like a towel, speaks like a towel and walks like a towel... I wonder why Heisig didn't include this one (as an actual kanji) in RtK 1.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: Obvious towel is obvious.

hints.author: sabretou
hints.mnemonic: If you got this far and need a story for towel, then you sir, have failed.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A towel is used as a belt to hold in your "walking stick".

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Primative from RTK1.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: A matador holding his red linen by his side.

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: The first rule of the Hitch-Hiker's Guide to the Universe is "DON'T PANIC!" The second rule, of course, is to always have a towel by your side. Personally, I prefer the linen sort.

hints.author: tomusan
hints.mnemonic: A linen towel should always be by your side just in case .

hints.author: dogray77
hints.mnemonic: If you made a towel showing all the great Communists of our time, 'linen' would be the furthest to the left.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Think of LINENS 'N THINGS opening up a new location in outer space. All they sell are towels, and we all know no outer space journey is complete without a towel by one's side.

hints.author: gsantise
hints.mnemonic: When stranded at sea, we needed a Sail. The best we had was a TOWEL, which was MEDICORE, only catching a DROP of WIND.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: A towel makes a mediocre sail.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: A sail is a piece of cloth used to catch every drop of wind.

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: One handy use for a towel, according to the Hitch-Hiker's Guide to the Universe, is as a sail. The effect will be mediocre, however, if there is little wind.

hints.author: stan_in_japan
hints.mnemonic: A towel makes a mediocre sail.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: In the west, the rich use $100 bills to light their cigars... In Japan, after showering, when the wealthy don't have any clean towels, they simply grab a hanging scroll off the wall and use it to dry off!

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: The towels of the wealthy

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: Check out http

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: In the west, the rich use $100 bills to light their cigars... In Japan, after showering, when the wealthy don't have any clean towels left , they simply grab a hanging scroll off the wall and use it to dry off! (Thanks Zazen! I can't seem to get the placement right here so I stuck the word left after towel to remind me where to put it!).

hints.author: KANJI
hints.mnemonic: WIDTH (keyword change) TOWEL wrapped around an enormous waist, associated with WEALTH in Japan.

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: If you wear a towel as a cap, you are at risk of being seized and searched in U.S. airports.

hints.author: kinkypete
hints.mnemonic: Originally the first cap was a turban which was a towel wrapped around the head to keep the sun out of the eyes.

hints.author: LordGolem
hints.mnemonic: Because it's a risk to stay under the sun in the desert, Arabs use to wear a towel as a cap.

hints.author: skellyfish
hints.mnemonic: When I think of a Japanese-style cap, I think of a TOWEL wrapped around someone's head. And we all know that the Japanese are obsessed with using caps, hats, umbrellas, etc. to minimize the RISK of skin damage. So know we have the form and the purpose of a cap in Japan.

hints.author: JohtoKen
hints.mnemonic: A cap is a cloth, which can help reducing the risk of the sun getting into your eyes.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: There is a graveyard outside my house that scares me, so I put a huge towel over the window to serve as a curtain so I can get a good nights sleep.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: When you're dead in the graveyard, "it's curtains for you.".

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: When a mobster says "It's gonna be curtains for you!" He means you'll be wrapped in a towel, dead in a graveyard.

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: After Towelie died, instead of burying him in a grave, we hung him up as a curtain so the neighbours couldn't see us hitting the bong.

hints.author: xeyes
hints.mnemonic: If you've read Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (SPOILERS AHEAD!)...think of the curtain in the depths of the Department of Mysteries, and what happens when Sirius encounters that curtain. (Well, yes, it's technically a veil, but since Heisig doesn't use that as a keyword, think of it as a really big...um...towel.).

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: A canopy is a towel to block the suns rays.

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: From the Hitch-Hiker's Guide to the Universe

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Picture a cafe in wartime Japan. Its' canopy is made of a big beach towel which has the imperial flag (the one with the sun's rays) printed upon it.

hints.author: lb4269
hints.mnemonic: (fighter canopy and tree canopy) Luke Skywalker is flying to see Yoda on Dagobah. He starts to crash, and he pops his canopy and uses a towel as a parachute. He gets stuck in a tree too high to jump down. The sun comes and starts to get very hot. He feels like he will be cooked alive. Yoda comes and tells him to use the Force. Luke concentrates, and he takes a ray of light from the sun and makes it solid. He then climbs down it like it is a pole.

hints.author: johngwk

hints.author: indigo

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Never heard of this word before encountering it here. So it turns out that the fanciest brocade in the world is actually a towel used by a Turkish monarch. It's embroidered with gold and cocaine. Yes, cocaine - what you thought it'd be something else? That is some true art right there. I think a great many people would want to own this towel.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: "Brocade" means 'twisted thread', and is usually made with gold and silver. Here it is written as a towel woven with gold and white.

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: First, the meaning of brocade in English

hints.author: duzymichal

hints.author: dwhitman

hints.author: smithsonian

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: First, note that the top half of the kanji consists of one and mountain. Of course, the "number 1" mountain in Japan is Mt. Fuji. The bottom half, under Mt. Fuji, consists of crown and towel. Now for the story. Archaeologists digging under Mt. Fuji (Japan's #1 mountain) in an ancient royal tomb (they know it's royal because of the crown) discover what looks like a towel, but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal sash for the king's kimono.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: WARNING

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Beautiful "Miss Housewife Japan" is on posters everywhere, cooking right before Mt. Fuji (the number one mountain) while wearing nothing but her crown, and an apron tied with a sash. (hodgepodge of mspertus, zwarte_kat, et al, with a jot of hadaka apron to focus the image.).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: The buckle is on the sash of the apron. (Note that according to the dictionary, breaking down this Kanji includes only the radicals for "walking stick", "one", "crown" and "towel". Hence, "mountain" is not part of the radicals.).

hints.author: deedriod
hints.mnemonic: Heisig fails to go into detail about the top kanji, but, It's not a mountain like everyone is saying. It actually means Thirty 丗 the stroke order starts with a One, then draw in the three vertical lines from left to right. Then the last stroke at the bottom closing it up. Then comes the Apron which makes up a Sash. (-Story

Just remember a powerful storm over an empty field and you're sure to remember this kanji.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: I yawn when I lack interest.

hints.author: sprutnik
hints.mnemonic: A bound up person lacks his freedom.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: This is clearly a BLOWJOB, we can see the MOUTH and the LACK OF condom. (I am sorry for the image, but it sticks forever in your mind).

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: How am I supposed to BLOW if I lack a mouth? (Imagine a kid at his own birthday party, and - like Neo in the Matrix - had no oriface where his mouth was to be. And yet, the people cruelly cheer him on to blow out his candles...).

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: I keep confusing this with suck (#689 吸). Consider someone blowing bubbles using their chewing gum because they're lacking attention in class.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: After your mouth opens and you yawn, you BLOW out a lot of air.

hints.author: meredithcat
hints.mnemonic: Blowing makes your mouth lack air.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Japanese cooking sometimes lacks fire, e.g., sashimi.

hints.author: Deonnn
hints.mnemonic: This character shows the difference between a cook and a chef

hints.author: Lizzie
hints.mnemonic: How can you cook something when you lack fire?

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is the first kanji for rice cooker ( 炊飯器 ). The reason they came up with that device is the sheer amount of incidents of people's morning rice going up in flames while they were yawning, trying to keep awake.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Ameyama
hints.mnemonic: Can-Can-ers lack the ability to sing a song, so they just dance.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Can-can dancers are supposed to be big-bosomed girls who dance. Yet these so called can-can dancers are flat-chested and singing a song, so audience of men is yawning in boredom.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Do you know the "Obama song"? It goes like

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: Modern SONGstresses have doubly-nice CANs, but LACK true musical talent.

hints.author: kaeru
hints.mnemonic: The Idol contestants think "I CAN I CAN SING THIS SONG" but most of them LACK talent.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Cars are rough steel things, lacking softness.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: If your car has really soft seats, you may start yawning and eventually fall asleep at the wheel (imagine that this seat is a huge soft beanbag that nearly swallows the driver, and it will be easier to remember).

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Someday, they will invent SOFT cars. The cars will be so safe that accidents will become no big deal. (Imagine drivers yawning as their cars crash into each other and bounce harmlessly away).

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: If you play SOFT rock in the CAR while driving, you'll soon start YAWNING.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: A softener commercial, but with anthropomorphized cars (similar to Pixar's Cars for example). The little baby car is wrapped in some kind of soft fabric and yawning. So cute!

hints.author: g33kette
hints.mnemonic: Is this store lacking ice? Let's try the next one, then.

hints.author: Lozza
hints.mnemonic: A rapper called "Ice" went for auditions but was told he lacked talent. Next...

hints.author: panjin79
hints.mnemonic: A lack of ice is the next phase of global warming.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Global warming has gotten extreme. You're sweltering in line at the ice rationing board. Every few minutes the sullen clerk yawns and says "next", and someone shuffles forward to get their ice cube.

hints.author: sethimayne
hints.mnemonic: The next time you yawn, I'm going to put ice down your shirt to wake you up!

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: To prevent animals from eating the beautiful flowers in your garden, the best thing to do is to plant briar bushes immediately next to them.

hints.mnemonic: The briar patch may look unremarkable now before it blooms, but there will be flowers next, and it will be beautiful.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Once you plant your flowers, what inevitably come up next are briars.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: An important life lesson

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: Briars are the kind of flowers that comes up next after a property is abandoned....it's an ecological succession.

hints.author: peace123
hints.mnemonic: Assets are the next best thing to money.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: The first SHELLS you get you obviously spend, but the NEXT SHELLS are your ASSETS, you should bury them in a low safe place (placement!).

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: I invest my assets in NEXTEL and SHELL.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: "I've already taken your assets!" says your ex-wife, adding "Next, I'm taking your money!" as she walks away with a satisfied grin on her face.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: The topless model was concerned about protecting her ASSETS so she went to Next (British high street clothes shop) and bought a tasteful pair of colourful shells. Next she stood outside in the street, with the sign for Next clearly visible over her head, and fixed them in position with chewing gum.

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: The next woman always has a better figure! Thinking like that, you'll end up alone in an old folks home longing for the good old days!

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: Whenever I am next to a woman, I can't help but take notice of her figure.

hints.author: rachels
hints.mnemonic: The next woman always has a better figure ! Thinking like this is a burden weighing down many women. - (Thanks to alantin, but the last statement helps me get the placement right - it always used to be a problem with this kanji).

hints.author: ew8049
hints.mnemonic: First you see her FIGURE, NEXT you get to know the WOMAN behind the curves.

hints.author: TwoGoats
hints.mnemonic: When i am next to a woman, i imagine her figure under me =D.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Having a word with the next mouth over, like a neighbor, is usually a good way to consult with somebody for cheap. Because, you know, actual consultants charge huge sums.

hints.author: g33kette
hints.mnemonic: "Consulting with" is having words with the next mouth.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Don't like the words of the first one? Consult with the next mouth available.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: If you've ever had to deal with consultants in business, you'll find that once you bring in one, there's always a reason to drag in more; a real drain on your resources. So I see this as the constant steam of words from the next mouth, all telling you that you need more conultants.

hints.author: burritokun

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Compensation is money you give to someone to shut them up (i.e. muzzle their mouth).

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Compensation is a kind of euphemism for hush money here. Money that muzzles.

hints.author: Jenelle
hints.mnemonic: I expect compensation for the bite I recieved when you didn't muzzle your dog.

hints.author: akahige
hints.mnemonic: In "compensated dating", Japanese girls earn shells from oyaji. The oyajis' members stand at attention and the girls use their mouths to earn their compensation.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: When I see this keyword I think of 'compensated dating' (AKA enjo kosai). A man hands over his money to the girl and then stands up, and she then opens up her mouth to compensate him. If that girl's parents want to fix her problem, they are going to need to put a muzzle on her!

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: To cultivate the land is to tame it, control it. In short, you muzzle it's unruly, chaotic nature. 培う つちかう to cultivate, to foster; 栽培 (さいばい)

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: The illegal immigrants cultivate the land but are socially and politically muzzled (wear muzzles while they work too).

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: In olden times the land (soil) was cultivated by farmers who were muzzled by the land owners

hints.author: fiddle
hints.mnemonic: The SOIL is MUZZLED to stop it screaming as it is CULTIVATED (torn up with blades).

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Image people cultivating , standing in a hole in the ground, preparing the soil to receive the next crop.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: When you DIVIDE someone, there is sure to be a lot of screaming. That's why you should use a MUZZLE before using the SABER.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Divide and Conquer

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Divide and conquer - first you cut them up (saber) , then you shut them up (muzzle).

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: The two women keep arguing about whose baby it is. So Solomon muzzles the both of them, pulls out a sword, and prepares to divide the child between the two.

hints.author: tstuhldreher
hints.mnemonic: In order to MUZZLE the two complaining women, Solomon offered to divide the child with a SABER.

hints.author: Aploosh
hints.mnemonic: If you were standing on the sun, believe me, you'd be making sound.

hints.author: HMiettinen
hints.mnemonic: The tongue wagging in a mouth produces a very high-pitched sound, breaking a nearby vase.

hints.author: wazato
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the SOUNDs a woman makes as she is STANDing above a WAGGING TOUNGE.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: Note that sound is very close to the muzzle primitive (it has the sun instead of the mouth at the bottom) - but in meaning they are precisely opposite!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: I STAND UP every DAY to the SOUND of [insert sound here].

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Picture the sun exploding - there would be a gigantic noise and then...nothing. Everything would plunge into darkness.

hints.mnemonic: In places of complete darkness, such as caves where the sun can't reach, creatures such as bats have learned to navigate by sound rather than sight. The poor guys must have to fly around screaming "Marco!" and "Polo!" all the time.

hints.author: eatyoda
hints.mnemonic: Total darkness lacks sun and sound.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: In the darkness of that dank solitary confinement cell, all you can do is fantasize about sun and sound.
