hints.mnemonic: Heisig was careless with his story for silence (#240 黙). i have a really hard time confusing it for this one now.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: What is a RHYME but some SOUND that EMPLOYEES say to get them through work.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: Dr Seuss's employee finally rebels against him

hints.author: Alunalun
hints.mnemonic: A rhyme is the sound of an employee going off to work. Everyone knows that ever since 'Snow White' in 1937 all employees sing 'hi ho, hi ho, it's off to work I go' (because it's so catchy! And it's so catchy because 'ho' rhymes with 'go'!).

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: "Sound as a pound" is a rhyme that fits the kanji. Sound + pound. Pounds being what you make when you're an employee (living in the UK that is).

hints.author: Immacolata

hints.author: amthomas
hints.mnemonic: Words are difficult to discriminate/discern from sounds in the middle of a fiesta.

hints.author: dwhitman

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: I wonder why Heisig didn't use discernment for this kanji. It fits the meaning equally and it is not as loaded as discrimination. // It is quite hard to discern words in the middle of a noisy fiesta.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: Discriminating someone's words from other sounds is hard to do in the middle of a noisy fiesta. (Thanks esaulgd).

hints.author: dihutenosa

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Mirror should suggest vanity. Imagine a spoiled girl who gets her parents to buy her a Golden mirror so she can stand in front of it all day vainly admiring her lovely human legs.

hints.author: digicult
hints.mnemonic: The metal mirror makes a sound - it's answering the question "who has the fairest human legs of all?".

hints.author: tritonxginnenglish
hints.mnemonic: metal + stand up + sun + legs  remember the legend of Amaterasu who retired in a cave. the other Gods brought a MIRROR made of polished  METAL at the entrance of the cave. Amaterasu who was STANDING UP saw her image of the SUN  and began to dance with her LEGS.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: Remember how Archimedes burnt an approaching fleet with mirrors? Mirrors then were metal and the sailors must have thought

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: WARNING

hints.author: nyquil
hints.mnemonic: In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put mirrors on the boundary of his land so it feels much bigger.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: This is an old trick to keep out migrants. You put a bunch of dirty mirrors on the boundary of your land and theirs. When they approach the boundary, what they see in the mirror is their own land and someone that looks like themselves, only dirtier, so they figure your country isn't any better than their own and they head back home.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Boundaries and borders (another meaning of this kanji) used to be protected by daggers and swords (see environs, frame 284); but today our lands are protected by one-way mirrors at airport customs with video cameras and interrogation rooms behind them.

hints.author: tstuhldreher
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, you often see MIRRORS at intersections. That's because the walls that form the boundary of people's LAND make it hard to see around corners.

hints.author: Rujiel
hints.mnemonic: Be aware the right-hand character 竟 really means "endpoint" or "finally"; it's commonly read "つい" (as in "ついに") and usually written in kana alone. A boundary represents a country's land's endpoint (awkward phrasing for order) .

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: The top hat hanging on a hook belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin.

hints.author: Robatsu
hints.mnemonic: The recently DECEASED are said to hang their hats on a hook by the door to the afterlife.

hints.author: ihatobu

hints.author: mezbup

hints.author: terozen

hints.mnemonic: The blind man could not see anything with his EYES, but he claimed, when he looked up, he could see the DECEASED existing above.

hints.mnemonic: Formerly, horned animals were used to plough the ricefield, and it took all day. Nowadays it's done by machine.

hints.author: shadolite
hints.mnemonic: The horns found in the ricefields were formerly used in rituals celebrating the sun goddess, amaterasu.

hints.author: Hyreia
hints.mnemonic: I can't help but see this as the former president of the United Sates, George W. Bush. The horns growing out of his brain with an evil thought, his tongue wagging in his mouth, saying something stupid. (It helps later on. Increase = him increasing the national deficit until we have nothing but dirt left, Hate = Bush's mind). Fun stuff.

hints.author: cricket
hints.mnemonic: This was formerly a human, but it has turned into a demon, with only jagged horns sticking out of its brain and a disgusting wagging tongue at the bottom.

hints.author: sannomiya
hints.mnemonic: Prices always INCREASE for LAND that was FORMERLY cheaper.

hints.author: submacrolize
hints.mnemonic: Farmers work the land so they can INCREASE their formerly puny crop supply.

hints.author: atylmo
hints.mnemonic: Lately, the artist formerly known as "Formerly Known As Prince", if you can believe it, has become increasingly dirtier in his songs.

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: This land on which "The Artist Formerly Known as Prince*" built his house has increased in value.

hints.author: shimouma
hints.mnemonic: Formerly there was lots of land for everyone. But as the world population increases, your own piece of dirt is becoming more and more difficult to secure.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: Imagine if the number of presents you get increases with each birthday. So on your first birthday, you receive just one shell as a present, but the next year it increases to two shells as presents, and so on, increasing and increasing so by the time you're elderly, the number of shells you'll get as presents will have increased to an awful lot of presents. GOT IT YET? PRESENTS = SHELLS + INCREASE.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: The artist formerly known as Prince gave presents to all his fans. Picture him throwing live oysters into the audience as he performs. People are horrified and start gagging from the smell.

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: SEA SHELLS were FORMALLY great PRESENTS. Nowadays kids wants playstation and DS!

hints.author: Seiska
hints.mnemonic: The money spent on presents increases every Christmas

hints.author: neilhalligan
hints.mnemonic: FORMERLY at Christmas I got PRESENTS, but now I just get MONEY.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Traditionally seen as a pictograph of the sun rising behind a tree.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Through the trees, I watch the sun rising from the east.

hints.author: g33kette
hints.mnemonic: To the east, you'll notice a rather large tree growing in the middle of that ricefield.

hints.author: saleem
hints.mnemonic: Imagine that hugely symbolic Japanese SUN piercing through a TREE as it sets on Tokyo ( 東京 ), the EASTern capital . (with thanks to AndamanIslander, just found it easier to remember this version).

hints.author: hornlo
hints.mnemonic: [ east = tree overlay sun ] - look east and you can see the sun rising through the upper branches of the trees

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a house should be made of wood and face east.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: Ok just a note to the 'ridgepole facing east story' im making up a story to JUSTIFY why that is the case. Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a 'sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is', back in those days when people used ridgepoles they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning).

hints.author: shank
hints.mnemonic: Way back when, all Japanese houses were made of wood and built with the ridgepole facing east. The reason for this is that since there were no alarm clocks yet, everyone needed the rising sun to wake them up every morning.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I need a ridgepole for the house I'm building. It's a very important part of the structure, so I need the best ridgepole money can buy. That means I need to special order one. The best ridgepole is made from a tree grown in the east. When the shipment arrives, I verify that the ridgepole is best quality by looking at the tree and seeing the east symbol stamped on it.

hints.author: alphador
hints.mnemonic: Secondo il feng shui la TRAVE PORTANTE di un edificio deve essere fatta di LEGNO e puntare ad EST.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Eastern Siberia is often frozen by ice. According to wikipedia, Yakutia (in Eastern Siberia) holds the record as the coldest town on Earth. Check it out yourself...it made it stick for me!

hints.author: Wizard
hints.mnemonic: The ice will stay frozen until the sun is visible through the trees.

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: It is always the east side of anything, mountain, yard, forest, that stays frozen with ice.

hints.author: crayonmaster
hints.mnemonic: ICE will stay FROZEN during the night, until the SUN rises over the EAST TREES.

hints.author: dat5h
hints.mnemonic: Imagine your freezer ( 冷凍庫 れいとうこ) breaking down in the middle of the winter. The temperatures are just around freezing (it'll have to do). So you decide to bury all of your food in the ice outside to keep it fresh. As the sun rises in the east you must quickly move all of your perishables to the other side because of melting (of course remembering to move it back as the sun moves over the trees to the other side). It's tiresome but it'll have to do until you can fix the freezer.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A pregnant woman is a porter of her child.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: A woman becomes pregnant when a drop of gentleman gets inside her.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: The gentleman gave the woman a bit of sperm...BAM PREGNANCY!

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: In PREGNANCY, a woman needs a porter to carry her bags to her room.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (Image

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: A porter has run away from his master. His punishment is to be stretched out on the rack. So say the courts in this barbaric time.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: The gentleman stretched the truth a bit in court.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Stretching the truth in court caused a drop of sweat on the gentleman's brow.

hints.author: gopineapples
hints.mnemonic: In court they STRETCHED the PORTER on the rack until he confessed. Torture!!!

hints.author: hornlo
hints.mnemonic: [ courts = stretch(porter) ] - the courts, porters of justice, sometimes stretch the letter of the law for their own ends.

hints.author: munia
hints.mnemonic: To make this dye, I used water and the barks of nine different trees.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The baseball team hangs their freshly dyed dripping jerseys at the top of a tree to dry.

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: Dye is a liquid that has to be applied nine times to stain the wood below.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [dye; color; paint; stain; print] The most common dyes are liquids that come in nine colors (the 7 of the rainbow, plus white and black), and are extracted from trees.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Dye a tree with the liquid in a lengthy 9-step process. I always remember the 9 because so far it's the number I've seen most used as a third primitive in kanji, especially with tree. For placement, just remember it's the liquid poured 9 times over the tree.

hints.author: saruwatari
hints.mnemonic: Any sort of thing can burn in the fire.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese are very particular about what SORT OF THINGs are considered BURNable trash and what's not.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Somebody from PETA is really angry that they sell dog meat in China, so they've gone to burn down the whole cart (my mnemonic for "sort of thing" was seeing strips of dog flesh roasting, and saying "well, that's just the sort of thing they do here in China).

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: Fire burns any sort of thing.

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: The "hot diggety dog" sort of thing caught on fire and exploded in the kitchen, causing me to sustain third-degree BURNS all over.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: This house is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not one of the few with enough money to call you that way, keep out!

hints.author: bendyarm
hints.mnemonic: The V.I.P. visits your house, but your ceiling is too low for his inflated head, which he bumps and hurts. You have to give him your few shells as compensation.

hints.author: vicnet
hints.mnemonic: HONEY! We've got a V.I.P visiting tonight!! Let's decorate the house a little why don't we? That ceiling is boring, let's hang a few fancy shells up there, that'll impress them!

hints.author: GenPDP7
hints.mnemonic: There's only one V.I.P. in the house, and all I can do is focus on her animal legs.

hints.author: matstc
hints.mnemonic: If you are a VIP, you are the only one who can enter the house without paying the cover charge (a few shells).

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Santa had to put his foot down to stop a march of little guys, namely elves. They were protesting the harsh treatment they get every year-end when Santa asks them to step up toy production for the holiday season.

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: At the year-end, everything seems to come to a stop. However, there's still enough time for a little march to celebrate.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: At year-end, we stop for a small celebration before marching ahead into the new year.

hints.author: cezpeleta
hints.mnemonic: At year-end, STOP and celebrate with a LITTLE MARCH.

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: Every YEAR-END, its important to STOP and have ONE LITTLE PARADE to celebrate.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: In Japanese this is KEN, as in Barbie's boyfriend. He has lovely blue eyes, a girlfriend who is as thin as a straightened out fish hook. But, down where it counts, he has very little to show...

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: After sticking a fishhook in your eye, the yakuza boss probably has little more to do to convince you to move to a different prefecture.

hints.author: kresobilan
hints.mnemonic: Smaller administrative units, hooked together by a (Sauron's) central eye.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Contradictory to what Heisig says, there is no eye of a needle in this picture, because that would be the top part of 直 . Instead, there is the eye of a fishhook. I will not hazard a guess as to what lives in such a place, but in fact the eye of a fishhook - as it has well-defined borders - makes a small prefecture of its own.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Eye (I) live in a small prefecture full of hookers.

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: There are a bunch of HORSE CHESTNUT TREES on top of this CLIFF above the beach. Chestnuts keep rolling off the cliff and falling on people's heads. So far TEN THOUSAND people have been killed by falling chestnuts, and the Japanese government still ain't did shit about it.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: There is a horse chestnut tree that has grown by a cliff for so long, it has deposited 10,000 horse chesnuts that lie at the bottom. Don't worry over this one too much, you'll spend so much time trying to figure out the right story for it, you probably won't forget it.

hints.author: Lizzie
hints.mnemonic: Horse chestnut trees grows in tens of thousands under the cliff.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: Strokes 5 and 6 are in reverse order, so it's not an ordinary cliff, but a drag (primitive at the beginning of lesson 50!) Story

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: This is NOT a cliff. the first stroke is right to left and slanted a bit. in fact, it's more like the axe blade of the axe character. story

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Picture the ground as an extent of soil where scorpions are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying 'no trespassing, scorpion mines' if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there.

hints.author: bigspenderJ
hints.mnemonic: The soil is littered with scorpions everywhere and no ones dares put their foot on the ground.

hints.author: harhol
hints.mnemonic: The DIRT SCORPION is a ground-type pokémon.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: You can't escape the scorpions on the ground by jumping into the pond 池 - scorpions like both soil and water!

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: Ground Zero, after the bombings, only scorpions could live there.

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: Remember the story of the scorpion that begged the turtle for a ride across the pond? Halfway across the water, the scorpion stung the turtle on the neck and they both sank to the bottom.

hints.author: yvanc
hints.mnemonic: Water scorpions loves to live in the pond.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: The POND was infested with WATER SCORPIONS.

hints.author: stshores24
hints.mnemonic: You thought water snakes were bad...this pond has WATER SCORPIONS. One sting and you're dead.

hints.author: lena1849
hints.mnemonic: Take out the 1st layer of soil in "ground" 地 , and add water. You've got a pond.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: I see the bottom of this kanji as an arm, and the top is an insect biting into the arm, sucking some blood.

hints.author: alexmat
hints.mnemonic: Insect in one drop of amber. Think Jurassic Park.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: An insect stuck its sharp, needle-like mouth in my arm and sucked out one drop of blood.

hints.author: lee101
hints.mnemonic: Just Remember it.

hints.author: alpuri
hints.mnemonic: The top part is IN as for INSECT. the bottom part is the arm in which the insect stings. (thanks Shibo).

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Bugs have to go to school to learn how to become lightning bugs. Only the brightest bugs graduate to become lightning bugs.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Q

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: In the schoolhouse for insects, the brightest are obviously the lightning-bugs.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Think of a small Japanese Schoolhouse in the country. The young children have caught some lightning-bugs in a jar and placed it next to window. Long after the children go home and the sun sets, the jar continues to illuminate the room. For me, this Kanji isn't about keywords, but a strong visual.

hints.author: Davve
hints.mnemonic: Poor schoolhouses can't afford electricity. As you can't teach in the dark the only solution is lightning-bugs! It's easy. Catch a thousand or so of them, bunch them together in a box and attach your wires to the box. Electricity flows through the wires as soon as the lightning starts flashing inside the box. Each bug has begun attacking it's neighbour with it's special weapon - the stinging rod of Lightning!

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: A snake eats insects and he does that outside, while we eat in the house and preferably with a spoon.

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: I use a spoon to feed my pet-snake insects in the house.

hints.author: potempkin
hints.mnemonic: The Far Side cartoon

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: My snake secretly eats insects outside the house, but in the house, he uses a spoon and follow etiquette! (adapted from nilfisq).

hints.author: cingold
hints.mnemonic: Solid Snake gets into his insect camouflage ready to infiltrate the house - the insect suit doesn't allow weapons to be carried so he pilfers a spoon and takes out the Patriots within, getting out aliv...Snake? Snake? SNAAAAAAKEEEEE!

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Little is it known that a rainbow is actually created by insects of different colours flying in formation, a craft they have perfected to create the rainbows we see today.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: Rainbow is of course created by billions of colored insects (what? you really thought it was an optical illusion?). However I had problems remembering that the insect primitive goes on the left. If you have similar difficulties, try this

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: For my arts and CRAFTs project at school, I made a rainbow out of dead BUGs spray painted different colors and glued to some paper. The teacher was not amused.

hints.author: Autolycus91982
hints.mnemonic: I see rainbow. I.C. rainbow. Insect Craft Rainbow.

hints.author: mcaruso
hints.mnemonic: You know Skittles, "Taste the RAINBOW"? The colorant that gives red Skittles their deep crimson color comes from crushing a type of insect called cochineal. So the next time you taste the RAINBOW, remember that you're really tasting insects crafted into sweets. (See

hints.author: zwarte_kat
hints.mnemonic: A butterfly is an insect that appears after spending a generation on a tree as a cocoon.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: Butterflies are insects that like to eat just the flowers but leave the leaves behind. (helps me to think of the kanji for leaves, minus the flower bit).

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: If an ugly insect can spend many generations in a tree, it will emerge as a beautiful butterfly.

hints.author: wilsoncb
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a tree which is weighed down, so much that its bending over, perhaps, by GENERATIONS of accumulated cocoons (this also helps place generation over tree). You know which INSECT is responsible

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: The bachelor's apartment looked like it had been attacked by a pack of wild dogs. There were even insects in the kitchen. No wonder he's single!

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: A SINGLE guy is a WILD DOG who BUGS many women.

hints.author: TunS77
hints.mnemonic: I'm telling you, A pack of wild dogs were taken down by a SINGLE insect!!! Shocking, I know.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: Dawg, you're single cuz you got fleas in your hair!

hints.author: killerducky
hints.mnemonic: The bachelor is single because he has a pack of wild dogs with insects (flees) instead of a nice dog.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: There are no insects in heaven - well, that is, except for silkworms. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China?

hints.author: kokeshidoll17
hints.mnemonic: In China it was believed that the silkworms were insects sent from heaven because of the beautiful material they produced.

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine an insect, the silkworm descending from a heavenly, golden, cloud- filled sky on a single string of silk.

hints.author: g33kette
hints.mnemonic: Heavenly bug.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: The poor silkworm insect goes up to heaven after we boil its coccoon to take its silk.

hints.author: Ceryn
hints.mnemonic: They say that when an INSECT flaps its wings even the single DROP of WIND that it creates is sometimes enough to create a hurricane on the other side of the Earth.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The WIND usually carries things around in it - drops of rain or snow, and lots of insects.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Most people don't know that wind is actually created by a bunch of insects at the end of the earth. They wake up in the morning, twist their fitted blue baseball caps backwards (see it on top of their head?), and get to work flapping their wings as hard as they can, causing the wind shockwave to spread in all directions.

hints.author: burritokun
hints.mnemonic: Ever heard of the butterfly effect? All it takes is one flap of an insect's wings to alter the wind patterns around the world. http

hints.author: Rujiel
hints.mnemonic: Mediocre insects get caught in the wind.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This kanji looks like the "s" of "self", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his "self".

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: When Superman looks at himself in the mirror, this is what he sees on his chest.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: I is self educated! I drawed this "S" all by myself!

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: I can't believe I didn't think of this as a primitive before. What word starts with the letter 's' and ends up producing someone like your 'self' later on? Sperm. Sperm are wiggly, like a snake, Contain 記 written dna records of yourself into them like words on a page, 起 rise up and run out of the penis once they ejaculate. require wrapping to prevent having babies, 包 . The task master of the sperm, 改 , make up ya own story. 紀 an era is like a thread line of different sperm that conquered the days.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: SSSSSSSSelf!.

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: Be careful when you're RUNNING through the jungle, because you might step on and ROUSE a sleeping SNAKE. Then you'll have to RUN like hell before it bites you!

hints.author: mfistik
hints.mnemonic: Nothing will rouse you quite as much as finding a snake in your bed. You will run away like you've never run before!

hints.author: smujohnson
hints.mnemonic: Yelling "Run!!! Snake!!!" is more than enough to rouse anyone nearby.

hints.author: ngoli1
hints.mnemonic: I was having a nightmare that I was running from a snake when my mum roused me from my sleep. "Wakey, wakey, run from snakey!".

hints.author: dizzwave
hints.mnemonic: Whenever I rouse myself from bed, I find that all the blood has mysteriously run to my snake. (The same can be said for being a-roused!).

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Cleopatra.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Be careful you don't pick up a drag queen at a club - they might look like women, but they have a snake down there!

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: Queen Cleopatra ends her reign (and life) with the help of a snake.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Medusa, the snake queen. She's the penultimate "snake woman".

hints.author: Daffydus
hints.mnemonic: A queen is a woman who only thinks about her self (#525 己).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: The taskmaster of Slytherin ( wizardry house symbolized by a snake ) plans a reformation of Hogwarts, disallowing the study of magic to all muggle-born. こわいですね！.

hints.author: krungthep
hints.mnemonic: If you want to achieve the reformation of your inner self you have to control your desires and correct your flaws; in sum, be your own self taskmaster.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: This is a Meiji reformation taskmaster, trying to force usage of the Roman alphabet in Japan in place of Kanji. He holds a snake in the shape of the letter S and tries to explain how much simpler this is (j/k).

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: The Reformation was led by Martin Luther, regarded as a serpent-in-the-grass by the Catholic Church, but as a noble taskmaster by his followers. 改革 かいかく reform, reformation, innovation; 改札 かいさつ ticket gate; 改める あらためる to change, alter, reform, revise.

hints.author: munia
hints.mnemonic: Snakes are so twisted that only the most skilled taskmaster can achieve their reformation.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: A scribe writes down the words spoken by a snake (i.e. a lawyer).

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: Snakes have no hands. So, when a snake needs to write down something, it has to call in a SCRIBE, who will write down all the sayings of the snake.

hints.author: samesong
hints.mnemonic: This scribe was truely badass - to jot down words, he would grab the nearest snake and squeeze it's venom out of it's fangs and use it as ink.. no pen for this guy.

hints.author: elhnad
hints.mnemonic: A scribe writes down the words using the snakes venom.

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: The scribes of yore had no pens or paper. To transcribe words they had to train snakes to twist their bodies into letters as they were spoken to.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The snake bound up its prey by wrapping his body around it.

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Jessie sending in her Ekans (snake pokemon), and telling it to use bind attack to wrap up pikachu.

hints.author: burritokun
hints.mnemonic: Wrap it before you tap it (wrap what? your snake, of course...).

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: Picture a snake all bound up in wrapping paper (to keep from confusing it with other kanji).

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: When you WRAP a Christmas gift, you BIND it UP by your - SELF.

hints.author: wzafran
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a newborn baby, fresh out of the womb, being entirely wrapped by the long piece of flesh, called a placenta, that once fed him.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Placenta is flesh/part of the body wrapped around the foetus.

hints.author: Phil2Musashi
hints.mnemonic: Placenta is the flesh that wrapped around us when we were in the womb.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 胞子 , 共産党細胞 , 細胞核 , 同胞 ,placenta (#531 胞)ホウ( 包 ) ... Parts

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: The placenta is the part of the body which feeds the baby. However this unlucky baby didnt make it because the placenta wrapped around its neck and choked it to death. Not a nice story, but a memorable one. (And I know it's the umbilical cord that feeds the baby, but that doesnt affect the story).

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Primitive cannons fired stones wrapped with poisonous snakes.

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: Cannon = stone projectile wrapped by a barrel.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: A stone wrapped in smoke blazes from the mouth of a cannon.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Picture a very powerful cannon (such as on pirate ships), only this one's on an island, and pointed at the sea. It's recoil had to be dealt with somehow, so it is placed in a tight-fitting alcove of stone. Hence "stone-wrapped cannon".

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Rather than a cannon, think of a catapult or trebuchet. Both these siege engines fire a large stone that is initially wrapped up or cradled in some fashion. 鉄砲 (てっぽう)

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: When water forms a bubble, it wraps a pocket of air.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: To prevent people from popping bubble wrap for fun, the post office has started filling the bubbles with water.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: Bubbles are just air wrapped up in a layer of water.

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: Bubbles are WATER WRAPPED around air.

hints.author: pjhoover
hints.mnemonic: Anyone remember the disney version of robin hood? the snake falls into the ale (water) then goes about spying on robin hood as a helicopter with a bubble wrapped around his head.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: It seems bizarre, but tortoises are a genetic cross with the head of a fish and the tail of an eel. Where the shell comes from, no one knows.

hints.author: skylarth
hints.mnemonic: A tortoise is prosperity bound up with a tail. They are very lucky creatures.

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: Tortoises are known to live relatively long lives (it is not uncommon for them to exceed 100 years of age). Thus, a tortoise is a creature that is bound by its shell to see many days, with its little tail peeking out.

hints.author: Yuta73
hints.mnemonic: Tortoise. DBZ. This is goku's symbol in his back. How can I forget it!

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: [addition to dwhitman's] It seems bizarre, but tortoises are a genetic cross with the head of a fish and the tail of an eel. They are the symbol of prosperity (stroke order).

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Think of a two natural sources of electricity

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: This kanji was invented by the first Chinaman to discover electricity. He was so unfortunate, he stepped on an electric eel and got struck by lighting at the same time.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: When it RAINS , if you put an electric EEL in the swimming pool , you can generate ELECTRICITY.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: It's unwise to stand in the rain while holding an electric eel. Picture getting struck by lightning because of this.

hints.author: Norman
hints.mnemonic: If it rains on an electric eel, expect electricity.

hints.author: niktok
hints.mnemonic: Have you ever seen an asian DRAGON? it looks like an eel, but can stand up because it has legs.

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: A dragon is like a standing eel.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: If the poor villagers don't provide him with a vase full of eels each day, the dragon will lay waste to the village.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Dragons actually evolved from eels a long time ago - they learned to stand up and became much bigger (and the ability to produce electricity evolved into fire-breathing).

hints.author: deadsexylady
hints.mnemonic: Think Mushu from Mulan. Mushu was far from the most impressive dragon. He looked nothing more than a eel standing up. Mulan was very disappointed.

hints.author: mhaellix
hints.mnemonic: The Water Dragon dwells in the waterfall.

hints.author: smujohnson
hints.mnemonic: Ever went under a waterfall, vase in hand, trying to catch eels from the water as it pours down?

hints.author: migge
hints.mnemonic: A WATERFALL makes the WATER roar like a DRAGON.

hints.author: snozle
hints.mnemonic: I imagine an incredibly high waterfall spilling into a small vase. Several eel are swimming over the edge and having a diving competition to see whether they can make it into the vase. Just imagine a few missing and you're set.

hints.author: Xzbeat
hints.mnemonic: In Saint Seiya, the Dragon knight was always training under a Waterfall.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: Pork comes from the flesh of a sow.

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: One possible pictograph for "sow" primitive

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: When a mother pig nurses its piglets, we call it a SOW. When that same mother pig's body parts are on our plates, we call them PORK.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: Pork is the name we give to the flesh of a sow.

hints.author: FuDaWei
hints.mnemonic: When Kermit was caught eating barbecued PORK rinds at the bar with Fozzie, he spent an entire month apologizing to Miss Piggy.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: In association with consummate (#540 遂), our sow is on the road pursuing a mate.

hints.author: samueruht
hints.mnemonic: The pig is on the road in the pursue of the turtle who is trying to escape (#283 逃). (See story on escape (#283 逃) & consummate (#540 遂)).

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: In order to hunt for food one must pursue the fat sow on the road.

hints.author: dizzwave
hints.mnemonic: Miss Piggy, everybody's favorite sow, is hitting the road to pursue her long lost Kermit the frog.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Think of cops (P.I.G.s) pursuing someone down the road. (e.g. a Ron Ronnie Run clip).

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: This is still Miss Piggy only she's gotten horny (as she often does) and now she's pursuing Kermit to help her consummate her desires.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: I don't often complain about Heisig's keywords - but 'consummate' is a little misleading. Think about this kanji in terms of ACCOMPLISH or "realize" rather than a sexual encounter. Or, combine the two

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: In association with pursue (#539 逐), our sow has tracked down a suitable mate, they've consummated their relationship, and now the little sow is all grown up into a boar with horns.

hints.author: noushina
hints.mnemonic: The Horny Pig Consummates in the middle of the Road.

hints.author: samueruht
hints.mnemonic: The turtle promised to marry the pig, but after some second thoughts the turtle is on the road trying to escape (#283 逃) and the pig is on the pursue (#539 逐). We end up with a horny pursuer trying to consummate the matrimony.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Think of "The Three Little Pigs". There was a house made of straw, another made of sticks, and a third made of bricks, each occupied by a pig. So, naturally, housetop over pig means house, the central element of that story.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Man, ever hear of cleaning? This house is a pig sty.

hints.author: mattoc_g
hints.mnemonic: Miss piggy in the hooooooooooooooooouse.

hints.author: chucklol
hints.mnemonic: ALL YOUR HOUSE ARE BELONG TO PIG.

hints.author: ew8049
hints.mnemonic: ANIMAL FARM - The PIGS took to taking charge of the barn HOUSE.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the woman feels more like she's married into the house than into a relationship.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Traditionally, it was the women who would marry into the households of their husband's families.

hints.author: yawfosu88
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a beautiful woman, say Rihanna, being married inside your house to a pig, an actual pig. Your house is filled with her pig family dressed up like humans. 'I can't believe it, this beautiful woman is about to marry into a pig family right in my house!'.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: 婿嫁婚姻

hints.author: mattoc_g
hints.mnemonic: A poor woman marrying into the house of a real pig.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: In Orwell's 'Animal Farm' the pigs overpowered every other animals. They crownded themselves as ruler of the farm and walked tall on their rear legs, a crime strictly forbidden in the animal republic.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: Ganon, the tall crowned pig, has been overpowering ther land of Hyrule for decades.

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: The tall, crowned "king-porker" from Orwell's Animal Farm was an overpowering pig named Napoleon.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is also used for Australia. Think about it from Japan's point of view. On average Australians are taller than the Japanese. Australia is nominally a monarchy, indicated by the crown. As far as manners go, compared to the Japanese, typical ockers are pigs.

hints.author: bigspenderJ
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a tall crown wearing Ms. Piggy beating the $#it out of Kermit...

hints.author: Twentytw0
hints.mnemonic: Intestines are the part of the body that is taken out of piglets to make piggy banks. Just imagine factory workers scraping out the intestines of real piglets and packaging them up for little children.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Taking things too literally, you used a real piglet as a piggy bank. Now when you smash it open to get your coins out, you have to dig out your coins from its intestines. ew.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a child's horror if upon smashing open his piggy bank, instead of coins, instestines(flesh) pours out.

hints.author: nagisa
hints.mnemonic: The intestines are like the piggy bank of your flesh, everyday you deposit a little more into them...

hints.author: uchifly
hints.mnemonic: The INTESTINES are the part of our BODY that acts like our PIGGY BANKS. We store our food in it!

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: You're looking for a good location to bury your piggy bank savings. It has to be in some soft soil that's easy to dig up, well hidden, and easy to rememger like this kanji.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Don't confuse with place (#1127 所). Think of location not as a single fixed spot, but as the act of locating. You've buried your piggy bank in the dirt in your backyard, but you can't remember where. You frantically dig everywhere in a process of location to find your piggy bank.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Location, location, location, they say in the real estate business, cuz they know if you find the right bit of soil, you can pretty much take that to the (piggy) bank.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: A pile of soil marks the location of where I burried my piggy-bank.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: A pirate finally finds the location of a legendary buried treasure, where X marked the spot. But after long hours of digging, he discovers it was just some kid's piggy bank. ARRRRR!!!!

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a hot water kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder!

hints.author: Clint
hints.mnemonic: Hot water is a phrase that can mean "getting into trouble." This kanji pictures just one of the many meanings of that phrase

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: My HOT WATER cut off because I forgot to pay the bill. So I break open my piggy bank and run to the local 銭湯 (sentou; public bath).

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: Hot water is the kind of water you don't have when your piggy bank is empty.

hints.author: Savara
hints.mnemonic: If you put your piggy bank in hot water you will make sure no one can get to it... ... including yourself.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Picture of a sheep run over by a steam roller. Must have been a ram, note the horns.

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Our Lord and King put on ears and a tail to become a lowly sheep for the slaughter.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: The horny king of the SHEEP had a huge erection.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: (you might consider using something with a religious connotation when used as a primitive, like "lamb of god" or something, because sheep seems to appear in a lot of religious kanji).

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: DO NOT CONFUSE these SHEEPS with the SHIPS in the OCEAN ( frame 549). The only difference is the water. 羊 洋 .

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: I guess this kanji proves it's not just the Welsh whose idea of beauty is a large sheep.

hints.author: narafan
hints.mnemonic: A Sheep on top of a dog is NOT a beautiful thing.

hints.author: axelb
hints.mnemonic: Who is more beautiful, a sheep or a st. Bernhard dog? Imagine a big contest with many judges, then let the sheep win, since it is on top in the kanji (perhaps even let the sheep ride on the st. Bernhard dog because it won).

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Sheep dogs are beautiful animals.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (Image

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: This kanji refers to the waters of the Pasheephic ocean.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: Remember the story of Jason and the Argonauts from Greek myth? Jason travelled across oceans of water in order to recover the fleece of a certain sheep.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: If you drop a sheep into an ocean, it will soak up all the water with its thick coat of wool.

hints.author: KathyinSB
hints.mnemonic: When you look at the ocean, those little whitecaps look like sheep in the water.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Sheep are pretty absorbent. If you had a few billion sheep handy, you could drop them all into the ocean and soak up all of the water, thereby creating a big white fluffy sheep ocean.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Trembling from head to hoof from such a traumatic experience, the sheep gives a very detailed worded account to the detective about his wolf attack. "We need more details Mr. Sheep. Tell us exactly where the baaad man touched you".

hints.author: graham6565
hints.mnemonic: Say! detailed sheep, not like that! DE-TAILED sheep. Got it?

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Babe had to remember the detailed words of the sheep in order to get through to them. Anything less detailed and they will just act like crazy sheep.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: The next time you can't sleep, instead of counting sheep, think of wordy sheep, boring you with details of their mundane lives (baa, baa, baa, .........zzzzz). 詳しい (くわしい)

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Detailed words must not be said sheepishly.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: The freshest fish is caught in the middle of the night while most people are "counting sheep." (If you've ever been to Tsukiji fish market, you know what I mean).

hints.author: Bullfrog
hints.mnemonic: This one's easy to remember. The kanji gives 2 examples of foods that should be purchased fresh. To remember which foods, take the first letter of fresh, "F", to stand for fish and the final sound of fresh, "SH", to stand for sheep

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: There was a fisherman living near the coast, who was also raising sheep. One of his sheep once died after eating not-so-fresh fish, and since then, the fisherman's been feeding his sheep with fresh fish. -- "fresh fish for the sheep".

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: I like my FISH 'n' SHEEPS (chips) FRESH.

hints.author: sheetz
hints.mnemonic: To keep your fish fresh, wrap them up in sheepskins.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: Dolly (the first cloned sheep ever) grow tired of being a celebrity and escaped from the labs by digging a tunnel. She turned out to be an ACCOMPLISHED escapist, as she managed to dig a road under the soil. /Imagine Dolly performing a escape, like those movies where the main character has to escape from jail.

hints.author: erlog
hints.mnemonic: The dirty sheep had come far down this road and had accomplished many things.

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: I see this character used most often as the "-dachi" in tomodachi. And so, as we travel the roads of the earth, we gather a flock of sheep (friends). And only then we can say we have accomplished much.

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: Only the most accomplished grave digger can cover a sheep with dirt in the middle of the road and have no one find the grave.

hints.author: Sabien
hints.mnemonic: Cover the roadkill sheep with soil before the farmer sees, we drive off, mission accomplished...

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their water.

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Envious of the greener grass on the other side of the fence, the sheep looks down in disgust at his own dry grass lacking water.

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: Some ppl have to try things like counting SHEEP or DRINKING a glass of water before they can sleep. Some other can just YAWN and fall asleep... you can be ENVIOUS of those one.

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: A sheep that lacks  water is envious of those who have it.

hints.author: natemb
hints.mnemonic: Unlike cotton, wool is warm even when wet, because it wicks water away from the skin. Many animals have cool adaptations and abilities that I wish I had, but I am most envious of sheep, because even if they get wet on the outside, the water is lacking UNDERNEATH. (helps to remember the water-lack part goes on the bottom).

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: This New-Zealand pro-gamer has won many distinctions playing WoolCraft (a massively multi-user game in which the goal is to shear sheep).

hints.author: samueruht
hints.mnemonic: The distinction between fine and common wool, is the craftsmanship of the wool.

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: Noob players make no distinction between what games they play, whether it's the geniune thing or a bootleg fake copy. The biggest example of course, would be the legit World of Warcraft and the biggest ripoff there is

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: Since all sheep look alike, it is hard to make a distinction between them. You have to learn the craft of telling them apart by their wool.

hints.author: saxman_52
hints.mnemonic: A distinction must be made between "World of Warcraft" and "Wool over Craft.".

hints.author: mocm12
hints.mnemonic: A pullover is donned by pulling wool over your eyes.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Someone who is donning a disguise does that in order to pull the wool over your eyes.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: Don Juan caught a disease called Wool-eye. Now women Don Juan anything to do with him. (ROFL).

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: I imagine a very tight wool sweater, maybe a gift from uncle Don. This wool sweater is so tight that it makes your eyes bug out when you pull it over your head, but you have to don it every time uncle Don comes to visit and pretend you love it.

hints.author: aerdeyn
hints.mnemonic: The wolf donned his disguise by pulling the wool over his eyes.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The mouth of a turkey is used solely for saying, "Gobble." Likewise, your mouth, full of turkey, is solely used to gobble it up.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: Sadly my mouth gets to taste turkey solely on Christmas Day.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: "We can't prosecutre the murderer based solely on what comes from the mouth of this turkey!" Imagine a turkey who witnessed a murder of his fellow kind (to be eaten) and trying to report it to the cops.

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: To be remembered in conjunction with its virtual synonym "only". All we need to remember is this

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: Remember the episode of Friends, when no one except Joey wanted turkey for thanksgiving? Joey insisted, "what kind of thanksgiving would it be without a turkey?" so Monica agreed to make one, if he could eat it all by himself. A whole turkey solely for the mouth of Joey Tribbiani! Just picture him sitting there, with a huge turkey on the table in front of him, stuffing it in his mouth. If I recall correctly, he still had some space left for the desert!

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: After our pre-Thanksgiving massacre, we piled high all the turkey corpses atop the soil of the farmyard.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: During the Turkey Holocaust (this is what the animal kingdom calls Thanksgiving - they have really short memories and thus don't recall that it actually happens every single year), turkeys are killed en masse, and their bodies are piled high. To keep them from tumbling down, a pile of dirt is piled high right next to them to keep them standing upright so that they will be fresh when it is time to eat them.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: The farmer awakes Thanksgiving morning to find huge mounds of dirt piled high in front all of his doors and windows. He can't get out. Clever turkeys.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Soil piled high on top of a turkey with only it's gobbler sticking out.

hints.author: perrin4869
hints.mnemonic: The turkey is making a pile of soil (piled high) trying to hide its doo doo.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: This is the kanji for the shii tree, on which shiitake ( 椎茸 ) mushrooms grow. It's easy to picture a turkey dropping by the shii tree to gobble down some of those sweet oaky (shiitake) mushrooms.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Why is the sweet oak so sweet? Not sure, but to me it tastes just like turkey (with gravy and cranberry sauce!) Now that is sweet.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: I always use SWEET OAK WOOD to add flavor to roasted TURKEY.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 無脊椎動物 , 脊椎動物 , 脊椎 , 椎骨 , 椎骨 , 椎茸 , sweet oak (#2505 椎) ツイ,しい ... Tree now written ツイ. Used for Spine脊椎, and Shiitake 椎茸 . Replacing the key word to Spine ( お風呂 spine (#24 呂) is a phonetic only character), remember the 仙台 hermits we 催す sponsor (#987 催) 'd? Well we got them out of the mountains and then we got the Mountains out of them by telling them to get a Spine and got a job. (mnemonic 2

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The turkey liked to search for food under the sweet oak tree, believing that sweet grains would grow there.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Do you remember that song where they say "Who let the turkeys out!? Gobble.. gobble.. gobble"?

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [who; someone; somebody] You're alone when, suddenly, you think you hear someone speaking. "Who's there?", you say, but there is no answer. Then you find out it was only a turkey gobbling. You feel relieved (and ashamed to tell this story). (Based on raulir).

hints.author: Wally
hints.mnemonic: Who talks turkey? (I'm surprised this common American phrase 'talk turkey' hasn't made it in here. It is North American centric, however -- and how the heck is this not in RTK 1? I mean, primary school kids have to know this kanji.).

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: "Who's there?" he says, but it was only a turkey.

hints.author: hknamida
hints.mnemonic: Socrates spins around, startled. "Who's there?" It turns out that it is only a turkey, and the philosopher is safe... for now. （だれ）.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When I put the turkey over the oven fire, it always ends up being charred beyond recognition. I'm not a very good cook.

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: Char could be any meat over oven fire. So why is it a turkey in this kanji? Because charred turkey is what sticks out most in your mind as the thing that ruined Thanksgiving dinner.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: We see here the roadrunner, running so fast that it chars the ground beneath it, leaving a trace of fire.

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: Turkey is not very common in Japan. (found only in Subway sandwiches!) So when Japanese try to barbecue turkey on the grill, they always char the meat. masaka!.

hints.author: Apple_Head
hints.mnemonic: Unfortunately, Ash Ketchum's charmander sucked so bad it devolved into a charturkey. Charmander has flames on its tail, charturkey has flames on its butt.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Reefs are often formed from volcanic rock, or "rock that has been charred".

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Coral reefs are now dying off due to our abuse of the environment and now look like charred stone. For a picture illustrating this, see http

hints.author: ruukukun
hints.mnemonic: You may be familiar with this unfortunate natural phenomenon. The Coral Reefs are some of the most beautiful habitats in the world, full of color and life. However, recently due to overfishing, the reefs have been undergoing something called Coral Bleaching. The algae dies off, and the sun chars the coral, leaving nothing but a barren wasteland that looks like charred rock. The color is gone and all you have left is bone-dry, white rocky charred stuff.

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: A turkey gets stoned on reefers to prepare itself for the oblivion of the oven.

hints.author: Clint
hints.mnemonic: This character illustrates ancient ideas about the origin of coral reefs. Although we now know that coral are in fact marine organisms, the ancients thought that reefs looked like a gigantic pile of stones that had been charred.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Hunter-gathers, searching all along the ground for food. They never look up and see the Turkeys that have gathered on top of the trees to hide. Those were some smart turkeys!

hints.author: dsamari
hints.mnemonic: Gather the turkeys for Thanksgiving. Gather the trees for Christmas. In that order...

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: A GATHER of turkeys up a tree, K-I-S-S-I-N-G.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: The TURKEYS GATHERED in the top of the TREE........who knew they could fly up there??

hints.author: yukkuri_kame
hints.mnemonic: American families gather around a TURKEY at Thanksgiving and around a TREE at Christmas. I prefer the Turkey over the Tree. 集まる＝集まる＝ to gather 集める＝集める =to collect. Examples

hints.author: mattoc_g
hints.mnemonic: Quasi-modo, the famous hunchback of Notre-Dame wasn't actually a hunchback at all!! He used a frozen turkey to make a hunch!

hints.author: bigspenderJ
hints.mnemonic: An iced turkey is only quasi-as-good-as fresh turkey.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: You're having a frozen turkey for dinner? Come on, that's not a real meal...that's a quasi-meal at best!

hints.author: GenPDP7
hints.mnemonic: An ice-turkey is a quasi-turkey.

hints.author: isharabash
hints.mnemonic: That turkey's frozen! It's not even quasi-cooked!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Why did the turkey cross the road? To advance to the other side, of course.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: [re

hints.author: danflynn
hints.mnemonic: The turkey leader led his brave troops across the plumage-covered road

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: The first game out on gameboy advance? A little known Japanese game called "Turkey Road" -- it was like Mario Kart but everyone had deformed turkey heads!

hints.author: paddy71
hints.mnemonic: I asked my boss to give me an advance... He said "Hit the Road, Turkey"....

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Newscast

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: On the left we have baseball and wood, which obviously means a baseball bat. Instead of balls, there are miscellaneous other objects you may hit with it. While beating people may be one favorite use, in this case we see it used for making turkey mash.

hints.author: tcjeff
