hints.author: akimoto
hints.mnemonic: The ten commandments were heavy. So to help carry them, Moses made a wooden contraption; the ark of the covenant.

hints.author: FutureBlues
hints.mnemonic: Think of a complex wooden contraption capable of giving you a two-handed fiesta.

hints.author: zz_alex_zz
hints.mnemonic: In the medieval days, all who broke the commandments were locked up in a wooden contraption. (AKA Wooden Stocks).

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Treebeard's commandment was that the ents destroy Sauromans layer and all of the magical contraptions therein.

hints.author: Tornadic_Indignation
hints.mnemonic: The 12th commandment

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: An Egyptian embalmer reaching both hands into the dead pharaoh's nose and yanking out handfuls of brain.

hints.author: imojyochu
hints.mnemonic: I sneezed so hard that through my NOSE I blew out my BRAINS into BOTH HANDS.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: Remember when you had the flu, and you were sneezing all the time? I bet you thought that you could end up holding your brain in both hands after it was spitted from your running nose!

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: An addition to Heisig's story in order to remember the position of the elements

hints.author: ludd1t3_sp4nn3r
hints.mnemonic: Oneself may experience hay fever from rice fields requiring two hands to cover the nose while sneezing.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is for severe punishment. A man has his shackled hands placed on a wood block and they're chopped off with a saber. No more stealing bread in the Middle East...

hints.author: imojyochu
hints.mnemonic: In Arab countries they punish theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE.

hints.author: osaki
hints.mnemonic: I'm gonna use my two hands and my saber to punish you naughty girls!

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: The ancient punishment for theft was to have the thief's two hands chopped off by a red-hot sabre. To distinguish from penalty (#833 罰), think in terms of 'to punish', the actual -application- of the punishment, which only comes after deciding what the penalty shall be.

hints.author: Alexis598
hints.mnemonic: This is Saber from Fate/Stay Night holding her Excalibur with both hands dealing Divine Punishment to the evil Servants!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A famous ninja once pressed his two hands and saber into the soil of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The mould of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area.

hints.author: Ceryn
hints.mnemonic: As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted MOULD of my whole BODY.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Did you know there's a street in Japan like Hollywood Blvd. where famous ninjas press their hands and sword (which are famously deadly) into the sidewalk(soil) to form a mould?

hints.author: tgray88
hints.mnemonic: When you are moulding clay, you are in fact punishing the ground by folding, pressing, and hardening the mould.

hints.author: Kurisu
hints.mnemonic: On the fifth day God did punish the soil by molding it into man.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Spinal tap

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: A TEN year old had a STROKE of GENIUS and wrote this joke

hints.author: osaki
hints.mnemonic: Ten is ten, but add a stroke of genius and...

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo! Genius!

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: I use Azumanga Daioh's Mihama Chiyo-chan for this. Not only is this character "genius", but it is also the simplified "years old" counter, one which children use instead of 歳 . I can imagine Chiyo-chan saying

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: If you're a money genius, you can afford a lot of property.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership”

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Property comes in several forms, shells (money) and intellectual property (genius).

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: A genius with money LEFT over buys property.

hints.author: xxinde
hints.mnemonic: To gain a lot of property, you need either a genie or to be a genius. The clam is there to emphasize that this character is more about financial property or funds than real estate.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: A TREE GENIUS is a LUMBER jack. Duh.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Just when the were about to turn the last tree into lumber, the Lorax (the tree-genie) jumps out and puts a stop to the whole affair.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The genie turns the lumber back into a tree.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here we have a wood-genie or tree-genie, dancing and singing the popular song from the Monthy Pythons

hints.author: rachels
hints.mnemonic: This can be remembered as a pictograph = 2 trees, one of which, has had a branch cut off to make lumber.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: How do you suppose they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I suppose they put him in there while he's still a little child...

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) child in it. The villagers suppose that the child is a genie in a bottle.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Suppose a genie in a bottle granted a child 3 wishes, that'd be great eh?

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Only children suppose genies are for real.

hints.author: xxinde
hints.mnemonic: A genie in a bottle is supposed to grant you three wishes (one for each stroke of the genie primitive). Every child knows ( ご存じ ) that.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Genie in the bottle does exist but you need to dig deep into the soil to find one.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: You wipe the soil from the bottle, only to have a genie float out above you, saying

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: Genies don't exist! If you open the "genie in a bottle" you'll find nothing but soil.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Only one extra stroke separates this from pressure (#152 圧). // If genies do EXIST in bottles, they must certainly be crammed in them under extreme pressure ( 圧 ). If you really want to make sure that they do exist, be sure to clean the dirt off the lamp and give it an 'extra stroke' to find out!

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: When Aladin discovered the magic bottle, he rubbed it and nothing happened. He then concluded that genies did not exist. However, upon arriving home, he saw that the spout was filled with soil. After cleaning the bottle the genie emerged and disperesed the skeptical Aladin's doubts.

hints.author: sutebun
hints.mnemonic: FROM a pictograph of a thumbs up. That's how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph, see book. This kanji, as a chinese character, is in fact the origin for the hiragana possessive particle “no”. Try drawing this kanji fast, in a single stroke and you will end up with の .

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: Think Charlton Heston

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: Imagine fists punching at you from all angles.

hints.author: Captain+Kanjipants
hints.mnemonic: FROMs up!

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: This character is the "kei" in "keitai" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. Imagine you've just arrived in Japan, but don't have a cell phone yet, so instead you're carrying around a portable turkey you can hold in your fist. To dial a number, just poke it with your fingers.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Because they have no fingers, turkeys must use their fists when dialing on a portable phone.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: This character is the "kei" in "keitai" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. I use my keitai with my FINGERS, like everyone, but if some TURKEY try to steal it, I don't hesitate to use my FIST .

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: Some TURKEY has been sitting in the PORTABLE toilet forever. I pound my FIST on the door. Finally he comes out and gives me the FINGER.

hints.author: terebijoke
hints.mnemonic: What do you do with your portable keitai? Play ANGRY BIRDS, of course! You use you fingers to drag the birds across the screen. How do you know these birds are angry? Just picture a turkey scowling and shaking his fist at you.

hints.author: Killersquierl
hints.mnemonic: I like to think of this as a fist with with brass knuckles because of the extra line. An old school thug reaches out to help you up but then with his other hand ( with the brass knuckles) punches you.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: Reach out and fist someone (Do you see the person primitive?).

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: I like to think of the MATRIX. Now hear me out... Remember the scene when Neo and Mr. Smith fought in the subway? there was this one part where Mr. Smith threw his FIST at Neo, but Neo stopped it. Mr. Smith reached out his finger (the line coming from fist) and hit Neo in the throat.

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: This is an image of the fist getting an arm (the new stroke). The FIST now reaches out farther than before.

hints.author: Asriel
hints.mnemonic: Dhalism (Street Figher) can reach out his fist an extra stroke farther than anyone else, even if their hands are outstretched..

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: An open mouth and reaching hands

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a baby reaching out and holding mom's breast as if it were bottle, and sucking on it to get some milk.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: It's a terrible image, but I see a baby reaching out to her mother's breasts, wanting to suckle some milk with her mouth. Meanwhile, her mother is sucking back on a cig with total disregard to her child's health. / Thanks Proxx

hints.author: jwy2k2
hints.mnemonic: Reach out and suck someone.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: To suck

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: See suck (#689 吸)

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: One of the first thing a baby can do with his hand is to reach out and grab your finger as if it was a little handle.

hints.author: paddy71
hints.mnemonic: Handle with care... carefully hold the Nitroglycerin within your fingers with outstretched hands for fear of it blowing up in your face...

hints.author: nagisa
hints.mnemonic: A toddler reaching up with OUTSTRETCHED HANDS for a mug sitting on the table, just barely out of his reach. Straining, he can just barely get his FINGER to brush the handle.

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: Pay attention to this story because you'll learn how to recall the reading of this kanji as well

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.

hints.author: samesong
hints.mnemonic: When girls ask about my length, I hold out my one arm, and tell them "you get the idea".

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare "length" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn't show "it" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji.

hints.author: fragileshards
hints.mnemonic: This kanji demonstrates the proper technique for throwing a bowling ball the LENGTH of the alley. Stroke 1- lift the ball up horizontally to judge the throw Stroke 2 - gently swing the arm back Stroke 3 - whip your arm forward and roll the ball off the tips of your fingers Strike!

hints.author: fruitangel
hints.mnemonic: ONE ARM LENGTH.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: I sleep in history class with my mouth tucked under my arm.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: History students usually going to school with a history book tucked under their arm. But now instead of a book, you have a small talking mouth that tell you about history. "When I was young, I used to walk 5 miles everyday.....".

hints.author: bigspenderJ
hints.mnemonic: History is told by one mouth; the winner's. The loser's opinion is not told and is tucked under the arm (silenced ) by the winner.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: You've got your Hogwarts Magic History book in time for the semester, but with its ferociously snapping mouth, you can't just tuck it under the arm and carry it to class.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Someone with big arms goes to a museum and picks up an historian at the entrance, tucks it under his arm, and proceeds with the visit. The historian is like a mouth tucked under the arm, telling the big man all he needs to know about history.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: One officer can change the course of history.

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: One officer, namely Napoleon, changed the course of history. (Thanks, ayoung24). Napoleon is also my primitive meaning.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: In a police state, the police officers all speak with one mouth and have a gun tucked under their arm.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: This is not military officer (#1095 尉), but more of a government officer, official or bureaucrat, such as Barack Obama, who started out as a lowly government officer (communitee organizer) and the broke through the glass ceiling to become president of the United States and make history (I know a glass ceiling generally refers to an obstacle for women, but I wanted to avoid key words such as woman (#98 女), lady (#1151 婦) or feminine/female (#563 雌)).

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: I used HISTORY as a primitive rather than separating it into 'mouth' and 'tucked under the arm'. Think about the Japanese history textbook controversy. The government OFFICERS choosing the textbooks are the ONE elite group determining Japan's HISTORY.

hints.author: perfecturbo
hints.mnemonic: It's starting to GROW LATE, so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he'll bring it back, so don't worry.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: At nightbreak (#30 旦) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: I keep one sun tucked under my arm for light when it grows late.

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: As it begins to grow late the sun projects the shadow of my arm on the ceiling.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: When it is growing late, the sun sinks below the floor. Time to tuck your belongings under your arm and head home. 更ける (ふける)

hints.author: Deborah
hints.mnemonic: A stiff drink on the ROCKs after it GROWS LATE is a way to unwind after a long day...

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: Stones are so stiff that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would grow late far before you ever accomplished your task.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: There's a city whose inhabitants stiffen and turn to stone every night when it grows late.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: My girlfriend started playing with my stones when it was growing late, and I got a stiffy.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: The trolls took so much time discussing how to cook their meal that it grew late

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: I learned this one from the movie Evil Dead, but when it grows late, trees change shape and become spiny creatures! Lesson

hints.author: Gwindarr
hints.mnemonic: As it grows late, Lakitu retires for the evening, leaving the spinys to fend for themselves against Mario. Picture them jumping out of trees instead of being hurled from Lakitu. Lakitu - is the guy who flys the cloud in the Mario games...

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Usually the tree you bump into when it grows late happens to be spiny.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 梗概 , 梗塞 , 心筋梗塞 , 桔梗 , spiny (#2498 梗) コウ, キョウ ... Parts

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: INFARCTION (new keyword, according to real meaning). If it GROWS LATE and you get an INFARCTION, have someone call an ambulance. In the meantime try to relax, stay under a TREE.

hints.author: sindhikara
hints.mnemonic: This keyword should really be "again" not "or again" Here is some context

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: After her boyfriend's crotch has been satisfied, a woman might suggest they cuddle. The boyfriend, on the other hand, might say, "Or again, we could fool around . . . ".

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: The crotch is the area of vital "or agains". (Organs, that is.).

hints.author: zenkun
hints.mnemonic: As a primitive, instead of using "crotch", I also often use "sat cross-legged" as this also looks like the kanji.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: I agree with bodhisamaya and sindhikara, this kanji is more like just "again". You can change this kanji to "again" if you change [ again FRAME 1815 ] to Re- , which is it's real meaning anyways. Also, beware of too many penis euphemisms. Associating crotch with penis is not too bad, but if you associate column, meat, gigantic, etc. with penises, you might find yourself confused as to which euphemism you meant.

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: The animals boarding Noah's Ark all came in pairs – but Noah had to carefully check the two crotches in each pair to ensure that the animals were of different sexes and thus able to further their species after the flood.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Crotch to crotch is how many pairs spend their private time together. . .

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: Instead of bringing home 1 girl and enjoying her CROTCH, it's better to bring home a PAIR of girls and enjoy 2 CROTCHES!! I've done this several times so I'll remember this kanji easily.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The left crotch looks more like the man's and the right a woman's, the ultimate pair.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: Hey buddy, grow a pair! (two testies) Oops, one is kind of misshaped.

hints.author: dilandau23
hints.mnemonic: Children going around the mulberry tree singing "This is the way we wash our crotch, wash our crotch, wash our crotch...".

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Imagine kids all over the top of a mulberry tree, sitting astride limbs so that their weight is on their crotches. (Mulberry trees have big sprawling limbs that run horizontally or at shallow angles making them easy to climb and sit in. I have an old mulberry in my yard, and my kids are in it constantly).

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: According to Wikipedia, "unripe [MULBERRY] fruit and green parts of the plant have a white sap that is intoxicating and mildly hallucinogenic." When looking at the MULBERRY tree, some have hallucinated that they are seeing crotches, crotches everywhere!

hints.author: strider62590
hints.mnemonic: Mulberries taste like crotch. This is a pictograph of the crotchberry tree. Look at all the ripe berries up top!

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Do you see the three students sitting cross-legged on the tree eating mulberry?

hints.author: perfecturbo
hints.mnemonic: On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the VESSELS, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's CROTCH.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Donald Duck is a big bird that does not wear pants. It's good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count vessels.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: The turky's crotch is a vessel for the stuffing that you fill it with.

hints.author: peterlasky
hints.mnemonic: The USS Turkeycrotch is a seaworthy vessel.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: An ole' pirate turkey sits astride the prow of a vessel (i.e. with his crotch on the prow). Recall from PAGE 211 the old turkey with pipe and monocle

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Think of the flower-vessels as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big flower painted on the hull (this will come back in seize (#701 獲) and harvest (#908 穫)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. -- In this kanji, we see an inauguration speech being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to safeguard our planet.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Words and Flowers are exchanged between sailors and their wives before they board the vessel to safeguard the world.

hints.author: samueruht
hints.mnemonic: (With sarcasm) A Bush speech telling how all the US vessels are always welcomed, covered with flowers and words of gratitude for safeguarding democracy from the evil doers.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: The flower vessel is of course the Mayflower in which the pilgrims came to America in their search for turkeys. During they trip, they prayed non-stop - using words as spells to safeguard Mayflower from danger.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Thanks to fuaburisu with modification Think of the flower-vessels as a ship full of hippies garlanded with flowers -- In this kanji, we see that the hippies carry no weapons on the ship to safeguard against pirates. No, because of their nonviolence pact they have decided they will fend off pirates only with their words.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A pack of genetically-modified wild dogs is seized by a group of Greenpeace activists and taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (the flower vessel, see safeguard (#700 護)).

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: Customs just seized a crate of poppies (flowers) detected by trained wild dogs who inspected the vessel.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: A group of police dogs are used to sniff out some opium flowers on a cargo vessel. The drugs are then seized by the authorities.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Pirates, the wild dogs of the seas (seize), capture a vessel loaded with poppy flowers. (The poppies were intended for medicinal use, but the pirates have other ideas). 獲物 (えもの)

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: Wild dogs SEIZE the (may)flower vessel! Those meanies.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: That GUY stole my WOMAN so I kicked him in the CROTCH. (This story helps keep the word "GUY" as someone you hold in contempt).

hints.author: kinkypete
hints.mnemonic: Guys only care about 2 things

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: All I need is a woman next to my crotch. What can I say, I'm a GUY.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: GUYS (derogatory) are always thinking about women's crotches. 1) 此奴 【こいつ】this guy. 2) 其奴 【そいつ】that guy. 3) 彼奴 【あいつ】that guy.

hints.author: xxinde
hints.mnemonic: On the streets of Bangkok you see what looks like a woman, but a glance at the crotch reveals it's a guy.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This woman is angry because of the guys in the previous frame who pay more attention to her crotch than her heart. I prefer to decompose the kanji in three elements here because it is easier to read like a mnemonic.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: WOMEN get very ANGRY over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When a guy steps on her heart, a woman can get quite angry.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Guys are angry at heart.

hints.author: zardoz73
hints.mnemonic: You want angry? Here's angry

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: A good friend is always at your side. ---- I teach at a Japanese High School, and I often see chummy male students grabbing each other's crotches in a joking manner. It's still weird to me, but apparently reaching to your side and grabbing you neighbor's crotch is a great way to express friendship.

hints.author: nakome
hints.mnemonic: Think of a sex friend (a fuck buddy if you will). The benefit of such a relationship is that there will always be a crotch by your side. (the Japanese refer to such a friend as セフレ, just as we do).

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Friends with benefits anyone?

hints.author: Lizzie
hints.mnemonic: A friend is always on your side - again and again and again.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Your best friend is your crotch. Its always by your side and never lets you down.

hints.author: rizzo
hints.mnemonic: Don't let good friends slip out between your fingers.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: The only stories I can think of here are really aggressively pornographic, so maybe I should just say nothing.

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: "I want to finger my friend!" The words just slipped out. That's the last time I play truth or dare while drunk.

hints.author: kansaigaijin
hints.mnemonic: My fingers slipped out of my friend and I knew we were past the friend's stage at that moment.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Well, you usually use your fingers to throw objects used as missile weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the missile primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a crotch (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the wind. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers...

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: If you use the primitive "semen" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: RPG. A wizard throws magic missiles from the tip of his fingers.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: He's a great pitcher. He can throw a split finger fastball that's like a missile..

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, where gun-control laws are strict, the desperate criminals have resorted to throwing chopped-off finger missiles at each other.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (Note

hints.author: calittle

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: 支 (branch) is not actually used for tree branches, but rather for conceptual branches, like a store branch, or a branch of mathematics. 枝 (bough), on the other hand, is an actual branch from a tree.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: As James Heisig suggests, let's take a moment to focus on the differences between a bough, a branch, and a twig. A twig is “a small, leafless branch of a woody plant”. A bough is “a large or main branch of a tree” (a branch is somewhere in between the boughs and the twigs).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The limbs that this kanji represents are parts of the body that are connected to the trunk, like the main branches to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, limbs are "flesh branches".

hints.author: thermal

hints.mnemonic: If you really love someone, you won't keep them in a cage-like bird house relationship, but rather open the door and let their heart walk around freely. Think less about "I" (あい) and more about "we".

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: The man is about to enter the 'birdhouse' (brothel) when he remembers his true love at home, and, following his heart, uses his walking legs to go straight home.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: 愛は相手の心を受けることです。 (I heard that one from a buddhist priest - dont forget the extra stroke).

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Here we see what the guy from melancholy (#616 憂) ended up doing. To solve his matters of heart, he turned his walking legs towards the brothel (bird house) seeking for love.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: An overly romantic man carries a bird house all the time with him, so he can send love-messages with his pigeons wherever he goes on his walking legs. His heart beating heavily in between the bird house (sitting atop the head like a hat), and the walking legs.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The sun's love is equivocal

hints.author: perrin4869
hints.mnemonic: Inspired by haabaato

hints.author: FoxintheStars
hints.mnemonic: In RTK1 Supplement as "unclear." His feelings about her were equivocal/unclear, so she spent all day playing "loves me, loves me not.".

hints.author: haabaato
hints.mnemonic: 曖昧。 On a sunny day, a guy professes his love to a girl he admires. But she gives him the common equivocal response, "Let's just be friends.".

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: (Thanks HaaBaato) 曖昧。 On a sunny day, a guy professes his love to a girl he admires. However, while he's down on one knee, the sun comes out from behind a cloud and blinds him. The girl takes her opportunity, gives him the common equivocal response, "Let's just be friends," and runs away while the poor guy is still blinded.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: You're at a restaurant and raise your finger to indicate to the waiter that you want to pay. Your friend elbows you in the ribs -- it's his shout, and he insists on taking care of the bill.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: You are walking out of the restaurant when the waiter uses his FINGERS to grab you at the ELBOW and says, "excuse me sir, didn't you forget to PAY?".

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: It costs an arm and a leg but I pay a finger and an elbow...

hints.author: stazor
hints.mnemonic: Traditionally Japanese people kept vallet in their kimono sleeves, so they reach for elbow with their fingers when they want to pay.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: As if making people pay with their fingers is bad enough, the Yakuza now accept elbows as a form of payment.....

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: The Batcave is very wide and has a lot of elbow room for Batman to do his yoga.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: A wide cave has a lot of "elbow room".

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A caveman widens his cave by pounding on the interior with his strong elbows.

hints.author: sleepyday
hints.mnemonic: This character depicts that of someone standing at the entrance of a cave. He's standing there with his hands on his hips, and his elbows pointing out to each side. He's telling you that the cave is wide enough to walk through comfortably. Try playing with the form of the Kanji to draw out the pictograph I described.

hints.author: Koos83
hints.mnemonic: The CAVE wasn't very wide. Both my ELBOWS touched the sides.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Your elbow is bound up so that your biceps will stay flexed.

hints.author: FoxintheStars
hints.mnemonic: In RTK1 Supplement as "hooked." A friend hooked someone literally, by binding them up with their hooked elbow.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: My elbow was bound up in a cast, making it impossible to keep it flexed.

hints.author: drwaltoa
hints.mnemonic: Peter Pan tried to escape, but Hook hooked him by the elbow and bound him up.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: At the risk of confusing with "captured" (frame 1018) I'm going to use "to capture" as the keyword since this kanji often shows up in kidnapping related compounds and flexed is hard for me to work with. Here, you bind up the kidnapping victim's arms together at the elbows behind his back when you capture him.

hints.author: tofuinoakland
hints.mnemonic: Japanese girls are tight and may require fingers inserted to broaden them and make them wide enough before you can...

hints.author: mattoc_g
hints.mnemonic: Spread your fingers wide to broaden your hand.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: When Batman's cave isn't wide enough to hold all of his new inventions and gadgets, he has his friend Superman use his superstrong fingers to grip the entrance of the cave and broaden it, making more elbow room. Goatse-style visuals at your own risk.

hints.author: chully
hints.mnemonic: goatse. If that word doesn't help you remember this, maybe you should broaden your horizons a little.

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: An orthodontist with his fingers in your mouth says "open wide" and helps you to broaden your smile.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Elbonium

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: A wide range of metals are classed as minerals.

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: You need a wide range of minerals and iron (metal) in your diet to avoid anaemia and other nasty things.

hints.author: Raschaverak
hints.mnemonic: Imagine some miners mining some minerals, with their metal picks, in a cave, as they mine out more and more minerals, the cave gets wider and wider….

hints.author: dsamari
hints.mnemonic: Metal is a general term for a wide range of minerals.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Opening a stuck valve requires 2 hands and a lot of elbow grease.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: The cubans build a pipe to flood the USA. Castro just has to turn the valve on it, and USA is flooded. Suddenly, CIA agents tackle him from behind, grabbing both his arms. But Castro manages to open the valve with his elbow, by raising the elbow above his head. Success! USA is no more...

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Opening a stuck valve requires 2 hands, and on top of that, a lot of elbow grease. (thanks scottamus).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: You try to unblock an old rusty valve with a hit of the elbow, and then with your two hands, to no avail.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: "She's stuck real good-like" the guy from the いなか ( 田舎 ; country) said to me with a strong rural dialect ( 弁 ; べん). "You best grab on ta'er with both hands and giv-er that VALVE some elba' greeze." (I couldn't resist

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Men walk with their elbows out from their sides in a weird turkey trot when they try to appear very MASCULINE. Think of a 70's pimp walk.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Masculine duties are to offer your elbow to the lady by your left side and to cut the turkey on special meals.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Surely you remember feminine/female (#563 雌)? In that kanji, we said stop/spooning/turkeys, spoon females! Here, once again, my buddy is looking at a turkey. What the heck is his problem? I give him a sharp elbow in the side. "Dude, be a man!" I said. "Where's your MASCULINE side?".

hints.author: Hawkeye123
hints.mnemonic: While it's not feminine/female (#563 雌) to eat a turkey with a spoon, a masculine man would push people aside with his elbow to get to the turkey first.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a turkey making a pose like it's really buff....it's elbows are by their side at an angle.

hints.author: akotkav
hints.mnemonic: When someone's elbow is above your mouth he/she is probably standing on a pedestal.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: After training your whole life, you manage to get a bronze medal in the Olympics. You're extremely proud of your accomplishment as you step up to receive your medal. The guy in first place is up on a pedestal, towering above you, his elbow level with your mouth. Being a smug bastard, he "accidentally" knocks his elbow into your mouth, causing you to bleed and lose a tooth. Just cause he won the gold doesn't mean he can place himself on such a high pedestal and do whatever he wants!

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Rodin's 'Thinker' sitting on a pedestal, the arm bent at the elbow cradling the mouth.

hints.author: frychiko
hints.mnemonic: Think Indiana Jones... he rests his ELBOW on some ancient pedestal to gather his thoughts, when all of a sudden an OPENING appears in a wall and treasure is revealed!

hints.author: Rivvie
hints.mnemonic: It is physically impossible to put your elbows in your mouth (just try it...) the first one to do so deserves to be on a pedestal.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: While standing on the pedestal at the award ceremony, the recipient heartlessly neglected to mention the people that got him there.

hints.author: Evangelo
hints.mnemonic: Someone you put on a pedestal will NEGLECT your heart.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: The Gold Medal Winner (see pedestal (#744 台)) gets all cocky and neglects his girlfriend ("throws her heart away"). She cries and cries, her heart eventually exploding from the grief and she dies from neglect.

hints.author: sindhikara
hints.mnemonic: People who neglect don't put your heart on a pedestal, they put it below it!

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: If you neglect your personal hygiene, you will end up with elbow, mouth and heart disease and wind up looking pretty nasty! Just imagine what you will look like with a locked elbow, your mouth open in a grimace with missing teeth, and one handclutch your heart as it shoots pain through your body! That is the price of neglect my friends!

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: From his water pedestal Neptune reigns over his Sea Empire.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Build a moat around your pedestal to protect your reign of power.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: The reign of the Gold Medal Winner Bastard over water sports is of unsurpassed length. There he is, once again, his hair gray, wearing a bathing cap, on his pedestal with the gold medal around his neck.

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: Michael Phelps reigns supreme as he stands on his watery pedestal (he just got out of the pool).

hints.author: Daizumi
hints.mnemonic: From his pedestal, Manneken Pis reigns over Belgium with his...water.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The secrets of metallurgy and smithing

hints.author: brendanmacdonald
hints.mnemonic: An ICE PEDESTAL is useless in METALLURGY since it will just melt.

hints.author: wilsoncb
hints.mnemonic: I get this confused with all the similar words (forge, tempering, etc.), so I'll make this metal-allergy. The poor blacksmith's son, who had no choice but to take up his father's vocation, spent every day by the pedestal/anvil. Sadly, he had a metal-allergy, so he spent every night putting ICE on his hives...

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: One secret used in metallurgy is to have a ice pedestal, in case you burn your butt.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Ice on the pedestal was no longer a problem thanks to the science of metallurgy.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Many men, before they commence their relationship with the woman of their desires, place her on something of a pedestal, which often leads to disappointment later on.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Just think of any art class. You put a WOMAN on a PEDESTAL then you COMMENCE to draw her.

hints.author: amthomas
hints.mnemonic: If you want to commence a relationship, just put a woman on a pedestal and she'll love ya forever.

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: After the march of intimidate (#364 威) women... the woman stood on the pedestal and commenced her speech with, "hajimemashite.".

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Your life commences when the matron (a very fat woman) extends her elbow and takes you out from the womb of your mother. This image will also help you on the next kanji.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The body part feminists like to put on a pedestal is the womb, especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. "We give birth, so it's your duty to do so-and-so".

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: If any body part deserves to be put on a pedestal, it is the womb from which new life springs forth.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In this kanji pedestal carries a sense of base, or stand. The womb is part of the body that acts as a pedestal

hints.author: mrred
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the womb as a part of the body which contains a little pedestal (#744 台) for the baby to stand on. Picture the baby, like a little statue of a cherub, standing on its pedestal in the fleshy womb.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: I suggest studing this kanji alongside with commence (#747 始). The womb is the part of the body with a mouth from which the matron took you out when you were born, using her elbow.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This is either a love scene or a murder scene that you are seeing through a window. The love scene

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: A photographer is at home, recovering his broken human legs. With nothing better to do, he is looking through the rear window with his camera (he needs to use his elbow to support those heavy lenses) until his heart begins to race as he witnesses a murder!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A voyeur peeks in the window of a house, but all he can see is legs. So he elbows up into the window for a better view which gets his heart racing.

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: When I see that window I get chills... I was in that house when my girlfriend threw me out the window. She broke my legs, my elbows and my heart!

hints.author: karmatheif
hints.mnemonic: The top primitive is similar to hole (#1316 穴). A window is a hole (#1316 穴) in your house that you occassionally sit next to while leaning on your ELBOW and gazing out, a picture of a lonely HEARTedness.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: "Going, going, GONE!", said the gravedigger as he shoveled soil onto the body's protruding elbow (the last bit left to cover).

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: If you want the soil stains gone from your clothes, then you'll need to put some elbow grease into cleaning them.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: A trick they do in war movies is they bury the arm up to the elbow in the soil, then put some fake flesh and blood by the elbow to make it look like the arm is gone. "AAAHHH!!! My arm's gone! MEDIC!!".

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: Gone, past, quit, leave, elapse, eliminate, divorce. When I myself (厶) am under the earth my time will have elapsed and I will be dead and gone. 死去 (death). 消去 (elimination, erasure, purge). 一難去ってまた一難 (it's been one thing after another). 歩き去る (walk away). 洗い去る (wash away). この世を去る (to leave the world, die). 引き去る (retreat). 走り去る (run away).

hints.author: vinniram
hints.mnemonic: I brush soil off my elbow - now it's GONE.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: This kanji shows up in a lot of words related to the legal process. Try this image

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: There already was a system (#418 制) for butchering cows, a technique (#421 芸) for turning smoke into flowers - why can't there be a method of about the same relevance for making water gone? Evaporation anyone?

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Following from the last frame; when rubbing isn't good enough, WATER is the best METHOD for making sure the SOIL on your ELBOW is GONE.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: If all the water is gone, we must develop new methods to survive. (Imagine Earth devoid of water, the opposite of the movie Waterworld).

hints.author: TaylorSan
hints.mnemonic: The Heisig Method will Water down your kanji problems, until at some point, they are gone.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: At the local company they have a very gory way of getting rid of incompetent personnel

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: The only thing created in most meetings is a lot of hot air. Imagine a cloud of it rising to the roof.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: Easy

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: No business meeting during honeymoon! Ha-Ni-Mu(n) ハニム.

hints.author: Tweenk
hints.mnemonic: When rising clouds want to hold a meeting, they need to an umbrella to gather under and keep them from flying everywhere.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Sexual climaxes don't always happen on the bed; they sometimes happen against a wall or on the ground!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The climax of the Berlin Wall affair was the tearing of it to ground.

hints.author: rosgmact
hints.mnemonic: The Biblical Onan was condemned for his solo climax. Working ONE ELBOW furiously, he spilled his seed on the GROUND, and God was angry at his selfishness and wastefulness. (Perhaps the greatest punishment is that his name has been synonymous with such solitary pursuits throughout the ages since.).

hints.author: playadom
hints.mnemonic: He climaxed so hard, it spurted up on to the wall, and he soiled his pants in the process.

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: You put bags of soil against the bedroom wall to drown out the neighbour's climax noises.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: You book a room in a love hotel called "Climax House".

hints.author: eieneverafter
hints.mnemonic: A simple room is made up of a roof, some walls, and a dirt floor.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This is the room of a “climax house”, that is, a Japanese love hotel.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: "Jesus, get a room you two." So the couple went back to their house and climaxed there instead.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Under my roof, I've climaxed in every ROOM. I also enjoy doing it in different kinds of rooms

hints.author: watanuki
hints.mnemonic: Http

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Just as we were about to climax her father arrived with a sword.

hints.author: oRis1024
hints.mnemonic: Arrival of a hero always happens at the CLIMAX of the movie, and of course he carries a SABER to defeat the enemy.

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: The arrival of the main character from Yojimbo back in town with a saber in hand, is the unforgettable climax of the movie.

hints.author: pm215
hints.mnemonic: Musashi's rather late arrival for a duel, sabre in hand, is the climax of that novel...

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: This character is used in two very high-frequency words

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: To reach climax I doth the bidding of my dominatrix taskmaster.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: After he had climaxed Shakespeare is reported to have said to his taskmistress, "The lady doth charge too much.".

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Let's have an irreverent take on a line from the play “Hamlet”, by William Shakespeare

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: The taskmaster is my old English teacher. He loved Shakespeare, and the climax if his day was to hear his pupils say doth.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: The 69 position allows both parties to mutually give themselves pleasure.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: If you can combined your walls with another house's walls, both houses would mutually benefit, by the increase in size....

hints.author: FoxintheStars
hints.mnemonic: Mutually means "You and You together"---two katakana ユ (yu)s interlocking top and bottom.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: It feels better to imagine two elbows linked together in mutuality.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph, see book. To me this kanji looks like the T and L of mutually (in the first two strokes) mirrored upside-down just like the King/Queen/Valet of a card game. The two L's of mutually are there to remind you the pair of TL's are mutually joined by the L's (i.e. “two times T and L, joined by the L's”).

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to abandon it but it keeps coming back...so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree!

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: As in sash (#415 帯), I treat the one mountain in the middle to mean Mt. Fuji (Japan's ichiban mountain). Now we see an infant being abandoned on top of Mt. Fuji well above the tree line to die of exposure.

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: A terrible image of an abandoned infant. Here he is in his little car seat buckled to a tree.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The abandonned infant was buckled to a tree.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: Bringing up your offspring means raising them from infant until they are meat ready to be harvested. What, cannibalism is in poor taste? Forget I ever brought it up. But bring up will forver be infant meat to me. I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs!

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: I will bring up my infants to eat meat. I'll not endure any vegetarian children in my house!

hints.author: sprutnik
hints.mnemonic: Bringing up an infant requires months of hard work.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Bringing up an infant on the Moon is easier than it is on Earth. (month=lunar) Gravity is lower, so they're easier to carry and they don't get hurt if they fall down. Best of all, their little space suits keep all that poopy smell inside!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Remember The Matrix ? There was a spectacular scene where you could see human infants brought up by the machines, as if they were vulgar meat, for the sole purpose of feeding from the human's biological energy.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: A terrible yakuza taskmaster is bringing up his infant. Every time the infant does something wrong... well, you know what happens to yakuzas when they do something wrong.

hints.author: rhclaghorn
hints.mnemonic: "Don't lay a finger on him," a concerned mother says as the state REMOVES her child away for upbringing by a taskmaster foster home.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Ever heard of a kancho? If you haven't, just look it up. ;P Well I think of a kid giving his taskmaster a kancho. His parents, thinking they raised him properly, are appalled when they see this one day and immediately scold him, telling him to remove his finger from the taskmaster.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: A taskmaster brings up his infant by threatening to remove a finger as punishment.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: To remove your taskmaster, bring up your middle finger.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Scene at the baby factory

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: An infant at the maternity ward is alloted a new pair of human legs, because his are not grown properly or absent. Picture the “lot” as a parcel, placed near the infant, to be used later. The “lot” of human legs has been alloted by some doctor, to be used later. Mnemonic “infant alloted new pair of human legs”. Note

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Each infant gets its very own pair of human legs, allotted by God.

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: In China, you are only ALLOTed one INFANT per family. My friends disagreed with that policy and HUMAN LEGGED it out of there!

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: God decided to allot each infant only one pair of legs.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: "Everyone is allotted a metal gun" (US constitution according to the NRA).

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: What is a gun but a device for allotting pieces of metal? One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...etc.

hints.author: strugglebunny
hints.mnemonic: During war, all metal is allotted to the effort to make more guns.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: If you picture the infant as Stewie from Family Guy, then it's easy to imagine him shaping whatever piece of metal he can get his hands onto into a gun. Stewie can already walk, so it's no surprise to see him get out of his cot with his human legs.

hints.author: sutebun
hints.mnemonic: Japan doesn't have many guns because they allot their metal to other things like cars and game consoles.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: Sulphur is like a rock, but it can stink like a stream of infant doodie.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Infants are baptised in streams inorder to prevent their descent into a place of sulphur and brimstone.

hints.author: inaka_rob
hints.mnemonic: Sulphur IS a rock, but it often stinks like a stream of infant urine. It is the same color too!!!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: One day a woman found an infant near the brim of a volcanic crater (“brimstone” is another name of sulphur) who was made of yellow stone. She brought him back to the village. The next day the village was flooded. The villagers thus cursed the woman for bringing him to the village. -- History

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Imagine an infant stranded on a rock in the middle of a stream of sulphuric acid, created by a nearby volcano... (continued in next kanji).

hints.author: Dragg
hints.mnemonic: INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the current of the STREAM.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A water-breathing infant (genetically modified?) is caught in a flood, and drifts with the current, apparently enjoying himself in the process.

hints.author: imojyochu
hints.mnemonic: An INFANT fell in the WATER and was lost down the CURRENT of the STREAM.

hints.author: numirabis
hints.mnemonic: The best way to deal with a stream of infant doodie is watery current.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: ...(continued from previous kanji). Unfortunately, the water-level rose and the poor infant was washed away by the stream's current... dying a sulphurous death.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In some Asian kung-fu version of James Bond, the main protagonist has a “License To Kill” with his deadly elbows and human legs. His suit is always stained of red blood at the elbows and lower legs (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements).

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: A midget driver trying to pass the road test to get their driver's license. Their elbows are too short to turn the wheel and their legs are too short to reach the gas and breaks.

hints.author: mazterdeath
hints.mnemonic: You need a license to show your elbows and legs in mid east countries.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: To apply for your drivers license in Japan, you have to fill out lots of forms at standing-only counters. This kanji is a pictograph of you standing at the counter filling out the forms for your driver's license. Your elbow is bent, writing the necessary information on the form (in kanji, of course!); your human legs are getting tired from standing. Why can't they provide chairs and desks?

hints.author: Oyabecory
hints.mnemonic: She did not pass her driver's license test

hints.author: LordGolem
hints.mnemonic: I named the right part legal prostitute has it represents a walker [walking legs] with the license. It's easy to imagine a legal prostitute tempting a man with her mouth.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a license to show off their walking legs and tempt customers with their mouths.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Francois
hints.mnemonic: With a hot mouth, a licence to screw and a pair of legs, Amsterdam prostitutes are sure to tempt you.

hints.author: dicedice
hints.mnemonic: The cop that pulled me over was such a prick, and I was sooo tempted to mouth off at him! However, I LEFT my mouth shut because I knew if I didn't, he would suspend my license for quite some time, and I'd be stuck with my walking legs.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example).

hints.mnemonic: Chi chi chi chia. P p p penis!

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: Stroke order

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I wouldn't have thrown my walking stick in the trash bin if I'd known I'd be climbing a mountain!

hints.author: Kurisu
hints.mnemonic: Horror movie cliche 769

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: You were bungling in the darkness and touched the cactus with your fingers. OUCH!!

hints.mnemonic: Here's a guy who's bungling his first experience with his hand up a girl's skirt and ends up with his fingers in the exit hole. She yells

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Boulder, Colorado the rocky mountain state.

hints.author: tomusan

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: You get charcoal from volcano ("fire mountain", 火山 ) ashes.

hints.author: Killersquierl
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a that a mountain fell onto a pile of ashes, compressing it into charcoal.

hints.author: Jaunty
hints.mnemonic: A huge mountain sitting on top of some ashes will compress it into charcoal (I know not really - but this makes it easy to remember).

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Gas or charcoal grill? BBQ aficionados agree

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: On the left, there are three mountains. The road branches off to each of them. (Note

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: In a lot of Super Nintendo-era RPGs, there are mountain levels to get through. You view them from overhead, so you can see a mazelike path with many branches. Picture your sprite characters at one such fork in the mountain path, as it branches off in two directions.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mountain branches mean you branched off the mountain path. In other words, once you branch off from the mountain path you are going to have to hack your way through the branches.

hints.author: kadano
hints.mnemonic: You want to avoid the mountain road, so you branch off to an easier path.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I just picture a tall mountain with many branches growing off its right-hand side. So many, that the mountain loses balance and falls on its side.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he'd chosen mountain pass for this keyword as it's closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a mountain pass is just below the mountain top.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The place on the mountain where you stand above and look down upon all creation is the mountain peak.

hints.author: howdycowdy
hints.mnemonic: You're stuck. You look up and see only mountain. You look down and see only mountain. How the hell do you get out of here? Oh, there's a MOUNTAIN PASS. Thank God!

hints.author: Izumo
hints.mnemonic: The MOUNTAIN PASS helps you go up and down the mountain.

hints.author: joyeboy
hints.mnemonic: Sam and Frodo were steadfast companions even as Mount Doom crumbled above them.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: September 11. [lol it also has 11 strokes], whoever reported this story is a loser, get alife. This is the best story on the website.

hints.author: nekoyaki
hints.mnemonic: Sept 11

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: You and your companion are climbing to the top of the mountain when it suddenly begins to crumble. Only one of you can survive - who's it going to be? You or your companion?

hints.author: Beneus
hints.mnemonic: The reason to always bring a companion when you go climbing in mountains. It is unsteady and may crumble under you at any time. That's when you need that someone to pull you up again.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves in the moutains.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves on top of the moutains. (Slight tweak of chamcham's story, using fuaburisa's idea for remembering where to put the mountain primitive.).

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: This kanji tells you an original version of "Brokeback Mountain". Here, the couple of cowboys have fallen in love, and their only way to keep their love in SECRECY is by meeting invariably at the house on the top of the mountain.

hints.author: j0k0m0
hints.mnemonic: Secrecy in your house, invariably leads to a mountain of trouble.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: My lover and I had a house in the mountains so that we could meet in secrecy, but it was invariably found out by my wife.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: When I think of honey, I think of a bee hive, which is a HOUSE that INVARIABLY has INSECTS.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: A house with a lot of honey will invariably attract many insects.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The “house” which is invariably divided in hexagons and is full of insects is where honey comes from (a bee hive).

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Honey left in a house will invariably attract insects.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Think of a queen bee that has been forcefully separated from her "king bee" and put in a luxurious beehouse to produce honey for a factory. Despite all the homely comforts, she weeps all day from a broken heart, thereby producing some of the most foul-tasting honey anyone has ever tried.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Storm is a full-blown wind that rips the mountains off the ground (you see one flying here).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Winds are gathering at the base of the mountain (note the hint to primitive placement), going up, and turning into a huge mountain storm.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: What a storm! Even a mountain was carried off by the wind!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A storm is winds strong enough to lift a mountain!

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: You are sitting on top of Fuji, enjoying spectacular view of the storm below.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: Promountory. A strange word, indeed.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: A promontory is a mountain strange (not a mountain range) that juts out like Cape Odd.

hints.author: krungthep
hints.mnemonic: Ayumi Hamasaki 浜崎 あゆみ will promote her Nagasaki 長崎 concert with a strange promotional stunt

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Standing at the base of the bluffs I announce, "I'm going to climb those ivy-covered cliffs, and then the mountain on top of them." My friends don't believe me, "He bluffs!" they say.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: The ivy-covered cliff we saw on the horizon (#157 涯) ... the sheer beauty of the mountain that overlooks these bluffs is enough to make you want to swim for shore yourself!

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: This is used in the title of the 2008 Studio Ghibli film "Ponyo on the Cliff by the Sea" 崖の上のポニョ。 "Ponyo on the Mountain-high Ivy-covered Bluffs by the Sea" is an alternative title. http

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: In 崖の上のポニョ (Ponyo), the bluffs are where Yousuke's house is, on the mountainous cliff covered in ivy.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: To get to the MOUNTAIN BLUFFS you have to scale the IVY CLIFFS.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive, using the image of going through a door, even one that stands alone with the frame and no wall around, helps flesh out the primitive “enter”.

hints.author: vgambit
hints.mnemonic: Gordon Freeman enters the Black Mesa corporation's headquarters on that fateful day, after starting up a game of Half-Life (this kanji looks exactly like the lambda from the logo when written).

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: Something only a Native American could pull off instead of saying "Come in please.". When used as a primitive, instead of enter, I use a tepee for this character. See my stories up to sue (#787 訟).

hints.author: myglagata
hints.mnemonic: Note that the printed character and the written character appear very differently.

hints.author: brainrobert
hints.mnemonic: HAIRU ENTER 入る person enters stage left.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to enter the roadway as it is crowded with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Everybody tries to enter the road during rush hour. That's why it's so crowded.

hints.author: blueraccoon
hints.mnemonic: There is a Japanese comedy skit where they play a trick on an unaware person who is walking down a quiet empty street. The trick is that a huge crowd suddenly enters the road and stampedes towards the person. http

hints.author: bigspenderJ

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: It's so crowded that even stepping into the road doesn't relieve the problem. ('These Crowded Streets'; Dave Matthews Band).

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: When something is entered by a dagger, it ends up being cut in several parts.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: (This kanji also has the meanings of "understand" and "minute"). It's important to understand that were you to enter an hour with a dagger and cut it into parts, those parts would be minutes.

hints.author: Kurisu
hints.mnemonic: Perhaps one of the most read kanji in Japanese. It means to understand, to part, fraction, to break up, rate, minute, etc. To understand something completly one must enter a dagger into it to break it up into its parts. Imagine understanding a body by doing an autopsy(enter, dagger) and studying the parts. 分かりますか？ .

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: I cut the cake in to eight parts by using a dagger. Then I ate one part every minute. (I just found eight easier to use than enter.).

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Forget mnemonics for this one. Just look at it, it's a sword parting the line above it (cutting it into two parts). Easy!

hints.author: darg_sama

hints.author: bokuzukuri

hints.mnemonic: I always enter the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: The public trains in Japan are so crowded, to enter you have to elbow your way in.

hints.mnemonic: It's bad manners to put your elbows on the table when you eat. So, when I come in to public restaurants, I always make sure that I keep my elbows down, out of the public's eye. (notice

hints.mnemonic: Following up with the "entering public restrooms" story for the right-hand primitive

hints.mnemonic: You can't show pine trees in public, because their lower parts are bare.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: The venerable old man is the public figure head of the Native American Village, answering all questions and solving all problems. The higher in rank you get in this tribe, the more feathers decorate you. Imagine this old man covered in beautiful feathers.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The venerable old man is using the public restroom in the park where he feeds the pigeons. But, alas, there is no toilet paper! So, he's caught a pigeon and is using it to wipe his bottom. (note the feathers on the bottom of the kanji, this helps remember placement). Can you see the feathers flying everywhere?

hints.author: martinnz
hints.mnemonic: The venerable old man is in the public park feeding the pigeons.

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a venerable old man sitting on a public park bench, with hair that looks like white feathers.

hints.mnemonic: Take care what words you say in public lest you be sued.

hints.mnemonic: [+radical_tyro] Socrates was giving a speech in public. Things were going rather well, until his robe opened a bit and people saw his, well, not-public area. He was promptly sued for public indecency. Certain things shouldn't be made public in public, you know?

hints.mnemonic: George Michael wanted to sue the newspapers for all those words about him and public toilets. Unfortunately, it was all true...
