hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: The erection is the crowned needle that's got the power to make children.

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: (Using both keywords). The child had the power of 10 crowns - it was he who led the peasant uprising. He didn't even have his first erection and yet he was more powerful than all the adults. 勃然 【ぼつぜん】 (adj-t,adv-to) sudden; fit of anger 勃起 【ぼっき】 (n,vs) erection (usu. penis); standing erect; stiffening.

hints.author: KanjiKami
hints.mnemonic: (Using the "newer" key word of "Uprising" and the 6th edition explanation that the needle/crown combo = "chapel") Joan of Arc was just a child under the influence of the chapel when she was inspired with the power to lead the French uprising.

hints.author: alucardchuu
hints.mnemonic: The power of his erection crowned him with 10 children.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: 10,000 Persians are at the base of the cliff, but the leader of the 300 Spartans just flexes his huge muscles and encourages his men by shouting that they have the power to fight them all.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: People encourage you, giving you the power so you can dive off the 10,000m high cliff into the sea.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: See the most-starred story in horse chestnut (#514 栃) for an easy way to remember this one. --> That same famous cliffside in Japan at which 10,000 people died ... together, we have the power to do something about it ... let's encourage the government to take action!

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: 10,000 lemmings, an invisible power seems to be encouraging them to dive off the cliff.

hints.author: yukkuri_kame
hints.mnemonic: All of you on this site encourage me so much. Japanese no longer seems like an impossible cliff 10,000 meters high. Thanks to the encouragement I've gotten here, I have the POWER to learn 10,000 Kanji!

hints.author: bigspenderJ
hints.mnemonic: If you eat anymore, you will be adding more カロries. (katakana karo).

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: This is Power Mouth, the most annoying neighbour in the world who always has something to add.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: To add muscle mass it's important to put protein in your mouth after working out.

hints.author: krungthep
hints.mnemonic: Some tenis players seem to think that they can add power to their shots by opening their mouths and groaning as they hit the ball.

hints.author: meredithcat
hints.mnemonic: To add muscles, add some calories (カロリー) to your mouth.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When someone at work gets married, you pass around an envelope to which you add some money and a card which you sign with your congratulations.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: Congratulations are so much better when you add money to them.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: I was a bit shocked when I learnt that it's tradition in Japan to add around 30,000 yen (shells) or more to a wedding congratulations card.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Congratulations on winning the lottery! We'll add the clams (money) to your account.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: You like it when shells (money) are added to your “congratulations cards”.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Instant wood. Just add Viagra.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: I'm not sure I know about erector sets or tinker toys but I do know about jenga. You play by taking wooden pieces from the middle of a wooden tower and adding them to the top. In this way you erect a very unstable structure.

hints.author: ivoSF
hints.mnemonic: Powerfull mouth makes "tree" stand erect, hmm what does that mean?

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: Add wood to erect a structure.

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: To erect a building in Warcraft, you just keep adding more wood, until the building is fully erected.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: What part of the body has a very, very, very powerful smell? The armpit, of course!

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: Armpit is the flesh near your triceps.

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (no important on yomi) The part of Conan's body that is three times more effective at defeating foes than his muscles are his stinky ARMPITs. [Note

hints.author: manos
hints.mnemonic: The piece of flesh between the triceps and the deltoid muscle (note how the 3 strengths form a neat delta) is the armpit.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The part of the body on your flank, where the triceps is attached, is the armpit. Note

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Compare the primitive positions of armpit (#870 脇) and threaten (#871 脅). When your triceps rest alongside your body, they fit snugly against your armpit. When you hold them above your body, however, your posture becomes quite threatening.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Arnold S. (triceps) threatens to kill the waiter if he does not put a steak (meat) infront of him immediately.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: Zelda (NES)

hints.author: TunS77
hints.mnemonic: Is he really that THREATENing..? He may have big triceps above, but I bet theres a tiny bit of meat below!

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: A towering mass of muscles on top of muscles is looming over you, threatening to beat you into a bloody pile of meat.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The nurse says

hints.author: xxinde
hints.mnemonic: Co-operation

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: 3 times Arnold (Schwazzaneggar) asked his co-workers to cooperate and give him a needle (syringe) of steroids (into his tricep), but each time they refused to co-ooperate.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The nurse says

hints.author: axelb
hints.mnemonic: If we cooperate, we will have ten times as much power and triceps.

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: To me, this looks like a bridge going over a body of water, being supported by columns underneath it. Being that I live near the ocean, I see tourists and vacationers coming and going constantly on the bridge. Because the bridge is so long, it forms an arc to support the structural integrity. You can see that arc here.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: I use The Flash for for this primitive; a superhero who is always going very fast.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: See book. * As a primitive I will prefer to use the meaning of column whenever possible, and use the image of columns of the temples of ancient Greece (such as Corinthian columns). The primitive meaning of line is best avoided in my opinion because it is very close to FRAME 812 “file”. Going is not very graphic, but may be used when a mnemonic calls for it.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: For those who need a mnemonic in order not to forget how to write this kanji, think of katakana イテ ite (here the イeven gets a dot)

hints.author: Hyreia
hints.mnemonic: I was having a hard time using 'columns' and 'going' for the left-side later on. What helped me was using it as "crossing the line". You know, as in "going too far". This might help, it did for me.

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: The calligrapher's brush is moving down a column of a script, in rhythm with his meditation.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The army COLUMN walked to the RHYTHM made by the drummer using a cool BRUSH like drum stick. Picturing the brush as a drum stick is not difficult if you've seen such a thing in jazz videos.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Picture a school of studious calligraphers. All their brushes are moving up and down the columns at the same time, in beautiful rhythm.

hints.author: CSBarnes
hints.mnemonic: Brush Hero

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+woel] Lance Armstrong is riding here while brushing his teeth. This is actually one of the secrets to his success - he sets his rhythm by brushing his teeth, and following that rhythm on the pedals. In-out-in-out-in-out; right-left-right-left-right-left. You can try it sometime if you really want to bring your rhythm to a good pace.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Before going all the way to the Boss in a Final Fantasy game, you should probably double back to save at a restore point.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: The column of soldiers has to double back to restore the peace in the village they just left.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: You are writing a complex technical document on your computer when suddenly your computer crashes and your document is lost. You have to restore your computer from backups. Your backups are kept in a tall column (spindle) of DVD's. After you finish restoring your computer, you double-back on your train of thought, reconstructing your lost work.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: To restore order, time travelers double back by going back on the timeline.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A restored column displayed at the Louvres in Paris, makes you double back for another snapshot or another good look at it. Alternatively you may imagine that as part of the restoration of an ancient Greek temple, some columns have been “double backed”.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: To gain more knowledge of what's goin on in the world I'm reading column after column of articles in the newspapers, and it takes so much time I'm glued to it till nightbreak.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Imagine fat people......they avoid going outside to exercise and stay glued to their TV set until nightbreak....so of course they gain weight.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: Just to GAIN a level in WOW, I will keep GOING until NIGHTBREAK GLUED to my PC.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: A COLUMN of soldiers gets up at NIGHTBREAK to chase the enemy whose trail they have remained GLUED to, and thus GAIN on them.

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: To gain more knowledge of japanese I'm reading column after column of RTK, and it takes so much time that I'm glued to my SRS until nightbreak (I love you Spidercat).

hints.author: Hyland1
hints.mnemonic: The line of viking soldiers is always accompanied by a horn mending specialist.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: I'm going to accompany the horny girl to her room so I can "mend" her.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: As you're going along someplace, you pause to mend a wounded animal's horns, and it decides to go with you, to accompany you as a pet/sidekick, out of gratitude.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Japanese Folklore

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: The symbol on the right works well as Horny Repairman (mender) so you can imagine a porn character like a cable repairman that shows up at the door, and a beautiful girl answers (having seen the Big Lebowski helps with this visual). But instead of coming in, he asks the girl to accompany him to his van and she obeys and goes with him. "obey" is the primary meaning of this kanji so it's good to work it into the visual.

hints.author: Deborah
hints.mnemonic: The junior employee is always RUNNING around GOING here and there for his superiors.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Your junior or Jr. in the succession line is the one who runs after you.

hints.author: pageturner1988
hints.mnemonic: I'm not sure where Heisig gets the junior keyword, but this kanji is more often used in the sense of either futile (e.g. 徒労 - fruitless efforts) or group(gang) member (e.g. 聖徒 - disciple, キリスト教徒 - Christian). I'll use gang member for this one. The junior gang member is going to represent at the running competition.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Little The Flash junior likes to run around in his red undies. But he's nowhere near as fast as his dad.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Spartan soldiers raised their junior boys strictly, one of the tests forcing them to run around their impressive columns untill the juniors fell to the ground, exhausted and dizzy to the state of nausea.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: A line queued up outside the Buddhist temple, waiting to see the shrine on New Year's Day.

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: The COLUMNS of this TEMPLE are a well-know meeting spot. You can always see someone WAITING there.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: According to my japanese teacher the etymology of this kanji is that in ancient japan, when people were going on trips they would wait at temples for other people, or to get rest.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Flash hates Buddhist temples because they always make him sit still and wait for prayers to finish. (Image

hints.author: gopineapples
hints.mnemonic: Im GOING to wait at the TEMPLE until buddha returns.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: In Medieval Japan, going to see your lord was often a long journey.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: The fellowship of the ring is on a long journey through the depths of Khaz Modan. Imagine they walk through the hall of pillars, with only light being from their own candlesticks that. Soon they will meet much more light than they would ever want to...

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Parties should stay in a single-file line and carry a candlestick while journeying through an unknown dungeon in an RPG.

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: Famous journey, the three kings, sheperds, and all, going to see their new lord.

hints.author: akahige
hints.mnemonic: The Olympic torch(candlestick) is on a journey around the world carried by The Flash. While he's running, he's got Journey playing on his iPod

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: America seeks to GO and CORRECT other nations. But really what they do is subjugate them...

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: To subjugate is to have somebody stand still and stiff as a column and behave one hundred percent correctly.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Subjugated Samson. Here's the Bible story of Samson after Delilah deceived him into telling her the secret of his strength, his long hair, now shaved and subjugated into submission by the Philistines, chained to the temple columns where he choose to do the correct thing; called upon the God of the Israelites to give him one last burst of power and brought down the entire temple of the Philistines and slew more enemies of Israel in his death than in his life.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: Roman legion (column), carrying a standard with SPQR emblazoned on it, subjugates the babarians and corrects their ways.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: The line of phalanxes entered the small town to show them the "correct" way to act and subjugate them to the will of the Emperor.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Scientists recently measured the diameter of Earth by drilling a deep hole and dropping a line of thread off a humongous spool until it got to the other side.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Suggestion

hints.author: randomkrazy
hints.mnemonic: I'm going to measure the diameter of your crotch, sorry I know it sounds dirty but its for the good of science!

hints.author: jamestaverner
hints.mnemonic: Lance Armstrong wins because his bike has wheels with a bigger diameter. This raises his crotch higher off the ground, giving him more pedalling power. (After winning the Tour de France so many times, the French public liked him almost as much as Princess Di (they use her as the yardstick to measure how much they like celebrities. You could even say that he went up a few notches on the Princess Di-a-Meter... (sorry))).

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: The column of soldiers to the left has been assigned to measure the diameter of a bomb crater. They carry a huge spool of measuring tape with them as they march to the other side.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: What's the main difference between a he and a she? The he has a column covered in a pelt... a penis. Badum-ching.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The ultimate he-man is the Neanderthal cave man. His club is as big as a pillar (column), and he wears a ragged pelt as his only clothing. To remember the column, imagine the cave man resting the club vertically like a column when not in use.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Wherever he goes // he wears pelt clothes.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: He tough man. He wear pelt. He go fight column of other he-s.

hints.author: Asgard
hints.mnemonic: He-man fights with The Flash over a fine pelt. Both want to make a new cape for their costume out of it.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Japanese kamikaze pilots (and the American from Dr. Strangelove) are so devoted to their duty that they go with their missiles.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: It is every American citizen's duty to GO and fire MISSILES at defenceless countries.

hints.author: rodders
hints.mnemonic: Imagine those poor saps in charge of nuclear silos, responsible for ICBMS, those towering column missiles. When the order comes they must decide whether to obey their concience or do their duty and damn the world to atomic annihilation.

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: GOING and CUMMING is a man's DUTY.

hints.author: kigabit
hints.mnemonic: It is a soldier's duty to maintain a perfectly formed battle column, even when missiles are exploding all around them.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Hearkening back to the kanji for LISTEN... Benevolence is a good listener who is willing to go the distance to help.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In a rare act of benevolence, the Sparten column removes the needle from the cyclops's eye, and he repays them by eating their hearts.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Benevolence

hints.author: marydj
hints.mnemonic: Darth Vader was put in charge of the benevolence fund. He stands holding a bucket with a big heart on it as the column of soilders passes by. Everyone contributes.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A heart which was full of benevolence, but so small that it could pass through the eye of a needle, was displayed atop a huge Corinthian column (maybe the relic of some Saint). The column which acted as a stand, reminded viewers not to be fooled by the heart's needle-eye size.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: The taskmistress in a moment of weakness allowed the man's column to penetrate her. As punishment he was made to bring up their infant.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Ha! In this frame, a bunch of taskmasters are lined up to penetrate the kids they raise/bring up! I'm thinking of some priests and choir boys.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to penetrate enemy lines (or the columns of soliders). It won't be easy

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: Penetrate = "goes into." As in the lessons of the taskmaster penetrating the minds of those he his bringing up.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Compare the two kanji for 'penetrate' and 'remove'

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: If you see a column of kings being marched up the mountain under a taskmaster's whip... indications are, there has been a coup.

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: The combination of column + mountain + taskmaster appear in quite a few kanji ( 徴 , 微 ,薇,黴), so let's give it the meaning of 'trek'. Story

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: This kanji actually means symbol. GO to the MOUNTAIN of the KINGS and find a TASKMISTRESS with the symbol (of the devil on her forehead)!!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: If your going through the hall of the mountain king, and you hear the music speeding up, indications are that the taskmaster is coming to get you… Thanks nest0r.

hints.author: amthomas
hints.mnemonic: All indications are that The Flash and the taskmaster have cornered the king under a mountain!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Penal servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart (learned one's lesson). Easily confused with punish (#679 刑) and penalty (#833 罰). Concentrate on the reasons behind the penal system ("changing people's hearts" here), instead of the penalty itself or the punishment (revenge) aspect. It may help to note that there's no sword, but a heart

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Judge

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: Penal servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart. In other words, when your iIndications changes from "I"M A BADASS MOUNTAIN KING TASKMASTER" to "I heart the world".

hints.author: cingold
hints.mnemonic: The indications of a good heart are what is required to get you out of the penal system.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Penal servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart. Remember in The Shawshank Redemption, Morgan Freeman wasn't released on parole until he had such a change of heart.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: The Column of 300 spartans were in a delicate situation. They had travelled in one line (using only their legs) to the mountain pass to face the fierce Persian task master.

hints.author: cingold
hints.mnemonic: We're going up the mountain announces the taskmaster. Anyone with legs too delicate must stay behind.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: [The sense of delicate implied by this Kanj -- easily broken, weak, brittle, insignificant] A column of taskmasters is trying to leg-press one mountain between them. They are old and frail, and their legs skinny and delicate. A single pair of legs wouldn't be able to achive anything in this case. However, together they manage to push the mountain up towards the sky.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Here we have a taskmaster who orders a mountain to go away. The mountain is so frightened that it sprouts two little delicate legs and gingerly walks away. Be sure to imagine the legs as really tiny and the mountain as really big so the delicate-ness is there.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: The fellowship of the ring had to move as a column delicately through the mines of moria. The mountain was above them with legs hanging from the ceiling, no doubt left there by the taskmaster they didn't want to awaken.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: The boulevard of boulevards, the Champs Elysées, with the Arc de Triomphe covered in ivy to give the champions a heroes' welcome.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: Specifically... ivy boulevard... think hollywood & vine.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mnemonic trick

hints.author: axelb
hints.mnemonic: A boulevard is one street where they use columns of ivy for decorations.

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: This is a pictograph of an ancient boulevard, so long disused that it is now covered in ivy all down the middle.

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: When the wooden girders start to snap, the workmen shout "Run! Let's go!".

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Girders are support beams that are nowadays mostly made out of steel. But in the ancient houses that are placed at the boulevard the girders will be made out of wood.

hints.author: aniseed
hints.mnemonic: 「けた」。This kanji is used to denote a number of digits or decimal places, e.g. 三桁のパスワード (a 3-digit password).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: People use girders these days – wood's going out.

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: [+astridtops] Girders are support beams now most often made of steel. But the girders of the ancient houses of this boulevard are strong columns of wood.

hints.author: Tweenk
hints.mnemonic: To maintain the social equilibrium in a future dystopian society, the brains of citizens are bound up (hypnotized). The government is using mental wave emitting statues shaped like St. Bernard's dogs put alongside the boulevards.

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: I think BALANCE is an easier keyword. I was walking down a busy French boulevard when between the rushing traffic I saw the wierdest thing. BALANCING on the central crash barrier was a St. Bernard dog, BALANCING a fish on its nose. As I looked closer, I realised it was a trick; it was holding the fish's tail in its teeth, and only pretending to BALANCE it. (keeps the position of the elements!).

hints.author: boyprangko
hints.mnemonic: [boulevard... bound up... rice field... large...] imagine a fish walking a boulevard trying to maintain equilibrium having had its fins cut off and replaced by a st. bernard.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The poor St. Bernard walking down the middle of the boulevard cannot see to mantain his equilibrium. It seems his brain is all bound up with alcohol.

hints.author: kazelee
hints.mnemonic: If you've ever seen the movie Equilibrium, you know this kanji has it all. Bound minds, dogs, and building shaped like long columns enveloped by endless boulevards of soldiered surveillance. Add some imaginary gun katas and you've got a lawsuit on your hands. If you've never seen this movie, do, or.... CrazyWashu uses the field of equilibrium generated between Azaka and Kamidake to create a hybrid fish dog.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Aliens often draft their plans for invasion by cutting designs among the tall wheat.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: The first DRAFT of catcher in the rye was actually called "catcher in the TALL WHEAT"...good thing they changed it. I read it in 高校 .

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Draft wheat beer (Hefeweizen) is served in the typical tall German glass.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: They tried to draft a plan to make the wheat grow tall.

hints.author: melchan
hints.mnemonic: The writer hid himself in the middle of tall wheat so he would not be disturbed while writing the draft.

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: Your earnings allow you to bring home your daily bread (made of wheat, naturally).

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Hmm, EARNINGS. Think of the popular saying "Bringing HOME the bacon". Here, EARNINGS is the picture "Bringing HOME the bread(WHEAT) and the bacon (PIG).

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: A farmer's earnings can be viewed as the amount of wheat he has in his grain silo (house).

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Earnings? Where I'm from, it's called bringing home the dough...

hints.author: jinkouchinou
hints.mnemonic: The breadwinner (wheat bread winner) brings home the earnings.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: The extent to which some people will go to create 'wheat displays', or as some call them 'crop circles', is truly amazing.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: The wheat crop has come in, and the mouth of the king is gobbling it all up. Everyone is waiting to see... to what extent will the king manage to eat it this year?

hints.author: rodders
hints.mnemonic: The extent of the wheat display (an ostentatious olympic opening-style event held at harvest time) will show you how profitable a year the kingdoms farmers had. "Ooo, pretty, wheat fireworks! Must have been a good year!".

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: The extent to which the king can open his mouth to fit in wheat is really astounding.

hints.author: kiisu
hints.mnemonic: The ostentatious wheat display shows the extent of the king's wealth.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Nobody likes the tax man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your wheat is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so taxes were paid by serfs in wheat to the devils who came over to keep them poor.

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: This is an easy one. Taxes is like the devil taking away your hard earned wheat.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: I don't know if it makes sense, but it works for me

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: "No, mister tax man, please no! Anything but this! Please don't take our bread away! how shall I feed my horny teenager now?".

hints.author: Pangolin
hints.mnemonic: When the church takes 10% of your wheat harvest, it's a tithe. When the devil takes it, it's a tax.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Immature turkeys are stuffed with wheat to make it look bigger.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: I can't believe I brought you to the fanciest restaurant in town and you asked for turkey on wheat...how immature is that?!

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: It's immature to whip turkeys with wheat.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The only wheat that a turkey is able to reach for eating is immature and shouldn't be touched. Wheat that is ready for harvest is as tall as a human. Shoo the turkeys away from the fields! Gobble gobble! (I guess there's no crows in Japan?).

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Wheat + Turkey

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: The first step to harmony is having enough wheat to feed every mouth in the world. Once we are all fed it is easier to get a long in harmony.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: People who live in harmony with nature live in the country. they are yokels or hillbillys. See Billy-bob sitting on the porch in their denhim dungarees a sheaf of wheat, sticking from their mouth.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: What better image of harmony and peace than relaxing amidst the wheat, with one long stalk in your mouth.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: A cereal commercial. Look at the family so happy in harmony. You know its true. Early in the morning you feel like smiling at each other, and being very happy while you eat that cereal.... not... I wake up, shuve it in my mouth and off i am.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Tasty wheat brings true harmony to the mouth.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Picture the WHEAT field, filled with MANY, MANY stalks of WHEAT. Notice how they SHIFT like waves in the slightest breeze. When you hear SHIFT, just picture that scene.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Many people are making the shift from white to whole wheat bread.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: To hide the wheat from the devilish tax (#895 税) collector, the villagers shift the wheat between them many, many times. "We don't have much, sir, but we'll do anything for the crown".

hints.author: harhol
hints.mnemonic: I have to work two EVENING shifts a week just to be able to put WHEAT on the table. Damn recession.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: As Japan became westernized, eating habits changed. Lots of people shifted from rice to bread...many, many loaves of *bread.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: An hourglass filled with wheat counts time. A few wheat seeds drop every second.

hints.author: nmkohi
hints.mnemonic: I'll be with you soon... please wheat a few seconds.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: I first came across this kanji on my microwave, so; if you want to microwave wheat, it's important to remember only to set it for a few seconds. If it helps you can picture those wheat/bran bag things that you heat in the microwave and apply to muscle aches.

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: Wheat can be cooked in a few seconds.

hints.author: xxinde
hints.mnemonic: [thanks, vosmiura] An hourglass filled with wheat counts time. A few wheat grains drop every second. Why wheat, not rice? Because wheat grains are yellow, just like the sand in a regular hourglass.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: In AUTUMN, the WHEAT looks the color of FIRE, meaning it's time to harvest it.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: Every autumn the wheat is set on fire to clear the way for next year's crop...

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: After the wheat harvest, the farmers have a bonfire to celebrate the autumn season.

hints.author: stshores24
hints.mnemonic: Every autumn they gather in the wheat and then set it all afire. I don't think they know what they're doing.

hints.author: shinyclef
hints.mnemonic: Have a look at this guy's photo if you need a mental image. Compare it to the pic before it to see how drastically the colour changes. http

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: In AUTUMN, the farmer's HEART is in DISTRESS as to if he has enough crops. Even better, the farmer will experience great DISTRESS in his HEART if his WHEAT catches FIRE!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here we have distressed (think "gloomy") people with "seasonal mood disorder" during the autumn season. Hence "autumn heart" is distressed (gloomy).

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: The HEART becomes distressed in the AUTUMN when summer loves end.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The damsel in distress was tied to a big stalk of wheat in the middle of a field.. The evil, dastardly villain then set the field on fire! Can our hero get to her in time, saving her life and winning her heart?? Tune in next week!

hints.author: Jaunty
hints.mnemonic: I have to imagine a "damsel in distress" to avoid confusing this with similar keywords. Think of Rapunzel sitting in her tower staring out at the autumn scenery, her heart aching.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Warning sign

hints.author: hilber
hints.mnemonic: A joke so bad as "wheatashi wa" deserves an elbow in the private parts.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: I already know this as watashi, or "I". In order to associate the keyword of private, I'll think of this one as "Private I", like a detective.

hints.author: baldy514
hints.mnemonic: Wheatashi wa.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: I was glad that nobody was around when I stuck my elbow in my cereal bowl and spilled the whole damned mess all over myself. Something that stupid should remain private -- between "me, myself, and I".

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Think of REGULARITY in terms of bowel movements. Enough WHEAT in your diet will help your DROPS with improved REGULARITY.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: Eating plenty of wheat will improve regularity and help you lose weight.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: I got it. Regularity, order, system, systematic. Now, Imagine the husband (the 'head' of the household, the farmer and what not). Walking across his farm, then in a regular, ordered, and systemised fashion he DROPS (the drop) a little piece of wheat. I love this image not only because it answers the keyword, but it is really close to the meaning of the actual kanji.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Increase your regularity by eating wheat-bran cereal to improve the regularity of your drops in the bathroom.

hints.author: eieneverafter
hints.mnemonic: Farmers deal with losing some of their wheat as a regularity.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: The prize at the bottom of a cereal box is invariably a secret decoder ring.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: A young couple meets in secret in the wheat field because their families are enemies. They cross their hearts and swear eternal - even if secret - love. Do not confuse with secrecy (#775 密).

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: The farmers invariably keep the actual amount of wheat produced a secret from the tax assessor.

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: My diet secret

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: NOTE

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: Taking appellation to mean the act of naming, we have the little baby superman reclining in the space craft that landed in a wheat field. Mr. and Mrs. Kent look down and decide to call him Clark. (I also thought of Jesus but he was born in a barn full of hay not wheat).

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: WHEAT that is RECLINING and LITTLE (small) can't get the APPELLATION "quality wheat".

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: An Indian chief explains the art of appellation by introducing his three children

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: The way this wheat reclines a little justifies its appellation

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: If you're having trouble thinking of a name for your little one, go lie down in a field of wheat for a while and gaze at the stars.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: 1. Steal a bunch of wheat from a wheat field by cutting it down with your saber. 2. ????? 3. Profit!

hints.author: ivoSF
hints.mnemonic: In the middle ages there where only 2 ways for peasantry to make a profit. one by being a farmer, 2 to be a mercenary and live by the way of the sword.

hints.author: mairov
hints.mnemonic: Use the saber to cut the wheat and get your profit.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: Your earnings (#893 稼) are divided between the tax man's share and your profit using a saber, which by the way is a cavalry sword, wielded by the tax (#895 税) man on his pale horse (not pictured).

hints.author: HydroKirby
hints.mnemonic: The Legend of Zelda players know that you will profit from going into fields of wheat and cutting them down with your saber.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese pear tree is the most profitable in the world, because it produces its fruit in pairs [sorry for the awful pun].

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: And a profit in a pear tree...12 days of christmas.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: The profit on Japanese pear trees is next to なし! (get it?).

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: During the 12 days of Christmas, the person who made the most profit was the tree salesman, since he sold 12 partriges in a pear tree.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: Japanese pears (http

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The harvest of genetically modified crops is taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (see the flower vessel in safeguard (#700 護)).

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Wheat is harvested; the grain (flower) is put into vessels for shipping.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: The harvest of wheat was bountiful for the Pilgrims abord the Mayflower, which is supposedly the reason for the first Thanksgiving.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Aha! It's the wheat harvest that's being safeguard (#700 護) on the ship! That's why the pack of wild dogs seize (#701 獲) the ship!

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: The flower vessel that the hippies tried to safeguard (#700 護) with their words of peace but the pirates managed to seize (#701 獲) with the help of their pack of wild dogs, actually contained the whole wheat harvest for the year. (Thanks, dingomick.) 収穫 (しゅうかく)

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The pilgrims only had wheat, so they asked the Indians to do them a favor and trade them for some ears of corn.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The "ear of a plant" is the seed-bearing spike of a cereal plant, such as corn. In other words, it is the part which feeds us. Hence -- "the ear (of a plant) is the favor of the wheat".

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Botanist (lecturing to class)

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: The ear of corn fell into the dirt. It shouted to the nearby wheat- "Hey! HEY! Could you do me a favor?!" No answer... stupid stuck up wheat.

hints.author: unicornpuddlefoot
hints.mnemonic: Wheat; favour. The ear of the plant is nature's favour.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The rice plant is common in Japan because all the wheat was eaten by vultures in the olden times.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: It used to be that wheat was grown in Japan. However, this was often stolen by vultures, so in olden times, the gods gave the Japanese the rice plant.

hints.author: altape
hints.mnemonic: The rice plant evolved from wheat in olden times to defend itself against vultures eating it - rice causes vultures to explode.

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: Wheat has been trying to claw its way in to japan since olden times but the rice plant still domiantes the landscape.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: What we are calling wheat really refers to a rice plant, known to Wolverine from olden times (Wolverine is a lot older than he looks -- he was born in the 1880s). Imagine Wolverine in ancient times (mukashi mukashi) planting rice by poking a little hole with his claws and then settling the plant into the mud.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: If you focus the suns though a magnifying glass on to the bottom of a stalk of wheat it will start to smoulder and burn like a stick of incense. The weird thing is that it burns from the bottom upwards, hanging in the air as if my magic. Try it and see!

hints.author: Alucard
hints.mnemonic: When the sun burns the wheat a smell of incense remains in the air.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: If we would throw a huge amount of wheat on top of the sun, would it become a galactic incense? Maybe then aliens wouls come more often, enjoying the incense.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: When the Sun goes down, the pagans light their wheat, producing a natural incense, to honour the Sun God.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Incense is commonly used in worship and at shrines in Japan. On sun( 日 )days( 日 ), many people used to go to their shrine of choice, probably that of the SUN goddess Amaterasu, and place a small gift of incense and wheat at the foot of the shrine, wishing for a profitable harvest.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: There's a season for planting wheat and there's mating season for having children.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: As the seasons pass, the wheat and the children grow, but the wheat grows faster, right over the children.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: Look at this adorable child with a bale of wheat on his head! He's playing Autumn in his school play the "Four Seasons". Aww...too cute! Perhaps we should light the wheat on fire to complete his Autumn costume. (I know, twisted...but I kept forgetting what was on his head).

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: When the wheat has grown so high that the farmer can't see his child playing in the field anymore (child under wheat) he knows that the season has come to harvest his crops.

hints.author: ellasevia
hints.mnemonic: According to Greek mythology, the seasons are a result of the wheat goddess's (Demeter) child (Persephone) having been kidnapped by Hades.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Female WHEAT farmers decide to create a COMMITTEE, which they fittingly name “The WHEAT WOMEN COMMITTEE.”.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: At committe meetings, Japanese bureaucrats slurp ramen noodles off of naked women.

hints.author: axelb
hints.mnemonic: While the men had to harvest the field, the women formed committee where they decided what to do with the wheat. Here you see one of them carrying some of it away.

hints.author: kodorakun
hints.mnemonic: The 'straw woman' (woman figure stuffed with wheat) is put on the committee to make it look as if there is equal representation, but really it's just a bunch of men ("keeping the women down" for placement).

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: There is just one woman on the executive committee of the Australian Wheat Board. See for yourself, here

hints.author: GoodSirJava
hints.mnemonic: You spend three hours putting all of your wheat sale transaction records into Microsoft Excel, when suddenly it crashes, so you put your fist through the monitor.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: A soviet-era poster for the 5-year plan shouts "Excel" and shows a fist clenching a sheaf of wheat. Wheat/Fist.

hints.author: astgtciv
hints.mnemonic: The icon of the Special edition of Microsoft Excel for Farmers shows a fist holding wheat.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: A photo depicting that this year's harvest excelled all others

hints.author: saizen
hints.mnemonic: Sensei to student

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: If you excel in the Mario Kart road, your movements are saved and you can race against yourself as a transparent racer. http

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: If you want to excel at driving in the roadway, it's better if your windows and windshield are transparent. Picture the drivers with opaque windshields all wrecked on the side of the road.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Because it is transparent, fiber optic cable excels as a roadway for the information superhighway.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: If you're going to use Excel while driving on the road you'd better use a transparent screen so you can still see where you're going.

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: I just thought of it as a car that is excelling on the road so much that the motion blur makes it look transparent.

hints.author: amthomas
hints.mnemonic: Word and Excel somehow manage to entice people to use them, despite their plethora of bugs.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Think of the smooth talker who EXCELS at using WORDS to entice women (including married women if it makes it easier to remember).

hints.author: sethg
hints.mnemonic: I was enticed into Heisig, because Khatz tends to say your Japanese will excel after using it.

hints.author: Machine_Gun_Cat
hints.mnemonic: I imagine alot of the users of this site imagine themselves in the future as some sexy beast in Japan who Excels at speaking with japanese Words so much that their words alone are enough to Entice any Japanese girl.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: This kanji actually means "invite" so think of it as enticing someone to attend something. This is a PR person, enticing everyone to attend an event. To be a good PR person, you would definitely need to excel with words. (Also, if you don't excel enough, you could get people drunk on beer(wheat) or hire the mob(fist) to get them to come to the event).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The hardest part of my training as a cook was when they gave me some wheat and a chihuahua with a human leg and said, "Now make something delicious".

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: After a hard day of training, wheat is understandably delicious.

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: The CHIHUAHUA with a human leg is now in training to be a baker, learning to turn WHEAT into DELICIOUS loaves of bread. Notice the Chihuahua is standing on a delicious loaf of bread in order to reach the counter.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: When you are in TRAINING mode, all you eat is WHEAT to keep your weight down. You really want to eat something DELICIOUS during this time, even that CHIHUAHA HUMPING YOUR LEG is beginning to look DELICIOUS.

hints.author: Puchatek
hints.mnemonic: Using delicious wheat snacks (I like the myself!) as prizes I was training my chihuahua with one human leg dog tricks.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: There are different cereals in different parts of the world. Japan has samurai cereal. Great Britain has Crowned Wheat ... the United States and Russia have Missile cereals.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The samurai crowns wheat as the best cereal, and blows all others up with missiles (he's a cereal killer).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A pack of cereals (i.e. cornflakes) contains a plastic samurai (toy) with a crown and missile (i..e a rocket launcher on its shoulder).

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Japan has samurai cereal. Great Britain has Crowned Wheat ... the United States and Russia have Missile cereals (hey, what do you think they keep in those silos?).

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Can also mean bacteria.....imagine the wheat pent in your fridge growing to the point where they resemble flowers.......I actually had something similar happen to onions...they grew footlong legs after about 2 or 3 years......OR just think of that Cowboy Bebop episode with the lobster in the fridge...

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Actually it means germs as in microorganisms. So for example, you have to keep wheat enclosed so it isn't exposed to other plants. That way it can't catch any germs (like fungi) from them.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: If you pent in the wheat, it'll turn into wheat germ and sprout flowers.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Keep your wheat pent in an airtight container or it may catch germs and sprout flowers.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: A very logical kanji. Wheat germ is the "heart" of the kernel; on a wheat stalk, there is a flowering spike or ear (of a plant) (#909 穂). The little wheat germs are pent inside of the seeds on the flowering ear.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: The keyword numb makes no sense. I choose 萎む （しぼむ）"to fade away". A girl lies in a wheat field at the same time every day. A photo is taken every day showing this scene and a time lapse video shows the wheat growing through the year until the wheat is tall and the top sprouts to look like its flowers. At this point, the girl can no longer be seen in the photos and she fades away.

hints.author: Nukemarine

hints.mnemonic: The acupuncturist was not very good. His bamboo needles made his patients cry copious amounts of water. He was put on a register of doctors to avoid.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: After diluting your bad humours with flowers in Frame 217, the acupuncturist pulls out a bamboo slab and asks you to sign the register, including your e-mail address, so that you can receive periodic updates on special promotions and also read his blog.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: The keyword refers to register as in an expense book. I imagine a wealthy housewife writing up her elaborate and unnecessary expenses in her register notebook

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Bamboo crafting is a mediocre substitute for wood when you are building or fabricating a house. While it may look good and might attract a chick (ちく) or two, the kids'll (きず) just tear it to pieces as its not sturdy enough.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: A bamboo fabrication is a mediocre substitute for wood.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: If you fabricate a boat from bamboo you get a pretty mediocre craft. Use wood instead.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Just as you wouldn't want heart surgeons who were mediocre at their craft operating on you (see raulir's story for fear (#613 恐)), you also wouldn't want house builders who were mediocre at their craft fabricating your house for you--they might fabricate a flimsy one of bamboo instead of sturdy one of wood. 建築 (けんちく)

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The only cage that can keep a dragon is made of bamboo.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: A bamboo cage won't hold a dragon!

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: A bamboo cage has a 50% chance of containing a dragon (thanks Mantixen and cb4960) I should add that this is yet another example of Heisig choosing a less used simplification. 籠 is more common.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 立て篭る =立て籠る, 印籠 =印篭cage (#2638 篭)ロウ, かご, こもる ... Parts

hints.author: dominikun
hints.mnemonic: German

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Behold Mister T (of "A-Team" fame)! I chose Mr.T because he's sure to make amusing stories. He is a very versatile character since he's both the big, tough guy and the “moralistic” person, telling kids not “to do drugs or alcohol”. He is easy to imagine, the heavy gold chains are probably the most prominent feature of the character. And last but not least you can always pepper your story with the famous line “I pity da foo!” * Fittingly, on the left side of the kanji, it looks like a “T”.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: [I appreciate some people's occasional habit of using P for person in shared stories. That makes it easier to substitute Mr. T, Captain Picard, or whomever else a student is using as person.].

hints.author: ImaginaryJapan
hints.mnemonic: Khatzumoto.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: For this character, I'm going to use Chuck Norris. He is a world class martial artist, winning several karate championships in a row. He also achieved ultimate power according to his Chuck Norris Facts, and works as a Texas Ranger (sheriff). He is however a very kind and religious person. Here we have a view of his powerful legs, while the contracted form shows him performing a roundhouse kick.

hints.author: didz13
hints.mnemonic: JESUS.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mr T's assistant is on his left. Why? Because Mr T has this bad habit of suddenly extending his right arm (what with all the boxing that he did), and his assistant got inadvertently punched in the face more than once (ouch). So now his assistant is always to his left side, much safer - "Stay on my left, foo!".

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: On your right is your "right-hand man" that you credit for all your success....on the left...... is your assistant who does all the grunt work and gets no credit for anything...

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Your left-hand man. (NB this kanji suggests a lower-ranking assistant. Their is a similar but rarer kanji 佑 with "right" that indicates receiving help from a superior.).

hints.author: Stryder
hints.mnemonic: Dwight Schrute wants to be Michael Scott's right-hand man (Assistant Regional Manager) but the best he ever manages is his left-hand man (Assistant TO the Regional Manager).

hints.author: somukeru
hints.mnemonic: As Obi-wan's padawan, or assistant, Anakin is the Jedi who stands on his left.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T don't take a partner, especially one with no spine. "I pity da foo got no spine", he says.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T needs a partner with a strong spine as he's a beast in the bedroom.

hints.author: brendanmacdonald
hints.mnemonic: As a PARTNER, I want a PERSON with a strong SPINE.

hints.author: Gwindarr
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T comes up behind you saying 'Howdy Pard'ner' while slapping you on the back in a friendly gesture, but shattering your spine unintentionally in the process.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: MR.T broke his partner's SPINE after he was double crossed.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: However drunk Mr T is when he comes back to his place, he always get up at nightbreak. “I pity da foo who gets up after nightbreak !”, says Mr. T.

hints.author: etpan
hints.mnemonic: Most people go to bed at nightbreak. However, Chuck Norris does not. He does not sleep, he waits.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: MR.T leads a busy life, however he always makes sure to be in bed by NIGHTBREAK, however much he might want to stay up watching A-Team re-runs.

hints.author: Verdana
hints.mnemonic: Khatzumoto says you should learn Japanese however you want, but you must have fun with it every day until nightbreak.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: However many times i try to look at this kanji in review i realize how abstract the term "however is". But i remember this story i made up just now which is a poor person until night break trying to remember this kanji.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: When Mr T shows people round his dwelling he takes a big candlestick (with a candle in it!) so that the light shows off his collection of bling bling jewellery.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T DWELLS in a house fit for a lord. As with all the bling, he has to keep up appearances, you know. Now all the people on his street are just 'trying to keep up with the T's' (as opposed to 'keeping up with the Jones').

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mister T dwells in a big brass candlestick, the flame of which serves as a beacon for the boats in the nearby harbour. Sometimes in the morning, Mister T has to clear the wax that has landed and solidified in front of the door.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: A person dwells in the place where he puts his candlesticks.

hints.author: Verdana
hints.mnemonic: Khatzumoto doesn't dwell on the past when he sucked in Japanese. Instead, he is now lord of Japanese language.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mr T ranks first position in the stand-up competition (doing knee flexions). Just picture him doing hundreds of these while the rest of the participants are already completely exhausted after a mere hundred.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Rank A person's standing.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T ranks high with the ladies because his...ahem...is always standing up. "I pity da poor fool whose tool be lying down on the job.".

hints.author: eatyoda
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T ranked number one in the "last man standing" boxing tournament. You can imagine Mr. T standing atop all his fallen rivals to exemplify his top ranking.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: In martial arts, you reach the highest RANK if you can stand against a roundhouse kick from Chuck Norris (person). Unfortunately, when Chuck Norris performs a roundhouse kick, the only one that is left standing is Chuck Norris.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: When negotiating a hostage situation, Mr. T acted as the go-between, or person in the middle, for law enforcement and the terrorist.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Go-between The person in the middle.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: They say only Nixon could go to China; but actually he sent Mr. T as a go-between. Nixon understands the Manchu dynasty, but only Mr. T pities the Fu.

hints.author: uberclimber

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mr T literally goes between two persons, through the middle of their guts, acting as some kind of link in their personal relations, or as a middleman.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Mister T works out his body (body-building), using two piles of books (i.e. an exercise that can be done at home with two chairs, similar to push-ups but working mostly the shoulders, trapezius and triceps).

hints.author: pageturner1988

hints.author: harhol
hints.mnemonic: MR. T's fitness BOOK

hints.author: ImaginaryJapan
hints.mnemonic: Khatzumoto's body is like a living, breathing book. It's all that SRSing he does, I guess.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: [Easy one] Origin of a person = body.

hints.author: calittle
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T ventured out into a remote area to visit with his wise, old taskmaster who must use a walking stick to get around and originally gave Mr. T the heart to fight crime for the good of the community.

hints.author: somukeru
hints.mnemonic: Yoda, the Jedi with the walking stick who was a hard taskmaster for Luke but who had a big heart, was permanently exiled on the remote planet Dagobah.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Even a person being hit with a walking-stick by the taskmaster, can remain calm if their heart is remote. (i.e. "emotionally remote", kanji also means calm/composed).

hints.author: dihutenosa

Mr T clutches his heart and starts beating the television with his walking stick. A nurse runs up to him and tells him to be careful of his heart, and to use the remote control next to him. "I'll use my stick to stop Hitler! I pity da foo that tries to take the easy way out with a remote!".

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [permanence; distant; long time; leisure] A person needs a walking-stick to visit the remote taskmaster... and a lot of heart, too (can you feel that heartbeat after walking to such a remote place?).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.mnemonic: It's one or the other

hints.mnemonic: Old latin saying

hints.mnemonic: Sith - the "other" jedi - were like scorpions...deadly and treacherous. 他 (ほか)

hints.mnemonic: Mr T resting by a tree.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett

hints.mnemonic: Haruhi is anti-provisional

hints.mnemonic: (note

hints.mnemonic: As a PERFORMING ARTIST MR.T has BRANCHED out into KABUKI theater.

hints.mnemonic: Only the jedi chief gets to use a white lightsaber.

hints.mnemonic: Mr. T has faith in the Word of God. (Image

hints.mnemonic: Faith is believing that a person will be true to his word.

hints.mnemonic: Have faith in Mr. Ts words!

hints.mnemonic: Have faith in Khatzumoto and his words, and one day you too will be fluent in Japanese.

hints.author: nilfisq

hints.mnemonic: The square jewel chained to the neck of Mr.T is what makes him excellent.

hints.mnemonic: Mr T is reliant (depends on) on his garment (the gold chains).

hints.mnemonic: Proverb

hints.mnemonic: This keyword gave me trouble, I could write the kanji from memory but could not remember the keyword the other way around. In such case the dictionary definition can be helpful

hints.mnemonic: There is the dark side and the Jedi side. Those on the Jedi side follows the rules.

hints.author: cescoz

hints.mnemonic: Mr. T infiltrates the secret samurai Buddhist temple as a waiter with a tray of green tea. (Careful

hints.author: thelooseteeth

hints.mnemonic: Mister T can do no meditation! So he is a waiter at the Buddhist temple, attending upon the zen monks, serving green tea, etc. (but mostly, he is annoying all the monks with the noise of his big gold chains).

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: I think its best if we derive this from 待 (wait). So the waiter, WAITS for the people to pick their order by holding the menu [extra stroke] in his hand. This clever keyword allows one to go from waiter -> person that SERVES you. A samurai was bound by oath to SERVE their master etc etc, 侍女 【じじょ】 (n) lady attendant, maid, (P) 侍医 【じい】 (n) court physician, (P).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The A-team tries to disguise Mr. T as a waiter. It would have worked too, except that he was to go undercover at a Buddhist temple. "I pity da foo sent me to a Buddhist temple dressed up like a waiter!".

Noticing how nice a restaurant it is, he/she decides to call a few friends to visit the restaurant, as well. The new arrivals also notice the nice atmosphere of the restaurant and decide to call a few more friends. And so on. Eventually the restaurant is filled with hundreds of people, whose sheer weight causes the rotating section to come to a complete halt.

hints.author: Danieru

Some scholars say that it references the importance of humane relationships between two people (parent/child, sibling/sibling, ruler/subject, etc). It's easy enough, though, to look at it as a person in a dialogue with another - the give and take, yin and yang - the two-way street in which humanity relates to each other.

The top hat and scarf were placed on him by a tourist as a joke, and the "praise" is really his cohorts mocking him.

hints.mnemonic: Chuck Norris. Wearing only sunglasses. With "wood". This IS Greatness personified.

Can't you just see him here as the new porter, wearing a harness with a his little dude (who already has a little matching mohawk)?

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T berates a lazy worker

hints.mnemonic: The porter of people (rather than of baggage -- i.e., bus driver, airline pilot, ...) is the person with the greatest responsibilty.

hints.author: etpan
hints.mnemonic: You can hire Chuck Norris to be your porter but he will take no responsibility if he damages your luggage while saving the world.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: It's your own responsibility to pay the bus fare with the correct number of shells/money.

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: In Japan they have automatic ticket gates so you cant easily cheat on your train fare. In England however the ticket gates are fairly open. It is a different kind of system. In England you are given the RESPONSIBILITY to put in the right amount of MONEY, but if you are caught cheating, the fines are stiff and you feel like a real CHINCHIN. "un.CHIN".

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Belligerent passenger to bus driver

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: In Japan you often pay the fare when you get off the bus. You have to put the correct change in to a machine. It's your responsibility to make sure you have the correct money/shells ready so as not to waste time. There is another machine you can put bills and large coins in to, which dispenses smaller change at the bottom.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T walks out on his porter job and hails a cab. The cabbie tells him how much the ridiculous fare is and out of spite Mr. T pays him with shells he's kept in his ass.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: "Mister T substitutes an arrow for a toothpick" -- The keyword meaning is to replace something with something else, to act for another, to represent. It's best to stick to the first meaning, because the last two are very close to "mediator" which will come in frame 1761. The idea here is that the arrow is not a toothpick, neither it is changed into one, but it can substitute for one.

hints.author: bkvogel
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T shot the substitute teacher with an arrow.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: The gym teacher asks Mr. T to substitute for him on the day the kids will be shooting arrows for archery class. Imagine going home and telling your friends "dude! Mr T was my sub today! I hope my teacher gets hit with an arrowhead and never comes back!". (thanks dihutenosa).

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [substitute; change; convert; replace; period; age; counter for decades of ages, eras, etc.; generation; charge; rate; fee] A stuntman is a person working as substitute for the main actor in the scene when he is shot by an arrow.

hints.author: Ellen
hints.mnemonic: I immediately thought of substitute in a footballing sense, and this video came to mind

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: A sack is an easy substitute for a garment.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A worker who was recently sacked from his job, is wearing a sack of potatoes as a substitute garment (naked otherwise), in some kind of protest. The kanji is close to frame 1547 "bag", and although the later really refers to a "straw sack", I use the image of a sack of potatoes here, and that of a "plastic bag" for frame 1547. The keywords would have been better swapped in my opinion, but the relevancy is not so important at this point (see notes of Lesson 31 in the book).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: If you're super poor, you can substitute a potato sack for normal garments.

hints.author: unicornpuddlefoot
hints.mnemonic: When my clothes went missing I found a quick substitute - a sack!

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: A sack can be used as a substitute garment.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: In order for the bank to lend you money, you need to put up some sort of collateral as a substitute for the money.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The poor substitute teacher asks the class to lend him some money for the bus fare home.

He refuses, and you feel a bit embarrassed. Mr T quietly reaches into a sack (which they will cart him away on later) and discreetly hands it to you. "I'm just lending it to ya, foo! Stop that thanking jibba jabba." [trigger

hints.mnemonic: I pictured the "substitute shells" as semi-transparent, or ghostly money, symbolising how they only stand for money that you didn't have in the first place. -- "lended shells are substitute shells".

hints.author: robertmyers
hints.mnemonic: When you lend money to someone, you are in essence substituting their money (or lack there of) with yours.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Referring to a scene in the movie "The Matrix" where a girl bends a spoon with the power of her mind alone, I imagine Mister T who changes a spoon into something else (maybe the waiter forgot to bring knives or forks). Note

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: I just see this one as a pictograph of a person changing position and sitting down.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T reaches into his wallet for some spare change but it has all changed into spoons.

hints.author: Valkyrie
hints.mnemonic: MR. T can change a SPOON into a spork using only his teeth.

hints.author: partyrash
hints.mnemonic: You'd be a changed man if Chuck Norris spooned you!

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The flowers change with the seasons.

hints.mnemonic: "Hana" turned me down so I gave her a flower to change her mind.

You put in some change and it starts up...goes for a few minutes, then starts to slow down. You look at the slot..there's actually a slot for spare change and one for regular shells. Your call, but it seems to prefer spare change over shells.

"Now describe what this person Marsellus Wallace looks like!" "W-w-w-what?" "Say 'what' again! SAY 'WHAT' AGAIN! I dare you! I double-dare you, motherfucker! Say 'what' one more god-damn time!".

hints.author: Delina
hints.mnemonic: Be careful if you're using alternate primitives for this kanji! There are only three strokes, and the stroke order is similar to bound up with an extra 'leg' like the last stroke of person. Using recline and person would give you four strokes. Using drop and enter would give the wrong stroke order and the wrong shape in handwritten kanji, even though they all look kind of the same in print. See http

hints.author: miyadamuraman
hints.mnemonic: This is a very easy kanji. A PERSON who is PENT IN is obviously captured. DO NOT USE MR. T! Why people are using this as a primitive element is beyond me. MR. T is the variant of person when it appears on the left side of a kanji. Do not confuse your PERSON and MR. T or you'll never know which one to use when you have a MR. T story. Keep each version of a primitive distinct in your naming. (Think of the difference between using "heart" and "valentine").
