hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: You're short of paper, so you try printing on a towel. Your unhappy printer shows you a red flag but when you show it your sword it becomes very obedient and starts printing. Awful quality, but the printer did what it could...

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Modern laser printers can print on flags and towels with saber-like precision.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Before the invention of the printing press, there were many failures, such as the peeing press. Yep, having people pee onto towels that had letters cut into them with sabers just didn't work very well.. (note

hints.author: jwy2k2
hints.mnemonic: Slang for blowjob and that's priceless for stories...but also the character looks like the letter R which I think of as standing for RULER (12 inches) other meanings include

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: Since this is SLANG for BLOW JOB and since it looks like an "R", let's have the primitive be the R in BROW JOB.

hints.author: brianobush
hints.mnemonic: R-rated term for blowjob.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: For the primitive meaning let the shakuhachi flute be the magic flute of yore. (Apparantly for a woman 'to play the shakuhachi' is a euphamism for oral sex, if this helps with the character).

hints.author: cornrow
hints.mnemonic: Slang for blowjob... looks like a person with a giant mouth.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: A women is so exhausted by her "shakuhachi" that she needs to ice her jaw.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Exhaust here is like car exhaust or using up something such as exhausting your supplies. So picture a SHAKU-HACHI flute being played in ICE cold temperatures. You'll see the EXHAUST from your breath as it leaves the SHAKU-HACHI flute.

hints.author: jwy2k2
hints.mnemonic: That's not ice...it's my last drops and I'm exhausted! ;).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This old Japanese man totally exhausted himself giving a winter-time performance of shakuhachi. That winter was so cold, the shakuhachi was getting clogged with ice as the man was playing. Mnemonic

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: You can imagine how exhausting it would be to play a shakuhachi filled with ice. It would exhaust your supply of breath (and probably patience).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: You're hiding from the enemy underwater in a swamp. To breathe, you have your shakuhachi flute poking up through the surface of the water.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Sirens in the swamp play eerie music on their shakuhachi flutes to lure you in - you follow the enchanting music then its too late as you get trapped in the swamp!

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: "Eww.. It feels and tastes like a swamp!!", my girlfriend said, after she received my 尺 shakuhachi 'water'. // タク ze2 택 (taeg) 석 (seog).

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Different from marsh (#137 沼) in that swamp has trees. The trees are represented by shakuhachi flutes here, mystically calling the water in like Pied Piper did to rats.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: My girlfriend doesn't want to give me shakuhachi in the swamp. She doesn't want to get swamp water all over her.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: You cannot pretend to translate into words the melody of the shakuhachi!

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: You all know that 'shakuhachi' is a slang word for blowjob, right? In this kanji you got a job as a TRANSLATOR for Japanese porno movies. So you sit there all day translating dirty WORDS and watching girls perform SHAKUHACHI. This is the life!

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: Imagine some weird guy who only communicates via shakuhachi, so he always brings along a translator to translate his shakuhachi sounds into words. "Excuse me, do you know where the library is?" "♫♪♫♫♪♫♪." "It's just down the street on the left.".

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: A true story I always think of

hints.author: j0k0m0
hints.mnemonic: Words R us- translating company.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Hand job or "shakuhachi", choose.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Depending on where you choose to put your fingers, the shakuhachi will produce a different note.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: In the Matrix Reloaded, Neo must choose a door. The Architect tells him

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Lisa is playing a shakuhachi. Ralph points at her saying "I choo-choo-choose you!" and accidentally gets his finger stuck in one of its holes.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: The fingers on the Shakuhachi "choose" the notes.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Roosters in Japan are very civilised, they play the shakuhachi at nightbreak to signify the beginning of daytime.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: In a Zelda game, you can warp to the daytime if you play your shakuhachi to bring about nightbreak... or your ocarina if you don't have a shakuhachi.

hints.author: GoodSirJava
hints.mnemonic: A daytime blowjob? Can't you at least wait until nightbreak?

hints.author: AndamanIslander
hints.mnemonic: Fun fantasy

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: I wish I could get a shakuhachi all during the daytime right up until nightbreak.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Traditional Japanese storefront doors have several flags, known as "noren," hanging down from a curtain rod in front of them. I see this as a pseudo-pictograph, and use the horizontal line across the top to represent the curtain rod, since noren don't usually hang from the ceiling.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A Japanese door has a noren, a flag hanging from a rod. (I give this primitive the meaning of a noren-covered door).

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: Their is only ONE FLAG on DOORs in Japan. The Japanese FLAG of course!

hints.author: b0ng0
hints.mnemonic: If you are too poor to afford a door, you can just hang a single flag instead.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: I was standing in my bathroom peeing when there was a loud knock on the door. It scared me so badly that I fell backwards and peed on the ceiling. What can I say, I got some strong pee muscles.. (Note

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: The shoulder is the best part of the body to bash a door open with (Don't ever try this. Use your foot).

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The shoulder is part of the body you use to push through the noren in a doorway. I was having trouble with positioning of the primitives until I tweaked shaydwyrm's story slightly. If you think of pushing through a noren, this makes sense as a pictograph. The noren hangs from above, and you push through it from below.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A part of the body I always seem to bump against the door.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: See those pieces of meat, on either sides of the door frame ? They are the shoulders of this body-builder who tried to get through ...

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: My friend decided to act like superman and bust the door down with his shoulder. Needless to say, the end result was him crying and clutching the flesh of his tender shoulder.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: Explanation here

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: A tassel hangs from my door showing the breeze's direction.

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: When you graduate from a school, after they gave you your tassel, they shove you to the door and give you a compass saying "Sayonara & Good Luck out there!" (ボウ).

hints.author: inaka_rob
hints.mnemonic: When you walk in the DOOR to the sumo stadium you will see the 4 TASSELS pointing in 4 DIRECTIONS These TASSELS are always placed in the same order

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: At graduation, you are about to enter a new door to your future. to signify that, the speaker guy askes the graduates to move the tassel on their hands to the other direction.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: It's insanely hot today! I'm standing in the doorway, fanning myself with feathers.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: Home Alone, when the bad guy opens the door, it triggers the fan to blow feathers into his face.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: I am a fan of The Doors but I also like the Wings. I have a fan that I take to rock concerts with the picture of the bands on each side.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: The Geisha met her customer beneath the doorway with a fan of feathers.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Bird flies through door, hits the fan, feathers.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This hearth is equipped with a fire-proof door. On the kanji you can see somewhat pictographically the fire-proof door keeping the fire behind, and nothing comes under the door primitive, where you would have expected to see another primitive.

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: -"Honey? Do we have any wood left for the hearth?" -"Aagh, just use the frickin' door!".

hints.author: Verdana
hints.mnemonic: Hearth is a fireplace, meaning a fire-door in the wall.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: This hearth is Calcifer, from Howl's Moving Castle. He's a pain, so you bolt the door when you leave, so that he can't follow you out.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: This is a reminder that when the fire is going in the hearth, keep the door closed so we're not heating up the whole outdoors.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: The St. Bernard dog whining at the door of his master’s house in order to re-enter / re-turn inside.

hints.author: thermal
hints.mnemonic: This is common with cats, but also happens with dogs. They go out the door. 5 minutes later they change their minds and come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. They re-come back in. They re-go out the door. AAAAAARRRRRGGGHHHH!!!

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: Think about hachiko, the dog waiting at the door of the station, waiting for his master to re-turn.

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: This story can help you remember this Kanji as well as the next frame tears (#1082 涙). When the lost dog re-turned to his master's doorstep, the two re-joiced at their happy re-union.

hints.author: unauthorized
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: I see the story of Hachiko

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tears are watery (water + re).

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: When my dog (who was about as big as a St. Bernard) got quite old, he had to be put down. The last thing that I saw was him lying on the table staring at me before the vet shut the door. The way he looked at me, I swear he knew that his time was over. Dogs don't shed tears but if he could have I think he would have at that time.

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: The master shed tears of joy when his lost dog returned to his doorstep. (See re- (#1081 戻)).

hints.author: kalin
hints.mnemonic: Futurama

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Our company has no standards. We'll employ any turkey who walks in the door.

hints.author: kazelee
hints.mnemonic: Comedy. An executive is having an argument with a cocky, but skilled, employee

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: "Sorry," says a store manager, "We don't employ Turkeys here." He then points to the door. The disappointed turkey hangs his head low and walks out.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: It is the last straw...we shall employ the ultimate weapon! Open the hangar doors and unleash the turkeys!

hints.author: tritonxg
hints.mnemonic: [FR]employer N2 KO yato(u) k&k1553 porte+dinde employée secretasse

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: I was EMPLOYED to give HEAD...when I look back, maybe that was not a wise career move.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: The people we employ are always turning their heads to look back. They don't want to be caught playing solitare on company time.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: It's sad to see the turkeys look back one last time before entering the door of the slaughterhouse and losing their heads.

hints.author: myglagata
hints.mnemonic: Think "Spirited Away". Chihiro is told not to LOOK BACK at the magical bathhouse, else she will revert to the EMPLOY of the witch with an enormous HEAD.

hints.author: Lutzos
hints.mnemonic: Looking back, employing that turkey was our smartest move in ages. It became head of the company in no time!

hints.author: bluestocking
hints.mnemonic: Behind closed DOORS, the TASKMASTER tortures to get prisoners to open their MOUTHS and DISCLOSE information.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: You signed a non-disclosure agreement with the taskmaster but you opened your mouth as soon as you got out the door!

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: It's best not to disclose what you were forced to do with your mouth behind closed doors for your taskmaster.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: Before they go out of the door, the taskmaster makes everyone sign non-disclosure forms to keep on top of the possibility that they might open their mouths.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A closed door refuses to disclose (dis-close) whatever is happening behind, so someone asked the taskmistress to whip the door, and force it to reveal/disclose what is going on behind. The door gives up (who can resist the taskmistress, hehe) and discloses the information by way of a mouth that appears, just like that (even in imaginary world, doors need a mouth to talk).

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: A boy made an altar, but he's afraid to show it to God because he thinks it's two little.

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: "I'll SHOW you mine if you show me yours!", she said. I did & she scoffed because it was TWO LITTLE.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I give this form a primitive of EVIL ALTAR. Imagine a black stone altar used for satanic rituals. I give the left radical form a primitive of CHURCH ALTAR. Imagine a beautiful cathedral altar.

hints.author: Hyreia
hints.mnemonic: Unrelated

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: A picture of an altar. Two small things are placed on it to show them off (I imagine two watches covered in diamonds).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: "Indy, my friend, you must be very careful! If you approach the altar and do not give the proper salutation a large fishhook will rip you away".

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: You should fish hook (bend/bow) your body before an altar as a form of salutation to God/gods.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: SALUTATION (a hand salute in this case) was given to the ALTAR by a veteran with a HOOK for his hand. Just keep that mental picture and you own this kanji.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: This cult has a really dumb salutation. They form sort of a 'fishhook' on their foreheads with their thumb and index finger. They do it whenever they come near the altar. They say it's 'L' for 'Luck', I say it's 'L' for 'Losers'.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Salute the church altar with a bow (bend yourself like a fishhook).

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Bringing a sheep to sacrifice on the altar was a sign of an auspicious life. The poor could only afford a pigeon, the more auspicious an expensive sheep for an offering.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: On this ewe-spicious occasion, you sacrifice a sheep at the altar. —— Sorry, but I really need more than generic altar sacrifices to connect keywords to stories. Sometimes an egregious pun is the only way.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Once a year, the people pray for a sign from the gods. If the gods are pleased, they send down a sheep to the altar. The people see this as an auspicious gift; the wool and milk from this sheep is considered holy. But the gods think of it as a witty joke, since it's just a metaphor for the people following ancient rituals like blind sheep. Continued in calamity (#1291 禍).

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: It's an auspicious sign when you go to the altar and the sheep is already beside it, ready to go.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: Auspicious (adj)

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: When Japanese people turn 20 they usually visit the altar at their local shrine and celebrate no longer being a teenager.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: It's a Bar Mitzvah. At the altar, the teenager is singing in his awful, mid-puberty voice. We'll all celebrate when that part is over!

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Teenagers celebrating at the church altar. (Maybe they just finished RTK).

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: This teenager is at the altar, about to celebrate the sacrament of Confirmation.

hints.author: sir_sanuk
hints.mnemonic: Coming of Age Day ( 成人の日 , seijin no hi) is a Japanese holiday held annually on the second Monday of January to celebrate those who have turned 20 years old. In this kanji we see someone going to the altar to celebrate no longer being a teenager.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This recalls the selling of indulgences in the history of the Church (As an aside, Protestantism began as a protest of this practice). Basically, one gave wealth to the altar (i.e. priest) and received a blessing. If you prefer a Jewish version, think of the donation (wealth) that is expected when you're called to the ark (altar in the kanji) to give a blessing over the torah.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Put all your wealth on the church altar and receive one blessing. (You stand up out of your wheelchair or something.).

hints.author: akaiYaMa
hints.mnemonic: Wow, this is Scientology put into a kanji. In the Scientology faith the wealthiest members have the highest status in the Church. So basically, the wealthiest person that puts the most money on the alter receives the most blessings....(not really, from what I've heard, the more money you give the better parking spot you get....).

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: When you pray at the altar be sure to count your wealth  as a blessing.

hints.author: kadano
hints.mnemonic: This illustrates the idea of tithing... thankful for God's blessings, you give back a tenth of the wealth He has given you at the altar.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: And in front of every altar, she stopped to pray for the welfare of the others.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Religious Republicans regularly go to the altar to pray for a stop to welfare.

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: I pray at the altar everyday that they don't stop my welfare checks. (A quick mnemonic is better for this one).

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Marxist belief

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: I remember this one with a political idea ... don't read if you're easily offended. Ironically, many of the people on Welfare in the USA are the super-religious type (the sort that regularly visit their respective altars) in the American South, and tend to all have that infamous "Footprints" poem (where God carries you across the beach) hanging in their living rooms. These people tend to vote conservatively (politicians that oppose federal welfare), and thus ... against their own best interests.

hints.author: mfistik
hints.mnemonic: When you enter a Japanese company it's like you join a cult... your workdesk becomes your altar and you worship the very soil the office is built on.

hints.author: Delina
hints.mnemonic: Some Japanese companies, including Toyota, have a Shinto shrine on their grounds to bring luck and prosperity to the company and its employees.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: If a company is built on land near the altar, it is believed that it will become successful.

hints.author: endote
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese treat their company like a shrine and the company treat them like dirt.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: An altar was bulldozed and filled with soil as the foundation for a new company building.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: The beaurocracy in Japan is such that even altars need to be inspection approved. A little man with glasses comes once a year to give the altar a "visual once over" as he calls it (perhaps checking for unauthorised symbology?).

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [inspection; regard as; see; look at] Inspection

hints.author: phauna
hints.mnemonic: (Thanks to Ricardo) There's an inspection in the church. You show the altar, and the inspector sees if it's okay or not.

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: At the altar, god looks at you, in an inspection of your soul.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: The stone cutter inspects the altars with his keen eyesight for details. The surface must be smooth as ice, not a blemish must be seen. Very well, let me see the next stone altar.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: It's beautiful place, but the dark side of Nara is that they sacrifice St. Bernards on evil altars every night after the tourists leave!

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: Nara is just a big show for tourists.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: There is a BIG ALTAR in NARA. (really!

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Nara is famous for its deers running freely everywhere. To avoid any accidents, Shepperd dogs are put on to the temple's altars to stop the deer from entering the temples.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: Toudaiji Temple in Nara is one heck of a big altar.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Of course it had to be the military officer's idea to glue a national flag to the altar he's stationed at.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Perhaps you have heard about Koizumis controversial visits at the Yasukuni war memorial shrine. It is the japanese flag waving above a small stone altar. A military officer keeps watch here night and day, to honor the dead war heroes, as if he is glued to the ground.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Only way I remember this is think of a MILITARY OFFICER standing next to a FLAG draped ALTAR (well, the coffin is by the altar) as if GLUED to it. Might hurt if you think that GLUED primitive looks like the MILITARY OFFICER is saluting the FLAG draped ALTAR, with a slight tear coming from the eye.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Military officers glue their flags to the altars of the countries they've conquered.

hints.author: KristinHolly
hints.mnemonic: The military officer is even patriotic when he watches tv. Whenever there's a flag on the show, he's just glued to the set.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A military officer must offer consolation to the hearts of the families of his fallen men.

hints.author: RobMow
hints.mnemonic: This Kanji appears in the word 慰安婦 いあんふ, which was what the infamous WW II "comfort women" were called in Japanese. The story goes something like this

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: The MILITARY OFFICER is given a Purple HEART by the army as consolation for the wounds he received in the line of duty.

hints.author: hunchbag
hints.mnemonic: The military officer consoles the parents

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: "My time in the army was complete misery." - "Well if it's any consolation that bastard military officer had a heart attack.".

hints.author: ovioprime
hints.mnemonic: Samuari, altar, yawn The samurai is on the altar, preaching about goodwill. The audience just yawns however, they want to see the man fight!

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: A samurai's show of goodwill is never lacking.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: For better remembering the placement of the eleements

hints.author: subhuman
hints.mnemonic: Goodwill is something that samurais show and other warriors just lack.

hints.author: Deborah
hints.mnemonic: Goodwill Hunting, the Japanese version. Will is played by Toshio Mifune, a former SAMURAI who dreams of attending MIT. However he LACKS confidence and instead works polishing ALTARS at a nearby temple.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Similar to radical tyro's story. If you live in Japan, your main exposure to this kanji is probably "no smoking" signs. So I imagine the government enacting a prohibition of tobacco, and burning whole groves of tobacco plants on an altar (the altar of public health, or self-righteousness, if you will).

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Hidden in a grove was a church with a secret altar that was stocked full of prohibited alcohol during the American prohibition period of 1920-1933. A local registered himself as a mininster of this altar so he could stock prohibited alcohol "for sacremental purposes" and share it with his kin (きん).

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: Placing trees on this alter is prohibited.

hints.author: Antunes
hints.mnemonic: When Chirstianity was prohibited and the christians were being chased in Japan they had to hide their altars under the groves.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: During prohibition, people drank hidden in groves so that they wouldn't be shown drinking in public.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: A collar is the part of your cloak that, if tightened too tight, will prohibit breathing.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Collars are prohibited from wizarding cloaks. Blood purists say they're too muggle.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: Dress code

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: In some future anti-Catholic dystopia, a prohibition against collars has been enacted, so Catholic priests often conceal them (or cloak them) underneath their cloaks. Imagine a cloaked Catholic priest walking down the street when he sees a police officer approaching him, and the priest nervously tightens his cloak to ensure his collar isn't seen.

hints.author: nebusoku
hints.mnemonic: Popping the collar on any cloak is strictly prohibited because doing so will make you look like an enormous douchebag. Fun fact

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: I never really did figure out what religion my host family was - all I knew was that they kept an altar in their home.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: All the RELIGIONS have their own temples, which are houses where they place their altars.

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: You can discover a japanese family religion by observing their house altar.

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: We have an altar in our HOUSE to SHOW our religion.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: A house with an altar? Perhaps they practice a religion.

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: In ancient Greece, it was the religion of the time to adore the gods who live on Mount Olympus.

hints.author: Shizuru
hints.mnemonic: I would adore the religious people if they just went and threw themselves off a mountain top.

hints.author: Hawkeye123
hints.mnemonic: Several kanji become their 'greater' version when you add 山 on top ( 風 becomes 嵐 , 石 becomes 岩 ). Thus, religion becomes adoration.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: The annoying woman from Los Angeles says "oh I absolutely adore those cute little mountain religions, like tibetan buddhism, they shave their cute little heads and wear those bright pretty robes, so adorable.".

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: I adore mountains over religion.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: A ritual such as a circumcision

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: There are many famous penis matsuris(festivals) in Japan. The rituals of these festivals involve placing the flesh of the crotch on an altar.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: まつり（ 祭り ）Ritual nude dances (nothing but flesh) involving lots of pelvic thrusts before the altars of ancient Japan. Now they're nothing but festivals, but back in the day they were rituals. Most Japanese festivals have a circle dance, just imagine all the old people doing the except same dance but in the buff, wrinkly flesh flapping in the wind and all. Remembered. Unfortunately, perhaps forever.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is used for festivals. [Flesh from one leg ... show] I think of those sexy high slit skirts, the ones that let you see the leg of its wearer.

hints.author: narafan
hints.mnemonic: The top part of this kanji I memorize as circumcision. - - - - - - - -- - - - - - - - - - In an ancient ritual, people are shown how to circumsize their newborns.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: I have an informed guess about whose house the dark rituals are performet at.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Police ( 警察 ）drive around a street at night trying to guess whose house is having a matsuri indoors after complaints from the neighbours.

hints.author: MethodGT
hints.mnemonic: For our child's circumcision (the ritual) we invited a rabbi to our house. We didn't know it at the time, but he was blind, and he had to guess which little squishy thing was the baby's penis.

hints.author: pandawhipped
hints.mnemonic: The POLICE had enough evidence, so they were able to make an informed GUESS as to which HOUSE the dark RITUALS were being performed in.

hints.author: Alunalun
hints.mnemonic: In our house we have a ritual. When something happens someone says "Guess what happened." We ask for some sort of vague hint, but get "no, go on, guess!" Asking what sort of thing it's about, news, music, catastrophe, just gets "no, you have to guess". It takes quite a long time to find out what's happened. It's a very annoying ritual.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: If you mis-guess the cheese you'll grate your fingers on the cheese-grater (happens to me all the time).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Ouch! Guess how many fingers I just grated in the grater? (Edit

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When you grate something you have to guess where your fingers are so you don't hurt yourself.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: It was a cruel form of torture. He would grate cheese and by the smell make me guess what sort of cheese it was. If my guess was wrong, he would grate one of my fingers. Which is how I know how pretty much every cheese smells now, although I don't have many working fingers left.

hints.author: n1williams
hints.mnemonic: The meaning of this kanji is more like "rub, scour, scratch, or scrape." Story

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: "Wherefore art thou, Sprouteo?" (Juliet has fallen in love with a brussel sprout) (OR

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: "Cogito ergo sum." Wherefore is a bad choice here for two reasons. For one, it's often mistranslated as "where" when in fact it's an urge to know a cause or reason; and two, because this kanji represents the reason, not the urge. [A thought sprouts from my brain. I think, therefore I am.].

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Errata

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: "Wherefore art thou Romeo?" says Juliet on her balcony as she plucks brussel sprouts instead of rose petals. (This takes on the primitive of the much more memorable BRUSSEL SPROUT).

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Wherefore art thou, Romeo. He's in the rice field. You can see his hair sticking up above the rice. New Primitive

hints.author: Thora

hints.mnemonic: I tried to deliver a clear message to my girlfriend that said "I don't like brussel sprouts" by peeing on the bowl of them that she'd just made. (Note

hints.author: tummai
hints.mnemonic: Bamboo shoots... make good flutes.

hints.author: Immacolata

hints.author: smithsonian

hints.author: samuize

Then I realised it looks in fact like the belly of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, which I somehow associated with the samurai armor because of the "turtle samurai" that appeared earlier. Fits me. The bit that pokes down is to protect the genitals, I guess.

The big green machine is extremely hot from the desert sun as well as the heat its engine has created. With that picture in mind, this Kanji depicts what happens next when the soldiers get around the back of the tank and have to push it with their fingers because the surface is too hot for them to put their hands on.

You push it, and the front wall of the shell pushes out violently. You've learned a new attack - this isn't just a defense tool anymore, you can now run around and push people around for no reason! Cool!

hints.mnemonic: A headland is a mountain that is firmly rooted despite being surrounded on 3 sides by water. (Just like your head is a mountain surrounded by air on 3 sides, a headland!).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A mountain that has been pushed into the sea.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: The headland is mountainous terrain that provides a natural fortification (or armour) against sea-borne invasion. 岬 (みさき)

hints.mnemonic: Forget confusing the meanings (headland, promontory (#778 崎), cape (#153 埼)) they are synonyms, no way around that. Luckily, all three seem to be used in names most. I used

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: Words signify the written words in a book. The fruit represents something whole, complete. A chapter in a book often offers a complete idea, setting, or account. It's good to disambiguate the keyword from paragraph (#82 項). To reinforce the kanji, imagine eating a fruit at the end of each chapter of Tolstoy's "War and Peace" to reward yourself. (If you ate a fruit at the end of each paragraph, you'd very quickly run out of fruit).

hints.mnemonic: The words of each chapter bear a different fruit.

hints.mnemonic: An absurd image, but working for me

hints.mnemonic: Sadako Sasaki vowed to fold 1000 paper cranes and kept her word. (http

This was next to pointless, however, as the old broads easily got around it by being so skilled at folding their words that while they never TECHNICALLY lied ... the absolute truth that they spoke was still highly deceptive.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: After cutting himself badly, Socrates vowed never to fold origami again.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I wanted a convertible so I chopped off the top of my car with an axe.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: A "chop shop" is a place where stolen cars are taken, and parts chopped off with an axe, to be sold.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Picture a death-mobile car with rotating axes on the hood that drives by and chops off people's heads. [beheading is another common meaning].

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Seen before in "Steadily" and "Temporarily". Both stories talked about taking an AXE to a CAR. Here, either take the horror movie approach where a driver in a CAR had his head CHOPPED OFF by a maniac with an AXE, or take the CHOP OFF shop approach where a guy is cutting up a CAR with an AXE.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: In movies cars often have their tops chopped off as if with an axe.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Your car has been savagely (see steadily) attacked by an ax. It will be some days before your car is fixed. So you are temporarily without car.

hints.author: jotun
hints.mnemonic: Today is Car Axe Day. The day where you can temporarily (today only) attack cars using an axe without punishment.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: The top kanji is chop off (#2092 斬).

hints.author: tenken3
hints.mnemonic: Axe murderer hiding in a car temporarily for a few days after killing someone.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: [chop off (#2092 斬) ... day] During daylight saving time, we temporarily chop off the day by taking an hour out of it, which we will return back in six months.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: I imagine firemen working steadily to rescue a man from a crashed car. First, they spray it with water; then, they use an axe to break through the window.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Water + Car + Axe

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: Dripping water on your car steadily builds up rust. Over time, it's just as damaging as taking an ax to it.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Driving steadily down the road in the wet in a chop off (#2092 斬) convertible. Singing in the rain.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: The attempt to fix the car's radiator with an axe did not go well. There was a steady drip drip drip of water.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: [Based on fuaburisu's] A man puts some rice on a fishhook as bait, but catches a fish so strong, he needs to take out his axe and sever the line lest he be dragged into the depths.

hints.author: marydj
hints.mnemonic: When you get the ax at work, use your severance pay to buy fishhooks and rice. At least that way you can eat sushi.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The axe man is fishing at a nearby river, using a rice-ball on a hook as bait. He catches some real big fish, which is pulling so hard on the line that axe man has to sever the line or let go of his pricey fishing rod. And at the same time there is the idea of severance in axe man having to let go of his big catch.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Your manager brings you into his office and offers you three severance packages. You can take the hook (become a fisherman), take the rice (become a farmer), or take the axe (become a lumberjack). Picture the items laid out on his desk like the shopkeepers in Zelda.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: After he got hooked on rice wine the Japanese salaryman got the axe at work. Now all he has to live on is serverance pay.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: What is this substance on this clam? I've already broken 2 axes on it! (Good question... 質問 ).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Another keyword that I do not like by Heisig. 質 【しつ】 (n,n-suf) quality. Story

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: [seems to mean "substance" in the sense of essential nature or core quality, most common usage might be 質問 , shitsumon (inquiry)] a pair of scientists are smashing away at a mysterious shell with axes, pounding it into powder so they can feed it into their analysis machine and discover exactly what substance it's made up of.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This guy dealing in illegal substances makes a lot of shells (money), but he's always equipped with his dual-axe ... it's a dangerous job.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The newest illegal substance on the streets is Shellinium. It's made of shells hacked to bits with axes. Imagine going to your local dealer to get it - you've got to get past a huge shell mafia goon who is holding two axes...

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The kids at school used to reject me.. Made me feel really bad till I brought my axe to school. See the drop of blood on it?

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: The quality expectations are very high in our axe manufacturing facility. If there's one drop of rust on any axe, it gets rejected.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: Gimli REJECTS an AX because it has a DROP of blood on it. Obviously the "soul" of the ax is not pure so he must REJECT IT.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This axe is a reject from the axe factory

hints.author: nadiatims
hints.mnemonic: My pawn shop rejects any axe with even a drop of blood.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: I strongly reject the accusation implicit in your words.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Words that make you feel rejected.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: After murdering those who rejected me with my blood-stained axe, I received a letter containing words of accusation from their families and the police.

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Words of accusation are usually rejected, rarely accepted.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A mnemonic to put in image

hints.author: kyldyyr
hints.mnemonic: One can use a simple word play to remember this character - the day that I saw before today was yesterday.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Yester-DAY, all my troubles seemed SAW far away...

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: Today I see. Yesterday I saw.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: My coworker has an excessive way of updating his daily calendar. Instead of throwing yesterday's page into the trash, he'll pulverize it with a chainsaw he keeps under his desk.

hints.author: Apple_Head
hints.mnemonic: Yesterday

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: Pinnochio gets frustrated that every time he utters a word of a lie, his nose grows and he has to get the saw out again.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Her lies are words that cut not like a knife, no not cleanly, but savagely like a saw.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: This really has the connotation of fraud rather than lie but the Pinnochio story works too well.

hints.author: nicjsb
hints.mnemonic: His words were false; I saw right through his lie.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr T.'s favorite magazine is Make. He loves to make things. But he's a purist

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When the A-Team crash lands on a deserted island, Mr. T salvages a saw from the wreckage and says, "I don't know about y'all foos, but I'm gonna make a raft.".

hints.author: thelooseteeth
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T can make anything with his trusty saw.

hints.author: etpan
hints.mnemonic: Chuck Norris can make a saw just by biting into a piece of iron !

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Police ask a witness about what they saw and the person makes up a story instead of telling the truth.

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: SNOW isn't all that different from RAIN, except it can be removed with a BROOM because it only forms in freezing temperatures.

hints.author: nesert
hints.mnemonic: Unlike rain, snow can be swept away with a broom.

hints.author: gibler
hints.mnemonic: PRIMITIVE

hints.author: netsplitter
hints.mnemonic: It's going to rain tomorrow with a 3% chance of snow!

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: When it snows, you need a broom to clear your porch.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: A monk won a gold metal for breaking the current record for most swept rice in one minute.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This character is about a recording for a music box. The tines of the mechanism are like a metal broom and the little pins on the cylinder are like metal grains of rice.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Historians have discovered an ancient record about Buddhist monastic life recorded in gold plates. Sadly, the only thing the monks did was use their brooms to sweep up rice.

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: For the combination of broom+rice I'll use Curling http

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: The right part should be a new primitive since it will appear several times (see green (#1371 緑), peel off (#2145 剥) and salarium (#2602 禄)) and can easily confused with similar stroke combinations. I suggest videotape, deduced from its Chinese meaning (thx shinclef).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Peel off the outside of the broom that sweeps up rice grains to reveal a saber.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: A multi-purpose broom! It cleans, it sweeps (rice!), it hits! In fact, peel off the mahogany exterior to uncover a sabre! It slices, it dices, it kills!

hints.author: shinyclef
hints.mnemonic: This may be of interest to some. [录 [lù] verb - record; write down; copy; videotape] (http

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Horror movie (on a videotape, see my comment for record (#1144 録), thx shinycled)

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: For those of you using the "curling" primitive (broom plus grainy (r)ice - see record (#1144 録) for more info)

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The policed inquired into the erotica scandal. They tried to sweep away the evidence, but some of it stuck. (Note

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: As a verb this means, this means "to ask; to enquire; to search; to look for; to look into; to investigate;". Imagine the police inquiring in an in-depth investigation. They are interrogating a suspect. But the suspect has a crafty mouth and is very sly. He/she also knows when to keep their mouth shut(glued) at the right moments to avoid self-incrimination. As a final measure, the police torture the suspect by tickling him/her with a broom while they inquire.

hints.author: netsplitter
hints.mnemonic: You are new in Japan and you inquire about a new job. Lucky for you, there is one. You're now the guy with the broom who sweeps the エロ (ero) "studio" after they're done. "Eww, what's this gluing the broom to the ground...". Time to inquire about a new job

hints.author: melchan
hints.mnemonic: The cleaning lady found some エロ ero pictures glued together while sweeping the floor and started to inquire everyone around about it.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: I tried to inquire about broom craft but every one's mouth was glued under an inquire spell.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: She was always bound to a broom, her heart pounding in a hurry to finish before she was punished for being slow.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: In a hurry to tidy up before guests arrive, you're feverishly sweeping with a bunch of brooms bound together, your heart pounding.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Fantasia

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: Cinderella was always bound to a broom, her heart pounding in a hurry to finish before she was punished for being slow.

hints.author: yo6shi9
hints.mnemonic: Hurry potter (terribly sorry for the pun...) here we see him flying by in a hurry, bound to his broom not to fall, in a heart pounding race to get the Quidditch World Cup RTK2

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: This whole kanji is a picture of calmness. The wheat has been harvested and even the vultures sit calmly watching the humans sweep and clean-up after the harvest is over. Hearts are peaceful and calm at this time of the year. Even the days are calm without storm.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: The farmer is calm knowing that his wheat fields are protected from vultures by his strawman with a heart (all the better to do the job properly).

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: A Calm day

hints.author: kusterdu
hints.mnemonic: The farmer lying in the middle of the wheat field is so calm the vultures think he is dead and keep trying to get at his heart. He just lightly brushes them away with a broom, barely noticing their presence.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Creepy but calm bucolic scene

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: The parson ENCROACHES on the French maid; driven wild by her little broom, dainty tiara and sinfully short skirt showing her knickers (crotch)!

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Mr T. hits a condom salesman (broom + crown + crotch) over the head with a broom because the dude ENCROACHed Mr. T's privates area during the sale.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: "I pity da fool who encroaches on me". Mr T. is dressed as a French maid (= broom + crown + crotch), working undercover at a hotel that has a problem with guests misbehaving towards female staff.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Right side is similar to accept (#735 受), except that instead of birdhouse here we have a broomhouse. I assign broomhouse meaning to whole primitive. -- Mr. T locks in a broomhouse anyone who encroaches upon his position of leadership.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Here we see the sex starved Marine SENTRY about to ENCROACH upon the French MAID (broom, crown, and a nice crotch?). Makes for an easy mental picture.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The French maid draws a bath for her amorous master, but slips and falls in - getting immersed. (thanks to Nukemarine for the French maid image!).

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: ***YOU MUST BE 18 YEARS AND OVER TO SEE THIS *** You load SEXY.FRENCH.MAIDS.XViD.avi and you see a French maid, immersed in sperm. Shit close the porno someone is coming!!

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: After being hit in the head with the broom, the condom salesman IMMERSED his head in some water.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: French maid at the hotel is demonstrating how to use the bath

hints.author: findus
hints.mnemonic: Often in a broomhouse you also have water so that your broom can be immersed before the cleaning.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: After work, the French maid goes home and lies down with a turtle. Turtle? Well, he's sloooow and always hard... (thanks to Nukemarine and Wakela!).

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: After being hit on the head encroach (#1148 侵), the condom salesman goes back to his house to lie down. He hasn't made a single sale today, so he doesn't have enough money to buy a pillow. He lies down on his pet turtle and cries himself to sleep.

hints.author: Koos83
hints.mnemonic: The French maid I hired cleans my house as slowly as a turtle, but I keep her on, because I love to 'lie down' with her...

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: While the maid in our house was lying down, I touched her crotch, but there was half a turtle shell covering it. Nice foresight girl!

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: For this kanji, LIE DOWN in your HOUSE and imagine a MAID (broom, crown and crotch should make an easy picture). In her HOUSE, she gets lax and LIE DOWN, with her feet propped on a TURTLE table. Maid works great in the previous two kanji's, did it not?

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: In high society, a lady is a woman who never touches a broom or an apron.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The LADY of the house is nothing more than a WOMAN who's a HOUSEWIFE (BROOM and APRON anyone?).

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Im a laaaaidy! (little britain) - heres the old fashioned woman with her apron on beating a man up with a broom because he made an ungentleman like advancement on her.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: The French maid is the ideal lady -- here's a woman that comes to your house dressed in an apron and carrying a broom. To enforce the position of the primitives, make this a particularly kinky maid that is wearing just the apron below her waist, and using the broom to cover her breasts.

hints.author: KeroHazel
hints.mnemonic: The French maid modestly covers her crotch with a towel when she enters the womens' bath. As dirty as she may be in her private life, in public she is a perfect lady.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: Whether I SWEEP something away with my FINGERS or my BROOM, I should always wear my APRON.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: FINGERS of the HOUSEWIFE (in itself, holding a BROOM, with an APRON) busily SWEEP the floor.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: Sweep - Learn to sweep properly! Grip the broom with your fingers and be sure to wear your apron.

hints.author: vitor569
hints.mnemonic: While she was sweeping the floor I took down her apron and fingered her.

hints.author: walexander5
hints.mnemonic: Our lady (#1151 婦) is now afraid she'll break a nail on one of her fingers since had never had to sweep with a broom in her life. It's not easy trading in your crown for an apron.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Some mothers use a small broom to hit their children when they misbehave.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [hit; right; appropriate; himself] If you're old enough, this is a pictograph of an Atari joystick (which, BTW, got its name from this word/kanji). You can also think of how an Atari joystick is like a small broom with which you can hit and sweep off the enemies from the screen...

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Here is a weird carnival game where you hold a broom like a javelin and throw it, trying to hit the center of a very small target. The target is so small, in fact, that if someone does manage to hit it, the operator turns in surprise and says, "Whoa, really?! ( 本当 ?!)".

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Hit the Atari ( 当たり ) joystick; it's a small hand-held broom- like device which you can use to hit and sweep off the enemies with. Tootal (とう) destruction! (Readings

hints.author: sabretou
hints.mnemonic: RPG

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: I was having mutual difficulties in my relationship. She was always the one wearing the crown and I was the one picking the fruit. In order to fix the problem I checked the glossary for "mutual difficulties" but found nothing. I guess we're going to have to mutually end our relationship.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: When I went to Headless Mutual, the bank for tough London gangsters, I was given a pamphlet that said "If you try'a rip us off, we'll give you the rough end of a pineapple." I didn't quite understand this phrase, but it was important that I knew my legal obligations, so I consulted my Glossary of British Thieves' Argot. The result

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: People who read the glossary are mutually exclusive (exclude the top line of mutually (#757 互) ) from those who eat crowned fruit イ はりねずみ same kind 語彙 .

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: I was reading a recipe book but had trouble figuring out what a "pineapple" was. Thanks to the one-way assisting glossary at the end, I learnt that a pineapple was a crowned fruit.

hints.author: BladeWalker
hints.mnemonic: We had no idea what a crowned fruit was so we mutually checked the glossary. Well, I say mutually, but really I did all the work.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This can be seen as a Retarius, a roman gladiator. The Retiarius always fought with a net to bound up his opponents, and with a trident, which was able to pierce enemies after tying them. They were terrific contenders, so they were only paired with gladiators specially equipped to fight them.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: A boxing ring is bound up by the ropes. The contender is cheating and using a rake.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: In an episode of the Simpsons, Sideshow Bob is trying to kill Bart, but on the way has to contend with a pile of rakes which keep him bound up for some time.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: The peasants revolt

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: One of the contenders in Street Fighter 2 isVega who has rakes bound to his hands.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Bottled water marketers contend to make their version of tap water sound the cleanest.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The water contends against the dirt in the ultimate battle for cleaninless.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Separate the primitives. Cleaning the garden involves watering the lawn and binding up all the leaves with a rake.

hints.author: narazumono
hints.mnemonic: I wanna see a clean fight. Pour water on the contenders to make them clean. (silly I know).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Gladiators (see my story for contend (#1154 争)) often bathed in water or oil before a battle, so that their opponents would have a hard time trying to grab them. As a result, they looked very clean and shiny!

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Just one word about this matter from your mouth and you will find this rake across it.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I had to take one day off from work due to 'personal matters' after stepping on a rake and having the handle snap up and smack me across the mouth. I certainly wasn't going to tell anyone about it.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: This is a pictograph of someone stepping on a rake, and the handle coming up to hit them in the face...no laughing matter.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: This IS a laughing matter

hints.author: Kewickviper
hints.mnemonic: Just one word from your mouth about this matter and I'll stab you with a fucking trident.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Two archeologists are in a cave looking at Chinese artifacts from various eras. One picks up a rake and says, "What about this – T'ang, do you think?" The second puts the rake in his mouth and answers, "Yes, it does tang a bit".

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Screw it, this character refers to the drink. The powdery orange substance is actually found on the floor of tropical caves, where trained aboriginal peoples use wooden rakes to rake the Tang into a pile before putting a bit of it in their mouths to see if it's tasty or not.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: (Based on matticus) The Tang juice was created in China in the T'ANG dinasty. The T'ANG emperor discovered that certain caves walls had a very sweet smell, so he raked the walls of one of them and put the rake into his mouth. This way he discovered that tasty powder that nowadays is known as TANG juice.

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: Archaeologists found an ancient RAKE from the T'ang dynasty at the MOUTH of the CAVE.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: I imagine that people from the T'ang dinasty looked a bit like cartoony asians, with teeth so prominent that looked like rakes on their mouth. They felt ridiculous about that, so they usually hid on caves, wishing for a dinasty with better depictions.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: Sugar made from rice has a tangy flavour.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: The T'ang are the ones who began using sugar in China--of course, the first thing they tried it on was rice.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: The ultimate sugary breakfast is a rice krispy treat and a big glass of Tang.

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: This is what my research yielded on the origin of the kanji

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Condi Rice wakes up every morning and spoons about three cups of sugar into her Tang. Why? Well, she's got to have something to hype her up about facing the American public day after day. Picture her waking up and shaking until she gets her daily sugar ration...then things go overboard and she starts to pipe sugar-loaded Tang straight into her veins..

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: A psychiatric hospital is located in a CAVE. To determine, which patients are sane and can be released, they are given a SIEVE and asked to empty a bathtub (the sane ones take out the plug and get the water out with ease).

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: People on the cave age became more sane after they started using sieves to avoid eating harmful things with their grains. (This kanji is almost exclusively used to write 健康 , health).

hints.author: matt_jenkins
hints.mnemonic: Ever since I meditated in the cave and realised that wearing a sieve on my head would stop the C.I.A controlling my thoughts, I've been completely SANE.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Japanese doctors recommend you retreat to a cave every week to sieve rice through a rake. It will keep you sane, sound, healthy, and wholesome.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: A sane person in a polluted CAVE will use a SIEVE to breath.

hints.author: bokuzukuri
hints.mnemonic: Think police roadblocks. They act like road sieves, letting good people through but apprehending criminals.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: In Space Balls, they were combing the desert in order to apprehend Lone Star. Picture Dark Helmet saying "Combing the desert failed, we must now sieve the road!".

hints.author: Koos83
hints.mnemonic: The police have a new way of apprehending criminals; a big sieve in the road. Innocent people pass over, but people with a guilty conscience fall through.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: Corrupt cops "apprehend" a suspect by shooting him in the middle of the road, shooting him until he's so full of holes he's leaking like a sieve. No wonder the general population is so apprehensive when the police roam the streets

hints.author: scarby+dancer
hints.mnemonic: When they were finally APPREHENDED, Bonnie & Clyde were shot so many times they were leaking like a SIEVE on that desolate Louisiana ROAD... ["So numerous were the bullet holes that undertaker C. F. 'Boots' Bailey would have difficulty embalming the bodies because they wouldn't contain the embalming fluid." WIKI] ... [ 逮捕 【たいほ】 arrest, APPREHENSION, capture versus 勾引 ; 拘引 【こういん】 arrest, custody, seduction, abduction].

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The "boot" of Italy has gotten Europe all muddy. Who else could mop it up but Mr T?

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here I have Mister T cleaning up with a mop, a real mess of spaghetti, in front of the Piza (in Italy).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: The radical on the right looks to me like a fork holding a spaghetti. In Italia is pretty common to see people eating spaghetti.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is so excited to be Italy! Wow!! He gets off the plane and sees what must be an Italian delicacy! Spaghetti on a stick! look at those huuuuuge noodles! T is chowing down. Meanwhile, the airport janitor is wondering why Mr. T is eating his mop...

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Luke Skywalker in Italy, mop-in-hand working as a cleaner for a pizza restaurant. Sometimes, when nobody is around, he pretends the mop is a lightsaber, reliving his glory days.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: There's a tendency in Japan to make the younger members (kouhai) clean up after the older members (senpai) of a group, which results in a lot of grumbling and whining. "Well old boy," a senpai might say, "If you did as much work with the mop as you do with your mouth, you would have been done an hour ago".

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: The Beatles, english old boys, had hairs like mop and a good singing mouth.

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: 君 [kimi] is said by the old boy to the younger boy, never the other way around as it would be an insult.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: For this character I think of the Korean movie "oldboy", in which the protagonist has hair like a mop and a mouth that screams in agony. If you have not seen it you really should it's great, I won't spoil the ending...you won't see it coming

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: 君 [kimi] is said by the old boy to the younger boy, otherwise it would be an insult and someone would end up with a mop to the mouth. (Thank you Raseru).

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Good ol' boys are like sheep; they tend to flock together.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: A little girl herder calls out, " 羊君、きて！ " to the sheeps and they flock to her at once.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: (Thanks Stefanot) Fans flocked like sheep at Beatles - old boys concerts.

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: Quentin Tarantino fans are like flocks of sheep. He gives the thumbs up for "Old Boy" and everyone flocks to the theatre to watch.

hints.author: Dantheman
hints.mnemonic: Kimi! Get back in the flock, like a good sheep.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: [akrodha] My comb is rust-proof, water-proof, and fire-proof. But unfortunately it is not idiot-proof--and I glued it to myself.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I spent $100 recently on this excellent rust-proof, water-proof, fire-proof comb. But two days after having bought it, I left it in my back pocket and sat down, snapping this expensive comb in half! I glued it back together, but now every time I try to comb through my thick hair, it just breaks apart again. I guess my comb is also glue-proof.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: Glue your hair together and it will be comb-proof.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Urushi is one of the hardest lacquers(and glues) known to man. It's -proofed against everything

hints.author: thelooseteeth
hints.mnemonic: My comb is glue-proof!

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Supply and demand is a simple concept

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: If it's raining combs, then the demand for them sure does drop.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: If it rains, the demand for combs will rise. However, if it rains combs, the demand for combs will fall. It's all about supply and demand. (A combination of radical tyro's and FuduMyo's stories).

hints.author: paramausi
hints.mnemonic: It's raining combs?? I demand an explanation for this shit.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: A smart salesman will know which kind of weather will cause frizzy hair, with the subsequent increase in the demand for combs.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: No more Confucian jibba-jabba! I demand you tell me why it's raining combs!".

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: One day, Mr. T started reading the little proverbs he found in fortune cookies, and with this newfound wisdom he became a Confucian scholar. He was suddenly in high demand as people came from all over to ask for his sage advice, immensely satisfied with suggestions such as, "You will find happiness with a new love".

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T demands to know what Confucian means!

hints.author: finethankyou
hints.mnemonic: Confucius Say

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Confucius is a person who demanded that people make an effort to live up to high moral Confucian standards and improve society that way.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Have you ever seen those shots in movies where the hero is standing at the edge of a sheer mountain face, hair blowing in the wind? It probably wouldn't seem so heroic if you saw him ten minutes earlier, when a crew of stylists was carefully combing his hair so it would fall perfectly.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: When you stand a comb on its edge, it looks like the mountain (#768 山) kanji.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Jimi Hendrix

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: Standing on the edge of a mountain, you throw your comb into the abyss. Head shaved, no need for it anymore. Goodbye comb, goodbye. You're on the edge yourself, you look below. The abyss beckons. You watch the comb fall...

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: He valianty stood at the mountain's edge... and proceed to comb his hair for the photographs.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Primatives celing; belt; mountain as per Cumulative Errata. See volfy post for link. Both effective ways to commit suicide, hang your self from the celing with your belt or jump off a mountain.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Under one ceiling both took off their belts in Brokeback Mountain.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Be careful with this one. The correct primitive order is ceiling . . . belt . . . mountain. That said, in the Mario video games, there are some levels where spikes hang from the ceiling and there are large conveyor belts. One example is Koopa Mountain. Imagine both Mario and Luigi trying to get through the level unscathed.

hints.author: volfy
hints.mnemonic: Matticus, the errata at www.nanzan-u.ac.jp/ SHUBUNKEN/publications/miscPublications/ Remembering_the_Kanji_1.htm reflects your view of how the character should be written. Everyone should take a look and correct all the listed errors in the book.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Both the ceiling of heaven and the mountains are belted to the Earth.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Add water THEN the flowers. With both the vase will be full.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I was thirsty so I gulped down the water. Then I realized I was also hungry. So I ate the flowers. Yes, I am responsible for both the missing water and the missing flowers. Yes, I'm afraid both. Am I still hungry or thirsty? Thank you for asking! How kind! But no, I feel quite full now.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: I hate going on dates where a girl says "I'll have a salad and a water" and then insists that they both make her full!

hints.author: Machine_Gun_Cat
hints.mnemonic: Just imagine you and your closest Japanese class rival having a contest to see who can get full marks ( 満点 ）in a test, the winner is given Flowers, the looser is drenched with ice cold water, now imagine you both get full marks and so both of you get drenched and flowered.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: In spring, the water of Kyoto's waterways is full of cherry blossom flowers, right up to the banks on both sides.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: To paint a kanji in your ceiling with only natural materials, you use a sprout as a brush and shovel some dirt to use as paint for your strokes. [modified from johnskb's].

hints.author: chully
hints.mnemonic: Start with just one stroke. Soon more will sprout, and then you end up with a whole shovelfull!

hints.author: cingold
hints.mnemonic: The first kanji I learnt was just one brush stroke, but then my knowledge sprouted and I knew a shovelful.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: New age artist. The canvas is on the ceiling. The floor is covered with bean sprouts. The artist takes a shovel and makes a sweeping motion on the ground, sending a stream of sprouts flying up to the ceiling and sticking to the canvas in strange patterns. "This is radical calligraphy," he says, panting for breath, "and the act of shoveling is my new-age equivalent of the classical brush stroke.".

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Stop shoveling rice into your mouth, you'll hurt a tooth! Use chopsticks instead.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: My dentist used his foot and a shovel to dislodge the rice stuck between my teeth.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: My female dentist

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: A Japanese wife stopped cooking rice one night because she was tired. Her husband complained so she took a shovel to his face and broke all his teeth.

hints.author: Nick65765
hints.mnemonic: I cant believe i didnt see this before .............................................................. ITS A PICTOGRAPH OF A TOOTH!!! ...a front tooth thats white as rice, wedged into the upper gum to stop it moving and the shovel primitive is the shape of the tooth. ...you dont need much imagination to picture this!!........UPDATE

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: It looks like the mouth of Bender the robot, from Matt Groening's animated series "Futurama". Thus, I use the character Bender the robot as a primitive.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Also means "melody". Think of it as a pictogram of a guitar where you have to bend the strings to make a melody.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: When two sprouts sprout at the same place they don't have enough space and have to bend in different directions to grow...

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Hannibal Lecter exposes his victim's brains and inserts two walking sticks, using them to bend the victim to his will. Note

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: This is a guitar fretboard. You have to bend the strings to produce a melody.

hints.author: mikemikepw
hints.mnemonic: A space cadet eager to make one bend around the sun. (a dangerous maneuver).

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: Bender lasted just one day in the space cadets.

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: Japanese cadets have to constantly do one thing--bend OVER all day, bowing to their superiors.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: This is from back in Bender's early days, when he was a promising young space cadet at the evil empire academy. He had one task - blow up one sun. One. Sun. That they had set up for him beforehand. Well, he ended up blowing up the entire solar system his outfit was stationed in. When he got called in for a meeting, the commander said

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Close encounters of the third kind. The space cadet encounters aliens on the road.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Bender the cadet (see frame 1172) has an "encounter of the third kind" on the road. Reference to Steven Spielberg's 1977 movie "Close Encounters of the Third Kind". Also a reference to popular stories of people reportedly chased by UFO's while driving on the road.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Close encounters of the third kind. You encounter a space cadet on the road. (tweaked version of radical tyro's story. Having "alien" in the story made me want to use 玄 in place of 曹 ).

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: You encounter cadets on the road as they march "hut 2-3-4" (frame 1173).

hints.author: thelooseteeth
hints.mnemonic: While traveling the Milky road-way, Bender the space cadet had an alien encounter. However, he's used to them by now, so it wasn't really a big deal.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Bender the cadet (see frame 1172) is rowing, during some army exercise, and he's very afraid of water (Bender is a robot).

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The space cadet is in training, rowing in the water (see it splash).

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: A space cadet has crashed on an unknown planet. Fortunately he crashed in water so he's unharmed, but now he has to do some rowing to get out of the water.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: When the cadets are ordered into the water, it can only mean one thing - rowing. (Make sure to picture this as the verb rowING, so as to not confuse with row (#1785 並), which means 'a row of something').

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Water cadets (a freshwater branch of the sea scouts), love to go rowing. Stroke! Stroke!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Also as part of some army survival exercise, the cadets (including Bender see frame 1172) are sent into the woods to build a vat (for collecting water for example).

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: Bender the Cadet (kudos to Fuaburisu) is found on an army training exercise, hiding behind a tree, getting drunk on the famous scotch whiskey Vat 69.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: A true (?) story about Captain Cook and sauerkraut. Cook was convinced that sauerkraut would prevent the disease scurvy among his sailors, but his problem was getting his sailors to eat the stuff. He tricked the low-ranking cadets into eating sauerkraut by storing it in wood vats labeled "for officers' use only". The cadets thus believed that they were being unfairly denied access to the officers-only vats, so they secretly stole and ate the sauerkraut - which was exactly what Cook wanted them to do.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Space cadets are decompressed in wooden vats when they return to Earth.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Cadets have to bathe in wooden vats.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Since the meaning of "big dipper" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of measuring cup. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Is it just me, or do all of these traditional kanji pictographs look like they were drawn by a retarded bunny rabbit?

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: I looked out my window frame and saw two shooting stars slashing through the big dipper. Primitive

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: This does not look like the big dipper or 18 liters of anything in any way, shape, or form.

hints.author: meiko452
hints.mnemonic: The Big Dipper is a celestial measuring cup.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: When buying rice, the fee is calculated by the cup. Naturally we don't just use any cup; it has to be a proper measuring cup.

hints.author: wzafran
hints.mnemonic: Samurai(s) once received their fee in the form of rice that had been carefully weighed in a measuring cup beforehand.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Ancient Japan mobile promises no monthly fees for long distance but I hate the fact that they don't take credit cards. I'm tired of mailing them a measuring cup full of rice every month.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Hidden fees are everywhere nowadays. Just the other day, I bought some rice, and they charged me for using the measuring cup!

hints.author: Hawkeye123
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is used in 料理 (cooking). Imagine a cooking recipe

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: University departments study things like wheat (agriculture) and the big dipper (physics/astronomy), and exact measuring cups (engineering).

hints.author: cornrow
hints.mnemonic: The national DEPARTMENT of WHEATS and MEASURES. Get it? This one was hard until I came up with this.

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: The science departments at universities are trying to grow one wheat plant that can fill a whole measuring cup. (genetic engineering).

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: An alphabetical list of the university's departments reads "Agriculture (wheat), Astronomy (Big Dipper)...." and so on.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The Department of Wheat Measurement has heard some strange things about Cap 'n Crunch Cereal recently - namely, that the amount of wheat in Cap 'n Crunch Cereal may not be as high as is claimed on the box. So here they are at the factory with a huge garbage pail-sized measuring cup, putting the appropriate amount of wheat into each box.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Can't see direct relation to Big Dipper (#1177 斗) since its writing order is completely different. As raulir noted, it's written as overlapping at the last stroke of ツ and the first of メ. I take it as a pictograph or treasure map. Two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: A pictograph of a treasure map. Two steps east then X marks the spot. 図る はかる attempt, deceive; 地図 ちず map; 意図する いとする make a goal, intend to do; 図々しい ずうずうしい impudent, shameless; 図書館 としょかん library.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: When I arrived in Hollywood, I bought what they call a "star map." Much to my dismay, it didn't even show the location of the big dipper!

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: A PENT IN BIG DIPPER is an astronomy MAP.

hints.author: cingold
hints.mnemonic: Ahem, it looks like a Trea-tsu mep, er a treasure map...

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: To tenderize meat in an emergency wilderness situation, just utilize your walking stick!

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: I'll confuse this with use (#990 使), so build a distinction right from the start. For me, "utilize" has an artificial, business-speak connotation; you only utilize "utilize" when you're trying to puff up what you're saying and sound important. So

hints.author: nmkohi
hints.mnemonic: When your flesh is weak you must utilize a walking stick.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: We have to utilize different tools for different jobs. If some object in your kitchen needs to be be screwed, you would utilize a screwdriver. If your woman needs to be screwed, you would utilize your meat stick.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: NASA utilizes a giant laser to cut the moon in half. Very shortly, the Earth will have two companion moons.

hints.author: rtkrtk
