hints.mnemonic: To live a comfortable life, single men need only a cave for living, a rake for cleaning and a screwdriver for fixing.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: When I first moved in to my new cave, all I had was a bed (see bed (#592 床)). But now I've settled in, got myself a few handy things like a rake and a screwdriver, and made myself more comfortable.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: To make your cave more comfortable, you'll need to do some work with a rake and screwdriver. Clean it up. Fix a few things.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Commonplace seems like a better keyword for this, though it's easier to confuse with others like "usual" and "mediocre". In this case, commonplace refers to something ordinary and non-exceptional. I picture a commonplace caveman's cave, with very ordinary, non-fancy, cave drawings he did with a screwdriver because he couldn't afford a writing brush. You have to visualize him etching the drawings with the screwdriver.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: (Thanks rtkrtk) To live a comfortable life, the Flintstones need only a cave for living, a rake for cleaning and a screwdriver for fixing.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T wants to climb up and pick the flowers at the top of the cliff. He equips himself with screwdrivers to use as climbing spikes to reach the top of the cliff. Imagine a large AMMO belt full of philips screwdrivers instead of bullets.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: An RPG where you're using Mr T as a character. Before you enter a battle, you equip the flower cliff screwdriver. This is a small screwdriver obtained at the bottom of a cliff that, when used in battle, shoots out pink flowers. When they touch the ground in front of the enemy, they create a massive cliff, and the ground under the enemy falls away into the sea. Picture being at the item select menu and EQUIPping this item just before facing a tough boss.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A person equipping themselves with flowers they will utilize to beautify the barren cliff.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T falls from the edge of a cliff but grabs hold of a flower to save his life. He then shoves a screwdriver into the dirt and lifts himself up to safety. "I pity the fool who doesn't come equiped," he quips.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Jedi Anakin wanted to present Padme with some rare flowers which only grow at the top of a high cliff on Naboo. To equip himself for the climb, he only carried a sonic screwdriver, since he was able to utilise his Jedi powers. 準備 じゅんび preparation; 備える (そなえる)

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, the children were forced to eat their salad every day.

hints.author: andye
hints.mnemonic: For those who don't know the expression, "salad days" means the time of one's youth. (originally from Shakespeare's Antony and Cleopatra - see http

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time there was a McDonald's salad and it was left out in the sun for a whole day. But ... nothing happened because it was a McDonald's salad, chock full of preservatives and other garbage. The salad lived happily ever after (and so did the person who didn't eat it). The end. [I didn't write this... the original author deleted it... but it's my favourite story on the whole site.].

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: This is the kanji for "mukashi". Often used for "once upon a time" or "long time ago". I will take this kanji to mean "really fucking long time ago"......A really fucking long time ago, I use to eat salad every day and was very slim.....those days are long gone and I'm now fat as a pig...

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time there was a ruler called ceaser (shiza sarada). He ruled everything under the sun, even the sun worshiping egyptians, until one day he was killed and then his sun Augustous took over. I think Ceaser will be an easier primitive than once upon a time. N.B. It's worked really well for me over the next couple of kanji.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: A long time ago, people of the world got confused because there were so many kinds of Metal coins. today we only have the euro.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, it was thought that the ancient "art" of alchemy could transform anything into gold. At that time, people were obviously confused about the difference between reality and myth. (Arguably people are still as confused as ever, just about different things now.).

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time there were some very confused alchemists. They couldn't understand why they couldn't turn other metals (i.e. lead) into gold. (adapted from Raichu).

hints.author: tummai
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time Metallica used to be a great metal band. Somewhere around 1990 they got confused and now they write shitty pop rock songs.

hints.author: epangelia2k2
hints.mnemonic: Ahhh senility, when you are confused by the everything in the world . . . your golden years are not at all like your salad days.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time I let Mr T borrow my salad bowl, but he won't give it back. "This be mine now, foo!".

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T borrowed a copy of Cinderella and won't give it back. He keeps watching it over and over again, trying to figure out how the Fairy Godmother does her magic.

hints.author: phauna
hints.mnemonic: A really long time ago, I borrowed some gold chains and a vest from Mr. T, I hope he doesn't notice that I haven't given them back yet.

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, Chuck Norris borrowed something from me. Do you think I'm going to ask for it back? No way!

hints.author: ambassadog
hints.mnemonic: Back in the day, you'd borrow from a person. These days you go to a bank.

hints.author: jmadsen
hints.mnemonic: What a pity! My state of mind when i think of the opportunities I missed from once upon a time.

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: "I pity da foo who borrowed my place in this kanji! (Watch out Data!).

hints.author: zz_alex_zz
hints.mnemonic: Data says "What a pity" when he hears that once upon a time there were no robots.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A state of mind when you regret things done once upon a time.

hints.author: nac_est
hints.mnemonic: "Pity? It was pity that stayed Bilbo's hand! Once upon a time he would not have felt it, but his state of mind changed, and he spared Gollum's life".

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Long ago our ancestors set aside the use of fingers and began to use cutlery. (Raichu,11-7-2006) The way I remember it's 昔 once upon a time (#1184 昔) rather than 旧 olden times (#35 旧) is that they began to use cutlery to eat salad. (I also think about how when you visit the Medieval Times theme park, which is set in Once upon a time, their gimmick is that you eat with your fingers.).

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: "Once upon a time..." Oh hell, you're just too old for this. You close your fairy tale book and set it aside, pushing it away with your fingers.

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: To set aside in the sense of giving it up. We set aside childish things, namely, those ONCE UPON A TIME stories we grew up with-- though those stories' faeries and Disney tinkerbells come up to us, we brush them away with our FINGERS, once after another, but they keep coming, not wanting to be set aside-- so we flick them away!

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, I set aside my fingers and began using chopsticks. The rest is history.....no more sticky fingers.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Long ago our ancestors set aside the use of fingers and began to use cutlery.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: The taskmaster is dissatisfied with the meal she's served, and scatters the salad & meat across the floor for the servants to clean up.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When his salad had meat in it, the vegetarian taskmaster blew his top and scattered it all over the restaurant floor.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Perhaps you've heard of Nyotaimori or Nantaimori (http

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: As we all know, Hitler was a vegetarian. So when he was enjoying his salad and found a bit of flesh scattered in it, he flipped out and scattered it all over the floor. After hearing it was the chef's special creation, a "Flesh Scatter Salad", he goes on a rampage and startskilling people. Imagine him walking into a room, with people screaming, "Oh no! It's Hitler! Scatter! Scatter!!".

hints.author: Rivvie
hints.mnemonic: So... what's in the salad? Just some lettuce, the taskmaster answers, oh, and some human flesh. Everybody scatters from the dinner table.

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: A generation is 30, one stroke less is twenty.

hints.author: Pauline
hints.mnemonic: Ten plus ten is twenty (see generation (#28 世)).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: 十 ten (#10 十)、廿 twenty (#1190 廿)、世 generation (#28 世).

hints.author: mattias
hints.mnemonic: 十、廿、丗 ... Ten, Twenty, Thirty... Japanese is logical as usual.

hints.author: fagie37
hints.mnemonic: I'll give you this twenty if you'll give me two tens. I just really got to break this twenty.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Commoners have to huddle in caverns around a campfire, while higher class people get heating and central air conditioning in a hotel.

hints.author: fagie37
hints.mnemonic: If you are so poor that you are a commoner, you will have to live twenty commoners to a cavern, with only one fire for everyone to share.

hints.author: epsilondelta
hints.mnemonic: PRIMITIVE

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: I draw upon The Two Towers again. Imagine the scene where the people of rohan seeks refuge in the cavernous fortress of Helms Cleft. The nobility and warriors stand ground at the bulwark, where as the commoner stay behind in the huge caverns of 20 little fireplaces.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Tamaki is fantasizing about Haruhi again (Ouran Host Club), thinking of her commoner lifestyle, eating commoner food--in this particular fantasy, she's in a cave with twenty raggedy commoner family members (must have borrowed some siblings from Yamada Taro Monogatari) trying to huddle around a fire, cooking some sort of commoner food.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The commoners are revolting! We must intercept them on the road before they reach the castle!

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: If don't want your secret message to be intercepted, make sure your deliveryman is dressed as a commoner while traveling on the road.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Robin Hood was a commoner, but he still would routinely intercept the Sherriff of Nottingham on the road.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: This keyword is dangerously similar to apprehend (#1160 逮). The idea of a "road-block intercepting" people can't be used twice, so here's an alternative

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: In Lord of the Rings, the COMMONERS are INTERCEPTED on the ROAD to Helms Deep. Think of the scene where they attacked by the goblins.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Remember those poor commoners huddled in groups of 20 in a cave? The only thing they had for a seat was some old toweling (while their lords could recline on luxurious couches).

hints.author: epsilondelta
hints.mnemonic: PRIMITIVE

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: You're tired from walking the tour at this cavern and there's no benches to sit down on, so you take a towel and sling it up into a hammock-like seat using the stalagmites. (Big no-no).

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: You're in an onsen cavern, peeping at the pretty young girls wearing only a towel... when suddenly Chris Hansen appears. "Please take a seat".

hints.author: b0ng0
hints.mnemonic: If you want to take a seat in the caverns, they're often pretty damp - best to lay down a towel first before getting a wet ass.

hints.author: jimsublimeman
hints.mnemonic: The cavern refugees are so poor that they can't afford thermometers. So, the menfolk expose their crotches inside the cavern, and approximate the temperature in degrees from how shrivelled everything looks downstairs...

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: The cave is twenty degrees cooler than the outdoors. Twenty male crotches experience shrinkage.

hints.author: epsilondelta
hints.mnemonic: PRIMITIVE

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: You might want to pick a seat in the cavern a little closer to the cooking fire, though. Otherwise, the second you sit down on the cold rocks, the temperature of your crotch will drop about fifty degrees!

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: (Continuing story from previous kanji - thanks matticus) One of the commoners has no towel. As soon as he sits down on the cold rocks of the caverns, the temperature of his crotch drops about fifty degrees!

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: This particular form of transit is a ferry (one of the actual meanings of this character). Naturally it can only cross the water if it's not frozen, so the temperature must be above 0 degrees.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: The transit system in Tokyo is one of the best in the wrold, but why is it that when it is 35 degrees outside, it is about 2 degrees on the train? Or when it is 2 degrees outside, it is 35 degrees inside the train. This degree of difference means I am always sweating then getting the chills! I think I caught a fever!

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: This kanji becomes a snap when you think of a surveyor's instrument called a transit! The transit has a small, curved liquid tube (with an air bubble) and a scale marked in degrees so you can tell if something is level or not.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Water may change several degrees during transit.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Hustle and bustle = a big St. Bernard dog frisking about in a haystack, knocking it down and spreading the hay about, after the field hands just stacked it up.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: A bustle is also the name for the big wire-framed skirts that women used to wear. Here's a St. Bernard dog jammed ass-first into the top of a haystack, looking like some kind of proper Victorian-era lady as he struggles to get out.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: (note

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: In the hustle and bustle of NYC, you suddenly find this humongous haystack and a giant St. Bernard sitting on top of it, howling Christmas songs. Nobody even stops to look....only in NYC.

hints.author: imagia
hints.mnemonic: - I had trouble using the haystack primitive without "money" as in the following frames, so I've separated the elements out to make sure I don't put "money" into this kanji. Whenever you come across any BUSTLE, there's a simple solution for getting through. Get your St Bernard and prick him with a needle - he'll cut right through the BUSTLE. You just have to hold onto him with two hands!

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: History of Pompei

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: A bit nasty (but makes the whole thing much easier to remember) is to take the right side and call it a bearded clam. For erupt, you can make your own story about the mouth/opening on the left.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Well, the local farmers stuffed the mouth of the dangerous volcano with haystacks, thinking that would prevent eruptions. Even more stupid was one tourist who threw some sea food (shellfish) into the mouth of the volcano. This caused an instant eruption of unprecedented magnitude!

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: After eating some particularly bad clams at a dodgy seafood restaurant, you erupt and release them back out through your mouth. You cover up the mess with a haystack.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: For 30 clams, a prostitute will let you erupt in her mouth.....LOL...

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: After the eruption all is a tomb. The soil has covered the remains of the farmers gathering haystacks and of the fisherman collecting shells.

hints.author: Soseki
hints.mnemonic: Using soil and hay to make bricks, the Egyptians built the pyramids to entomb the Pharaohs along with all of their money.

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: Depending on how much money you have, you can be buried in the hay, in the dirt, or in a tomb.

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: An Egyptian tomb is soil molded in the shape of a giant haystack, with all the money of the pharoah burried underneith.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: I think I'm gonna puke. That bearded clam has so much dirt in it that it looks like a tomb rather than a womb.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: Data was aroused/indignant when he saw what the volcano had done to the farmers building their haystacks and the fishermen collecting their shells . The tragedy of it all aroused him so much he didn't even notice he was feeling emotion.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: Aroused

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: Oh boy, does bearded clam ever work for this kanji! I get into an aroused state just thinking about it.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: After Data got his emotion chip, his anger was aroused when he realized he wasn't getting any of that bearded clam.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Ah, there's no better way to bake a pizza than an oven fueled by a burning strawman. And if you listen carefully, there are stifled strawman screams coming from the kitchen. Think of this image

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: To the fire goes the straw man, thinking to bake a cake on it, but...

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: The best yakisoba / yakiimo / yakizakana / yakitori / yakiniku / takoyaki / taiyaki / shogayaki / sukiyaki / okonomiyaki / dorayaki / teriyaki / teppanyaki is made by burning a strawman.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: I see the strawman as The Wicker Man (which incidentally I would recommend to all!). Without wanting to spoil the film for those who haven't seen it, let's just say that if you have seen the movie, this one is easy!

hints.author: partyrash
hints.mnemonic: The straw man burning festival. Burning man music festival. I suppose a lot of people have lighters and matches there so they can get baked, eh?

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The sun rising beside a straw man in a corn field is a classic cartoon depiction of daybreak.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: The first person to see the sun at daybreak is of course the straw man who stands outside all day.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Daybreak comes and at the touch of the sun all the vampires instantly become straw men!

hints.author: xingji
hints.mnemonic: nightbreak (#30 旦) was yoake 夜明け = or when the night brights up - daybreak is a akatsuki (the kun reading of this character), coming from akatoki =明時 which is the exact moment at which the SUN can give life to the STRAWMAN (it used to mean the period of time when it's still dark - before dawn) dawn (#2448 曙) is usually reserved for the figurative sense of beginning of a new era. to keep them separated i'm sorting them chronologically as

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: I'd like to see a daybreak more often but I'm never up that early. So instead, I get my Voodoo Doll and leave it outside facing east. So it sees the sun rise up for me, whilst I'm still sound asleep. (Hey, if it can transfer pain to me, it can transfer beautiful sights like this!).

hints.author: bspeaks
hints.mnemonic: Imagine karate chopping the number three in half with a WALKING STICK and pausing the picture just as the first "board" breaks.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: I think of this as a pictograph, there are three boards to cut, the first one is already in half and there are still two more to go.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: What is 1 divided by 2? ONE (vertical stroke) divided by TWO (horizontal strokes) equals one- HALF. The ANIMAL-HORNS are your prize for solving this complex math problem.

hints.author: Nayelianne
hints.mnemonic: If this were a comic drawing, and someone was cutting vegetables in a half with a knife real quick, this would be the view from the above of the scene. The ' ´ are just the impact / action marks. And the knife is the | dividing the two halves.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: I karate chopped the first one in half but for the next two I needed a walking stick.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The person who is your consort is most commonly "your other half".

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T wants to splits himself in half so he can be his own CONSORT.

hints.author: myglagata
hints.mnemonic: MR T's CONSORT is only HALF the size that he is (she's Japanese after all).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T will never take a consort. Marriage or nothing! No half-way measures for Mr. T!

hints.author: Jaunty
hints.mnemonic: The Asari consort from Mass Effect looked half human.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: A PADDY-RIDGE divides the RICE FIELD in HALF.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Better keyword

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Think about a large rice field as a big square. Then you draw a line down the middle, halving it into two. Then you draw a line across the middle, halving it again into four... These halvings are paddy-ridges that separate the rice field into separate sections. I dunno the reason why, but that's how it's done.

hints.author: protput
hints.mnemonic: Http

hints.author: Garland
hints.mnemonic: If you keep dividing the rice paddy in half, and in half again, and again, you'll get more and more paddy-ridges.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: In the bible, King Solomon's JUDGMENT was admired not by saying to cut the baby in HALF with the SWORD, but that it revealed who the true mother was.

hints.author: jotun
hints.mnemonic: It takes good judgement to cut things in exactly half with a saber.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: See book. Solomon made his judgment and decided to cut a baby in half with his saber. Good thing he found the real mom before that happened!

hints.author: errtu
hints.mnemonic: Heisig's story is perfect.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Judge Judy

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: 1) I hold a roll of quarters in my hand when I make a fist. 2) I hold a quarter in my hand as I prepare to play the Iron Fist Tournament

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Quarter, hand

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: 及  fist* His fist is a QUARTER the size of his open HAND.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: A fist is a hand that offers no quarter.

hints.author: einahpets
hints.mnemonic: Your hand may only be a quarter of its usual size with the fingers spread out when you make a fist but it looks a lot tougher.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Entering the movie, the dude asks for your ticket, so he can tear it in half. He looks at you funny when you hand him a ticket already torn in half. He quietly tears the stub into quarters after you show him your dagger with a smile.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, the JR railway ju-hachi-kippu seasonal discount ticket can be cut into quarters with a dagger and shared with your friends. (its actually sort-of true).

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: Typically, about one quarter of a ticket with be separated by a perforated edge which the ticket guy will tear off when you are at the gate. However, this kanji was made waaay before perforated edges were invented. It used to be that the guy would cut off a quarter of your ticket with a dagger.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: Fact #1

hints.author: sdrobertm
hints.mnemonic: While a quarter may not buy you a ticket, a dagger will; if you know what I mean.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: At a mysterious bazaar, you happen to come across something interesting

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: How to make snake maki

hints.author: nadiatims
hints.mnemonic: This scroll isn't long enough to show more than a quarter of a snake.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The quartered snake was the illustration on the famous scroll by Ben Franklin that read, "United we stand, divided we fall.".

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Orichimaru (Naruto) uses a scroll to summon a SNAKE. To his surprise, the snake demands a QUARTER. Orichimaru forgot his quarters, so back into the scroll goes the snake...

hints.author: ivoSF
hints.mnemonic: I assosiate scrolls with spell casting, the efect of this spell is pent in a certain sphere of influence, outside it no damage is done.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: [RPG] You're fighting a powerful enemy. Your mage uses a scroll/quartersnake of protection, and he's pent in a sphere of protection.

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: The entire sphere of human knowledge used to be pent into the library of alexandria on scrolls. (oops, but then it all burned).

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: If the area of the page is outside the SPHERE of your screen size, you have to SCROLL vertically or horizontally so that the display on your screen display is not PENT IN by physical dimensions.

hints.author: tritonxg
hints.mnemonic: [FR]sphere japlt

hints.author: happychair
hints.mnemonic: After your VICTORY cut your enemy's FLESH into QUARTERs to show your POWER.

hints.author: msukovich
hints.mnemonic: After England's victory over Scottish rebel William Wallace, they had his flesh drawn and quartered and then sent around Britain to demonstrate their power.

hints.author: wio_dude
hints.mnemonic: On the moon it only takes a quarter of your power to accomplish the same victory (because of the low gravity).

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Victor Belmont, one of the lesser-known Belmonts, derives his strength not from the full moon like most mythical characters, but from the quarter moon. When there is a quarter moon in the sky, his muscles become suddenly huge, and his victory over Dracula is assured.

hints.author: Haych
hints.mnemonic: You are sure to achieve victory in an arm wrestle if your opponent's flesh has a quarter the power.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: According to legend, the great Ogaki wisteria tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: The wisteria is a type of hanging vine covered with flowers. By the light of the quarter moon, the flowers look like clusters of rice grains.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This is easy if you've seen Desperate Housewives. Here on Wisteria Lane, under the immaculate flowers, you wouldn't believe the things going on at night under the light of the quarter moon, and we're not talking about fancy recipes for cooking grains of rice.

hints.author: khooks
hints.mnemonic: Wisteria is a plant that is the color of the moon and only blooms one quarter of the year (spring). It's best planted in a hole full of rice grains.

hints.author: pgp27
hints.mnemonic: The wisteria is a FLOWER you can cook with MEAT and a QUARTER of a pound of RICE to make a delicious dish.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: Sending a facsimile to the moon can be problematic only a quarter of the words actually get there.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: As a prank, a guy sits with his butt flesh on the facsimile machine, inserts a quarter, and tries to fax it to his boss. However the facsimile machine has pattern recognition technology and instead of an image of his flesh, it just transmits the word "asshole". Don't forget it's flesh, not words, on the left side; the flesh image gets transformed into words.

hints.author: narazumono
hints.mnemonic: When you send a facsimile to the moon it costs a quarter per word.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: What used to take a month to re-scribe only a quarter of the words, the modern technology of a Xerox or even mimeograph or facsimile reproduces them them in moments.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: It really is a quite acceptable fax. It's just in the moon light, you can only read a quarter of the words.

hints.author: saranich
hints.mnemonic: Fuaburisu's pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife is a one-sided version of the story. Others say he was giving her the finger.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Taking the keyword in the sense of only one part of a whole, I see this as a pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife (I couldn't see any trees or branches in there).

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: A one-sided romance--he proposes and she says no. (Thanks to fuaburisu).

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: If you look at this image from one side, it looks like the top hat is floating over a chair.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: There is also other side (left-side) of the tree, which is the kanji - 爿(radical no. 90, which has the meaning of "piece of wood" and was earlier used in status quo (#239 状), robust (#321 壮), leader (#731 将), but then was simplified to "half-turtle" element). Now put them together - 爿片 - and you can see a tree.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: Before the advent of printers in Japan, typewriters couldn't be built as they were in the west due to how many kanji there are. Lots of small printing blocks had to be used instead. One side of the printing block would have a mirrored (anti) image of the kanji. This is true.

hints.author: matsuyamakiwi
hints.mnemonic: Nazi propaganda. Picture the printing blocks producing very one-sided (Aryan), anti-Jewish propaganda spreading posters to hang around town.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Printing block has a one-sided anti-image of what's being printed.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Printing blocks are one-sided and have "anti-image" of the page carved into them (the background-colored areas are engraved, not the text).

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Picture teams of monks copying scriptures... before the advent of printing blocks, documents were copied by hand. The copyists were able to get away with making slight omissions & changes when they didn't agree with the source documents, resulting in one-sided versions of the original text. The invention of the printing block ensured all copies would be identical to the original; thus it is anti-one-sided.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Of all the kanji, this is the only one 之 orro can write.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: The Z of Zorro (and yes he has a hat).

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: "Hey Zorro, would you sign my chest?" "Why of course!" Long story short

hints.author: Groot
hints.mnemonic: The mark of 之 orro!

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: My kanji dictionaries state that this is an alternate kanji for これ (this one) ( 此れ being the other form). It looks like a very small person 人 who lifts a hat with his arm. I like to think of him as a gardener with a Panama Hat, but it could also be the almighty Zorro!

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Just one drop (of alcohol) and he starts walking in zig-zags – no wonder Zorro's living in destitution. (Note

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Children in complete destitution have no hope of ever getting toys to play with, so when they find even a tiny drop of a building block they are overjoyed.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: The people living in destitution POOR. Zorro gives them every drop he has

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Zorro helps prostitutes living in destitution. He gives them money, in return they allow him to cover them in drops of Zorro. What a philanthropist! (thanks filip!).

hints.author: digicult
hints.mnemonic: This is bad story, but whatever, it works, I was having real trouble with this kanji

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Zorro, with a flower between his teeth for the ladies, defends his turf against evildoers. "This is my turf! And this...is for the lady.".

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Artificial turf made easy

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: ZORRO tried to plant FLOWERS but found his lawn was made of astro-TURF.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: You know that when you see a flower bed in the shape of a Z that you're on Zorro's turf.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Ever seen turf rolled out like carpet on a new block? Here a roll of turf is unfurled and inside of it was Zorro with a flower in his mouth. Some people are just that smooth...

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: [Smithsonian] Scene

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: One below zero is a negative number.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: If just ONE PERSON has a DROP of NEGATIVITY it can make everyone NEGATIVE.

hints.author: FoxintheStars
hints.mnemonic: A minus sign with an arrow pointing up at it, indicating that this is the symbol that means negative.

hints.author: owenjd
hints.mnemonic: Anything smaller than 1 is negative.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: To distinguish between 否  negate, and 不 negative (#1217 不)

hints.author: mairov
hints.mnemonic: Negative mouths negate everything.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: I get this mixed up with negative (#1217 不). The difference here is that someone ate the negative to negate it.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: unauthorized
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The maple tree is very negative about it, but the farmer still collects cupfuls of maple syrup from it.

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: Ｗｈｅｎ　ｙｏｕ　ｓａｙ　［いっぱい」　Ｔｈｅ　ｋａｎｊｉ　ｉｓ 一杯． Just think of Wooden cups being used for drinking, but drinking CUPFULS is Negative as you might get sick.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: The kanji for いっぱい is 一杯． One cup is great, two cups still good, but if you have so many cupfuls that you pass out under a tree, the situation has turned negative.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A wooden cup is a piece of wood with negative space waiting to be filled by the cupfuls.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: If you want the tree to show negative growth, you should use a few cupsful of poison every day.

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: Do not mistake with LOSE 失 .

hints.author: j0k0m0
hints.mnemonic: I lost 845 失 the tip to my dart 矢 .

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Darts are like drops falling from heaven. I see massive falling darts from a scene in Babylon 5. I think they were either Shadow weapons or weapons used to attack the Shadows...

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: The 11th and not so well-known plague of Egypt

hints.author: Fluhk
hints.mnemonic: Angels have now been given a powerful tool to rectify human behavior instantly, without delay - they have been allowed to drop darts on those who misbehave... spare the dart and spoil the man...

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: The darts of the angel Cupid are supposed to bring people joy, but usually just make things a lot worse. Here we see another angel flying around shooting people with the anti-darts (antidote), to rectify the situation.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: The Angel cupid uses darts to rectify people's love life.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: While trying to make you fall in love, Cupid accidentally threw a dart up your rectum. Now another angel is coming to rectify the problem.

hints.author: nilfisq
hints.mnemonic: Oh Cupid (angel with the darts)

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: With a banner declaring "Keep Out!" and blow darts to back it up, the Amazon tribe is not that friendly.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Once tribes shot darts under their war banners, now they are putting banner ads on the internet for betting on dart-games at their casinos

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: TRIBES in Japan either have BANNERS (samurai) or poisoned DARTS (ninja).

hints.author: epsilondelta
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: lecz0r
hints.mnemonic: An Amamzonian TRIBE puts a BANNER outside their village that reads

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I should know. After all, I did graduate from Dartmouth!

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [know; wisdom] [An arrow 矢 like mouth 口 ] If you know the answers, they will fly like darts from your mouth.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: A know-it-all can't help themselves, like Hermione, the answer to every question just darts from their mouth. [slight reframing from Ricardo's].

hints.author: chully
hints.mnemonic: See http

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Dartmouth is a place in England; do you know it?

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Wisdom is knowing everything OVER the sun (fools assume everything UNDER).

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: Knowing more each day, brings wisdom.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Wisdom is the knowledge gained by the passing of days.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge that "enlightens" and brings warmth to others, just like the sun does.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: The wise old man says his wisdom is all thanks to his Dartmouth days.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In the busy pub, one of the dart players shoved his dart into my elbow by accident when it nearly slipped out of his fingers.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Your fingers slip when someone's elbow shoves you, causing you to drop the dart you were about to throw. But as you can see, their elbow is very small, so you decide they're too weak to shove back.

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: You're scared to do your introduction ( 挨拶 ）, so a giant FINGER appears to shove you in front of the class. You land on your ELBOW, and the class shoots DARTS at you for falling.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: (+astridtops) In the crowded bar, someone shoves an elbow into you just as you are about to throw your dart. The dart slips from your fingers. You are just about to curse at the person when you realize that she is your Japanese teacher. You bow and greet [ 挨拶 (あいさつ)

hints.author: Kaame
hints.mnemonic: I shoved him with my fingers. Then he shoved me with his elbow. Then I threw darts at him. Then he killed me

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: マオ Zedong always carried a halberd.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Make the halberd a heroic warrior (perhaps of scandinavian origin) who weilds this polearm - the most effective, brutal and vicious one - with great skill. He can use it to hook, pierce and chop (the three strokes).

hints.author: adrenaline
hints.mnemonic: Mao (マオ) gets his head chopped off by a halberd.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Halberd

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: It looks a lot like child. Picture a powerful warrior cutting a child's head off with a halberd. You can see the head removed from the body and the slashing halberd.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [tender; weakness; gentleness; softness] Love me tender, Love me perfect, Never cheat on me. Or I'll impale you on my Halberd, And hang ya atop a tree...

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Use a halberd to tenderize a tree

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: I like my steak tender. That's why I impale it with a halberd and smash it against a tree to tenderize it.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The poor warrior wanted to eat a tender steak but all he could find was a slab of wood. He chops at and beats at the wood with his halberd until it becomes tender so that he can imagine eating a tender steak. Primitive placement

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Seeing all the children he orphaned, the now tender knight hung his halberd up on a tree, permanently.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: It is with the halberd he holds that the taskmaster exerts his power over those actually performing the task.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: So many video games have a "boss" stage you must pass in order to advance to the next level. Here, your task is to use your halberd to beat the taskmaster with the huge, bulging muscles.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: The most powerful taskmaster knows how to multi-task. Here he's given himself the impossible task of halberd sparring with one arm, and muscle building with the other - and he's succeeding!

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: A first RPG task--not even a full quest, just a task some random dude gives you (you always have to start off with some stupid weapon and go kill some other random dude, for no reason). Here, take this halberd I happen to have lying around. Now go kill the taskmaster and his hired-muscle UNDERling.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Your task is

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: This fog is the perfect weather for us to perform our task undetected.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: FOG is easy to associate with the RAIN primitive. So think of FOG as a type of RAIN that is slow at the TASK of getting the place wet.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Rain's task is to get rid of the fog.

hints.author: rganymede
hints.mnemonic: In Persona 4, your task is to rescue people before rain falls and the fog sets in.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Rain + Task

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: Am I the only one who took this as penis and balls? In order to be in the man-squad, naturally you need to have two balls with your "spear" in the middle there.

hints.author: shirahime
hints.mnemonic: Here we have two kings trying out for the cheer-leading squad. A spear on the floor separates their dancing areas.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: King Leonidas from the movie 300 throws his spear at Xerxes (the Persian king) trying to kill him as his squad of spartins make their last stand.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: If you have a SPEAR and TWO BALLS you have no business being on a cheerleading SQUAD.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: A long SQUAD of men carrying SPEARS keep the two rival KINGS separated, so that they won't fight.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: A female warrior returns home from battle. Her husband takes away her spear to symbolize the end of fighting and gives her a broom and an apron. “Boy, this is some kind of HOMECOMING,” thinks the veteran. (Adapted from johnskb).

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Our high school theme was tradition. They gave the homecoming king a spear and the homecoming queen a broom and apron.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Well, the boss man warrior upon his homecoming has set aside his spear. Remember the lady (#1151 婦) (who put aside her broom and apron)? I wonder what they're doing now?

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: A veteran returns home from battle. The village chief takes away his SPEAR to symbolize the end of fighting and gives him a BROOM and an APRON to begin his new career as a hotel maid. “Boy, this is some kind of HOMECOMING,” thinks the veteran.

hints.author: endote
hints.mnemonic: At the homecoming, the man drops his spear, while the women drops her broom and removes her apron. Cherishing the moment that they are reunited.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings

hints.author: stshores24
hints.mnemonic: I have a BOW made from a SNAKE that I BOUND UP. He sure wasn't happy!

hints.author: Earthlark
hints.mnemonic: Http

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: Picto

hints.author: bokuzukuri
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph, see book.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Put a walking stick in the bow and pull it back, ready to fire at the geezer.

hints.author: eugs51
hints.mnemonic: This is actually a bow and an arrow. (Real origin of this kanji). Pull and release to fire!

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Legolas catches Frodo pulling on his walking stick. I'll let you decide what that means exactly.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: If you pull at the ends of a bow long enough, you'll deform it to make a decent walking stick. This was a tactic used by injured archers to escape battle.

hints.author: dilandau23
hints.mnemonic: This is the story of Odysseus’ great bow, here we see it as the bow both strung(as bow) and unstrung(as walking stick). The challenge was given by Odysseus' wife (Penelope) to see who had strength enough to pull the bow and string it.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Perhaps a pictograph of a soldier's weapons--his sword and bow-placed ceremonially over his body before burial, while people offer their condolences.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Send your condolences to the old geezer whom you shot the walking stick into with your bow. (see pull (#1232 引)).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Don't confuse with reparation (#985 償), compensation (#476 賠). Condolences aren't monetary or physical; it's just a letter. "Dear wife, your bungling soldier husband tried to string his bow with his walking stick, which of course failed. He was promptly killed by enemy fire. Our condolences.".

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: A dead soldier's bow and walking staff unceremoniously delivered to his widow with a note

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: The enemy archer kills your friend. Then, seeing how upset you are, he mocks you by offering his condolences by using his bow and walking stick like a violin to play a sad song.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: If you pull the bow back with your elbow, you can shoot a vast distance.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: The valley was so vast that if you yelled elbow! you could hear it echo bow, bow, bow.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: This land is so vast, I have plenty of elbow room to pull on and shoot my bow.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Legolas pulls back his elbow so he can fire a vast distance. I think of the part of 'The Two Towers' when they are chasing the orcs who have captured Merry and Pippen. They were covering a vast area.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: In ancient times, feudal lords agreed on a method to fairly distribute land. Each lord would stand on the top of a different hill and shoot an arrow by pulling back on the bow at exactly the length from hand to elbow. The arrow's distance would serve as the radius of his new vast territory.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: An insect who can fly vast distances is strong.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: The vast majority of insects are pretty strong; ants can carry 10x their weight!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: There was once a legendary archer, who was known for being incredibly strong. In reality he was very weak but had a powerful insect friend who tugged on his elbow while pulling on his bow and arrow.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Legolas is so strong that he can even shoot down vast numbers of tiny insects at vast distances with ease.

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: When using a bow, you need a strong arm, and a steady elbow to hit an insect.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If I recline back, I can pull my bow open a little more and more.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: More and more bows were made to kill people, until they were laid down for better smaller guns.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: The bow dug more and more into the small of his back as he reclined on it. Will someone please tell the idiot to get up?

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Little Clark Kent, who was found reclining in his spaceship as a baby, grew more and more stronger over the years, and found he could fly as fast as an arrow shot by a bow.

hints.author: Corodon
hints.mnemonic: More and more archers shoot their bows while reclining a little. It's a very popular stance.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Two weak archers agree on a duel to the death. They constantly shoot at each other but never manage to hit their target. But what they lack in skill they make up in determination, and they keep shooting for hours, and days, and months, until it's wintertime and their bows are coated in ice.

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: BOWS with ICE on them are brittle and WEAK.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: I'm missing this Kanji too much, so here's another take

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Two bows with ice on them are still weaker than one bow without.

hints.author: Fangio
hints.mnemonic: These two archers are so weak it's just as if their bows were shooting feathers.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Weak people placed in the water start drowning. Get some strength in those arms and learn how to swim!

hints.author: nadiatims
hints.mnemonic: Weak people who can't hang onto the deck(DEKI) during a storm end up drowning.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Darwin awards

hints.author: n1williams
hints.mnemonic: After the Titanic went down in the WATER those who were WEAK soon found themselves DROWNING.

hints.author: kiwiburner
hints.mnemonic: You will begin drowning if you are put in the water when you are weak.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Re CharleyGarrett

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When his daughter used a lot of water for her shower, the father could practically see the dollar signs, so he was seething with anger.

hints.author: n1williams
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is more closely related to water and emotions boiling. Story

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: ivoSF
hints.mnemonic: I seethe (and not only from the heat)when i found out how many dollars one water bottle costs in this desert!

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: An expense is an expense, whether you put it in dollars or in local money.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: A dollar sign next to an amount of money denotes an expense.

hints.author: Fluhk
hints.mnemonic: Shell, one of the largest oil multinationals in the world, makes a lot of dollars in Nigeria, often at the expense of the local population.

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: There's always an extra expense involved when you try to convert DOLLARS into other MONEY (clams).

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: I drew up a monthly expense list, and the largest expense was me buying shells with dollar signs painted on top of them... what's wrong with me?

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: The No. 1 currency in the world is the dollar. But, the Asian nations are fast catching up and may in reality have already surpassed it. So, let the bamboo represent the No. 2 currencies (the yen, etc.). The reverse order (bamboo on top and the dollar on the bottom) is really a look at the future.

hints.author: WithLoveFromExIA
hints.mnemonic: The No.1 currency may at one time have been the dollar, but since the economic slowdown the weak dollar has been overtaken by currencies from bamboo growing countries. (Thanks to Johnnyltn for the idea.) Using the alternate writing of the dollar primitive as weak dollar.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Bamboo bling is the newest Asian Rapper, No. 1 on the charts right now.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The pole vaulter wants to be No. 1, so designs a bamboo pole with dollar signs painted on it. (The shape of a pole signifies this is the 1-stroke $).

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Even in the bamboo forests of Southeast Asia, the US Dollar is the No. 1 currency in demand. (well, it is true of Cambodia at least).

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Younger brothers are always more prone to mischief. Mine, you can almost see the little horns on him and the dollar signs on his eyes when he comes up with a money-making scheme.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: The younger brother was a horny dollar -chasing bastard.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: This is a picture of my stupid younger brother's tattoo. I can't believe he thinks a red dollar sign with devil's horns is cool.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: My horny younger brother is always pinching dollars from me for porn.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: Condolences for the freakish younger brother who was born with horns and a tail (the long diagonal stroke at the bottom).

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Adroit

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: To be adroit one must have mastered the crafting of snares.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: To be adroit is to have mastered the craft of avoiding snares.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: It's a spy movie and a trap has been set for our hero in an industrial factory. Our hero trips on a snare which sends a heavy metal I-beam swinging towards his head. He adroitly does a roll to safety.

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: The adroit McGuyver crafts a snare out of...um...nothing. I kinda wish this kanji had more primitives...

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: My nickname is "No Lips". Yep, I shouldn't have put my mouth on that bear trap...

hints.author: tony563
hints.mnemonic: When certain nickname snares to people's mouths, they will call you that way forever.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Also used in code, signal, password, etc. A password is the code you must mouthe to release the snare so you may enter safely. Most people just use their nickname (which is not recommended by security experts).

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Her mouth was a snare for cocks, so we gave her the nickname BJ Maxx.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: This guy talks too damn much! We nicknamed him snare-mouth. Once you get into a conversation with him, you're like a small animal who wants to escape but can't!

hints.author: volfy
hints.mnemonic: This snare isn't terribly effective, because it's swinging from a decaying tree. Imagine the tree as being so decayed that when an animal gets caught in the snare, its struggles cause the tree to collapse into a putrid mess.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+air,charley] Trigger

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: 枯 wither The decay of an animal in the TREE was from something caught in a SNARE.

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: Don't use wooden snares because, as the woodsman says, "They're prone to decay, and the catch gets away".

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Tree doesn't like getting chopped. To protect himself, he's set up a snare beside him. If anybody comes to chop him down, they'll get ensnared, and he'll just let them decay into nutrients that Tree will consume.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The hunter's boast

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: A dog owner boasts about how obedient, not how smart, his Saint Bernard dog is. "Why, my dog will even walk right into a trap if I tell him to. Watch!" With a single word, "go!", his dog obediently runs into a snare trap hanging from the ceiling. In a flash, the dog is netted tightly and swinging from the ceiling. Don't forget the ceiling!

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: When you boast too much, your words cause your head to become so big it gets snared on the ceiling.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: His large boastful words snared no one.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: I'm usually boasting when I say, "Yep, my big one usually snares the ladies." If only it were true...

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Your chin is the part of your head under your nostrils that forms the double snare that is your jaw.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Left side is crocodile primative. crocodile's head's most prominent feature is his jaw.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Both my friend's and my mouths dropped open when we saw a person's head snared up to the ceiling by his chin.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: Two mouths are attached to the ceiling with a long tongue hanging down ready to snare someone's head. This is why you should always have a positive attitude and keep your chin up (so you can avoid these kinds of things).

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: After I got my head caught in double snares, it looked like my chin had two mouths.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: A hunter Washes, with WATER, his TWO SNAREs, because they are dirty.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Washing your dirty snare in water, the extra line represents the water level as you submerge the snare.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: きtanai. Backwards き with drops of dirt coming off it.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: You should always keep two snares so that you can wash one with water when it gets dirty without interrupting your trapping.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Something dirty needs to be immersed in water. In fact it's so filthy you hold it by a hook. Note the water level marked across the hook.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: David went to battle with a slingshot and it only took him one shot to slay Goliath. Partly because of this, the prophet Nathan was later instructed to bestow upon David the throne of all Israel.

hints.author: eieneverafter
hints.mnemonic: In The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time, one of the first weapons bestowed on Link was the slingshot.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: High 5! And bestow me one low!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: A slingshot was but one of the items bestowed to the Dennis the Menace museum.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: I shall bestow you with "the one" slingshot.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: A crown was bestowed to the British royalty museum, but it was only a copy.

hints.author: pm215
hints.mnemonic: True fact

hints.author: narazumono
hints.mnemonic: A crown is bestowed upon each Burger King patron, why not? It's just a cardboard copy.

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: I actually knew this one, until Heisig's keyword threw me off. Heheh. It's the very part of the very familiar kanji for photograph

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: I think of the COPY of the CROWN that was BESTOWED upon David after he slew Goliath with ONE SLING.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Somebody was just looking for you. He had a longnose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. (greenapple,16-3-2006) The way to remember that this is somebody rather than someone (#1256 者) is that the story is full of body descriptions.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: Somebody was just looking for you. He had a long nose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Gang members sometimes mark themselves to show belonging, like by cutting their nose with a large slash mark. Why do they do it? To show that they are somebody. As a primitive, this character will mean gang member.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Somebody with a stick pierced through their nose just came in here. I think they were from the Brazilian rainforest.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 身体 somebody (#1248 身) シン, み ... Note

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The aim of shooting is to end up with a bullet stuck in someone's body.

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: Like paintball, GLUEball is another hunting game. You walk around looking for SOMEBODY to SHOOT a big blob of GLUE at, you know you have got him, because he gets stuck to the spot unable to escape.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: Skeet! Skeet! Skeet!.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: SOMEBODY put GLUE on my toilette seat, so I SHOT him!

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: Dick Cheney...

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: The famous speech by the man that Dick Cheney shot in the face

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: socrates says, "shoot first, apologize later".

hints.author: jonjimbo2000
hints.mnemonic: Say the words or I'll shoot. Apologize or I'll shoot. Say your sorry.

hints.author: alanj
hints.mnemonic: In the Wild West it's shoot first, apologize later, but in Japan the words come first - so polite!

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: An old man, wondering what it's like in a grave, sits in a freshly dug plot. When a gravekeeper mistakes him for dead and begins burying him with soil, the old man saves himself by flailing his walking stick in the air.

hints.author: aphasiac
hints.mnemonic: The dirty old man had a stroke so now he must be spoon fed.

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: Old man sits in the dirt, having a stroke.

hints.author: myglagata
hints.mnemonic: An OLD MAN in a Japanese nursing home must follow the rules

hints.author: nicjsb
hints.mnemonic: Old men soil themselves, have diagonal walking sticks, and must be spoon fed.

hints.author: kyldyyr
hints.mnemonic: Before shooting an old man with a slingshot, one shold carefully consider the possible consequences.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Even though he had the old man Mr. Wilson within the sights of his slingshot, Dennis the Menace considered what he was doing and stopped.

hints.author: Fluhk
hints.mnemonic: As a last resort, we actually might consider sending our old men into the battle, armed with slingshots only...

hints.author: dilandau23
hints.mnemonic: Think Rod Serling

hints.author: ihatobu
hints.mnemonic: Consider what would happen if we took the spoon away from the old man (#1251 老) and gave him a slingshot instead. (Creamed spinach all over the nursing home walls?).

hints.author: dilandau23
hints.mnemonic: This child has taken filial piety to the next level. He is actually carrying the old man on his shoulders.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: +dilandau23

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: In filial piety, the child looks up to the old man.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Filial piety requires a child to look after their old man when he becomes a really old man.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: In early Japan, filial piety was the cornerstone of education, and harsh taskmasters were employed to teach it.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: You could say that the taskmistress is teaching you filial piety when she whips you and asks, "Who's your daddy?!".

hints.author: Christoph
hints.mnemonic: Can you please teach me what filial piety means, taskmaster?

hints.author: etpan
hints.mnemonic: Under the 3rd Reich, Hitler's schoolmasters used to teach children that filial piety is less important than the fatherland. Kids ended up denouncing their parents to the regime.

hints.author: aphasiac
hints.mnemonic: In Nazi Germany, hitler made every school teach the concept of filial piety, as it was important to his dreams of an Arian race.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: In Torture 101 class they teach you to Consider the Fingers as the first part to inflict pain to. Then you can move on to other parts (like feet, groin, head, etc. etc. ; ) ).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: "Aaaargh, stop!" cries the victim of torture, his fingers being squeezed by the thumb screws. "I'll consider it," the torturer says coolly, "if you tell me the names of all the agents in your organization.".

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Pulling finger nails is considered to be the most common kind of torture.

hints.author: woodwojr
hints.mnemonic: Down in the interrogation room, the suspect's fingers are, one by one, slowly bent back, broken, and then crushed, one by one; he's given some time to consider confessing. It's uncertain whether the interrogators even care that torture rarely yields reliable information.

hints.author: peterlasky
hints.mnemonic: Dick Cheney was considering having prisoner's fingers broken (after the waterboarding). But he doesn't consider that to be torture.

hints.author: Shizuru
hints.mnemonic: I find the best way of memorizing this kanji is in conjunction with the Japanese compound for ninja

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Back in the day, the old man used to be someone. His name was in the papers and all that. I use CHUCKY from the movie Child's Play as my major alternate meaning for this primitive.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: An old man is someone who has seen many days.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The old man who desperately wanted a son (sun) was Gepetto. He just wanted someone to love. As a primitive, this character will mean Pinocchio.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: [aircawn] Back in the day, the old man used to be someone. He was famous for being the world's number one puppet manufacturer. (let the "one" be your way to differentiate this between the kanji for 'somebody').

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: I had a hard time with the next several frame numbers trying to use "puppet." So i thought of "voodoo doll" but then found "love doll" (which is just a special type of puppet) fit well with these 8 frames. Observe

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: There is a lesser known voodoo practice of boiling a puppet over an oven fire, to really make your victim feel the heat!

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: Instead of puppet I like to think of "someone" as ninja (since it is the second kanji in ninja)- it made me think of some interesting stories. First up

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: I boil my love doll (thanks decamer0n) over oven fire to disinfect her because somebody might have "used" her before...

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Instead of puppet, I use Chucky. Chucky is being boiled to death over a fire at the end of one of the movies.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Here I am, putting a wreath of flowers on my love doll's head and pretending she is someone of great renowned.

hints.author: trikatu
hints.mnemonic: This someone is so renowned they are covered with flowers every time they perform on stage.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: The most renowned ninja can use even flowers to kill someone.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If you put flowers on your voodoo doll that person will become renowned.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: People throw flowers on the stage after Pinocchio performs his act for the renowned evil puppeteer guy.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: I've always wanted to use bamboo chopsticks to eat sushi off a naked woman. Unfortunately, there is no woman in my life, so this love doll will have to do.

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Bamboo, lovedoll

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: This ninja uses bamboo chopsticks to fight enemies.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: Times are tough. And since Pinocchio is made from bamboo, his master sells him to the disposable bamboo chopsticks factory.

hints.author: HolyKotor
hints.mnemonic: In the Japanese version of Chucky, his preferred method of killing is with bamboo chopsticks.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Before giving your SIGNATURE to accept the LOVEDOLL, you should EYE over the LOVEDOLL for any damages, then give your SIGNATURE.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: The ninja's signature move was to paralyse people just by looking in their eyes.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Someone looking askance at my love doll's signature on a waiver of liablility...

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [signature; govt office; police station] Signature? Forget it! Retina scanners (using our eyes as signature) will empower governments to find someone in any soil, any day, rendering all of us like puppets!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The character also means "public-service office or station" (tax office, police station, ...). I'll use this to distinguish the kanji from other keywords like "inscription" that suggest a written name. Here I have a public-service station where residents can get a new signature, in calligraphy form. There are two sizes

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Ahh, a fine sultry day with my love doll under the hot sun. I think she's getting a tan!

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: [from decamer0n] This is the kanji for atsui ( 暑い ) as in hot. If you've ever been in Japan in the summer no doubt you have heard hoards of people bellowing "Atsui! Atsui!" Here you are laying with your love doll under the hot sun. Luckily the manufacturers were smart and when the doll got to hot it would bellow "Atsui! It's so sultry!".

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Ever wonder why ninjas only operate at night? It's to avoid the sultry sun of course!

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: You make a voodoo doll in your own image and set it down under the sun, on a deserted tropical island so you can feel the benefits of sultry weather all year round.

hints.author: nebusoku
hints.mnemonic: On even the most sultry days, Pinocchio can stand under the hot summer sun and it doesn't bother him one bit because he's made of wood!

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Because i get tired of saying the same old thing, I have lately been trying to use various terms of endearment to my love doll. I think she appreciates it too.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: When you pull the string at the back of Chucky, he will say various things. "Hidey-ho! Ha ha ha!" "Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?" "I'm going to eat your liver, bitch!".

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: The love doll can say various words such as " 気持ちいい " " 痛い " and "やめて!".

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: A ninja must be able to cope with various situations- like reciting word for word what he overheard while spying. (see the ninja clinging to the roof and spying on a conversation, preparing to recite what he heard later).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a wacky variety show on TV (i.e. talk show) where puppets are invited to talk about various topics. Here I use the expression "a variety show" to remember the particular keyword, and also keep it distinct from miscellaneous (#562 雑).

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: My love doll is made of special pheremone impregnated vinyl. Unfortunately, a pack of wild dogs mistook her for a wild boar and tore her to pieces. Oh dear!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (Image

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: The pack of wild dogs attacked the ninja, but he turned into a wild boar and gutted them all. (see the ninja snapping his fingers, cloud of smoke, and turning into a giant boar).

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Boar hunting has been quite popular but under pressure from PETA, the hunters had to replace the real boar with a mechanical puppet for the pack of dogs to catch.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Chucky is being chased through the long grass by a pack of wild dogs. He's looking behind him to see where they are until he runs smack into a boar. Now he had an angry swine to deal with... karma for being a murderer I guess.

hints.author: Talka
hints.mnemonic: I was stranded on a desert island surrounded by water for hundreds of miles on end. I wasn't upset though - I had my love doll! What a great strand of sand to be stranded on - just me and my love doll!

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: A lovely romantic walk on the strand, splashing in the water with my love doll.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The whale belches Pinnochio out of the water onto the strand.

hints.author: akahige
hints.mnemonic: There's a ninja here on this strand of beach. Can't see him hiding in the water? Can't see him hiding in the sand of the strand? Nope? He sees you, though...

hints.author: ruisu
hints.mnemonic: If someone's stranded, I hope they have water.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: When we gamble at the shell game, I always win against my love doll.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: People who gamble compulsively are like puppets controlled by money.

hints.author: Hyreia
hints.mnemonic: If you're worried about the drop above the sun, don't be

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Lots of shells are lost by Pinocchio when he gambles. He is a real poor gambler because everytime he tries to bluff, his nose grows longer!

hints.author: Corodon
hints.mnemonic: Some gamble with money. Ninja gamble with life and death.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: A gorge is where God has cut into a mountain with a pair of scissors. (synewave,6-10-2006) http

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: A gorge is where God has cut into a mountain with a pair of scissors. Nice pic mspertus!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A kid cuts a gorge into a paper mountain, with a pair of scissors.

hints.author: shinyclef
hints.mnemonic: Etymology of right half = 夾 (Type 1 Phonetic) (be pressed between). Interesting? gorge (#1265 峡) cramped (#1266 狭) sandwiched (#1267 挟). Very directly related to the meaning of these three kanji.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: For the radical on the right, I suggest using zipper instead of scissors (chosen by Heisig merely because it slighty looks like one), as I found it made this batch a walk in the park. What's more humorous than the image of a mountain gorge that can be opened or closed at will with a zipper?

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: In a CRAMPED space, a brave man holds off PACK OF WILD DOGS with only a pair of SCISSORS.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: A pack of wild dogs, waiting in a very cramped waiting room, to get their hair cut by Edward Scissors Hands, who is very popular.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: It's far too cramped on the train. You see that there is a guy with a pack of wild dogs, held only by a ribbon. You saunter up to him, and as the train doors open, you casually snip the ribbon with your scissors. Sensing that they are free, the pack of wild dogs spring into action and chase everyone on the car out, including their owner. A few people may get mangled, but hey, at least you're not so cramped anymore - in fact, you've got the whole car to yourself.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Pack of wild dogs in a cramped little room waiting to get a haircut from the barber (who uses scissors).

hints.author: shinyclef
hints.mnemonic: Etymology of right half = 夾 (Type 1 Phonetic) (be pressed between). Interesting? gorge (#1265 峡) cramped (#1266 狭) sandwiched (#1267 挟). Very directly related to the meaning of these three kanji.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 挟まる 【はさまる】 (v5r,vi) to get between; to be caught in; (P) Story

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Fingers sandwiched between a pair of scissors. Don't move or else!

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: In Tokyo trains, they've got a problem with chikan, or old men who "accidently" molest women while being sandwiched against them on crowded trains. So now, Japan has hired Edward scissorhands to cut off the fingers of the offenders. Being sandwiched together is no excuse for chikan!

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: (Being left-handed and always using right-handed scissors turned upside down) My fingers get caught/sandwiched in scissors' finger holes.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Hannibal Lector cuts his victim's fingers off with a pair of scissors and then serves them to him sandwiched between two pieces of bread.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Your cheeks contain your jawbones, which are known as the "scissors of the head.".

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: The Joker from Batman had his cheeks cut with scissors to give him that eternal smile. Now the Joker isn't right in the head.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Imagine using scissors to cut your cheeks off your head キョウ ほお ほほ.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: She grabbed the scissors and slashed at her assailant's head and right through his cheeks.

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Scissors, head

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Maestro, coattails flapping wildly, is being chased down the road by his fans.

hints.author: sleepyday
hints.mnemonic: This Kanji reminds me of Nodame Cantabile. I just have to imagine Chiaki, our maestro in training, getting chased by Nodame down the road.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Maestro primative = James Bond. Here he gives chase down the road to the bad guys. I'm thinking of the car chase in 'The Man with the Golden Gun' - NOT pursue (#539 逐). I think about 'Race N Chase' (a scalextric type toy)...there were no pigs in 'Race N Chase', only cars.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: I'm going to use Beyonce as the primitive meaning. She's a bit of a musical maestro herself AND she has an amazing butt, so all the bases are covered. Plus the radical looks like a 'B'! So this kanji is a pictograph of me chasing gorgeous Beyonce down the road. Mmm, Beyonce! (drool). 追う おう run after, drive out; 追い付く おいつく overtake, catch up (with); 追放 ついほう banishment, exile; 追加 ついか supplement, addition.

hints.author: jslindst
hints.mnemonic: I use Bond for the Maestro (the primitive also resembles B). Here you see James Bond being chased on a road.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: The maestro lives on top of a large hill so that he can play music at over ten decibels without anyone giving a damn.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: Note to those who have not got this far in the book

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: James Bond is planning a surprise attack on the enemy. He's sitting on top of a hill, overlooking where he expects the enemy to go by. He checks the hand of his watch (the needle), noting that there are ten seconds left before the enemy arrives.

hints.author: Gaignun
hints.mnemonic: Ludwig van Beethoven, the famous and famously irascible maestro, moves to the largest hill he can find in Vienna. At 10^10 feet above sea level (a ridiculously impossible height), he can compose his tenth symphony in peace. Unfortunately, death takes him before he completes it. Do not confuse with hillock (#1039 塚) or hill (#1329 丘).

hints.author: abdwef
hints.mnemonic: James Bond carefully balanced the large hill on top of the needle.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: A maestro in a large auditorium with high ceilings is conducting his orchestra of expert musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his towel to wipe his brow.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Maestro is such as expert, he can conduct even with a towel hanging from the ceiling in front of him.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: The maestro hangs the towel from the ceiling. He's not only a brilliant conductor but an expert in acoustics.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: James Bond is an expert at wearing one towel. Think of all the shower scenes. I also think that there is at least one (s)expert scene per Bond movie.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The maestro is such an expert, he throws his towel to the ceiling, conducts the performance, catches it on its way down and wipes his brow.

hints.author: happychair
