hints.mnemonic: The COMMANDER is a military MAESTRO who never throws in the TOWEL.

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: I like to recall commander in conjuntion with expert. Both are maestros with towels -- however, there is no upper limit (no ceiling) to what a commander can achieve in comparison to a mere expert.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: The greatest of them all; Commander James Bond, 007. Here he is the maestro of undressing women, removing the towel from some bond girl. Of course the towel symbolises her last vestige of resistance.

hints.author: dat5h
hints.mnemonic: Here we see James Bond as the ultimate Commander. In fact you can see him command-her to take off that towel and it just falls off without a second thought.

hints.author: thelooseteeth
hints.mnemonic: Beyonce make a controversial military commander as she goes into battle dressed only in a towel!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: No one likes classical music anymore. Our Maestro is here at home without his baton sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a bureaucrat.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: Bureaucrat, def

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Life as 007 is quite dangerous. Ready for a new life, we see James Bond trading in his gun so he can stay at home. Here he is sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a bureaucrat. [dingomick].

hints.author: swiftman
hints.mnemonic: Bureaucrat = the letter "B" beneath the "roof" of the House of Representatives ... writing legislation.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: Here we see Bond sneaking into a bureaucrat's house, to steal the latest information from the Russian government. But he no longer has his gun....

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: An excellent use of wood is to make coffins for bureaucrats.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The maestro at home was sick of being a bureaucrat, so he got some wood and built himself a coffin and got in.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The coffin must be constructed only of the wood of certain trees. It's the sort of rule that only a bureaucrat would come up with.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: The wooden cubicle is the bureaucrat's coffin.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: You can't even die for free these days. It's impossible to get a wood coffin without a bureaucratic muddle.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Japanese bureaucrats send all their messages through an inter-office bamboo pipe system.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: "The Japanese internet is a series of bamboo pipes" said one ignorant bureaucrat trying to draft Internet legislation.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: Contrary to popular belief, more bureaucrats smoke, you know what, with Bamboo Pipes than any other social group. I imagine a dull salary man (as the japanese say) with a collection o pipes at home.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, bureaucrats only smoke from bamboo pipes. They're "too good" for cigarettes.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Japanese version of the board game CLUE

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Luke, I am your father. Darth Vader (really surprised nobody put this one up before

hints.author: sleepyday
hints.mnemonic: Not to confuse anyone, but I think if you put your mind to it, you can see the image of a father here. The first two strokes take on the form of his eye brows, and the third and fourth stroke make up the nose and mustache.

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: It is a pictograph of your dad tying his tie!

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: My two gay fathers. The Sitcom (really surprised nobody put this one up before

hints.author: vengeorgeb
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of father. http

hints.mnemonic: Luke, I am your father. Darth Vader (really surprised nobody put this one up before

hints.mnemonic: Not to confuse anyone, but I think if you put your mind to it, you can see the image of a father here. The first two strokes take on the form of his eye brows, and the third and fourth stroke make up the nose and mustache.

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: It is a pictograph of your dad tying his tie!

hints.mnemonic: My two gay fathers. The Sitcom (really surprised nobody put this one up before

hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of father. http

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Your father uses his legs to stop himself from being put in a metal cauldron.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: Whilst on holiday, my father was captured by cannibals and put in a metal cauldron.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 釜飯 , 茶釜 , 釜茹で , 電気釜 , お釜 , cauldron (#2332 釜) かま ... Parts

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: Father keeps his gold in a cauldron (he's a leprechaun).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Picture some witches around their cauldron. They are making a magic brew to bring back their long-departed father. It works, kind of. The cauldron turns into their father, but unfortunately it’s just a metal statue of him (prob because the cauldron was made out of metal too).

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: Even though your FATHER is an old man, he can't give up his party lifestyle. Once a week he still dons his cool TOP HAT (well, it was cool 40 years ago) and goes out on the town to MINGLE with the ladies. This is a pretty common thing in Japan, where old motherfuckers still think they can pick up 19 year old girls.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Darth Vader tries to mingle with his troops. He even weares one of the helmets of the stromtroopers. (one of them laughs

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: My father puts on a top hat and tries to mingle.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The father of a poor family is trying to mingle with the high society, hoping to build up some good relations and maybe find some help. This is why he's wearing a very high class top hat.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Father = Bill Cosby. Here, Bill Cosby has put on his top hat and is going to mingle with some old jazz legends, like he tends to do on his show.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Mingling with the powerful can bring you success, bypassing the need for any merit.

hints.author: ashman63
hints.mnemonic: There is great merit in mingling with the powerful.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Once again Heisig makes a keyword that doesn't make much sense. The real meaning is effect/efficacy (take your pick). My dad tried out both wearing a top hat and doing some body-building for his muscles to see which was more efficacious .

hints.author: robertmyers
hints.mnemonic: Father explained to me that the top hat merits attention because it signifies power...with the crowd that matters.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: I'm the only one that instead of [mangling... powerful] sees [six... メカ]? All muslims should visit the Meca at least once in their lives, and many stop there. So, if anyone has visited the Meca six times, that has merit!!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, contrasting crowds

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Our world of today, cars mingling on busy streets, is in stark contrast to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would mingle on the streets.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: So Darth Vader tried to mingle with the earthlings, wearing his top hat. People were willing to forget his suit, but the Deathstar parked next to the other cars. Its a big contrast you know.

hints.author: Haych
hints.mnemonic: People mingle at parties. In contrast, cars mingle in traffic jams.

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: All the CARS MINGLING at the intersection ( 交差点 ）contrast sharply with each other - expensive porches next to old bombs, red next to green, huge SUVs towering over little Minis....

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: The schools that accepted them were posted on a TREE, the students MINGLED around trying to find their names. (コオ）.

hints.author: JetSetArnett
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Ninja school exam

hints.author: akahige
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: cornrow
hints.mnemonic: I "WOOD MINGLE", but I have an exam. Ha ha ha.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Captain Ahab lost his leg to the great white whale's mouth and had to mend it with a peg leg.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: I'll use my mouth to mend your leg, I'll kiss it all better

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: zwarte_kat
hints.mnemonic: I'm gonna mend your mouth with my 3rd leg ;).

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: I picture Seamus, the peg-leg sailor from Family Guy. He only has a mouth and a bunch of mended limbs.

hints.author: akira
hints.mnemonic: You stimulate a person by giving him a kick.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Mr T, ever the optimist, is trying to stimulate Capt Ahab's wooden leg by rubbing it down. Capt Ahab normally wouldn't let anyone do that, but he appreciates Mr T's stimulating conversation.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: I know a girl with a wooden leg who is only sexually stimulated when I chop it with an axe and call her my dirty little pirate.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is such an incredible masseuse that he can even stimulate a wooden leg. "I pity the peg that don't feel like a leg!".

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T stimulates the hot pirate girl's wooden leg.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I felt a finger on my leg as someone tried to nab my wallet.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Fingers nabs Davy Jone's wooden leg

hints.author: bej001
hints.mnemonic: We almost nabbed the pirate. I had my FINGER on his WOODEN LEG.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 捉える =捕らえる, 捕捉 , 捉まえる =掴まえる=捕まえる=摑まえる,nab (#2260 捉) ソク( 足 ), とらえる, つかまえる ... Parts

hints.author: perrin4869
hints.mnemonic: This kanji shows someone jumping to nab a pirate by his wooden leg with his fingers.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: You can step a long-distance if you have a leg that's gigantic!

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: You can step a long-distance if you have gigantic wooden legs (stilts).

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Capt Ahab chases a gigantic, one-eyed (if you take Moby Dick a bit more literally), monster over a very long-distance.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Anything we might consider long-distance would be a truly gigantic distance for someone with a wooden leg.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: My ex-girlfriend suffered a car accident and had her leg amputated. Ever since the accident, she's been completely irrational. I had to break up with her, so I drove out a few states away and called her from a public phone. Naturally she flipped out, and out of nowhere came this gigantic wooden leg aimed straight at the telephone booth. Thankfully I jumped out before the leg pulverized the phone booth, but good thing I broke up with her with a long-distance call instead of in person.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: When pirates try to hide, it's always easy to find them. Their wooden legs leave distinctive prints, showing where each is hiding and the exact path he took.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: I have a wooden leg for each type of path. One with a rubber stopper at the end for absorbing shocks on paved paths, and one with a wide foot to distribute weight better on mud paths.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: On the path to becoming a pirate, each one must gain a wooden leg.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: each leg of the Tour-de-France race has its own path.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Each person must walk their own path...even those with wooden legs. 道路 (どうろ)

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: After the rain the path was covered with dew.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: A lame Mountain Dew commercial

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: The path is always so wet with dew in the early hours that everyone assumes that it had rained.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Dew forms on the path least weathered.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: Dew becomes rain from the path of the gods. When the gods walk along their path, dew drops shake loose and fall to the ground as rain.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: A turtle with a wooden leg needs to hop to get around.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: A girl with a wooden leg always wanted to play hopscotch with the other girls, but every time she tried to hop she'd lose her balance and injure another girl. That's why the other girls make fun of her and see her presence as a portent to injury.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Captain Ahab's peg leg is so sensitive to Moby Dick's presence that when Ahab starts hopping around the deck, it portends trouble.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Don't hop! Because it's a portent that in the future you will have a wooden leg.

hints.author: SimHuman
hints.mnemonic: Mario can hop on every turtle (Koopa) except Bowser. If he tries hopping on Bowser, he'll end up with a peg leg.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Well, there are weekdays weekday (#576 曜) and there are laundry days laundry (#577 濯), and on February 29th leap day, the manufacturer recommends servicing or replacing your peg leg because they tend to wear out every 4 years.

hints.author: pm215
hints.mnemonic: [Story for people following katsuo in making feathers+turkey a 'futon' primitive] If you're going to leap from a high place, better hope there's a futon below -- otherwise you're going to break your leg at the very least...

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: marydj
hints.mnemonic: The turkey with a peg leg is trying to leap across the canyon. He flaps his wings wildly and feathers  fly but he doesn't make it.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: I've always imagined a leap involving one leg instead of two, which would be a jump. Using your only good leg for propulsion, not the pegleg, you try to leap over the canyon. Even with the aid of feathers, you fly like a turkey and fall like stone. This is very Roadrunneresque.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The pirate with the wooden leg chased after the parade float and was run over by the next one, leaving tread marks all over him and his leg.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Pirates must tread carefully when walking on parade floats, so as not to break through the weak plaster with their wooden legs.

hints.author: Christoph
hints.mnemonic: Did Jesus actually tread on water? or maybe his wooden leg just allowed him to float.

hints.author: zz_alex_zz
hints.mnemonic: At our natsu-matsuri they fixed auto-powered moving wooden legs to the parade float. It looked like a big festival insect and it was all great until it started going crazy and began to tread on all the little Japanese kids... I can still hear them screaming in terror.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: trikatu
hints.mnemonic: You have to watch your step when moving your leg on a watery day.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: So, we've walked on the moon, but it's going to take a pirate with a wooden leg, with a huge supply of cooling water to land on the sun and take that "one small step for a man".

hints.author: wazato
hints.mnemonic: Use Floatingweed5's story, except, to remember the positioning of water and sun, picture the pirate pouring water into his mouth with a wagging tongue. How refreshing while doing his step aerobics.

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: The peg leg pirate, wanting to get fit, signs up for some step aerobic classes. Here is is clutching his bottle of water and stepping up and down from his step platform in the island sunshine.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: This is better remembered as "step on" or trample. I picture a puddle of water with the sun reflected in it (to get the water above sun positioning), then you step on the puddle with your foot to trample the image.

hints.author: fightswumbrellas
hints.mnemonic: Footprint

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: The trail of the wooden leg religion was very easy to follow, since all its followers have wooden legs.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Footprint

hints.author: Phlail
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: CasualTatsumaki
hints.mnemonic: The disappearance 失踪 しっそう of the pirate, leaving nothing but footprints and a wooden leg, inspired a strange new religion about Bluebeard's resurrection and ascension.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Your body meat is attached to the bone joints of your skeleton.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the skeleton. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams].

hints.author: Medialis
hints.mnemonic: The most awesome pictograph ever

hints.author: n1williams
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a king who died on his throne and was never removed. Since his SKELETON has no hair, ears, etc, the CROWN has slipped down past several bone JOINTS and rests amid other PARTS OF his BODY.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a skeleton wearing a crown and with flesh on just its bone joints. What a strange skeleton...

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Don't give water to a skeleton. When he drinks it, it'll sluice right through his bones, forcing you to put one of those "Caution - Slippery Floor" signs up on the resultant puddle.

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: Slippery surfaces are very dangerous for skeletons, since their bone feet slip easily... a few drops of water, and zweep! A large mess of bones to pick up and reassemble!

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: Caution

hints.author: dtcamero
hints.mnemonic: WET SKELETONS are notoriously SLIPPERY.

hints.author: Captain+Kanjipants
hints.mnemonic: Most slippery when wet signs show a picture of water to caution you. This one goes a little far by showing a skeleton laying in the middle of a pool of water.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: A skeleton is shuffling along the shoulder of the road, so you pull up next to him and ask where he is going. He says he's going to donate his marrow to the hospital because he got into some financial trouble and lost everything; his marrow is the only thing he still possesses.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: Did you know there are road ways in skeleton? Yeah, they are cool, they possess marrow.

hints.author: karmatheif
hints.mnemonic: Why didn't the skeleton cross the road? Cause he didn't have (possess) any guts (or marrow for that matter...) RTK2

hints.author: Monkeys_Spiders
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: A marrow transplant is needed, the skeleton possesses the marrow needed to ensure a fast road to recovery.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Continued from auspicious (#1088 祥). Once a year, the people pray for a sign from the gods. But if the gods are feeling particularly mischievous, they'll send down a jawbone to the altar. The people see this as a sign of calamity to come. The gods think of it as an amusing prank.

hints.author: Rivvie
hints.mnemonic: Truely a calamity for an undead wedding, just as he may kiss the bride at the altar, he loses his jawbone.

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: Bit of a calamity at the wedding. The bride tripped and broke her jawbone on the altar. Funniest home vids here we come.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Well, for Jawbone I think of Samson and his JAWBONE of an ass. So, Samson caused great CALAMITY at the Philistine ALTAR when he attack the priesthood with that JAWBONE of an ass.

hints.author: gopineapples
hints.mnemonic: The pope fell at the ALTAR and smashed his JAWBONE. Wine and blood everywhere. What a calamity!

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: Grampa's flushing the toilet, when his denture (Jawbone) pops out and gets sucked down the whirlpool!

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: A whirlpool is water opening its jaws to swallow anything whole.

hints.author: akimoto
hints.mnemonic: Jaws, the shark, sitting at the bottom of the whirlpool waiting for victims.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: A whirlpool of water in your jaw bone as you rinse your mouth after brushing your teeth (gara gara pe!).

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Charybdis (from "The Odyssey") opens her jawbones and creates a watery whirlpool.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: A metall pot with non-thermoconductive jawbones as handholds.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: A gruesome kind of cauldron that Snape might have used is a metal pot in the shape of a skull.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A jawbone is thrown in a metal pot to make bone soup.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Back before metal, people used other people's jawbones for pots.

hints.author: einahpets
hints.mnemonic: A metal なべ full of jawbones for dinner? No thanks...

hints.author: Talka
hints.mnemonic: Jaws XII~! Jaws strikes the highway! Man, they're really overdoing it now.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: In 'American History X' Edward Norton's character overdoes it when he makes the dude that tried to steal his car lie face down with his jawbone open over the pavement of the roadway and then stamps on the back of his head. My teeth still tingle when I think of that!

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: Grampa is in the old age marathon, but after a half mile on the road he is wheezing so hard he coughs up his dentures (Jawbone). Geez Grampa, don't overdo it man!

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: To pass the day grandpa decided to throw his jawbone (dentures) onto the road, and then sue (す) the next car that came along and crushed them. I know he's bored, but that's just overdoing it! NOTE

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: Don't overdo the running. Your jawbone will be hanging open, as you puff and pant your way down the road. 過ぎる すぎる pass, exceed; be too ~~ ; 過ごす すごす pass time, spend time or money, get through; 経過する けいかする pass, elapse, expire; 過程 かてい a process.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: If you're scared of Heights, you don't want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle. Primitive

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka Heights, the pinnacle of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with Anti-Osaka Heights signs.

hints.author: cefreddffo
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is only used in names and in "Osaka". By chance, last week my japanese friend told me that it used to be 大坂 (as in "slope"), but Hideyoshi, the Taiko, didnt want to have anything to do with "land" (his ascendance were farmers...) so he replaced the "earth" for what we call "pinnacle".　Its true. RTK2

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Just by changing the soil in slope (#723 坂) to a pinnacle you get to the Heights. If only reaching the top of Everest were this easy...

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Can you see Africa from The Pinnacle? I can! I can!

hints.author: alreadytaken
hints.mnemonic: A kinda pictogram

hints.author: saizen
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnacle of the Mt. Kilmanjaro imagine Chaka Zulu (famous African war commander) yelling at his troops, "are you an Afri-"can" or an Afri"can't?!" To get the pumped up for the next battle.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: It B-can in Afrikakakakaka...

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: You can see all of Africa if you can climb to its pinnacle, Kilimanjaro. "Can you see all of Africa now? Yes, I can.".

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: On occasian, rituals are held at the very tip of The Pinnacle.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Many rituals are practiced every day (blessing before meals, evening prayer, etc.) Only the peak rituals (wedding, Bar Mitzvah, etc.) qualify to be called an occasion.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The international penis matsuri at The Pinnacle is the biggest occasion of the year.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Wordplay (occastion->caucasian). The Pinnacle is a whites-only community, and is a favorite place for white-supremacy rituals. The motto of the Pinnacle

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: They usually do the A-ritual, but on a special occasion they do the B-ritual.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The officer at the gate to The Pinnacle with a giant badge sewn to his chest hinders all visitors. But not the handicapped. They're hindered enough already. They're given a badge and can pass right into The Pinnacle.

hints.author: Soseki
hints.mnemonic: The pinnacle of racism was that of the Nazis. They made the Jews wear a badge on their clothes to identify them. They hindered their every movement. Moreover the peace-loving Dutch all wore the badges so that the Jews would be unidentifiable. Effectively hindering the Nazi plot.

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnacle I was awarded a badge so big that it hinders my movement.

hints.author: nadiatims
hints.mnemonic: Getting to the PINNACLE of mount fuji is full of hinderances and you don't even get a BADGE at the top.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: When you visit The Pinnacle, they are so keen to make sure everyone knows who lives there and who's just visiting, so they force you to wear a massive badge that reaches from your neck to your knees, and hinders your movement substantially.

hints.author: to_nihon
hints.mnemonic: They won't let me in The Pinnacle, but I can see a little bit of sun through this little chink in the wall. Hmm, maybe I could make this chink bigger...

hints.author: steves
hints.mnemonic: There was only one chink in his plan. Even standing atop the highest pinnacle, standing above even the sun, the little man was still just as little as when he was under the sun.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Man those little chinks can do anything! They were the first to build rockets, and by launching one off the top of the highest pinnacle in China, one little chink was the first to ride above the sun, and see all the little chinks below!

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: In a wall at The Pinnacle, there must be a chink in the wall because I see some small rays of sunlight peepin' through, up there and down there.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Daedalus, a talented craftsman, attempted to escape from his exile, where he and his son Icarus were imprisoned. Daedalus fashioned two pairs of wings out of wax and feathers for himself and his son (you can see them flying in the sky, they are very small) However, Icarus did not listen to his father warning and flew too high - even above the sun! The wax melted and the wings got chinks. The end of this old story? Icarus crashed onto the pinnacles (small variation of the original story)...

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: [Image

hints.author: pjhoover
hints.mnemonic: This story is about lemmings. when the first takes a road that falls off a pinnacle, the rest follow as if possessed.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I fled to The Pinnacle for safety, but the demon followed me right up the road!

hints.author: b0ng0
hints.mnemonic: Those who possess a map of the road to the pinnacle are the best people to follow.

hints.author: dimi3
hints.mnemonic: You want to go to The Pinnacle? If you possess a pass, follow this road.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: In case of emergency, The Pinnacle has auxiliary guard dogs, but they keep them muzzeled until they're needed.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: When you climb the pinnacle you'll need to take a muzzle of auxiliary oxygen.

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: Make sure you've got the primitives and ordering down, so as to avoid confusion with 部 section (#1845 部) later on.

hints.author: unauthorized
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: When I see auxiliary I think of the "AUX" input on an amplifier. Imagine a PA system being used at a protest event outside the gates of The Pinnacle. The protester shouts into his PA system to get the attention of the decadent residents of The Pinnacle. The guardsman of The Pinnacle silences (muzzles) the protester by unplugging his microphone from the auxiliary jack of his amplifier. (Similar scene in Forrest Gump).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A kid is perched on a pinnacle with his piggy bank. He uses the coins to catch the sunshine, and redirect it into people's eyes, far below.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle is environmentally friendly. They collect solar power through sunshine on their piggybank shaped solar arrays.

hints.author: gibosi
hints.mnemonic: At the Pinnacle, they use solar collectors, sun piggy banks, if you will, to capture the sunlight.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: Mario SUNSHINE

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: The pinnacle catches the sunshine like a piggy bank catches coins.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Every morning at The Pinnacle, the residents line upon the East side for morning stretches and leisure.

hints.author: kadano
hints.mnemonic: Hikers line up to get to the top of that great pinnacle of the East... Mount Fuji. Seriously, they really do! ...probably the only mountain in the world with a queue at the top.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Modified dingomick's

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnacle of your studies, you'll be able to exhibit your knowledge of the kanji

hints.author: typosensei
hints.mnemonic: This is not "people in a line". This is "a line up" like a line up of shows or performers. @gavmck At The Pinnacle they are having an exhibition of Oriental art where you can see all kinds of amazing artifacts lined up.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A giant compass is The Pinnacle's self-defense system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to ward off the intruders.

hints.author: Johan
hints.mnemonic: To ward off enemies, the ancient Greece kept watch from the Acropolis, where they had a clear view in all directions.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: On the pinnacle you can see in every direction and can ward off attacks or invasions.

hints.author: ivoSF
hints.mnemonic: In the anime naruto, Neji Hyuga uses 2 techniques Byakugan and the Hakkeshō Kaiten to ward of any atack from any direction, the pinnacle of warding off.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle hotel employs cutting-edge technology to ward off spirits. They even have detectors that can tell you which direction the spirits are coming from.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: A sign was AFFIXED on the PINNACLE of the Acropolis so that tourists would ADHERE to the rules.

hints.author: xentropic
hints.mnemonic: Signs are affixed to walls in The Pinnacle to ensure tourists adhere to the rules.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle is firmly affixed to the top of the mount with bubble gum. (adhere (#1000 付)).

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: At The Pinnacle, they use the best quality glue to make sure things adhere properly. If you see a sign adhered to the wall of The Pinnacle, don't bother trying to steal it - it's firmly affixed.

hints.author: haole
hints.mnemonic: Being affixed is really the pinnacle of adherence.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Institution of The Pinnacle is perfect in every way. It is the new House of God, his chosen city.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: To reach the pinnacle of kanji perfect you need to attend the Heisig Inst.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: The Inst. of Kanji.Koohii. It's where we all try to get to the pinnacle of Japanese by perfecting our kanji writing skills.

hints.author: kanjiknight
hints.mnemonic: The Astronomical Inst. at The Pinnacle is the perfect institute to study stars as nothing blocks the view at that height. 病院 びょういん hospital.

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: The Acropolis is the perfect place for an Institute to study Ancient Greece.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: Paparazzi make camp outside of The Pinnacle in their cars, waiting for the celebs to come out.

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnacle of Mt. Everest, you can camp, but you cannot find a parking place for your car!

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: My grandparents think the pinnacle of cars is to have an RV camper- they go everywhere in one.

hints.author: tritonxg
hints.mnemonic: [FR]campement N1 JIN k&k

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Every regiment of The Pinnacle's army is lead by a Miss Piggy with a viking helmet on.

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: Every regiment of The Pinnacle's army has an animal name. This regiment is called "Horned Pig Regiment". They're wearing Wiking helms and are usually cowered in mud.

hints.author: tomtosh
hints.mnemonic: As the only female in her police regiment, Officer Pinnacle often endures sexist remarks from the horny male pigs she has to work with.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: After fleeing from horny miss piggy who tried to consummate (#540 遂), Kermit is now sitting on the pinnacle. But not for long, because Miss Piggy and her regiment are launching their assault!

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: Here we have a Pinnacle full of Horny Piggies to mean REGIMENT. Well, just the elements and shape give it away. The very lurid details that don’t need to be mentioned are always involved with REGIMENTS. They work very hard to get to the Pinnacle to get the high land and on the way, they act as though they are just Horny Piggies that rape and take away everything.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: One of the members of our air force regiment has been shot down; he managed to safely eject, but his plane crashed into the ground.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The regiment led by horny Miss Piggy wearing a viking helmet accidently falls off The Pinnacle and crashes into the ground below. // old story with wrong meaning of regiment

hints.author: Pangolin
hints.mnemonic: Horn-helmeted Miss Piggy and her regiment of Valkyries really believed they could fly just like real Valkyries (yeah, and pigs might fly) so they launched themselves from the parapet of The Pinnacle. Of course they crashed to the ground (soil).

hints.author: unicornpuddlefoot
hints.mnemonic: The parachute regiment crashed to the ground.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The Airborne regiment hit the ground in a crash.

hints.author: wingedge
hints.mnemonic: "Sunglasses-missing-one-lens" is obviously the monocle. The proper, high-class way to descend The Pinnacle is wearing a monocle with your walking legs splayed to a full gentlemanly stride.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: After a cool, hip businessman angered the executives at The Pinnacle, they beat him up, popping out a lens from his sunglasses, and tossed out the window, head first, walking legs second. One executive later commented, "It was like he was descending into Hell from Heaven!".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: To descend from The Pinnacle you must walk down the stairs with your sunglasses-missing-one-lense on.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Used in 降りる 【おりる】（to alight or get off - e.g. from a bus). So here we have a tour bus arriving at the acropolis

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: A Yakuza member descending down from the pinnacle with limping walking legs and a lens from his sunglasses missing. He tried to break into the resort but the security threw him out.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: All buildings of The Pinnacle are multi-storey. They don't have much room, so they have to build up. It sucks when someone presses all the buttons on the elevator! You have to stop at each storey!

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Some stupid kid has pushed all the buttons in the elevator. As it stops at all storeys you reach a pinnacle of impatience. Finally you reach your storey, the last one, at the pinnacle of the building.

hints.author: b0ng0
hints.mnemonic: The pinnacle of a building is the sum of all the storeys.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: The second storey of the acropolis is the Laundrymopolis, where the elite Greeks meet to compare the whiteness of their sheets.

hints.author: Jaunty
hints.mnemonic: You're taking the elevator up to the pinnacle, and someone presses all the buttons, making everyone wait while it stops at every storey (thanks dingomick).

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: Your highness is the pinnacle of finesse compared to all of us commoners who are but like dirt on the ground.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: His Highness, the main man at the Pinnacle, often compares those who live outside the city's walls to dirt.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: One of the many talents of the highness of The Pinnacle is his astounding knowledge of soils. He can compare any two soil samples brought to him.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: We search high (pinnacle) and low(ground), and nothing compares to your highness!

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: "You're nothing but dirt when compared to me" said His Highness of The Pinnacle.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: America thinks it is the pinnacle of the world, looking down on all neighboring countries through its mirrored, aviator sunglasses.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: All the neighboring communities to the Pinnacle have a major problem. The kids at the Pinnacle have a habit of throwing down rice from the city walls in all directions, so people in neighboring communities are forced to wear sunglasses all the time in order to avoid getting rice in their eyes.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Tom Cruise (American with sunglasses) tried to get admitted to The Pinnacle but, with all the weird press, he was rejected and so now lives in a neighboring Scientology exclusive gated community.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle's neighboring mount is a place where they grow rice. They wear sunglasses since it's the sun's glare is so strong there.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle, to me, is a city that makes itself out to be perfect but is filled with dirty secrets that photographers are always trying to reveal (see dissolve (#1044 融) The city's councilmen have isolated all professional photographers to make sure they don't photograph these "dirty secrets". (which are up to your imagination).

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: The people of the pinnacle isolate themselves, dissolving any outside friendships.

hints.author: playadom
hints.mnemonic: Sadly, since the Pinnacle is isolated, they have no modern technology. Their only means of photography is an old camera. What's that? Forgot how old cameras work? Let me show you

hints.author: shimouma
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the landscape photographer, like Ansel Adams, isolated and alone at the pinancle taking pictures with his camera. (See zenkun's story for (FRAME 1044) dissolve).

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Do you remember the poor insect in dissolve (#1044 融)? Actually, it was not dissolved - it was beamed right into the pinnacle prison for committing the crime of disturbing a photographer preparing for a snapshot and now lives isolated until the end of its three days long life... (note

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The wheat farmer's heart is calm (#1147 穏) about the eagle not stealing his crops because of the broom scarecrow. But he still conceals all his wheat at The Pinnacle in case anyone else trys to steal it.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Move the broom with a vulture perched on top, and you'll find the concealed entrance to the heart of The Pinnacle.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: People of the pinnacle learned to conceal their nature with calm demeanors, though in their hearts they are vultures and witches (broom).

hints.author: etpan
hints.mnemonic: Kiki is back on her broom, she's being chased by vultures and she's trying to conceal herself. Her heart is still pounding, but instead of landing in a corn field, she decides to fly up to the pinnacle of the city.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Many treasures are concealed within the acropolis. Which is why it is guarded by vultures perched on brooms, ready to peck out your heart if you try to sneak in and steal them.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Any attempt to possess the pinnacle will degenerate into a land ("ground") war.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A degenerate doctor at The Pinnacle is doing illegal abortions. He's so sick he just throws the aborted fetuses onto the ground far below. And like a possess demon, he keeps some tied to his side on a belt as trophies.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle has degenerated into an group that just tries to possess as much soil as possible.

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle of the Roman Empire (as with many other empires since) degenerated as they just tried to possess more & more land. " like . . . . . . duh!('ダ') " // お.ちる / ダ duo4 타 (ta) 휴 (hyu).

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle possesses class and sophistication. By contrast, the land (soil) below is degenerate, and unrefined.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle is actually bound up by supports from olden times. Eventually, they give out, and the whole thing starts to collapse.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle is supported by pilings which were bound up in olden times. One day when the bindings rot away, the whole thing will collapse. (tweaking dihutensoa's story to work a little better for me).

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnacle of any society's development, being overly bound to rules from olden times leads to collapse (see Jared Diamond's Collapse).

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: The adventurers reached the pinnacle, and claimed the artefact which had been bound up since olden times

hints.author: genevere
hints.mnemonic: The collapse of the pinnacle society occurred after they were bound up in olden times beliefs and practices and thereby failed to progress.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A black hole is a "House of Infinity". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways "8", but here we have a Japanese "8" instead.

hints.author: zz_alex_zz
hints.mnemonic: Billiards anyone? House rules here state that the first person to pot the eight ball into the hole wins the game.

hints.author: montecristo73
hints.mnemonic: What good is it to buy a house with 8 holes in the ceiling? (The kanji for 8 also looks like water flowing from the ceiling.).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: I think of people playing on a mini golf course. One player is frustrated because the ball got stuck into a house (a small building decoration), and ends up doing a "hole-in-eight" instead of a hole-in-one.

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: I came home one day to find that termites had eight my entire house... nothing but a hole left.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The craft of creating a black hole is in creating an emptiness which can attract things.

hints.author: Ameyama
hints.mnemonic: Hole-craft is the way of making empty spaces, like the sky.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: The craft of making donut holes.....the middle of the donut is empty.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Hole-craft is the craft of making holes that are filled with emptiness or vacuum ( 真空 (しんくう)

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: HoleCraft, the new game from Blizzard, involves running around taking various items out of holes in the ground and bringing them back to your home base. The person with the most items after all the holes are empty wins. I'm already camping the game store for this release, can't wait. Been practicing by digging holes in my backyard, throwing various things in them and emptying them as fast as I can.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: With my fingers, I punch in my bank code and withdraw some money from my account. And now it's empty again, as usual!

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: If you find yourself in a fight with a karate master with no weapons or martial art skills, just your empty fingers, you should withdraw because 空手 (karate="empty hand") is more powerful than 控 (="empty fingers").

hints.author: senorsmile
hints.mnemonic: WITHDRAW your FINGERS from the cookie jar if it is already EMPTY.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: As in Aesop's fable

hints.author: shang
hints.mnemonic: This is a bit of an odd keyword choice from Heisig. "Withhold" would work a lot better considering how this kanji is used. As in restrain/hold yourself back ( 控える ) or withhold/deduct taxes ( 控除 ) or withholding a spare/reserve copy ( 控え ).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When you stab something you often leave a big hole.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The police have recruited a special breed of St. Bernard that can lick the wounds of a stabbing victim. The bleeding will stop instantly, saving the victim's life. One quirky side-effect, however, is that this treatment leaves behind a rather large hole...

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I stab your annoying St. Bernard and stare in shock at the giant black hole it leaves instead of a wound.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: There's a hole in that Saint Bernard -- somebody stabbed it.

hints.author: andresito
hints.mnemonic: A big stab leaves a big hole.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Most research scientists have 9 holes.....two nostrils, two ears, a mouth, and four eyes......

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: Scientiest are researching , and have already found nine black holes !

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The manager is doing research to find the holes in the opposing baseball team's strategy.

hints.author: leecha2
hints.mnemonic: When I saw this kanji I had the instant image of scientists throwing a baseball through a hole and noting the 'results'. I found that quite hilarious, but well, maybe it's just me.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Research has shown that 9 holes of golf can help alleviate stress.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: Sticking a plug up your hole will lead to stronger climaxes.

hints.author: Captain+Kanjipants
hints.mnemonic: I'm pretty sure Heisig wrote the whole book just so he could make this joke.

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: Here we have a Hole and Climax to mean PLUG UP. This is so butt-f**king easy, pun intended. If you PLUG UP her Hole, she will Climax.

hints.author: Danno
hints.mnemonic: I just think its hilarious how many stories are getting reported for this character. Come on!! what else could it be! How better to remember it ? Prudes please get over yourselves. If someone has a good story, just because you are easily offended, doesn't mean someone else( the majority ) won't find it useful. planning to be missionaries in Japan with all your Kanji skillz ? If you find this offensive...hahahaha. You will get a shock when you see your first KONBINI magazine shelf.LMAO..i gotsreported.

hints.author: penot
hints.mnemonic: My girlfriend plugs up her ちつ(vagina 膣) hole to climax! This Kanji's on-yomi is pronounced 'ちつ' (チツ) // zhi4 질 (jil) 절 (jeol).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This more commonly means "steal", like how a thief cuts a hole to steal the jewels.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: The word STEALTH makes me instantly think of Solid Snake, who CUTS a HOLE in a cardboard box so he can peer out of it.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Stealth bombers cut holes through the enemy radar.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: I picture a stealthy thief cutting a round hole in the glass window to quietly unlock it.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The new stealth bomber being developed by the US government is insane. Instead of flying under radar or disrupting it, it simply bypasses the whole thing. It cuts a black hole just above it with its nose, then disappears into it. Then it travels invisibly and instantly to its destination, then cuts another black hole into the sky and reappears. Only trouble is that they have to make sure not to enter or exit somewhere important - or they'll suck the whole place into the black hole.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: After Osama blew a hole in NY, the counterreaction forced him to yield and retreat into caverns.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In "The Empire Strikes Back", the Milennium Falcon flies into a large hole, of what they think is a cavern, because they don't want to yield to the forces of the Empire. Turns out it's not a cavern at all, actually...

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: The entrance to the cavern tavern is little more than a hole in the wall, but inside the place is such a maze of caverns that they have to stick a flag over the exit or you'd never find your way out.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: It seemed to be just a hole, but it did yield a wondrous cavern of stalactites and stalagmites.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Remember when they found Saddam Hussein in a hole and he finally yielded and exited holding a white flag? Wish they'd have found Osama in his cavern instead..

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A depression is a hole in the ground. Water naturally collects there which provides moisture for vines to grow.

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: The depression in the ground become a trap

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: The meaning of this character is an indentation in the ground, not emotional depression. It's best to avoid using the latter in your story because it will give you the wrong meaning (keep in mind the eventual goal is to read kanji and understand the actual meaning of them). This particular depression is a hole in the ground that collects water, and ivy is growing out of it.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: (WARNING

hints.author: coinbaahd
hints.mnemonic: This kanji reminds me of video games. There's a big sink hole in the ground that is now filled with water that you can swim in and vines growing all around that you can climb on.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: You have trouble squeezing your hand through the hole so you use a saw to enlarge it.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: (Thanks DrJones) You squeeze the teats of the cow with your fingers but it's your first try and you don't have any milk come through the holes, so you take a saw and cut the teats to make bigger holes. Poor cow, this story squeezes my heart.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Very simple visual image makes this an easy kanji to remember. Just picture that you SQUEEZE your FINGERS going through the HOLE in the handle of the SAW. You then SQUEEZE your FINGERS tight to use the SAW to cut a HOLE.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: To squeeze is to hold something tight (#2614 窄) in your fingers.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: Oh no! You cut a hole in your finger with a saw! Squeeze your finger to stop the bleeding!!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Be sure to put a hole in that ceramic sheep before you put it over the fire. Otherwise, it'll just explode in the kiln. (If you've never done ceramics before, it's important that the object have a hole in it, or this really will happen.).

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: You put the sheep in the hole of the kiln and turn on the flames.

hints.author: kodorakun
hints.mnemonic: True story

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Oh Boy! A craft project indeed! Thru the hole in the top of the kiln, put in the sheep you sculpted from clay. Turn on the fire underneath and voila!

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I kept forgetting the sheep in smithsonian's story, so just imagine the sound effects

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Hard up = nothing but your body, living in a hole, with just a bow to hunt for your food.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Somebody so hard up for cash, the volunteered to explore a black hole with nothing but a bow.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Ok, picture a HOLE (well, more a pit trap) that SOMEBODY (well, a hunter with a BOW) just fell in. He's dangling over the HOLE holding onto his BOW across it. SOMEBODY finds it's HARD to get UP out of the HOLE. That great visual image should grant mastery of this kanji.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: With the research to plug up a black hole going nowhere and funding slashed, (see research (#1320 究)), the team can not afford to launch any more probes due to the high cost of the fuel. Somebody, probably one of the hard up scientists desperately in need of more funding, tries using a bow to shoot a probe into the centre of the block hole -- and funnily enough it succeeds!

hints.author: aaronvanvalen
hints.mnemonic: A girl is so hard up for cash she lets somebody use her hole with a bow, it's a fetish-thing I guess; makes the guy hard and up.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: A pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting groped by perverts on the train. The fingers of course, a crown (her too short skirt) and her legs below (which to be honest are pretty thick like tree trunks).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: (based on gorgon's story) a pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting groped by perverts on the train. The fingers of course, a crown (her too short skirt) and her legs below. It's her own fault for wearing such a short skirt and causing the perverts to get wood!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: I don't know why, but this is a pictograph of someone groping about in the dark (with his fingers, obviously) for his beloved wooden paper punch.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: As esaulgd said, this kanji DOES NOT mean "touch" like 触る。 Here is my story

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: If the groper's "tree" goes up the girl's miniskirt too deep, he'll ejaculate fluid. (Sorry it's kinda coarse but it works.).

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Thrown in deep water, the Japanese School girl tries to reach a floating tree to save herself.

hints.author: tenken3
hints.mnemonic: Made a hole with a paper punch in a tree, so deep that water started flowing out.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Miss World (see Katsuo's note on grope (#1327 探)) is now hiding on a tree because now she is afraid of the deep water below.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: The gardner finds liquid oozing from a deep paper punched hole in the tree.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the axe planted on top of a hill.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: At Capitol Hill proposals get axed on the floor.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This is Faeries Hill (the kingdom of faeries is said to live under the hills, as in english myths) where a lumberjack mysteriously disappeared. At the top of the hill is an axe planted in the floor, left there by the faeries as a warning to anyone else who would be fool enough to go up the hill to gather wood.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: I climbed to the top of a hill but didn't have a flag so I stuck my axe in the ground in order to mark my momentous ascent.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: I like to c-hill-ax on the floor.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A point is a extra little hill at the top of a mountain. We'll call it 'Fireman's Point'.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This actually means a high mountain. So, to cater to the keyword, it's surely obvious (ahem) that if something gets such a fine title as Point, it must be more magnificent than the average mountain. It's as if there was a hill on top of an average mountain, adding to its height.

hints.author: Pauline
hints.mnemonic: There's a movie called "The Englishman who went up a hill but came down a mountain". The story is that English cartographer says that the mountain near a Welsh village is actually a hill (too low for a mountain), but the locals decide to make it a mountain (by making it higher). Let's say that in the end the hill got the title Point to mark it as a mountain.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: I chopped off the point of the mountain with my axe. Now it is just a hill.

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: At some point, a hill becomes a mountain.

hints.author: hirai
hints.mnemonic: Listen up soldiers! We're going to take that hill. You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with animal legs! Got it? Animal legs! Now take that hill!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: The hill is so steep that you almost have to have animal legs to walk on it. However, the soldiers have no problem because they've been trained to march there.

hints.author: tk2000
hints.mnemonic: Army ant soldiers climb up a hill with their mighty animal "insect" legs to battle the grasshoppers.

hints.author: nishur
hints.mnemonic: Soldiers specially designed for combat in the hills have got their lower body replaced by that of a mountain goat. Picture them hopping up the hills like silly little centaurs with their new animal legs!

hints.author: LorenPaul
hints.mnemonic: Soldiers use an axe as a tool of war!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Seacoast -> Coast Guard -> "water soldiers" lined up on the seacoast defending our shores.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Normandy after the strikes on the beach. The water of the entire seacoast dyed red with the blood of thousands of soldiers.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Water and soldier. Letters from iwojima. The seacoast scattered with soldiers, floating in the water.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: The seacoast is where the marines assault. Marines are water soldiers. 浜 (はま)

hints.author: Aldain
hints.mnemonic: In the time of the "sakoku" (from 17th to 19th centuary) japanese was isolated. Soldiers at the seacost had to watch out that nobody enters he water.

hints.author: lerris
hints.mnemonic: I also went with Spiderman. However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I've opted to use a similar character

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: You'll be seeing this one a lot. Seriously.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: On left with nothing on top of it --> SPIDERMAN. everywhere else....SPIDERPIG.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I'll stick with Spiderman. He's a very memorable character, and don't forget that he can shoot strings from both arms. What happens to the relative primitive when Spiderman comes along? If you can clearly picture his threads winding, pulling, yanking, sticking to, filling, tying, and strangling objects, then you'll never confuse this primitive with another one.

hints.author: aphasiac
hints.mnemonic: Hate to be pedantic, but it's spelt Spider-man, not Spiderman. Stan Lee added the hyphen to differentiate him from Superman..

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman weaves his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.

hints.author: akimoto
hints.mnemonic: Play the kazoo magically and the thread will weave itself.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's housemate insists on playing the kazoo every night, despite Spiderman's protests. Eventually, Spiderman can't bear it anymore and weaves a tight web around his housemate's face to prevent him from playing the kazoo. 織布 (しょくふ)

hints.author: zwarte_kat
hints.mnemonic: When spider-man weaves threads, they sound like kazoos when they shoot out his arms. When you imagine it, it's quite funny.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman weaves his threads using a kazoo as a shuttle.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: After a day being virtuouos and keeping the city safe, Spiderman's outfit is in need of some repair. Luckily, as he can shoot out threads darning is very easy for him to do.

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: Darning is too obscure a word for me, I prefer to just think of it as repair. And obviously, repairing someones broken cloth things is a virtuous thing to do, and you need thread to do it.

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is of course virtuous and spends a lot of time darning his costume after battles so that his privates don't show.

hints.author: akimoto
hints.mnemonic: Darning socks instead of buying new ones shows the virtousness of the person - it exhibits the Japanese virtue of thrift (the Meiji emperor would refuse to buy new boots, constantly having them repaired. The Showa emperor would refuse to buy books he wanted because he "couldn't afford them.").

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: The thread is too virtuous for damning; it can only be used for darning.

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: After spending the night at an inn, spider man discovered to his dismay that his costume had shrunk in the wash, and no longer fit!

hints.author: Wosret
hints.mnemonic: Don't let the Inn wash your threads, they will shrink them!

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman spends the night at a traditional Japanese inn (#995 宿), to spend time with his friend Mr T snorting cocaine under the ceiling. Alas, that's not cocaine, it's one of those magic mushrooms from Alice in Wonderland. Spiderman and Mr T start to shrink.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: To fit 100 people in one house you have to shrink until you're as thin as threads.

hints.author: kazelee
hints.mnemonic: After spending the night at a cheap inn, spider man discovered to his dismay that his costume has been shrunk in the wash, and no longer fits! Perhaps now here will stop getting cheap Inn cleaning service. ;).

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Important

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Venom is covered in a luxuriant and surprisingly clever symbiotic suit, but it's also the taskmaster for his every evil act.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Every taskmaster's threads are luxuriant, made with only the best fabrics in all the brightest colours.

hints.author: spleenlol
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is 1337 ^^.

hints.author: Kurenai_no_Buta
hints.mnemonic: Key word is luxuriant (abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation; teeming). Venom uses his cleverness to create a luxuriant garden, teeming with luxuriant vegetation, in a bid to lure Mary Jane into his clutches. (Thanks esaulgd.).

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When Spider-man does his amazing vertical wall climbing, a throng of photographers accompanies him to get a good shot of the action.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: You may only accompany spiderman if you're able to climb buildings vertically.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: True vertical can be found by hanging a plumb line - a thread accompanied by a weight.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: When Spider-Man goes vertical, it's very hard to accompany him.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: When you are facing a vertical climb, it is best to be accompanied by some good, strong thread.

hints.author: perrin4869
hints.mnemonic: This kanji shows Spiderman giving a dress of the finest thread to his girlfriend. Of course, the real purpose of the gift is to get his girlfriend to doth him.

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: fine

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Fine. The new Goth Spiderman doth wear a costume made from black spider silk of the finest weave. 緻密・ちみつ close, minute, elaborate, intricate.

hints.author: lernsky
hints.mnemonic: When Spiderman does (doth (#756 致)) climax he ejects only the finest thread because his taskmaster (taskmistress) told him so.

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman doth climax whenever the fine dominatrix Mary Jane tells him to.

hints.author: jamestaverner
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is used for train lines. Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing line as he enjoys the onsen.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Japan's train lines are like threads that spring from Tokyo station.

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman casts a line in order to get across a very hot srping.

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman usually just travels by web, but when he goes to visit the hot spring, he has to take several train lines instead, since there are no buildings to swing from. [He tried swinging from power lines once--big mistake].

hints.author: skyerise
hints.mnemonic: On a vacation in Japan, SPIDER MAN waits in LINE to get in the hot SPRING.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Even though his costume is coming apart at the seams as he chases the bad guys, Spiderman is still determined to catch them.

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is so determined to catch criminals that he doesn't notice his costume is coming apart at the seams. The Daily Bugle will love this! "Spider-pervert terrorizes city!".

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: The quality of the thread will determine whether your clothing will come apart at the seams.

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's costume has come apart at the seams and here he is, mending it in his house, determined to make it stronger than before.

hints.author: Hoticehunter
hints.mnemonic: If you want a simpler keyword, "rip" works just fine as a replacement.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: (astridtops) Spiderman managed to get behind the sovereign. (pick your favourite nowadays country ruler who isn't doing a good job). Spidey has tightend a web around the sovereing's throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The sovereign appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a thread around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn't like, she starts pulling the thread and tightens it around his throat.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: The Sovereign (a crazy comic book villain) has been caught by Spiderman. He's trying to get free so Spiderman tightens the web around him.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman tightens a web around Caesar's throat.. "Et tu, Spiderman?".

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: The sovereign uses his threads of influence ("pulling the strings") to tighten his grip on power.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Hey, Spidey! Eat that turkey if you want, but make sure you eat some fibers

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: If you want to increase your fiber intake, just leave on those threads that are used to sew up the stuffed turkey and eat them too.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Feeling mischievous while shopping, Spiderman throws his web into the cavity of a turkey. He chuckles, "That ought to raise the turkey's FIBER content.".

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: When Spider-Man first made his suit, he was so fixated on the textile aspect, on making sure all of the fibres were sturdy, he didn't realize till he finished that he'd made it with a turkey design on the chest instead of a spider. He felt like a real turkey then (that's the sort of campy insult he might use).

hints.author: bonitoclub
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman needs more fibre so he eats turkey sandwiches on wholewheat bread.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Lots of girls in Japan wear gauze patches over one eye made of course white fibers. They think it is cute, and I must admit, I have come to think so too.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Rocky won the match but left with a nasty eye injury, and needs some gauze for it. I use a modified version of the Rocky theme song to remember this one -- "the eye and the fiber".

hints.author: testoman
hints.mnemonic: The eyes on Spiderman's mask are made of carbon fibre gauze. Light, strong and see-through.

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: Gauze is a net of fiber.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is also used to mean "web" (e.g. in 網羅 ) and "ordered" (e.g. in 羅列 ). The web meaning is the basic one, and a web consists of fibers and the "eyes" (holes, 網の目 ; like "eye" of a needle) between them. Gauze is just a form of web. "Ordered" comes from the order inherent in the matrix formed by the holes. Think of ghastly eyes peeking at you from between the fibers (and fabric of space?) when you're not looking, and you won't look webs the same way ever again.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spidey stays on the east side of the city to practice. The West Side is too dangerous.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: [+ skinnyneo] Spiderman visits the East to practice his swinging skills. All those Asian cities with skyscrapers and low crime rates make it easy for him to practice.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: You practice your Japanese skills in a discussion thread with lots of people from the Far East (since many of the people who are interested in studying Japanese are Asian).

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: After being defeated one too many times, Spiderman heads East to the Orient in order to practice various martial arts.

hints.author: kapson
hints.mnemonic: PRACTICING Japanese every day is the THREAD that binds me to the EAST.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has a secret fetish, he likes nothing better than to dress his lovedoll in a thong. Wierd, eh!

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: A thong is no more than a thread used by someone as underwear!

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: Instead of puppet I like to think of "someone" as ninja (since it is the second kanji in ninja). A ninja must be able to steal a thread from a woman's thong without her noticing.

hints.author: wisego
hints.mnemonic: Spidey and a Ninja fight over a sexy thong they found, but then they realize that together ( 一緒 ) they could easily get another... ショ 一緒 いっしょ(together) チヨ 情緒 じょうちょ(heartstrings)….

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's girlfriend throws a thong she found in his bed at him. And who's is this then she asks, and Spiderman replies, uhh... someone's?

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Even though Peter Parker has become Spiderman, he continues to sell pictures that he takes as a photographer.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Here's how Spiderman comics sell

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's comics continue to sell after several decades. (Even the goofy samurai with his log-crown toys is selling spiderman).

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: Your thread had better sell if you want to continue to be a weaver!

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: If you attach strings to the things you sell, you will be able to continue making profit from them even after the fact.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: There's never a picture of Spiderman meeting Peter Parker... I wonder why?

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: Peter Parker's editor tells him "Next time you have a meeting with spiderman take a goddamn picture, you're a photographer after all".

hints.author: Nayelianne
hints.mnemonic: A picture is just a matter of the harmonious meeting of lines. The many threads of a brush meet together on paper, finally forming a painting.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: By coercing fine, colorful threads to meet other threads in a needlepoint, it's entirely possible to create a very nice picture.

hints.author: rucury
hints.mnemonic: A word of caution

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Spidey is alloted the biggest crime fighter jurisdiction in NYC because his OVERALL arrest record is the best.

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: According to Greek mythology, there's a thread alloted to everyone, and its length is the overall determinant of your fate.

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: SPIDERMAN was originally ALLOTTED some overalls by the Superheroes' Guild, but he rejected them in favor of his current outfit.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Overall I allot the Spiderman movies an average rating. Spiderman - Great, Spiderman 2 - Average, Spiderman 3 - ass. Overall they are average.

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: [smithsonian(I have to nitpick your story, sorry)] According to Norse mythology, there's a thread alloted to everyone, and its length is the overall determinant of your fate. Info

hints.author: marydj
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman hates going to parties and having to mingle. He wants to strangle someone after just a little small talk.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Darth Vader, who was mingling among the crowd with his hat, is spotted by Spiderman. Spiderman jumps at him to teach the villain for coming to New York. Darth Vader catches him in mid air and strangles him with the force...

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: Spidermancame out of nowhere and started to strangle me, when I was right in the middle of mingling with this cute girl named Mary Jane.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: At the elegant cocktail party of VIP's, the spy, dressed like everyone else in formal evening wear, sneaks in and strangles his victim with a very thin wire - a thread. Afterwards he mingles in with the crowd and disappears.

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: A serial killer goes to parties, to mingle with people and then strangle them with a thin thread.

hints.author: Proxx
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman wanted to be a salaryman, but the suit just didn't fit him.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has so little free time in his schedule that he is unable to fit in a job with a good salary.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: The quality of the threads one wears generally fits with one's salary.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Did you know that Spiderman gets paid by the mayor for fighting crime? The only problem is that since he doesn't have a bank account, his salary is paid out in cash. And since he doesn't carry around a wallet, he has to somehow fit the bills in his costume

hints.author: Wakela
hints.mnemonic: If you earn a good salary it can help you to make ends meet -- the ends of a thread.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: When threads become entwined, each thread is tangled to another.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman entwines each villain in a tangled mess of spidersilk.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: "Stop thief!" yells the greengrocer. The thief doesn't, so Spidey saves the day by entwining the crook in a web, and dangling him walking legs over mouth.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Small tweak to Django's story

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Spider-man has developed different kinds of thread to entwine each different villain with. Metal webbing for Doc Ock, gas-proof webbing for Green Goblin, alien-proof webbing for Venom...

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Ok, here, you have to think of the phrase "TIE the knot" , which means a wedding (this kanji is used in the marriage compound 結婚 けっこん ). Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will TIE the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or TIED) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off.

hints.author: Kieron
hints.mnemonic: Spidey ties up the villain in a web of threads. "Good luck getting out of that, heh heh!".

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman and a fan have a competition to see who can tie up the most enemies fastest. Spidey's using his webs and the fan is using an aerosol can of silly string. So far they are tied.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: I'm wearing my Spiderman tie today for good luck.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: I'm pretty bad with knots. The only way I'm ever going to tie this thread is if I have good luck!

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: This winter is so cold that spiderman's web gets brittle! Could this be the end of spiderman?

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man can't wait for winter to end. Going outside in spandex isn't exactly toasty.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The thread of life begins with the spring and ends with the winter.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: The final issue of Spiderman

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: Winter spells the end of every spider's life.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: This Kanji is the same ones used in the Japanese Language proficiency tests; i.e. ikkyuu ( 一級 ) The Kanji doesnt describe class as in a "class of students" or "classroom," but rather a grade of quality or ability. ---------- Spiderman is taking the JLPT Level 1. In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend's answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a class above him. Looks like this test is above his class of knowledge.

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman with his arm stretched out showing the class how he produces webs.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man reaches out to every class, rich and poor.

hints.author: akira
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman stretching his arms at different length produces a different class of web.

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: Class, grade, rank. Members of a particular class or rank are connected (as if by a thread) by their similarities and common circumstances; and often, by the extent to which they will reach out and exert themselves to new heights. 下級 (low grade). 学級 (school class). 勤労階級 (working class). 最高級 (top class). 審級 (instance). 上級 (advanced level, senior). 中級 (intermediate level). 飛び級 (skipping a grade). 上の級に進む (to move up to a higher grade).

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: Worst fan fiction ever....SPIDERMAN joins the CHRONICLES of narnia to battle a big SNAKE!!

hints.author: happychair
hints.mnemonic: In a CHRONICLE the THREAD of the story can twist and turn like a SNAKE.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man reads his self-chronicle every week when the newest comic comes out.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's autobiography, written by his own self with no help, is titled The Chronicles of a Web Weaver.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: I got the bizarre image of Spider-Man finding himself in Narnia, and crawling commando style through the snow by the lamppost is Solid Snake from MGS...
