Snake looks up, and there's a moment of awkward silence.... ("What are you doing here?" "I'm looking for Sniper Wolf, what are you doing? You're not even dressed for this weather, c'mon, tights?" "Err I just found this wardrobe..." "And you didn't think to grab a coat?" "Ok, so am I in your game, or are you in mine, or are we both just totally lost?!").

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman crafted a crimson costume to fight crime in.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: After Spider-Man is whacked in the head with a I-beam, crimson blood flows from the wound.

hints.author: BlackMarsh
hints.mnemonic: As this kanji is used to describe black (or "crimson") English tea, think of the craftsmanship involved in the production of the tea, from the tea leaves, to the paper bag, right down to the thread you use to dangle it in the cup.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This artisan crafted the finest thread you could imagine. So fine it was that it had to be tinted in the deepest red (crimson) otherwise you wouldn't see it.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: A person's first piece of thread craft is often stained crimson due to bleeding from the needle wounds sustained in the process.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Have you heard about patients who have surgery and the doctor mistakenly leaves a medical instrument INSIDE the patient’s body and proceeds to stitch up the patient’s incisions with stitching THREAD? Can you say “malpractice SETTLEMENT”?　.

hints.author: gdaxeman
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man was working as a surgeon's assistant. By accident, he threw his spider webs inside the patient, causing his death. Fortunately, the hospital reached an out-of-court settlement with the victim's family.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Another twist on the same theme

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman was caught hanging upside down inside the girls changing room. The resulting public backlash and court-settlement were embarassing, but he still thinks it was worth it.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: Natto ( 納豆 ) is fermented soybeans. One theory about the name says it was used as a form of payment to settle debts to your lord. Picture the little styrofoam natto package and when you open it up it's full of threads of sticky, stringy goo inside... 納金 [のうきん] payment 、納品 [のうひん] 、納得 [なっとく] 、納める [おさめる].

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman can spin his webs in any direction.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: "You keep me spinning right round, baby right round, like a compass baby." Spidey is making a retro 80s music video, spinning right round on his giant compass, singing his favourite song.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: The easiest way to spin some threads is to hook them up to a compass and take them to the North Pole. The compass will spin like crazy and the threads will spin with it. I confuse this with swing (#1967 揺).

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is spinning around, shooting webs in every direction.

hints.author: blueraccoon
hints.mnemonic: A normal spider spins a web into a specific pattern in order to catch prey. Spiderman, however, uses his web primarily as a mode of transportation, shooting it in all directions.

hints.author: timcampbell
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman got distracted when someone yelled, "Spiderman, wait a minute." He turned around and flew into a building. ("part" also means "minute").

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Due to the distractions of being a super-hero, spiderman can only work part-time. (variation on ayoung24's story).

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Distract = to lose the thread of thought in part, i.e. not completely.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman gets distracted as Wonderwoman parts her legs next to him.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is fired from his part-time job for being constantly distracted by his super-hero duties.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman seduces all the girls he's introduced to.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Peter Parker did a terrible job of seducing MJ. Spiderman however, seduced her as soon as they were first introduced.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: The first thread of a seduction is an introduction.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: A strange 1960's party game as a new way to introduce people to each other at a party. Six men, six women, and six threads. The threads are mixed together and thrown into a bowl. Each person takes one end of a thread, thereby matching that person up with a random partner. Obviously, the couples try to seduce each other.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The prostitute wore little more than a few threads, quickly seduced her client and left without even introducing herself.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a spool that is holding the threads together.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Suggestion

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is intriqued by some of the positions of the karma sutra, but reluctant to take part in an sutra orgy as he'd have to reveal his soiled underwear.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: A sutra reads

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man's kama sutra technique is so crazy that he always needs a whole roll of toilet paper to clean up afterward. Mary Jane is always soaked in a sticky white substance, and it isn't Spidey's webs.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Monkeys are very adept at swinging around trees. But when they met Spiderman, who could swing around even better than they could, they all quickly addressed him as sire.

hints.author: Atomik
hints.mnemonic: You are now two-thirds of the way through the book! Keep it up!

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman married a monkey and sired a brood of spider-monkeys.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: When conversing with a sire (noble person) you should always use proper words like "speaketh" and allow them to set the thread of the conversation.

hints.author: cae99v
hints.mnemonic: What do you call a monkey that wears the finest threads? Sire of course.

hints.author: eatyoda
hints.mnemonic: Anytime Spiderman breaks a promise, Aunt Mae hits him one over with her ladle.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman promised to get Aunt Mae's ladle back. He started to do a blood oath by spilling drops of blood but Aunt Mae stopped him and bound up the wound. "It's only a ladle Peter".

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Thread + bound + drop of blood. Blood oath is a promise, where a drop of blood turns into a binding thread.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman broke his promise to be home in time for dinner. When he came in late, Aunt Mae beat him viciously with a ladle. She just kept hitting, and hitting, and hitting until he lost consciousness, and even then she still kept ladling his pulpy carcass for like fifteen more minutes. Don't break promises to Aunt Mae.

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman and Spiderwoman share a drop of blood (the blood handshake thing, like in Natural Born Killers) to bind their promise that they'll always fight crime. Ladle was too hard. Spiderman PROMISES to get MJs cooking ladle back.

hints.author: marydj
hints.mnemonic: Dainty women would always rather work with thread than in a field.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man used to just be a dainty, brainy nerd.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman slips and smack his brain on a building... now he's sitting in the middle of the street pouring imaginary tea and acting dainty.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man's ideal type is a dainty girl with brains.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The threads of the brain (neurons) are dainty.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: (dingomick) Venom is upset because Spidey is just that much brainier than he is! He chooses to accumulate as many brains as he can, snatching them out of people's heads and storing them on top of his own, till there's just one massive brain on top of his head!

hints.author: Mighty_Matt
hints.mnemonic: When you accumulate knowledge in your brain, neural pathways are constructed. All those pathways end up like a huge ball of thread tangled together. The more knowledge you accumulate the more threads you throw into the mix!!

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: Like a jellyfish, a floating BRAIN accumulates THREADS beneath it-- a weird collection.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Venom is accumulating brains (much like Sylar in Heroes).

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: I found billyclyde's a bit abstract so I picture a brain rolling about the floor, accumulating threads scattered around and getting bigger as it rolls. (this is easy if you've played Katamari).

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has been captured and given the ultimate torture

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: (modified akrodha's great story) VENOM has been captured by scientists and is being experimented on

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: An electrical cord has two (or three) prongs - needles - sticking out of it, a housing for the prongs that can be thought of as a crown, and the long thread-like wire leading to the appliance.

hints.author: Biene
hints.mnemonic: That's venom for you! Since he can't make webs like spiderman can, he's now desperately hanging from a thin cord that he bought cheap in Sweden. It cost him only 10 Kroner (Crowns). I'm sure the cord will rip in a second or two. (Thanks desmidus).

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A cord is made of ten threads belted together.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman could not achieve general acceptance by the media even after winning the public's heart.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: NOTE

hints.author: happychair
hints.mnemonic: To win GENERAL approval THREAD your way into the PUBLIC's HEART.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: In general, spidey is accepted in the public's heart (see Spiderman1,2 and 3) Its only Jameson of the daily bugle that hates him (and a bunch of super villains). But in general, Spidey is in the public's heart, and the public is in Spidey's heart.

hints.author: mfistik
hints.mnemonic: General or universal refers to the common thread running through the public's heart.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's polyethylene suit starts to ride up after a while, so he always looks forward to the white cotton towels he wears while lounging around his apartment.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Cotton is the preferred thread for making white towels.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has a dark secret - he has stolen all the white cotton towels from every hotel he has ever been in.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Thread customarily used to make white towels with.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Compare with brocade (#411 錦). If the white towel is made of plain threads with no golden decoration, then it's just a plain towel. But at least it's a good fluffy cotton towel, not one of those cheap synthetic fibers. Remember

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Spider-man loves to run his mouth all over Mary Jane's silky flesh.

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has little squares in the flesh of his wrists that the silk webbing comes out of.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [silk] Silk is a thread that a larvae produces from its mouth to involve its body.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man barged in on our honeymoon, stuffing our silk sheets in his mouth--apparently he was out of webbing and needed to refuel.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Spider-man loves to use his mouth to remove Mary Jane's silk stockings and kiss the flesh underneath. (thanks Zazen666!).

hints.author: PacifistGod
hints.mnemonic: After stopping a bank heist, Spiderman is seen winding his webbing around the stolen goods to trap them in a tree until the police arrive to take them back.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman often accidentally breaks his furniture (thanks Katsuo!) with his spider strength, so he is often seen winding his webbing around various pieces to repair them.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Primary meaning of this kanji has to do with turning pages/leafing through a book so I focus on that meaning. Also taking the furniture suggestion from Katsuo about the primitive on the right and making it even more concrete by having it refer to IKEA. Here I see Spiderman reading an IKEA catalogue, he's lost in thought leafing through the pages.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Winding thread around wooden goods to ready them for safe transport.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man is hooked on rice--it's all he inherited from his Uncle Ben. (thanks Nukemarine).

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: A poor chinese fisherman could expect to inherit

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The INHERITANCE given to SPIDERMAN was only RICE, because it came from his "Uncle Ben", ha ha ha, get the HOOK? "Uncle Ben" RICE? To be fair, I couldn't work hook into that tale very well.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Uncle Ben was the employee that got the axe in severance (#1136 断), so naturally the fishing hook and rice ball is all that spidey will inherit.

hints.author: bigloui
hints.mnemonic: A poor chinese farmer could expect to inherit

hints.author: lerris
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's nemesis the Green Goblin is in a slump; He's replaced his glider with a broom and is throwing grains of rice instead of bombs.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: Tie green thread around the broom that you use for sweeping up grains of rice (ie the kitchen broom) to distinguish it from the other colour threaded brooms that you might use in say the toilet, or the garage etc...

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's fight against the green goblin was recorded on videotape (录, see record (#1144 録) and sold. You know the film, don't you? It's no hollywood movie - it's true!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has no affinity for a broom hence his house is a pig sty.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: I hate doing this, since the Simpson's Movie was recent. But think of the AFFINITY Homer had with the PIG that was to be killed. The AFFINITY first had SPIDER PIG (Spiderpig, spiderpig, does whatever a spiderpig does). Then Homer dressed the PIG up with a BROOM and glasses making him Harry PORKER. Homer had more AFFINITY for that PIG than his family, hence hilarity ensues.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: There is an affinity between the THREADS of a BROOM and a SOW's hair.

hints.author: sindhikara
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman, though genuinely a good person, had an affinity for beating pigs with a broom. (I know it's random, but the mental picture is both vivid and hilarious).

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman traps The Rhino under the hood of his famous netting, where even Rhino's horns can not break free, in fact if the netting did not dissappear after a few hours then Rhino might even perish in there.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: You use a 糸 to make a net shaped like a hood. A stray animal got caught in it by its horns and perished.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Sadly, sometimes nettings have a thread so strong, the net gets caught like a hood on an animal's horns, and stays there until the poor thing perishes.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: Spider-woman dies of a mosquito bite. They replace the (ineffectual) netting over her bed with a glass canopy, and put a viking's horned helmet on her dead head, so she can lie in state with dignity.

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman caught The Rhino, under a glass canopy; instead of his usual webbed netting. But unfortunately, the horned one perished

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Whenever Venom is tense, he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a slave to his crotch.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: You'd be tense too if you were a slave and your owner removed the threads covering your crotch.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: TIP

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: The crotch-slave from "intelligent" this time has hidden some thread as part of her elaborate plan to escape from her owner. Now she's being searched, and is afraid they'll find where she hid the thread -- she is quite tense, and it shows.

hints.author: busaiku
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is slave to his crotch, literally, because of that leotard he uses. If he get's just a little too excited in public, the situation would become very tense (if you know what I mean).

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Venom starts to choke on a spoon. He's about to get it out, when you manage to stop the spoon from getting out, so he turns purple, as he chokes, and dies.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Why is your ass purple? Well, I stopped and sat for a bit on a pile of thread... (I guess it was freshly dyed).

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: Stop sitting for so long - or else you'll get those purple threads (veins) on your legs from bad circulation. [link purple with those huge purple, bulging, crawling, worm-like varicose veins .....].

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: If you use Venom for the lower primitive, this kanji is a piece of cake. The upper primitive is the left part of feminine/female (#563 雌). So, PURPLE is the color of Agony, the female offspring of Venom http

hints.author: thomasritz
hints.mnemonic: Stop spooning spiderpig. He's turning purple!

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: Spidey received good word that the acupuncturist working down the road was actually the evil Doctor Octopus! Spidey headed over to the clinic, and trussed the acupuncturist Doc Oc up using the maniac's own metal limbs!

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: Because people are so afraid of the procedure, string has to be used by the acunpunturist to truss up his victims, er, patients.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Ok, I already finished RtK, I'm coming back to warn you about this one - the right primitive is acupuncturist, not specialty. Trust me, mixing these up will mess you up later.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's specialty

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman gets trussed/binded, tied by the new villain

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that's left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537 滝) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When Spiderman fights the giant tortoise, he grabs a straw rope from the edges of the sumo ring and swings it at his head. However, the tortoise quickly tucks his head back into his shell to avoid the blow (hence no head on the tortoise).

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A straw rope is made from threads and has about the thickness of an eel.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Our friendly neighborhood Spider-Man takes off the straw rope that was binding the tortoise.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's threads conduct electricity a bit too well, so when he has to bind up electric eels, he just buys some straw rope at the post office and shoots it out of his arm. Ouch, that stuff sure leaves a rash.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: In its infancy, a butterfly is protected by a cocoon, as it doesn't yet have any power of its own.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: During their infancy, children are often wrapped up tight like a cocoon (i.e. in those Snugli carriers) and supported by the muscle of their parents.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: During INFANCY the moth in its COCOON gains its POWER.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: In infancy it is the struggle to break out of the cocoon that develops a butterfly's muscles.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: Your infancy starts when you have enough power to break your cocoon (amniotic sac).

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Column of walking legs (caterpillar) getting into a cocoon, about to leave its past self behind.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: after a grub goes through the cocoon stage, it leaves its walking legs behind for a life of flight.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: Think of a column of ants moving to a new nest. The soldiers are in front. The workers are behind carrying the cocoons on their long walking legs.

hints.author: angerman
hints.mnemonic: Better get going, there's a cocoon on walking legs behind us!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Lookout The Flash! There's an evil cocoon walking behind you!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The villagers haven't the faintest idea that giant coccoons resting in the mountain are soon to hatch.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: Frodo and Sam fainted in the mountains and the spider wrapped them in cacoons.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Two cocoons set out to climb a mountain, but they get separated. They shout to each other, but their voices, blocked by the mountain, are so faint. Notice that the first stroke of mountain is first, followed by the 2 cocoons, then the conclusion of mountain.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Two people wrapped in their sleeping bags like cocoons are secluded in the mountains and can't hear the faintest sound.

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: At the Mexican fiesta, there is a coccoon eating competition. How many coccoons can one person eat? No one has managed more than two before giving up...

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: How many went to the party? Two aliens and one person (I feel sorry for that person).

hints.author: Justin42
hints.mnemonic: It is a little awkward when you are at a fiesta and the host serves some rare delicacy, like moth cocoons, the guests must decide how many it would be polite to eat. You do the math in your head and it comes out to two cocoons per person. This is why the horizontal line is a fraction bar with two cocoons on the top, and one person the bottom.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: There's a cocoon on each side of the entrance to the fiesta that can detect when a person crosses the threshold. They are the two cocoons that determine how many people are attending the fiesta. So how many were there? The answer is displayed on an abacus.

hints.author: MRT88
hints.mnemonic: At the Mexican fiesta, there is a cocoon eating competition. How many cocoons can Mr.T eat? Mr.T currently holds the record at two. Took misha's and edited for Mr. T purposes.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: An abacus is a mechanism made of wood used to calculate how many 'anythings'.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: To avoid confusing with contraption (#677 械), focus on the "ism" of mechanism. For example, fetishism refers to having a fetish; mechanism here refers to having a mecha-like property, where mecha is a type of anime robot that can transform itself. Imagine a mecha that can transform itself between two forms

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: [synewave]An abacus is a mechanism made of wood used to calculate how many 'anythings'. Important geek note

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Tolkien's ents are actually ancient robot-like mechanisms made of wood. Picture a pilot sitting inside, furiously sliding away at an abacus to steer the ent.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Uh-oh. You accidentally hit the self-destruct mechanism on your abacus. You hide behind a tree and wait for the explosion.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: People aside, I wonder how many rice fields there are in the capital suburbs.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: How many brains does it take to run the capital suburbs?

hints.author: einahpets
hints.mnemonic: This keyword refers to Japan's Kinki Region, a historic name for present-day Kansai. 近畿 きんき Just how many rice fields are in the capital suburbs? (The kinky (Kinki) people are hidden in the fields so you can't see them).

hints.author: sulris
hints.mnemonic: The capital suburbs were the five areas that around the kyoto nara osaka area that were under direct imperial rule (not ruled by the feudal lords) (the capital being first nara then kyoto) in this time the most important thing was how many rice fields you had. and as the area grew in the large cities that emporer had less and less rice fields (the latter half is not true).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: While exploring the capital you come across a cocoon fiesta being held in a paddyfield. "There's no space for this kind of thing in the city centre, we must be in the capital suburbs," you think.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: What could be more mysterious than a cocoon in a top hat trying to sneak in...? (Pimitive

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: The invisible man in his top hat and cocoon of white bandages is the most mysterious man in the world.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: As romanrozhok said, this kanji has little to do with mysterious. It has the meanings [dark, abstruse, calm] (in Spanish, [moreno and recóndito]). As for the story, the union of a hat and a coccoon is obviously a fakir turban. India was maybe an abstruse place far away from China. Visualize a mysterious, dark-skinned fakir with a turban (in calming meditation) and the kanji is yours!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji does not really mean "mysterious." In fact, out of all the words this kanji in used in, only one, an uncommon word, has that meaning faintly. If you look the kanji up, you will see that it is used in

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Even more mysterious than this huge alien cocoon is the fact that it is wearing a top hat.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: This mysterious rice field grows not only rice, but livestock too! Picture little pigs and chickens growing right out of the ground, among the rice plants. How bizarre!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The livestock are disappearing! I've placed Gandalf over the rice field to protect them.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: Livestock has been mysteriously disappearing from the field. Aliens?

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Top part, 玄 , means dark color. There's a certain dark-colored thing that livestock produce that farmers traditionally used as fertilizer on their rice fields. What could this mysterious thing be? Mmh...

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: In Japan there is no Bermuda triangle but there is a mysterious rice field where livestock disappear.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: One sneaky farmer wanted to amass a large collection of livestock. We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and amassed in his field.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: It may seem illogical, but the fact is, you need to plant flowers if your aim is to amass livestock.

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: To keep the difference between amass and gather (#559 集) and accumulate (#1364 累), I emphasize the MASS. To amass MASSIVE livestock, always feed them flowers. They'll get nice and plump. 蓄え = たくわえ = store; reserve; stock; savings.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Farmers in Japan grow flowers in the summer and rear livestock in the winter, in this way they amass a fortune.

hints.author: kanji_nightmare
hints.mnemonic: I amassed so many flowers from my many boyfriends, I had to feed them to my livestock to get rid of them.

hints.author: nyquil
hints.mnemonic: A magic bow that only Gandalf can yield

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: A bow with a mysterious invisible bowstring.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: TIP

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: It was always (and still is) a bit mysterious to me just what type of bowstring was supposed to be used on Chewbacca's laser bolt crossbow.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Legolas asks Gandalf to conjure him a new bowstring.

hints.author: Proxx
hints.mnemonic: A mysterious turkey with human fingers wants to hug me... I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again!

hints.author: pupul07
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Gandalf hugging a turkey....ouch! It bit off his finger!

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: Ok sweetheart, I want you to point your finger at the mysterious turkey who hugged you inappropriately.

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: As you peer even more closely at the top-hat clad cocoon from frame 1383 you realise that it's actually ET in disguise, back on earth for Christmas (carrying a turkey from his home planet), and holding out a luminescent brown finger towards you. You leap up and give him a hug.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: You can also break this into primitives as conjecture with mysterious stuck in the middle (I have enough finger and turkey primitives going through my head that I don't need any more...). As you hug your loved one who's going off on a mysterious mission, your conjecture is that you won't see them again.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: Water is doubly mysterious. It's in all our nourishment...and yet, it's really not nourishing at all.

hints.author: Okonomiyaki
hints.mnemonic: Going off the idea of the right side meaning rapid growth/increase of small objects, I've decided to make the right side be Gremlins, those little mysterious creatures that double rapidly. Gremlins find water a little too nourishing, as it makes them instantly multiply.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Because Siamese twins need twice as much fluid as their single body produces, the most nourishing thing they can have is water.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: It’s doubly mysterious how water can be so nourishing—it doesn’t seem to have any substance and yet we would die without it.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Gandalf (mysterious (#1383 玄)) finds nourishing water that reflects an evil double Gandalf looming beneath the surface.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Mercy comes from the doubly mysterious heart of God.

hints.author: mullr
hints.mnemonic: Two gremlins are atop a victim, tearing out his heart while he begs for mercy.

hints.author: Fluhk
hints.mnemonic: Here we see the DOUBLE-MYSTERIOUS Siamese twins again, at the MERCY of the machines that pump blood through their veins, since the single HEART they share won't do the job...

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Gandalf (mysterious (#1383 玄)) shows no mercy and rips his evil double's heart out. Instead of destroying evil, his malevolent act has merged the two of them into the grey Gandalf.

hints.author: atylmo
hints.mnemonic: Mercy is a doubly mysterious turn of the heart. On the one hand, everybody wants it, but on the other hardly anybody gives it.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: A magnet is a rock with two sides; one that mysteriously pushes and one that pulls; doubly mysterious. (see astridtops' story).

hints.author: arrogantape
hints.mnemonic: STONE + BAND OF NIGGERS

hints.author: mullr
hints.mnemonic: The gremlins have this mysterious rock the use to attract yet more gremlins.

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: I found some stones on the siamese twins. Turns out the stones were magnetic, and they weren't siamese twins at all!

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In the old days, people didn't know what magnets were. They just thought of them as stones that were double mysterious.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (Primitive

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's lineage (who his family is etc...) can be found in his DNA in a drop of blood. The villain that gets blood of Spidey will be able to find out who is family and lineage is. be carfefull spidey...

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: A single drop of your blood holds the proof of the unbroken thread of your lineage.

hints.author: cleber
hints.mnemonic: One drop of Venom's blood created a lineage of evil spiders.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: Your lineage can be found in your DNA, a loooong molecular thread that can pulled from a single drop of blood.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Mister T gets a DNA test, and discovers that he was meant to be the person in charge after all.

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: The person in charge usually must come from a long standing lineage of persons in charge.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is the person in charge of the DNA research center.

hints.author: stefanot
hints.mnemonic: chuck norris is always the person in charge! it's written in his DNA!

hints.author: mr_hans_moleman
hints.mnemonic: We think we have control over our own lives. But our DNA is the PERSON IN CHARGE. Our DNA controls our looks, and basically who we are.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Your grandchild is the child of your DNA.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Your child continues the family lineage by passing on your DNA, giving you a grandchild.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Grandchild is a kid of your directe lineage.

hints.author: tinuviel228
hints.mnemonic: I didn't find out that child was my grandchild until I got a DNA test... I didn't even know I had a child until I got a DNA test for that matter!

hints.author: Tornadic_Indignation
hints.mnemonic: The child took a DNA test and found out that he was his own grandchild. "What the fuck?! This doesn't even make sense with time travel involved. How did you figure this out with a DNA test anyway?".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The prefecture has suspended all DNA research for heart disease because of corruption. All involved will be suspended by their wrists.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: In a very racist prefecture of Japan, they screen everyone's DNA. If they find out you are of a different lineage, they rip out your heart and suspend it in the Hall of Shame.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: The prefecture has suspended all research into inheritable (lineage) heart disease.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: Suspended in the middle of the prefecture is a chart of the area's lineage. But, since this is Japan, it has to be cute, so the chart has been covered with little hearts.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: My parents aren't at all modest about their grandchildren, at every opportunity they take them on the road showing them off to their friends!

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: He wasn't at all modest when telling us about his grandchildren - "They're all on the road to success" he said.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: Swift wrote in "A Modest Proposal" that Ireland should solve its economic problems by collecting the nation's grandchildren from off the streets and eating them.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: When grandparents take their grandchildren out on the road, they want them to be modest little children.

hints.author: n1williams
hints.mnemonic: To instill a MODEST mindset in his GRANDCHILD, the grandpa sent him down the ROAD to find work instead of just giving him money.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [instead; on the contrary; rather] Gone is the time for stamps - use e-mail instead.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: We use e-mail now instead of regular mail. My e-mail is gone before you can even put a stamp on your snail mail.

hints.author: Wakela
hints.mnemonic: If you tried to attach money to an envelope to pay for postage it would be GONE before it arrived at the post office. That's why we use STAMPS instead.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Having accidentally sent his children a home made sex video instead of the family Christmas tape, the man ran to the post office to switch packages. "I'm sorry sir, but your package was gone moments after you paid for the stamp.".

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Lick soiled-elbow instead of stamp ?

hints.author: decamer0n
hints.mnemonic: Shins are the part of the body that Japanese traditionally sit on instead of their asses.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Shins are the part of the body that one uses instead of one's eyes, for finding furniture in the dark. (Ouch!).

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: This is one of the key aspects of soccer. At the beginning of every game you start by trying to kick the opponent's shins; their flesh, instead of the ball (lets them know you mean business).

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: When you want to say shins you can use this kanji for that part of the body instead of the kanji for leg.

hints.author: SuzuBell
hints.mnemonic: Wholesale refers to the sale of goods in quantity to retailers for resale. When this kanji was invented, large loads of goods needed to be transported by horses who left steep footprints because of the weight they carried. The wholesale goods needed a special stamp to indicate that they were legal for resale. See honorable (#1398 御).

hints.author: akrodha

He looks at one of those "WANTED" posters, with the portrait of a criminal he's been trying to catch for such a long time. When asked for his orders, still staring intently at the picture, he says

hints.mnemonic: I bounce down the road on my pogo stick, easily getting through the dense traffic. (Note

Hanging from the helicopter is a huge chopseal that they utilize to mark some of the cars that are causing trouble on the road.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: This is totally wrong. It doesn't mean "jump", it means "dance"! 踊 jump (#1409 踊) and 曜 leap (#1285 躍) are homonyms, so it is easy to become permanently confused about which one DOES NOT mean "jump/leap". Caveat Lector! Note

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Heisig is triiippppiiiin'. This means dance, not jump. I named the other "dance" kanji "interpretive dance" because it is used in all sorts of concepts figuratively related to dance, like stages, fluttering, etc. One of my legs is wooden, the other is a pogo stick. Surprisingly, I'm actually a pretty good at dancing.

'lion feeding time is. bla bla' You are having serious doubts about if you still want to go into this zoo.

This particular project is behind schedule, so to speed things up, they blow it up with mortar and an air-to-ground missile.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Drawing inspiration from beat (#709 撃) by kinkypete, this kanji shows the rules for a bizarre form of janken (paper, stone, scissors). A mortar can break soil (grinding it to dust). Soil can break a missile (burying it - causing it to eventually rust away). And a missile can break a mortar.

hints.author: mantixen

hints.author: Raichu

hints.author: genbaku

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: Those who have studied physics may find this useful. The two parts of the kanji represent the two statistical distributions for bosons and fermions. The Bose-Einstein distribution is represented by the sign of the bird because birds, like bosons, are social creatures who like to flock together. The Fermi-Dirac distribution is represented by a snake, since snakes, like fermions, are solitary creatures who like to keep to themselves.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The prostitute carries an old whiskey bottle filled with acid to throw at any difficult Johns.

hints.author: meolox

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A new alliance is proclaimed at the end of a meal between officials. As a symbol of their alliance they clean up together one dish, and present it to the photographers. The clean dish under the flash lights appears very bright, and it's pretty much all you can see on the photo that appears on the next morning's newspapers, with the title "New alliance, one bright dish!".

hints.author: Crowfoot

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: In medieval Japan (during Sengoku Jidai) there was an interesting ritual to form an alliance between different samurai clans. The warlord, who wanted to propose to form an alliance to another warlord, would send him a big ceremonial dish with the sun drawn in the center. If the proposal were accepted, the second warlord would draw an image of the moon next to the sun on the same dish, and then return the dish to the first warlord. (not true story, but helped me to create vivid image).

hints.author: dingomick

hints.mnemonic: The next thing on his list of things to steal after the dishes was the kitchen sink. Watch out for burglar (#357 賊) and rob (#566 奪) and crime (#1414 犯). To differentiate it, think that stealing is arbitrary (hence the kitchen sink), rob (#566 奪) is more deliberate (and hence the protection of the attack turkey) and burglar (#357 賊) is the most professional of them all (it is his full time job), so he knows when to hit (when everyone is at the fiesta).

hints.author: stshores24

hints.mnemonic: State of mind + Previously

"Shit! I should have taken my missle launcher with me!" You draw your sabre and prepare for the attack.

hints.author: scottamus

hints.author: wasurenaide

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: Death (I use Terry Pratchett's Death as a primitive for reap (#1488 刈), hope (#1489 希), kill (#1493 殺), ward (#1696 区)) uses a sword ( 刈 ) on kings, a scythe on ordinary folk, and a shovel on villains.

hints.author: parisnoneko

hints.author: astridtops

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: Just think of the heroine's bosom in a movie. The villain ties up the heroine (to the traintracks or the conveyor belt etc) but her bosom is the body part that is always left sticking out.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Here's an easy way to defeat the bad guy

hints.author: Raichu

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I've finally met my arch-rival, the evilest of all villains. Finally, I'm about to fight him. But what's this? He's suspiciously quiet. I move to attack him, and his right arm falls off at the elbow. Strange. I walk up to him and detach his left arm. Very strange. I undo his belt, and take off his top hat... BLAST! It was just a decoy turkey!

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: The most ridiculous character ever dreamt up for a film. DETACHO, a top-hat wearing villian who is able to detach his body parts for use as weapons. His most powerful weapons are his elbows, which he can detach, tie together with his belt and use as nunchucks. DETACHO has a sidekick turkey which he uses as an advanced scout as well.

hints.author: pmbeddall
hints.mnemonic: I'm surprised no one has worked Oddjob, the villain from the James Bond movie, Goldfinger into their stories. He's the big oriental guy that killed people by throwing his top hat at them. He practises his technique on turkeys, detaching their heads in the process. Being an assassin, he can also kill people by garroting them with his belt or smashing them with his elbows.

hints.mnemonic: As for the left element - 离 - i think it'd be interesting to read the following wiki-article http

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: The King's crystal got detached from his royal throne, and is missing! Looks like the turkey got away with it. He's no where to be seen!

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: In my story for detatch detach (#1492 離), the left side primitive was junkie. The top-hatted villian of society with a belt around their elbow. Here, the junkie is getting a fix of crystal meth

hints.mnemonic: Michael Jackson is the king of pop, wearing his crystal rhinestone glove (see detach (#1492 離).

hints.mnemonic: I remember this one the way the Japanese do

hints.author: jimitha
hints.mnemonic: A rare instance in which Heisig made a mistake in the primitives. The bottom is not spicy, because there is no vase or standing here--the first horizontal stroke of the "vase" is too long. Rather, this is soil and a new primitive below, which we shall call a garden-variety goat. It's like the mountain goat in frame 1959, just not in the mountains. Thus, happiness is exemplified by a goat nibbling on soiled garbage on the ground. (We'll only get to use goat once more, in frame 1613).

hints.author: CaLeDee
hints.mnemonic: Happiness adds a bit of spice to your life.

hints.author: jure23
hints.mnemonic: After finally tracking down your real father he Tenaciously clasps your hand.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Recall the fashion model wearing just a stamp over his crotch (clothing (#1399 服)). When he got happy, of course, it ended up in the news report.

hints.author: PrettyKitty
hints.mnemonic: On the news

hints.author: happychair
hints.mnemonic: The REPORT from the doctor made me HAPPY because it said that he had STAMPED out my CROTCH infection.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: "My child's book report got a happy stamp again

hints.author: yuriehoshii
hints.mnemonic: BÁO

hints.mnemonic: There was a man in a village who had a special gift

hints.author: scottamus

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Matthew

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Women love men with money. If you have a high income you can get a cornicopia of crotches.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: STROKE ORDER WARNING

hints.mnemonic: The Fantastic Four use Jessica Alba's crotch to gain some extra income.

hints.author: slats70
hints.mnemonic: A prostitute with 4 crotches could sure pull in a big income.

hints.author: ergerg

hints.mnemonic: Lowly people only have a drop of brains and use nothing but 4-letter words.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The lowly people with a drop of brains are the ones who labor to produce the cornucopia.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: That Fantastic Four movie was so lowly, I only needed a drop of brains to watch it. Note

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: There is a grave of a lowly man with a tombstone made of a simple, small stone. If you bow really low you can read the very small inscription engraved on the stone, it says - “Now that you bowed so low to read this, you are as lowly as I once was”.

hints.author: ruuku35
hints.mnemonic: A STONE makes a LOWLY TOMBSTONE.

hints.author: astridtops

hints.author: Nuriko

hints.author: fiminor

hints.author: fiminor

hints.author: thelooseteeth

hints.mnemonic: Looks like a physics formula to me

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: Halfway the journey of 3030 kanji (both Heisig 一 & 三 ), you watch the long road that lies ahead of you, and you start to feel down and overwhelmed... like if you were being swallowed by quicksand - grounds... but you soon realize that if you made it this far, you can keep going and eventually finish! You round up all the will-force UNDER your control, and get out of this rut! And just like you, our FORCES combined will let us finish this journey! Let's go users!!.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: land (#1513 陸) The rice-seedlings (newly freed from the ground but with soil still clinging to their roots) gather in a circle around an oven fire. They need to heat up prior to their journey (presumably plants can't walk if they're too cold?).

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: Heat up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. (Note

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: This is Mario avoiding the fire's heat. http

hints.mnemonic: Just a comment on Erikkusan's story

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: (NB

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: land (#1513 陸) Deciding to use the diamond-shaped water caltrop flower as cover/protection, the rice-seedlings with their walking legs (now free from soil), can start their journey.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: Some girls want diamonds, but others will be satisfied with just flowers. However if you think you can win her over with rice seedlings, expect her to get up on her walking legs and walk on out!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I gave her a flower  and a diamond. We went for a walk through the rice seedlings after she said yes.

hints.author: Drack
hints.mnemonic: Mitsubishi! In Japanese, 三菱 .. "Three Diamonds" .. Now look at their logo! THREE DIAMONDS. Not really a story for remembering this kanji, just wanted to share how I was just amazed by something obvious.

hints.author: Shizuru
hints.mnemonic: I would give that lady a diamond, if she let me plant a rice seedling in her flower between her walking legs...

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: land (#1513 陸) However, the pinnacle that the rice-seedlings finally reach with the use of their walking legs turns out not to be the Promised Land after all, but simply a mausoleum (containing many dead rice-seedlings exhausted from previous quests?). Oh no!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: On top of The Pinnacle is a masoleum for rice seedling farmers. They make an annual walking pilgrimage there.

hints.author: bananarama
hints.mnemonic: At the pinnicle is a mausolem. The ground is sown with rice seedings to stop the dead from rising on walking legs.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Every year, thousands walk up The Pinnacle to see the Mushroom Mausoleum. It's shaped like a mushroom, surrounded by mushrooms, and supposedly Toad is enshrined inside (he died in a fiery Rainbow Road accident).

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: Ancient Japanese built a mausoleum for the "unknown rice farmer". It's on the pinnacle of Mt. Fuji, and it has a statue of a guy with huge walking legs planting rice seedlings as he goes.

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Top Hat + Elbow + Person

hints.author: roundrabbit
hints.mnemonic: This is easy, if you know Mr. Peanut, the logo of Planters. Replace his face or body with an acorn and you have Mr. Acorn, the logo / sign of the hog. He wears the same top hat, has the same turned out elbow holding a diagonal walking stick, and poses like a human.

hints.author: Tobberoth
hints.mnemonic: Warning

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Q

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: The nucleus of an oak TREE is an ACORN.

hints.author: yorkii
hints.mnemonic: In the nucleus of the acorn, all the DNA is stored -- the building blocks for a new tree.

hints.author: daredawg3583
hints.mnemonic: Ernest Rutherford discovered the Nucleus. Picture him sitting under a tree pondering atoms, after an ACORN falls on him he suddenly understands that each atom has a nucleus.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [nucleus; core; kernel] Right in the nucleus of the acorn, you can find a future tree.

hints.author: atylmo
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the tree as the nucleus, and the acorn as the electrons rotating out around it. It's a forest of nuclei!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with sabres, distinct from samurai) used to engrave the kanji for his name onto acorns, and throw the acorns to distract his enemies. The legend goes that by the time his victims would pick up the acorn and read the engraved kanji, they were already dead.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: While it's traditional for lovers to engrave their names on a tree in many countries, in Japan, however, it was traditional for a samurai to signify his undying love for a woman by engraving the kanji of her name on an acorn with his sabre.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: TIP

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: The above-stated words are the acorn from which the following statement grows.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: I literally imagined atree with words stuck on acorns. And thus the words are above-stated (that is until they fall on your head I guess). (This one really needs a mental picture).

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: You, a hog, just asked what the word means. Socrates answers

hints.author: cameron_en

hints.mnemonic: Sorry, I know this is crude, but it's just so easy to remember

It is a flex of muscle by congress against the current president, but it is a very weak one. Imagine censure as congress flexing as hard as it can, only to have a little acorn-sized bump of muscle pop up suddenly.

Picture a stalk of celery and a pair of animal legs slipping and sliding clumsily around the ice, and never able to leave the house. Eventually it got so cold that the little animal froze to death.

hints.author: lankydan
hints.mnemonic: Block up cold house with dirt.

hints.mnemonic: Occurs in heart attack ( 心筋梗塞 ). To prevent it

hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Grass Skirt primitive

hints.mnemonic: This brew of whiskey will cause you wear grass skirts and dance around like a maniac!

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The islanders defer to the words of their chief Jou in his grass skirt.

hints.author: OddAndersen

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: OddAndersen is correct. 譲る 【ゆずる】 (v5r,vt) to turn over; to assign; to hand over; to transmit; to convey; to sell; to dispose of; to yield; to surrender; (P) 譲渡 【じょうと】 (n,vs) transfer; assignment; conveyance; (P) STORY

hints.author: aaronvanvalen
hints.mnemonic: The island girl in the grass skirt says demurely "I defer (yield) to your words of judgment, wise one". Colonization is great.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: My dream is to buy a small lot on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing in a grass skirt.

hints.mnemonic: On the island of JOU, in order to be considered a lot, a ground must be big enough to grow sufficient grass for a grass skirt.

hints.mnemonic: (RE

hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.mnemonic: Conversation at a party

hints.mnemonic: LASS is short for LAdy-in-a-skirt-made-of-graSS.
