hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: If you grow up with a mother that drinks and smokes, you can be sure it's poison in the stuff you get from her breasts.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Note that stroke order of grow up primitive isn't obvious from Heisig's diagram

hints.author: ctraabe
hints.mnemonic: You can use silicone implants to to make your breasts "grow up" but if they leak, it's poison.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: For grow up I will be using the idea of Peter Pan the boy who did anything but grow up. Have you ever wondered what happened to Peter Pans mother? My guess is he poisoned her.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: To those who grow up lactose intolerant, mother's milk is a poison.

hints.author: lerris
hints.mnemonic: When he was growing up, Venom never had many friends in elementary school. Maybe it explains why he turned out how he did.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: This is a pictogram of string theory. Strings are the most elementary particles of matter, which then grow up to become matter itself.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: Elementary my dear Watson! Peter parker grew up to become Spiderman!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman started fighting crime at an early age, so he didn't go to school as he grew up. He may be an expert in practical things, but his scholarly knowledge is quite elementary.

hints.author: eatyoda
hints.mnemonic: In elementary school Peter Pan taunted Venom eventually pushing him onto the path of evil.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: If you eat lots of barley, you'll grow up to have strong walking legs.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Barley is a very cheap grain, and it's not really worth spending time to harvest. Therefore, scientists have genetically engineered it to grow walking legs once the grain is grown up and mature, so it can harvest itself.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: "Grown up" barley, i.e. beer, is what gets you tottering legs.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: The secret of PETER PAN's flight - he eats BARLEY to turn his WALKING LEGS into flying legs.

hints.author: Beneus
hints.mnemonic: You're walking through a barley field. With every step you take, it grows noticeably, but if you go back it shrinks. You need to get to the other side of the field, but with every step it gets harder to navigate. Will you make it out of this strange field?

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: "Once in a blue moon" refers to a rare event. But originally "blue moon" refers to a full moon, in other words a fully grown-up moon. Whether once a month is rare or not depends on what we're talking about, but that happens to be the origin of the expression.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The last time I saw a blue moon was in my youth when I was growing up.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Blue = Smurfs, whose bodies never grow up.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: They say that as the sun gets older, it grows up and becomes red. However, that's not the case for the moon, which turns blue as it grows up.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Once in a Blue moon you can see Peter Pan flying high above it.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: Before rice is refined, it is actually blue...bet ya didn't know that!! (alternate....Condi Rice was blue when insurgents blew up the iraqi refinery where oil is refined).

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Very refined people in the upper classes have skin as pale as rice and blue blood.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: NB This means "spirit", "vitality", "essence", "semen". For vitality, you need to eat healthy food, symbolized by rice, and exercise under the blue sky.

hints.author: yorkii
hints.mnemonic: The job of the smurfs. not many people know this, but it is to create the most refined rice in the world.

hints.author: wonderflonium
hints.mnemonic: "Uh, why is your rice blue?" "It's been refined! And by 'refined' I mean it's been in the back of my fridge for a few months.".

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: That door-to-door salesman can stand outside ringing my doorbell until he's blue in the face. There's a big sign on my front door, and the words clearly say "No Soliciting".

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: You can talk until you're blue in the face, but if you're trying to solicit me, you're just wasting your time...

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Going through smurf blue light district - heres a smurfette saying all sorts of dirty words trying to solicit herself.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When you're blue, you need to solicit words to help you.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: The Blue Man Group need no Words to Solicit themselves. They naturally draw a crowd without ever speaking a word.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: Data is feeling blue about not having any feelings ... hey, wait a minute.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Feeling blue is a state of mind where you're dominated by your feelings.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Spending too much time with one's feelings leads to the "having the blues", which we can put graphically as a blue state of mind.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: Feeling blue is your state of mind when someone hurts your feelings.

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: When your state of mind is blue, you tend to want to talk about your feelings.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Sun and blue sky! Yep, the weather's cleared up!

hints.author: dilandau23
hints.mnemonic: When we speak of clearing up we easily think of both the sun and blue skies. But in another since to clear up is the absence of weather. And therefor the reason weather has no place in its writing.

hints.author: andresito
hints.mnemonic: The sky cleared up and we have a sunny blue day.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Its clear weather now. Smufs are sunbathing. Sun and blue sky. What more do they need?

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Once it clears up, the sun will wash your blues away!

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Pure sea water is always a radiant blue.

hints.author: partyrash
hints.mnemonic: Bottles of water claim to be pure. They're generally in blue containers, because blue makes you feel like its that much more pure.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Pure water is pure blue.

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: Aristocrats who boast of the purity of their lineage claim to have blue blood, as suggested by the delicate blue veins showing under their pale, thin skin. Here one of them is moved to cut himself, letting a few blue drops out to show the purity of his ancestry, breeding and intentions.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: You can't say (せい) that there is anything purer than crystal clear blue water from the ocean.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: When someone you know who is normally talkative goes quiet, it's usually a sign that they are contending with the blues.

hints.author: zz_alex_zz
hints.mnemonic: "And the next contender is.... a Smurf!" As you can imagine, the crowd goes quiet with shock.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When you feel blue, you want to go somewhere quiet to help you contend with your problems.

hints.author: robertmyers
hints.mnemonic: The once proud and boisterous contender has been smacked down by a smurf and is quiet for once.

hints.author: Skinny
hints.mnemonic: Best way to get kids to be quiet. Have a quiet contest. Each contender must be quiet by holding their breath until they turn blue in the face.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: As one grows up, one typically starts to blame all of their problems on money.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: This is the story of a poor fisherman and his wife. A long time ago he caught an oyster with a small but precious pearl. The intelligent wife told him to sell the pearl immediately

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Alice (poison (#1531 毒)) blames her strange adventures on a batch of bad raw oysters.

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: Those poor little oysters will never grow up now. And who's to blame? The Walrus and the Carpenter of course.

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: Peter Pan farts a lot, and he blames it on all the oysters he greedily devours! Tinkerbell says, "Peter, stop blaming the shells and grow up!".

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Spidey's exploits are world famous but still The Daily Bugle's pages blame him for every problem out there.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: [Geek alert] A lot of modern software is full of exploits which can be abused by hackers. I blame multi-threading.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Thorough psychological analysis reveals that all of Spiderman's villains are actually obsessed with him and long to be "dominated" by him. Therefore, the citizens of New York have no-one to blame but Spiderman for these villains' reckless exploits.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman's exploits have earned him fame and blame.

hints.author: jajaaan
hints.mnemonic: The exploits of the RTK online community are such that every single poster has personified the thread radical into Spiderman. I blame it on the video games and TV that the kids are watching now-a-days.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: On many wheat cereal boxes, there is a disclaimer stating that "This package is sold by weight, not by volume. Some settling of contents may have occurred." well they only say that because they don't want to be blamed by people getting really disappointed after they see what a small volume of cereal the box really contains.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The volume of the wheat crop is way down this year! Blame the weather!

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Wheaties and other cereals are sold by weight, not volume, in order to avoid blame if the contents settle. (simplified version of sweetneet's).

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: The volume of wheat I ate is to blame for my weight gain.

hints.author: arun90
hints.mnemonic: Most people say carbohydrates (grain) are to blame for their excessive volume.

hints.author: Wakela
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T's plot of world domination is foiled. Who is to blame? Bond. James Bond.

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: [bond; loan; debt] Mr. T buys a lot of high risk bonds and then blames his broker when they all plummet in value.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: It also means Loan and Debt

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: OBAMA won't take the BLAME for the drop in BOND markets, he'll blame Bush.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T came by my house and demanded I repay my bonds. But I told him it wasn't my fault—my annoying neighbor is to blame. Huh? It worked!? Seems like he went next door and beat my neighbor to a pulp!

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: When pickling you MUST use distilled water! When it doesn't come out right, generally it is the water that is to blame.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Bad water is to blame for the process of pickling.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: When the pickling doesn't come out right, generally the water is to blame.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Think of knocking over a big jar of dill pickles and spilling water everywhere, then blaming your friend.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: During pickling, water is drawn out of the vegetable or fruit. Thus the pickling agent (miso, salt etc.) is responsible (to blame) for robbing the pickled item of its water.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: When I was GROWING UP, the SURFACE of my SCARF was always covered with snot from blowing my nose on it.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: As girls grow up, something slowly surfaces from under their scarf.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Alice got back to the surface by climbing up the rabbit hole on an extremely long scarf.

hints.author: rhclaghorn
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a scarf growing up until it covers the entire SURFACE of the world.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: It seems to mean "outer layer". Some animals shed their surface as they grow up. If it doesn't shed fully they end up wearing it like a scarf!

hints.author: volfy
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T's punching bag has one beat up surface.

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Do you know why every person in Japan has a Louis Vuitton bag? After the 1985 JAL air crash that killed 520 people (the world's worst). An image on tv of the crash showed Louis Vuitton bags (whose LV logo covered surface was somehow impervious) litering the crash site. From that point on they stuck in Japanese people's mind's as durable and high quality. (True story).

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: Superficial people (ie those who are only concerned about the surface) are obsessed with expensive bags.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Haruhi is imprinted on the surface of my bag.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: TIP

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: To ensure she remained undefiled, a young girl growing up in a rough area always kept a dagger concealed under her threads, even when she went into the water.

hints.author: tcjeff
hints.mnemonic: (rgravina) To ensure she remained undefiled, a young girl growing up in a rough area always kept a dagger concealed under her Spiderman underwear (to remember the position of thread), even when she went into the water.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Venom's suit is self-cleaning and remains undefiled, despite its forming weapons, growing up into daggers and killing people, sending drops of fluid (blood) flying everywhere. No water necessary, and his conscience is clean too.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Oh no, comeback of the dirty imagery.. And I thought I got rid of that. Anyway, the "grown-up dagger" is a, um, phallus (are these characters like the Rorschach ink blots? Freud would be proud). Here someone ties a thread around it, so that dirty liquid won't come out of it and his surroundings remain undefiled.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: By growing up with a dagger under his pillow, Venom remained undefiled until marriage. He even washed himself with holy water just to be sure.

hints.author: frozach
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: With our new pills we pledge to grow your dagger bigger  - typical junk mail.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In order to pledge into her sorority, Alice had to stab a St. Bernard with a dagger. (Come on! DO it, Alice!).

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: In medieval Japan often to form an alliance Warlords would give up their daughter as a pledge. She would grow up guarded by daggers and St. Bernard dogs. If the alliance was broken she would be killed (More or less true).

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: "I pledge my allegiance to the flag....

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This means eat/drink/smoke. Maybe you make a pledge to stop gutsing/binging/puffing, but your own mouth is tempting you to put something in it.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: I make my mouth pledge to consume less.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: New American pledge of allegiance

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: After pledging, Alice and the sorority consumed the St. Bernard with their mouths.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: You have an eating problem and always CONSUME too much, cramming it in your MOUTH. Here, you make a PLEDGE to CONSUME less, maybe by keeping your MOUTH shut more often.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: With kids growing up in your house, you have to keep them from harm of putting anything in their mouth, paint chips, bleach, knvies, etc.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is silly, but.. If a house suddenly grows up from your mouth, you will come to great harm.

hints.author: Beneus
hints.mnemonic: Babies think that there's no harm in putting stuff in their mouths, but you just know that one day they'll find a growth pill, eat it and crash through the roof of your house as they grow.

hints.author: rowdyphantom
hints.mnemonic: In the house, whenever Alice opens her mouth (to eat or drink) she causes harm (by growing too big for the house).

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Harm is being done all throughout the house that Peter Pan lives in. Him and all the lost boys are all putting things they aren't supposed to into their mouths! (thanks dingomick) I'm going to call this the lost boys house.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Control is very important! Especially when operating a car. Few people realize the harm they can cause just by losing control of their car for a second. Tremendous harm. Stay in control!

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of cars have spun out of control! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents; nobody was harmed.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: If you lose control of your car, you may come to great harm.

hints.author: blubko
hints.mnemonic: Losing control of your car results in great harm.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: In Knightrider, the car KITT was in control, making sure no harm came to the Hoff.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [proportion; comparatively; divide; cut; separate; split] Hey, don't take this out of proportion! I did you just a little harm, no need to come over here with a saber...

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: As shown on this pie-chart, the proportion of people harmed by sabres is relatively a small slice compared to those harmed by guns.

hints.author: QuackingShoe
hints.mnemonic: In Japanese anime and video games, the heroes often have sabers that seem way out of proportion to their weilders, especially with how scrawny these pointy-haired kids tend to be. I'm not sure if the proportions of those sabers will cause more harm to their enemies or their weilders... Or, I'm surprised they don't harm themselves with the proportions of their sabres.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: The harm caused by a saber is not always in proportion to its size.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: The harm is proportional to the size of the saber.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The constitution is important. At least my parents thought so. In the house where I grew up, it was framed on the wall. Under the watchful (sideways) eye of my mother, we had to study it until we knew it by heart.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The house of US Congress needs to grow up! Their twisted eyes have lost the heart of the constitution.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The original Japanese constitution is locked up deep within the Imperial Palace, home of the Emperor. Since its creation, it's gotten bigger and bigger, and it's even grown a pair of eyes, as well as a beating heart. Naturally the Emperor tries to keep this hidden from the public, but what will they do once the constitution-monster becomes big enough to destroy the palace?

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: I grow up in a house which values the constitution. My father always told me to look not just with my eyes but with my heart as well.

hints.author: bennyb
hints.mnemonic: [ +CharleyGarret + Growing up=Peter Pan] In Peter Pan's Lost Boys house, they eye the consitution every day and have learned it by heart. "No Lost Girls, Captain Hook stinks, we'll never grow up! We'll scream till we're pink!" (Hey, I'm trying here - there are no other Peter Pan stories.).

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: This is the first CELL of a human, the foundation of its entire LIFE, a small DROP that will GROW UP to form a complex organism.

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: Growing Up is just a Drop of our LIFE.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: Frankenstein's monster given the spark of life. Let's call him Frank. From Mary Shelley's work along with Young Frankenstein and other references.

hints.author: dboyle
hints.mnemonic: Add a drop of miracle grow and a plant really comes to life.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Life starts with a drop of sperm and then you grow up.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The sun is the nearest star to the only planet with life - Earth.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Sun is a star that has given life. Can't say that of any other stars yet.

hints.author: kiisu
hints.mnemonic: Our star, the sun, gives life to all cells.

hints.author: shuusaku
hints.mnemonic: The SUN is the STAR that gives LIFE to our planet.

hints.author: paramausi
hints.mnemonic: One day in my life i will be a star!

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: On awakening the first thing I notice is a (nearly empty) whiskey bottle by my bed. Then I see the stars are still shining. “I think I’ll go back to sleep and try awakening again later.”.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: You'll need an awakening after the whiskey bottle makes you see stars.

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: My awakening came not from ordinary hallucinogens but from extraordinary whiskey

hints.author: HolyKotor
hints.mnemonic: The first thing I see when I awaken is stars, I wonder why until I feel the whiskey bottle next to me. Ah crap, I still need to sober up.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 半醒半睡 , 覚せい剤 , 覚醒剤 , 醒ます , 醒める awakening (#2750 醒) セイ, (さます, さめる (now usu. 覚ます・覚める ) ... Parts

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: When women marry, they adopt the surname of their husband, signifiying the start of a new life together. (adapted from gorgon).

hints.author: gorgon
hints.mnemonic: Woman change their surname when they "start their new life".

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: To help you keep this separate from family name (#1828 氏) (as I have been doing lately...), picture a woman who just married a man, and of course, she adopts his surname and they start a new life together. Throughout their entire life together, he requires her to address him as "sir." Yes, like the sur in "surname".

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Women should keep their own surname when they marry. Changing surname is like disavowing your previous life.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The woman didn't want to marry Frankenstein in the first place, much less have to change her surname. (Image

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Sex is the only state of mind for many men through their whole life.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: When you're in the state of mind for creating new lives.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I think this can also mean gender--one could look at the differences between gender and sex

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Data's life did not begin with sex.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Despite being of the same sex, Data and Frankenstein do each other knowing it's the only sex they'll ever get. (Image

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Animal sacrifice = taking the life of a cow.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: In the 21st century, animal sacrifice is no longer really necessary. We can take a single cell from a cow, with no harm to the cow. We create a viable cell line from this single cell, and feed the resulting biomatter into a furnace at the exact rate necessary to appease the gods.

hints.author: brian44
hints.mnemonic: The whole life of a cow is like one big long animal sacrifice.

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: Life for a cow in India is pretty good. At least they would never be used as an animal scarifice.

hints.author: Danieru
hints.mnemonic: There are two kanji that should be kept separate

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: If you were to stand up all the products you have accumulated over the course of your entire life on top of one another, the result would probably be as tall as a cliff.

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: The salesman is standing on the cliff's edge. "Buy my products!! Buy my products! Or else I'll take my own life"! Man, that's selling on pressure.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Japanese are obsesed with all the products they can buy. Stand up for your self!! take the products to a cliff, threw them off, and stat a new life!!!

hints.author: paramausi
hints.mnemonic: People stand on a cliff and want to end their lifes. This is a product of todays society.

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: A Biotech company has an unusual showcase for their products

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: You are struggling to the top across the humps, but you suddenly see the pinnacle and you feel new life in your walking legs.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A woman takes her bra off and what happens? Nine months later the hump in her belly pops out between her legs as a new life.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: I climbed to the pinnacle with my girlfriend and we immediately got to making life between her legs (humping).

hints.author: Ramchip
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle, this perfect place, did have one person with a hump on his back. Poor guy spent his whole life aimlessly walking around the Pinnacle, without finding anyone to relate to.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The hump of a camel is actually a separate animal resting on top of the camel. It has its own walking legs and its own life. These animals are great as pets but are very expensive. A resident of The Pinnacle has bought one of the expensive pets - a hump with walking legs and a life of its own - and is walking it home from the pet store.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: "Walking legs" over "bushes" needs to have a primitive meaning of its own. It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 sew (#1563 縫), 逢 tryst (#2417 逢), 蜂 bee (#2687 蜂), and 鋒 sword's point (#2768 鋒), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. "Pointy" works fairly well

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Moses climbs to the summit of the mountain using his walking legs to talk to the burning bush.

hints.author: crayonmaster
hints.mnemonic: If you are using the "walking legs + bushes = pubic hair" primitive... The nudist colony was banished to the top of the mountain's summit, so that nobody would have to see their bushes again!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Like in the next frame, the right side element is "walking through bushes". This time they're not on the road, but on a mountain, whose summit you're trying to reach. (the element will come in at least 逢 again).

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Bush between walking legs = pubic hair!

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: A bee is an insect with a pointy (see summit (#1562 峰)) stinger.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: I got stung by an insect walking through the bushes, I think it was a bee.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: Many people think bees are insects with fur. But that is not correct! The "fur" is actually the pubic hair (bush under walking legs).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The insect that interrupted our tryst (#2417 逢) was a bee!

hints.author: HolyKotor
hints.mnemonic: Most people don't know that the hair covering a bee (insect) isn't fur, but actually pubic hair. Little known fact.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Good thing I brought some thread, cause I need to sew my pants that I tore up walking through the bushes (see summit (#1562 峰)) before we hit the road to go back down the mountain.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman while walking through bushes chasing a villain, rips his suit and stops on the road to sew it up.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Spider man has to sew a new costume. He slipped while web swinging and fell on a bunch of pointy stuff in the road. Ouch! (See Mcfate's summit (#1562 峰) story for the "pointy" primitive).

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has to sew his spider suit after the tryst (#2417 逢) last night. (He had to keep his suit on during the tryst to keep his anonymity).

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: After a 逢 tryst (#2417 逢), they will sew a scarlet letter to your clothes with red thread. Or at least, that's how it used to be done.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: I put my fingers together in worship of the bush that hangs from the ceiling -- that wonderful mistletoe which has gotten me kissed by many a girl.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: Because I worship her, I only finger ONE BUSH, her's, and no others!

hints.author: mikedough2
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a weird cult where you hang a bush from the ceiling and then point at it with one finger saying "Bush, bush, bush, I worship the bush!".

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: PRESIDENT BUSH thought that coming to power would cause people to WORSHIP him, but now that his approval rating is so low, people just give him the FINGER and hang BUSH-pinatas from the CEILING to hit with bats.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Some people worship George Bush. I'd like to hang him from the ceiling and give him the finger.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This old China man glued shrubs to his body. The added intake of oxygen from the shrubs was, according to him, the secret of his longevity. Sometimes he would sit all day in meditation without moving, and the locals believed the old man had actually turned into a shrub !

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: To ensure longevity of her virginity, Alice applied a thick layer of glue on her bush.

hints.author: sarek05
hints.mnemonic: In an attempt to increase a bush's longevity, an incompitent gardener glues all the leaves back on that have fallen off. Maybe he should have tried watering it instead.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: The only reason "President Bush" has had such longevity in the white house is all the people under him who keep gluing his presidential career back together.

hints.author: sir_sanuk
hints.mnemonic: Increase the longevity of a bush by sticking the fallen leaves back on with glue.

hints.author: scout
hints.mnemonic: They made a metal casting of the Chinese man who glued shrubs to himself to increase his longevity. It's now sold around the world as it's thought that having one will increase your own longevity..

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: You make a casting of your baby's shoes in gold to ensure the longevity of the experience.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: We take a casting because metal will have much greater longevity than the original.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: Casting things in metal improves their longevity.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: I have a problem with longevity so I need Bush in this story too. Here das Bush is wanting a metal casting made of him to guarantee his longevity - reminds me of the statue of Saddam that was pulled down.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, in order to enroll in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that you were really Christian. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a Christmas tree and a picture of some bamboo and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Japanese father enrolls his student in a well-rounded school

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, Santa Claus visited Asia and left presents under bamboo Christmas trees for all the children who enrolled in his Asian beta-testing...

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: Once upon a time, there was a little bamboo plant who tried to enroll as a Christmas tree.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: Enroll in the class to make the BAMBOO- CHRISTMAS TREE that were made ONCE UPON A TIME. (セキ).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In the springtime bonsai get plenty of sun.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: When it's springtime you can only leave the bonsai out when the sun has gone down. Their little leaves can't handle too much heat.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: Springtime is the best season for Bonsai, because you can leave it out in the sun all day.

hints.author: gibler
hints.mnemonic: A more simple Primitive than bonsai

hints.author: Cyclone
hints.mnemonic: Quand le soleil sort enfin au printemps (il est encore bas dans le ciel), papa, maman, bébé (trois personnes 三 人 ) se promènent au soleil( 日 ).

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: The tree of spring. Fact

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Anyone who's lived in Japan knows camellia are by far the first tree of spring to flower. And how can you miss those shockingly pink flowers!

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: The camellia tree got its name from all the chameleons that cover every part of it during the spring.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The camellia is the tree which brings out its own springtime, even when it's not springtime, as it blooms around January.

hints.author: sskaggs
hints.mnemonic: The camellia is the famous tree you see blooming in early spring, and also, the camellia is taken from its tree to be used in "flowering tea," as a small way to bring spring into your tea breaks. ---- Ways you've seen camellias that may help memorization

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: If you look into Japanese gardens they seem so peaceful - with their small bonsais and the white stones looking like rice grains.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: A monk pleads with an invading warrior not to destroy his people. "We are a peaceful people," the monk pleads. "Our monks spend all of their time tending to their harmless bonsai trees. And as for food, we require only a few grains of rice.".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A bonsai with rice under it (to imitate a miniature white rock garden) is the epitome of a peaceful image.

hints.author: iVoid
hints.mnemonic: I can't help but imagine a monk mediating under a bonsai tree, surviving only on a few grains of rice, seems so peaceful.

hints.author: gibler
hints.mnemonic: A more simple Primitive than bonsai

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: When you play music to them, your bonsai will grow like they are in heaven.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: In heaven you are surrounded by bonsai trees (full-sized ones fall through the clouds) while you play music on your harp. I always have trouble remembering that the bonsai tree is on top, so think of them growing on top of the clouds.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: I play music to my bonsai to help it grow. Its favourite song is Stairway to Heaven.

hints.author: mr_hans_moleman
hints.mnemonic: When you play music to them, your bonsai will grow until they reach the HEAVENS.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese believe that when they die, they will go to a heaven with beautiful bonzai gardens and gentle music playing.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Bonsais are grown in a house, away from the harsh reality of the real world where they wouldn't survive.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: On this rather boring 'big brother' type reality show, they have locked up bonsai inside a house and everyone is watching them on TV 24x7. The viewers have to vote on which bonsai shall remain in the house and which one has to leave.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: (adapted from PepeSeco) In a new TV reality show called bonsai house, participants are challenged to grow the best bonsai. It takes years to make just one episode!

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Mr. Miyagi is on a new reality TV show, House of Miyagi. 20 aspiring martial artists have to wash and clean an old house, while growing their own bonsai. Of course, their Bonsai don't come out very well, since they're novices. (I'm trying to differentiate this bonsai from the rest of the ones we've learned as being a messed up bonsai.. Notice the last stroke doesn't connect to the 2nd stroke of the kanji, but the 3rd instead.).

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The reality is that most bonsai don't do well in the house.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: To join the temple, you have to dedicate yourself to raising bonsai for enlightenment, and cornstalks for sustenance.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A Japanese farmer who was growing corn tried to dedicate himself to the god of corn (in the hope it would bring better harvests). He had a little room with prayer beads, incense, etc. One day he brought an offerand that he thought would please the god of corn

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: I used does not equal for the primitve(slant the line as a slash through the "equals" sign). Story

hints.author: drivers99
hints.mnemonic: You have to be really dedicated to make a bonsai tree out of a cornstalk.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Once a year, the Japanese decorate bonsai trees with miniature cornstalks, and dedicate them to the Ainu, the indigenous people of Japan. (For the record, I completely made that up, and I don't think corn has anything to do with Ainu, except that it reminds me of natives).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T gets a stipend every month if he stays dedicated to his temple training, a very hard thing for the impatient T.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: People who are highly dedicated to their jobs get good salaries/stipends.

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: You must be kidding... yet another source of confusion, with earnings (#893 稼), salary (#1349 給), assets (#473 資), savings (#194 貯) and income (#1510 収). A stipend, in English at least, has a connotation of only a small regular payment. Despite a life of dedication, P has to go back to a simple life of tending to bonsai and growing corn after he retires with only a small monthly stipend.

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T triked the botanic intruction institute into thinking that he dedicated his whole like in bonsai and corn research. He even manage to get a stipend from that institute. In fact he's not dedicated at all when it comes to bonsai or corn... he only water them once in a while.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The stipend is given to a person who is very dedicated to his bonsai art so he can study more.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Ha! If you know anything about Buddhist monks, during meditation, they're slapped with wooden rods to stay dedicated to their task.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: The wood from this tree is dedicated to making rods to flog naughty kids.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: After crafting his rod from the finest tree in the land, Moses broke into a battle rap. "I dedicate this rod/ To the all mighty God!".

hints.author: eltjopoort
hints.mnemonic: A rod is a piece of wood that is dedicated to a particular purpose... (use your imagination).

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: I dedicate this tree... to rod stuart. fuck knows why.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I discreetly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Cabbage primitive

hints.author: kodorakun
hints.mnemonic: HOW TO REMEMBER CABBAGE

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Be discreet and don't say to old people that their heads look like cabbages, even if they're all wrinkles.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Instead of cabbage here I see the Piranha Plant from Super Mario bros. It's a flower with a mouth and it grows up out of a pipe! Seems to make sense to me. But instead of regular Mario you have Socrates! So here is what is going on. Two Piranha Plants are discreetly discussing when they will come up out of their pipes to hit Socrates. They have to talk discreetly however becuase Socrates is standing right next to their pipes.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: To MR.T swallowing a whole CABBAGE is no more than a TRIFLE.

hints.author: brendanmacdonald
hints.mnemonic: MR. T doesn't look a wee bit scared of the CABBAGE PATCH KID.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is a trifle annoyed when he finds cabbage in his trifle (pun -- trifle is a kind of dessert in UK).

hints.author: kanjihito

Many have been looking for the elixir of life but they failed. And they go together because many would despise a life without any money.

hints.author: FudoMyo

hints.author: rtkrtk

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: In the preface to his latest edition of RTK, Heisig tells us that until he invented his brilliant kanji-learning method, he was living in a cave beforehand. Luckily, the publishing of the book gave him enough money to move out of the cave into an apartment. He could also finally afford to put a handle on his halberd.

hints.author: lankydan
hints.mnemonic: Read preface on the cave beforehand or you'll be sorry...

hints.author: Viking101

hints.author: synewave

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: You bang your head on the ATM, wishing you'd deposited some money beforehand.

hints.author: rtkrtk

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: (RPG) All of you who enjoy playing RPGs every now and then should be familiar with this. When you accept a risky quest like hunting for the head of some evil monster. You should deposit your money (shells) beforehand, so that when you die you don't lose all of your wealth.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, instead of sending your statements in the mail, you are given a small book that you can insert into the ATMs and all activity will be printed inside. One of the few good things that Japanese banks do. When depositing money at an ATM, you must open your book to the right page and insert beforehand to have a record of the deposit written in.

hints.author: BlackMarsh
hints.mnemonic: These days we all work in front of computers. Beforehand we all worked out in the fields, in the plains.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The plains are a challenging place to get any work done. Be sure you recharge your computer's battery beforehand, or you won't get anything done.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Think of plains in contrast to hills, mountains, and skyscrapers. A saboteur breaks into the military computer complex. Wearing gloves to avoid leaving fingerprints, he types a few codes into the computer that unleash the nuclear weapons on the target city. The target city, formerly a varied landscape of hills, mountains, and skyscrapers, is instantly flattened into level and barren landscape

hints.author: aerdeyn
hints.mnemonic: If I'd checked Google maps on the computer beforehand I wouldn't be lost out on the plains.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a rake, is suddenly attacked from both left and right concurrently by bulls with animal horns. Our hero lets out a blood-curdling scream and tears his rake handle vertically in half, so he now has two wooden staffs (split rake handle) to fight with. He grips each staff (left side and right side) and rams it into the horns of the charging bulls. The force of each charging bull causes the tips of each staff to split again (split bottom of each rake handle).

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Special rake, used to hold a bull by both horns concurrently. Two handles have V-like ends to set your arms against.

hints.author: zanzibar

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Concurrently Primitive

hints.mnemonic: Naturally, if you're dating more than one woman concurrently, they will certainly dislike each other!

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: WOMEN dislike CASANOVA because he dates more than one concurrently.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: Have you wondered why so many people can die at a particular instant when there's only one Grim Reaper? Wonder no more! He uses a magical metal sickle that can kill mutiple people concurrently.

hints.mnemonic: For Harvest Moon Players

hints.mnemonic: When you are self-effacing you use words to concurrently bring yourself down and make yourself look better.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Try to compliment a Japanese person and they'll interrupt you by saying self-effacing words concurrently.

hints.author: Stormchild
hints.mnemonic: Though the man's words were self-effacing, his actions concurrently made it clear that his modesty was false.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Say + Concurrently

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: CASANOVA wanted to take you to a love hotel, but he loves a bargain; you ended up with CASANOVA in a CAVE.

hints.mnemonic: Http

hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.mnemonic: Only one out of every four westerns is worth watching. Even that's debatable. The rest are crap.

hints.mnemonic: One of the four directions

hints.mnemonic: Mr T is highly valued in the West.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (ヨウ) When Clint needs a woman, he likes to be on top.

hints.author: wrightak

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: To the puritans reading this site - please stop reporting stories that have anything to do with sex! Although (as wrightak said) this kanji really refers to the hips, Heisig clearly chose the keyword 'loins' because it was anatomically close enough, and the primitives lent themselves to an easy-to-remember story. Just because you're all sexually repressed doesn't mean other people won't benefit from a story such as "the part of the body people need more than any other are the loins".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: My loins ache! They need some flesh!

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The body part that has more "needs" than any other is the loins.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Loin clothes cover up the part of the body that really needs to be covered up.

hints.author: rptb1
hints.mnemonic: In the Old West there were no ballot boxes. Afraid of fraud and fighting among the gunslingers, the ballots were posted into a slot in the top of the local church altar instead. They may have been rough, but the cowboys wouldn't fight in the church.

hints.mnemonic: In western political elections (US), peoples ballots will often depend on religion and at which altar the prospective president prays.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: In the West we show our opinion through the ballot box.

(imagine him standing over the altar and punching down kinda like karata guy would).
