hints.mnemonic: Even in the Old West, the ballots showed Obama winning.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: In Florida, Bush through Kerry's ballots into the water, watching them drift away and setting the whole country adrift.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The political fanatic stole all the ballots and dumped them in the stream. He calmly watched them drift away as the cops came to a screech behind him.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Drifting on the water we held a ballot to decide who to kick off the raft.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Picture a drifting lifeboat, water splashing over the side, and the occupants holding a ballot to decide who to eat next.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Not correctly understanding the process, I put my absentee ballot in a bottle and threw it in the ocean in hopes that it would drift back to the states.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Trees were frequenly used as signposts in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Large wooden signposts are planted on peoples lawns, with the faces of their representatives all saying

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: The republicans attempted to rig the election by placing signposts on a progression of trees saying "democrat ballot boxes this way." The last sign pointed to a cliff. Very funny, guys.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: [Warning

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: You always know there's a ballot coming up when wooden signposts start appearing everywhere saying "vote for me!".

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Chestnut tree, west nut tree.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: The cowboy climbed the tree to see where they were in the woods. The poor guy chose a chestnut tree. ouch ouch.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: Picture an old western cowboy on his front porch shooting chestnuts off his chestnut tree.

hints.author: Koos83
hints.mnemonic: One of the trees most common in the Old West was the chestnut. Not the horse chestnut (#514 栃). They tried that first, but the horses spent all day eating those and they could never ride them.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Due to the great chestnut blight, since the time of the old west you just cannot find any more of these trees.

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: shudder

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Shudder. If chestnut trees were sentient, shudder would be their state of mind as the tree shaker approaches. Note

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: shudder in fear

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Data, chestnut

hints.author: lisbet
hints.mnemonic: In a nostalgic state of mind, I bought some chestnuts from a street vendor in NYC, only to shudder when I realized "these aren't chestnuts...".

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Since the days of the Old West, traveling has transitioned from trying not to step on big snakes to driving on big roads.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: The west has gone through quite a transition, gone are the days when dogs and snakes roamed the desert, it's all roads and casinos now.

hints.author: iheckman
hints.mnemonic: Going west on the road you will notice it transitions from a big highway to a snaking gravel road.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: I was driving through the desert, west into the sun, wearing my transition light-to-dark glasses. They were too dark, and I accidentally hit a dog. When I got out to see if it was still alive, a rattlesnake bit me. Before I died I saw the dog hobble over and drive off with my car. As I made the transition between life and death, I scratched this kanji into the sand.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: In Dragon Ball, the Transition after death occurs as follows

hints.author: Talka
hints.mnemonic: The U.S.S. Old West has capsized, and all the cowboys on board are trying to restore her upright.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Remember Oregon Trail? Remember how you had to float your wagon across rivers to get to the Old West? Well, sometimes that wagon capsizes. Once that happens you'd better quickly head to the nearest town to restore.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Many stories about the old west are arguably glorifying the wrong side - if properly restored to the truth, one would see the situation turned upside down (that is to say, capsized), with the natives heroically trying to fight off villainous foreign invaders.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: On its journey WEST-ward, the cruise ship CAPSIZED and was damaged so bad that they couldn't RESTORE it.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: (Talka) The U.S.S. Old West was capsized during the attack on Pearl Harbor. But it was later restored and used in the Pacific Theater.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: In the Old West, they used to light fires in the ground to make smoke signals.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Should be easy. SMOKE brings to mind "Where there's SMOKE, there's FIRE". So, the FIRE in the OLD WEST can tell people we're you're at, so put out the FIRE with SOIL to keep the SMOKE to a minimum.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: In the old west people not only fired up and smoked tobacco filling the air with its smoke but they chewed it too, spitting it on the ground.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: Clint sits by the fire on the dirt, smoking his cigarillo, watching the smoke float up slowly. This is his ideal way to spend time.

hints.author: childofthetao
hints.mnemonic: They used to light fires in the Old West on the ground to make smoke signals.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: South of my belt leads to happiness.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In the south (Southern Alabama, Southern Africa, picture any south, but choose one and stick with it) "they measure happyness by the belt". If someone has a larger belly (and a longer belt), it is believed they are well fed and thus are happy.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: The South is characterized by the region known as the "Bible Belt," which is so named because any happiness to be had there is belted down by ultra-conservative Evangelical Christian values.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: Some people can only find happiness through the southern regions below their belt.

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: A BELT cost 10 YEN in the SOUTH.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: We traveled to southern Japan just to see a camphor tree. It's what we came for.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Trivia

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: Camphor tree + south = Southern Comfort (the liquor) tree (works for me).

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Fact

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: There is a tree in the south that legand has if you CAMP under it, you will be visited by a WHORE.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: A South Korean street vendor is offering chihuahu snacks.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: If you go to someones place and the food sucks, you lower it down south of the table as an offering to their dog.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: KFC is offering southern fried chiwawa for a limited time only.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: In the South, the people are so religious that they’ve been known to put Chihuahuas into the offering plate.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: "Te ofrezco Taco Bell." If you go far enough into the American south you'll get to the banana republic of Texas, where the Taco Bell Chihuahua rules with an iron paw. Don't forget an offering of some Taco Bell, or you'll be in serious trouble.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: Heisig's stroke order in the 4th edition (and earlier) is wrong, so be careful -- first is the left-most vertical stroke, then draw the rest of the "sun" attachment as you would normally. In fact, if you just wrote it out as two suns with elongated sides, you'll get the stroke order exactly correct.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: The gates to Hell. guarded by Cerebus or ... Bill Gates?

hints.author: KristinHolly
hints.mnemonic: Bill Gates is just about to walk into a saloon.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: The GATES of Hell make a great primitive for the following frames.

hints.author: Dustin_Calgary
hints.mnemonic: Primitives, Either gates to hell, or the pearly gates

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: A mouth on the Gates of Hell says "Answer me these questions three, or thru the gates ye soon will be".

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: You begin to question all of the holes Gates leaves in his software.

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: The mouth is the gate from which questions are asked.

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: To get access to Bill Gates' supermansion you have to answer several questions asked by a weird detached mouth at the entrance. Get a question wrong and the mouth will eat you.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: As you walk through the saloon doors, everyone shuts up and stares at you, mouths open... the barman asks the question on everyone's mind - "Who the fuck are you son?".

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: A little devil at the gates of hell reviews your record to see if you're evil enough to get in.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: As I was reviewing for my exam at a quiet saloon, the devil popped out of nowhere and offered to make sure I pass. But I told him no way, since that's cheating. Besides, I'm just reviewing things I already know. I won't fail. But he kept insisting, so I kicked him and sent him crashing through the entrance gates.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Gates' IS the devil. He releases software that clearly hasn't gone through any kind of review process.

hints.author: furrykef
hints.mnemonic: At the gates of Hell, the Devil greets you with his punishment

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: At the Gates of Hell

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: You set a guard at the gate to fell intruders not of your clique.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The felled souls of the world, cut down like trees, pass through the gates of hell and join the clique.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: A clique is a small exclusive group of people usually gathering around a leader or for a common purpose. Here we see Mr. T's fan club meeting for a fiesta at a very select club called the 'Perly Gates'.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Bill Gates has been known to fell any rival software company that threatens his little clique at the top.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: You only get through the gates into that person's fiesta if you are in the same clique.

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: The interval between star systems (suns) was too large, so the stargates were created to travel between them.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: We open the gates at regular intervals to let a bit of sun in.

hints.author: scottamus
hints.mnemonic: At regular intervals the gates of Hell burn like the sun keeping all within nice and toasty. Interval paining.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: At almost regular intervals of a year or so, Bill Gates tries again to take on their rival Sun in the server market, and thankfully UNIX and Linux always prevail.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Lesbians do their thing on one day intervals because their gates get so sore.

hints.author: enryu
hints.mnemonic: Through the gates of hell there is no sound, no light, its all pitch dark.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: In the pitch dark, I can hear the sound of the lesbians rubbing their gates together.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: I like to think of a horror movie where the protagonists enter a graveyard when suddenly their flashlights go out and it becomes pitch dark, whereupon they hear the sound of the gate creaking shut behind them.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: When it is pitch dark, you must navigate by sound.

hints.author: Louismi
hints.mnemonic: I opened the gates and it was pitch dark. Only a eerie sound could be heard.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: The simplicity of bamboo plant is in all its joints being at equal intervals.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [simplicity; brevity] The ししおどし is a bamboo device for scaring birds from the gates of your garden by clacking against a stone at regular intervals. Its design is simplicity itself. (Inspired by PepeSeco).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Wordplay

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: In an existence of utmost simplicity you spend time listening to the liquid-filled bamboo tube (ししおどし) clacking at regular intervals.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: I imagine one of those little bamboo fountains where the bamboo fills with water, tips over and lets out the water, and then tips back to get filled again. In this way, it marks out even intervals. THAT is simplicity.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Sure you can squeeze through these gates by kicking them or pushing them with your body, but if you want to get them wide open, you need to do that with both your hands.

hints.author: shirish
hints.mnemonic: To open the gate, use your both hands.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The lesbians use both hands to open each other's gates. Sick, but try forgetting this kanji now.

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: Bill gates is entering the major gate of his mansion and needs his two hand in order to open the gate. (you would probably think that Bill Gates has an electric door and that's the case but the conputer that controls it has crashed!).

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: To open those big heavy Gates of Hell it takes both hands...

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The gates are too big to be closed by man. Only a genie can. "Close sesame!".

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: You hear lesbians moaning "オォ~" from behind closed gates, and you ask a genius how to get in there.

hints.author: nmkohi
hints.mnemonic: Bill GATES keeps his operating system CLOSED, does that make him a GENIUS? I think not.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A genie is making sure that the gates of Ali Baba's Cave are always closed. Picture the genie (who lives in an oil lamp in that cave) grumbling about how Ali Baba is so forgetful, and that it's always him, the genie who has to check that the gates are closed. See previous frame 1622 "open". -- Note

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: "オー no! I stayed out past curfew, and now the gate has been closed!".

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: To keep this distinct from other kanji such as "watchtower" and "pagoda", I use the mnemonic "towering tower". -- In some old 8-bit kung-fu videogame, with a plot similar as Bruce Lee's last, unfinished movie, the hero must break through a gate at each level of the towering tower, fighting with opponents using various styles of kung-fu until he meets the finale at the topmost level of the "towering tower".

hints.author: Proxx
hints.mnemonic: Remember the two towers from lord of the rings... each has it's own - very difficult to master - entrance gate.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Each lesbian waits for her turn with "the tower".

hints.author: walexander5
hints.mnemonic: There is a tower on each side of the gate, they are posts for archers.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: Since tower confuses me too much with other Kanji, I will use (political) CABINET instead, where this Kanji is frequently used. The CABINET decides that EACH GATE of a saloon has to have a sign saying that you have to be an adult to be allowed to drink there.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the gates the Garden of Eden, the ultimate land of leisure. You're not allowed in, but if you peek through you can see trees.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Getting wood watching lesbians is my idea of leisure time.

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: Beyond the Gates of Hell, there is only one leisure spot for all the billions of souls within, a single tree beneath which people can sit for a few seconds. Ah, but that moment of leisure makes the rest of Hell that much worse...

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Leisure Suit Larry walking through the saloon doors with wood in his pants, hoping to get lucky.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: "You can rest in leisure, Master Peregrin Took, until battle begins, because the guards of Gondor defend the Gates of the City and the White tree.".

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: Press your ear to the gates and see if you can hear what is going on inside.

hints.author: ambrokusa
hints.mnemonic: To distinguish from listen, you hear someone at the door (gate).

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: At the GATES of Hell, along with the mouth that asks the impossible questions there is of course a giant EAR to HEAR the answers. The ear doesn't really listen as it knows they will always be wrong.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The genius tells me to put my ear up to the gates in order to hear the lesbians better (see closed (#1623 閉).

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Your ears are the gates that allow you to hear. NOTE

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Forgetting about the moat, the king stepped out of his gate and landed in the water. Needless to say he got wet.

hints.author: nyquil
hints.mnemonic: (I had the same idea as Dingomick) I imagine some prankster who put a bucket full of water on top of the huge gates, so that it would fall on the king as he came through them. See the king now, between the gates, all wet, dripping drops of water.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If I was king, I would be wet with the water of lesbians rubbing all over me.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Some prankster threw water on the king as he came to the city gates. Now he's all wet.

hints.author: Airymon
hints.mnemonic: I immediately thought of Monty Python and the Holy Grail. Imagine King Arthur standing in front of the gate shortly before the end of the movie. When he demands to be let in by the French, they throw dung on him and Belvedere and they get wet. (Think of the dung as water in this case, it's liquid anyway) http

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A column of text scratched on a black tree beside the gates of Hell

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [column; handrail; blank; space] I think about oriental (eastern) Torii gates

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Ancient morning newspaper column, posted daily on a tree at the east gate. Why the east gate? Well, it's a morning paper, and the sun rises in the east, so the morning rays shining through the gate illuminate it nicely. I picture all the ojisan who rise in the wee hours gathering around the tree each, waiting for the sun rise so they can read the paper. "Been coming here every day for 40 years! Can't start the day without my paper!".

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Bill Gates already dominates the software industry in the West, and now he is turning his attention to the East. Trying to gain popularity and a glentler image there he writes a column in newspapers there about how he plans to save the trees using the latest and greatest features of Windows Vista.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This is a column of text, as used in a newspaper. The trick for this kanji is that to mark the columns in the old printers, you place wooden blocks at certain intervals of the paper. Now, look at the right part; it looks as if you had put a wooden block in an interval primitive. That graphical reminder will help you to remember this kanji!!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: During the saloon brawl, one guy got glued to a table and was tossed out through the saloon gates. But he really wanted to fight, so he ran back through those gates (with the table still glued to his back) only to be tossed out again. Imagine him repeatedly running in and being tossed back out.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: Food fight! Look, beans are stuck to the gates like glue.

hints.author: snzzbk
hints.mnemonic: Bill Gates and Mr. Bean having a glue fight.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: He's fighting to get through the gates, but Mr. Bean doesn't know they are just for show & have been glued together.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: In any classic bar fight scene, someone crawls under a table, someone sits glued to the piano, and someone gets thrown clear throught the saloon doors (gates). 戦闘 せんとう battle, fight, combat; 闘うたたかう to fight; to battle; to combat; to struggle against; to wage war; to engage in contest.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: (Warning-this one is crude) Imagine a godown (dockside warehouse) where you can meet girls who will godown on you with their mouth. To keep the place a bit of a secert, they only have one gate.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: matsuyamakiwi
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a mafia godown at the docks where shifty mafia types meet and lots of dodgy deals godown. This is a very secret place, so there is only one gate, and to enter you have to say the password with your mouth.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A godown is an old style warehouse where goods were temporarily stacked stacked to the roof(meeting). A series of gates with mouths(doors) were used access them for shipment. (Primitive EAST INDIA TRADING) http

hints.author: nmkohi
hints.mnemonic: Back in the day the people were so excited to get hold of the Sega genesis they looted the godown with sabers.

hints.author: imojyochu
hints.mnemonic: I prefer to have girls Godown on my sabre to prevent unwanted GENESIS of babies............ 創造 そうぞう (creation).

hints.author: atylmo
hints.mnemonic: The genesis of my hatred of kanji learning is when you get so mad that you have to look up what a godown is, and you end up cutting the book (or even Heisig himself) up with a saber.

hints.author: Wakela
hints.mnemonic: In the story of Genesis Adam and Even were kicked out of the Garden of Eden. They had to "go down" out of the garden and the entrace was guarded with sabers to prevent their return.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: God actually has everything ever conceived in a big godown

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: This looks like a pictogram of 3 fingers from each hand trying to open up a crack in a wall. That's an un-believable way to escape from prison OR the UN- have a prison in the Hague.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: People in the jail cell are un-friendly, un-comely, and un-cooperative.

hints.author: firebound12
hints.mnemonic: Ever wanted to have an undo button in life? Well, when you're in a jail cell, that's when you most want to press that button.

hints.author: Emiko
hints.mnemonic: Un-zipped.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: This is a pictograph of goatse. Rather un-appealing image, huh?

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I pity the fool/ Who put me in this jail cell/ I pity the fool. (Credit taijuando).

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: I pity the fool/ Who put me in this jail/ I pity the fool.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Person is put in jail for writing a haiku with the wrong number of syllables.

hints.author: lunairejam
hints.mnemonic: While in jail, some people find Islam, but Mr T finds haiku.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A person stuck in jail has nothing better to do than to compose haiku.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: When ordered to go to the jail cell, the defendant gave the judge the finger and said he repudiated all that the legal system stood for if they were going to send an innocent man like him to jail.

hints.author: jameserb
hints.mnemonic: He reached his fingers through the bars of his jail cell, trying to touch his beloved. But she repudiated him and left.

hints.author: FutureBlues
hints.mnemonic: Once he had his fingers around the jail cell bars he repudiated all ties with his former gang!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 排他 【はいた】 (n) exclusion; (P) 排日 【はいにち】 (n) anti-Japanese; (P) 排出 【はいしゅつ】 (n,vs) evacuation; emission (e.g. of CO2, etc.); ejection; (P) 排除 【はいじょ】 (n,vs) exclusion; removal; rejection; (P) STORY

hints.author: TomTomHatesCats
hints.mnemonic: Sarah Palin finally gets thrown behind bars in a JAIL CELL for being a complete disgrace to the country. Indignant, she points a FINGER at the guards, screaming, "I refutiate this! I refudiate it!" Picture the guards and the other prisoners replying, "Don't you mean, REPUDIATE?".

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Saddness is like having your heart captured and jailed because of some sad or terrible event, etc. Here the sad heart waits for someone to come and un-lock their jail cell and set them free again.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Stuck in a jail cell with his heart crying out to see his family again, the prisoner has never felt so sad.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: A jail cell will make any heart sad.

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: For some reason, this kanji makes me think of some Toni Braxton song, but I change the lyrics to "Un-jail my heart". Now that mnemonic has stuck in my head.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the sad image of a prisoner in a jail cell feeling sad as he looks at all the little hearts his daughter used to draw for him when she was just a child. Now she wants nothing to do with him.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: Guilty under the eyes of the law, therefore sentenced to jail. [note

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: It is his guilt that is causing them. He is having these nightmares where the great (sideways) eye appears at the top of his jail cell, and is staring down intently at him. Guilt is a merciless tormentor.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: EYE-witnesses helped prove this person's GUILT and put them in a JAIL CELL... now constantly under the watchful EYES of the prison guards.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A man who is in jail is so full of guilt that every night he is having these nightmares where a great eye appears at the top of his jail cell, and is staring down intently at him.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: He is guilty! you can see it in his eyes.. Throw that man into a jail cell!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Some man jailed in Russia, is freed by his comrade (from the Communist party perhaps), who crashes into the jail cell with a vehicle.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: (+fuaburisu) But it's the wrong jail cell! Your comrade is one floor above.

hints.author: smujohnson
hints.mnemonic: When you're in JAIL, your COMRADE will come and DRIVE a car through the JAIL CELL, coming FROM BELOW to bust you out.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 後輩 【こうはい】 (n) junior (at work or school); (P) 先輩 【せんぱい】 (n) senior (at work or school); superior; elder; older graduate; progenitor; old-timer; (P) STORY

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: In Mother Russia, self-stimulation isn't enough for goatse man, so he asks his comrade to drive a car into his ass.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: The only way out of a jail cell is to serve your time and walk out the front door. There are no other doors.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: An old man serving a very long jail sentence painted a life-like door at the back of his jail cell, hlafway open, with the blue sky, clouds, etc, as some kind of symbol of freedom. Every time the prison officers come to take him they ask him to come to the door. The old man with a grin always answers "Which door?", looking at his painted door with a grin. And the prison officer always answer, sighing - "The front door !".

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: It's a sad reflection on modern times that our front doors need to be built like jail cells to keep us safe. 扉 (とびら)

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: A jail cell only has one door. The front door.

hints.author: DurablePants
hints.mnemonic: Your front door leads to a jail cell in order to trick burglers.

hints.author: cb4960
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is made a marquis after he and the A-Team save the life of a duke. The duke also gives Mr. T the key to the gentleman's dart room where one can relax in luxury, smoke a cigar, and play a friendly game of darts. Mr. T eagerly accepts the key and places it on one of the gold chains that hang around his neck which acts as a key chain.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: (Going off various) Mr. T. is made a marquis and given the key to the city. But somebody disagrees with it and assassinates him with a dart.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: MR.T had one final challenge before he would be promoted to a MARQUIS. He must shoot a DART through the hole of a KEY.

hints.author: kodorakun
hints.mnemonic: Marquis Keydartee (make-believe french name, Key+dart+T).

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The French government hires Mr. T to bring the Marquis de Sade to justice. The Marquis runs away frantically. T pronounces himself "The Mar-key de Darts" and throws a bunch at Sade, felling him on the city streets.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: "If the marquis opens his mouth one more time, I'll cut his throat", his rival the baron said.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The Marquis de Sade was kinda gay. He used to mouth down a lot of deep-throat action.

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: I think of "clearing your throat". Some stuffy guy opens his mouth to clear his throat so the marquis can speak.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: "I swear, I'll cut his throat! If he opens his mouth one more time, I'll cut the marquis' throat", his rival the baron said.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: After MR.T was made a MARQUIS he was given a KEY to the DART room which he put in his MOUTH and swallowed down his THROAT.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: The marquis has absolutely no interest in issuses of climate change. He's old and near death. [Don't forget the walking stick to symbolize his old age.].

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: The marquis moves to a warmer climate after he gets old enough to need a walking stick to get around.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: In his old age (walking stick) Marquis T becomes Al Gore's climate control nemisis.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: The Marquis de Sade grows old, grabs a walking stick and moves to Florida for the warmer climate and to torture older ladies with his darts.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: As Mr. T drives off the lot in his new Mercury Grand Marquis, the climate control screws up, causing him to pull out his walking stick and beat up the dash. "I pity the fool who sold me this piece of junk".

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: "Decide!" "Decide?! Death by drowning in polluted water or death by guillotine. How can I decide?" I asked.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: To decide if someone is a witch or not first dunk them in water. If they don't drown they are a witch and can be sent to the guillotine.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: (Seriously, do we really need the guillotine primitive? Surely key and person are adequate...) I have decided that drinking more water is the key to becoming a more healthy person. 決まる きまる be decided, fixed, certain; 決める きめる decide, fix, choose; 決心 けっしん determination, resolution; 決定 けってい decision, determination; 解決 かいけつ settlement, solution, resolution.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Waterboarding? Guillotine? The Decider has decided both these are legal and moral. I keep mixing this up with choose (#1074 択). Try associating these negative options with our half-wit "decider" to build a distinction.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: He was sentenced to death, but at least he was granted the ability to decide how

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: A large crowd in a cheerful state of mind applaude each criminal as they become victims of the guillotine.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A cheerful crowd of insulted aliens applaude as Data's head is chopped off by guillotine.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Data is cheerful as he goes to the guillotine. That's because he knows he can just solder his head back on afterwards.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Data was soo cheerful when he was put in charge of the guillotine! He can't wait for the next person to commit a crime!

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: If Monty Python had set their movie "Life of Brian" in the time of the French revolution, you can just picture how the characters in a cheerful state of mind would sing

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is certainly an ADMIRABLE PERSON, so much so that parents are buying lockets with his picture in it and having their children wear them like amulets.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: For locket

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Stroke order

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: She thought that Mr. T was a tough, heartless guy, but then she found out that he carries around a locket with a picture of his daughter. Suddenly, she found it admirable that he had such a soft side.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: You lose your precious locket on the road to somewhere. You ask people if they've seen it, but no luck. "Just buy another one," someone says. "I mean, what's the difference?" Then of course you say "Well, it makes a huge difference!! Since it has sentimental value, I don't want a different one! " Then of course they understand.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: You loose your LOCKET on the ROAD and report it to the 交番 . They find one, and show it to you. 「これですか？」 But it's the wrong one... You say, 「いいえ。。違います。。」.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: An odd version of The Road Less Traveled

hints.author: desmidus
hints.mnemonic: You know what the difference is between you and me? I find this expensive locket on the road and I look for the owner. You, on the other hand, look for a pawn shop. THAT's the difference.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Noticing a difference between the locket hanging around his lover's neck and the locket he had giver her he rips it off her and throws it in the road.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman buys a locket for Mary Jane because he wants to get HORIZONTAL with her.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman on a boat, marking the Earth's latitudes. He first attaches a personal locket to a small piece of thread for ballast and good luck, and shoots with his right hand. After a few minutes (and lots and lots of thread), the locket and thread have flown around the world. Spiderman catches the locket with his left hand, and ties the thread's ends together. Voilà.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman gave up being spiderman and promised Mary Jane to live the horizontal life like the rest of us. Whenever he starts to feel like he wants to go back to his spidy ways, he takes out his locket with a mary jane picture to remind him that he will forever live horizontaly.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Imagine yourself tie a locket to the end of a thread and spin it horizontally..

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [defense; protection] For "defense against the dark arts" class, you go the magical boulevard and buy an enchanted locket.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Since it was in the middle of the boulevard, everyone could see she hit the man only in self-defense, as he was trying to steal her valuable locket.

hints.author: AryllWind
hints.mnemonic: I think of defense as an attribute in video games. Like Final Fantasy, for example. When you go to a new town, you walk up and down the boulevard for shops that will sell you better items. One of the best accessory items for defense is a locket that absorbs magical energy. Unfortunately, you can't buy it yet, as it costs over a hundred thousand gil.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Boulevard Locket. Defense +2 when equipped.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: "It's cheap defense. On this boulevard the mafia rules. Your only defense is the locket (with the picture of the Don in it) which we will rent for a 'modest fee' to anybody who'd like to keep living. You want some defense?" Tony said with a smile.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: There's a young Korean male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/Korean relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to Korea to see his home, started taking Korean language classes, etc. So, imagine here the misty eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their lockets with Yon-sama's picture inside watching his Korean romantic mini series called "Winter Sonata".

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: This character represents the flag of South Korea

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Kim Jong II gets all misty eyed when he looks at the locket of his departed mother; I’m rone-ry, so rone-ry (from team America).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The Korean army is wearing "mist lockets". When the lockets are opened, a mist spreads about a meter over the floor level, which allows the Koreans to advance without being seen.

hints.author: notgoing2argue
hints.mnemonic: I bomb Korea every night, then I send them 10 sunflowers and a locket to apologize the next morning.

hints.author: tomusan
hints.mnemonic: Dry one item in ten minutes on the clothesline.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: Vampire

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A dry water lily with no drops on it (see even (#1484 平).

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Heisig's pictograph of a clothesline is fine, but I also see another pictograph here, that of one needle trying to push its way through the dry surface of the earth above it but because of a lack of rain the earth is parched and dry thus this one needle stays buried in the earth below. Furthermore, you could say that the earth is so dry that there's not even one needle left on it.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: Well you all know that the liver is the part of the body that would be quite grateful if you led a dry lifestyle (i.e. no alcohol).

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: The slaughterhouse prefers to ship dried liver to the supermarkets (can you imagine boxes soaked in blood on the truck that delivers them?). Imagine them lifting the slabs of flesh and hanging them on the clothesline to dry.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Hannibal Lecter recounting his flesh-eating days

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a beat up liver(too much alcohol). The doctor takes your liver out of your body, and puts it on a clothes line to dry off. Then puts it back in your body, sealing up the flesh. A dry liver is a healthy liver he chuckles as he puts it back.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: The part of the flesh that keeps the blood dry of toxins is the LIVER.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The newspaper pages are hung on the clotheseline to dry and then cut down with a sabre to be published.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The newspaper pages are hung on the clotheseline to dry. This gives the government a chance to censor the news

hints.author: nakome
hints.mnemonic: The author's work was so dry that he had to threaten the publisher with a sabre in order to get them to publish it.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Cut and dried - yeah, that sounds like most of the drivel published nowadays.

hints.author: mclin
hints.mnemonic: I can't publish this. It's too dry. Don't you have any stories with people getting attacked with sabres or something?

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: The way sweat is supposed to work

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: When you sweat your clothes become soaked with water, prompting you to hang them to dry on a clothesline.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Sweat a process to regulate body temperature

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: When you want to sweat, there are 2 kinds of sauna - wet (watery) and dry.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Vampire trivia

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Flats in the city are crowded. You get a space for your car in front, and a clothesline out back. Nothing else.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Small flats (garages) for cars help keeping them dry.

hints.author: matsuyamakiwi
hints.mnemonic: Did you hear about the guy obsessed with his car? He keeps it in his flat to keep dry.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: A flat/house definition

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: I don't have a garage, so I keep my car in my flat to keep it dry.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: At the base of mountain cliffs, there is usually a beach. You often can see people lying there, drying off after a swim.

hints.author: Pete171
hints.mnemonic: Three impossibilities for a beach

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: I use a play on words here to help with the similar keywords such as "strand", and "coast". The Beach Boys just had a concert down at the beach, and they're all wet after the performance. It's not dry enough down at the beach so they climb the nearest cliff. Still, it's not dry enough there so they climb the nearest mountain. Finally, the air seems dry and they take a rest while their clothes dry.

hints.author: Mesqueeb
hints.mnemonic: The fastest way to reach the beach starting from our mountain cabin is to go down the MOUNTAIN until the CLIFF and slide down the CLOTHESLINE directly onto the beach!

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: A nude beach is generally sheltered from sight under a mountains or a cliff, where the bathers can dry in privacy.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: A fine mist is falling, and so everyone gathers around near the tree-trunk, effectively using the rest of the tree as an umbrella in order to keep dry.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: By astridtops - In the rainy mist, Totoro is standing in front of a tree-trunk at the bus stop, under the umbrella he just received. Look at him smiling

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: The word that you will sure see with this kanji is shinkansen (bullet train). 新幹線 . STORY

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: There is no tree in this kanji! So think of a cold, bare, dead tree-trunk, with the upper branches all cut off. Residents of the neighboring house have run a clothesline from their window to the dead tree-trunk. You are filled with sadness, seeing the greatness of nature being destroyed and exploited by mankind. You are walking by this sad scene on a cold and drizzly day with a fine mist descending, using an umbrella to keep yourself dry.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In the rainy mist, Totoro is standing in front of a tree-trunk at the bus stop, under the umbrella he just received. Look at him smiling

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: If your potatos are growing flowers and those little hooked roots, you should either buy less or eat them faster.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: If your potatoes are growing flowers, you need to store them in a more dry place, like hanging them on hooks so they don't accumulate moisture on the floor.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Believe it or not, originally the potato was cultivated because of its beautiful flowers rather than for eating the actual "potato" below. (historical fact).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Murjab
hints.mnemonic: The potato plant consists of both flowers and the root below. The root (the part of a plant that hooks into the soil), is all that most people think of when they hear the word "potato." Therefore, while the kanji for potato contains all parts of the plant - flowers and roots - as a primitive, only focus on the important part - the roots.

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: Under the eaves of the house the poor family has potate plants.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Very good image Erik. To help those who struggleded with this, the eaves of a house is usually the bit where you hang the roof gutter along, usually made of zinc or plastic and shaped as a half-pipe. It catches rain water, so it flows to a drain pipe instead of down onto people and windows. And in this family the potato plants grow along the eaves so the water pours down on them. They are poor. so no gutter.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means universe, seen here as a roof as that was how it was represented back then the vault of heaven. Today, we know that seen from the universe, our planet has the aspect of a potato, and not a perfect sphere.

hints.author: DurablePants
hints.mnemonic: During christmas, since your family is TOO POOR, you hang potatoes off the eaves instead of christmas lights.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: Sam at the beginning of the Lord of the Rings was outside the house in the potato bushes when Gandalf was talking with Frodo, even though he denied it

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: You hang an umbrella upside-down on a hook of the scales and fill it with little potatoes. No luck

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This is the kanji for 「あまり Amari」, which means too little in negative sentences and too much in the rest (always with a negative sense). I take the liberty of using the symbol ">" (more than, another meaning!!) as the umbrella component, and using two (#2 二) and little (#105 小) for the potato primitive. So, this kanji either means "two much" (more than 2) or "two little". (thanks, Virtua_leaf and Thunderball!).

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: I was worried that my POTATOES were getting TOO MUCH direct sunlight so I stood over them with an UMBRELLA. Now they are getting too LITTLE rain! I clearly have TOO MUCH free time on my hands.

hints.author: rowdyphantom
hints.mnemonic: Umbrellas for little potatoes??? That's too much!

hints.author: Talka
hints.mnemonic: You're weighing potatoes to take from the market but they weigh too much. It's windy, so you hook your umbrella onto the scale hoping to subtract weight by catching the wind's force. Still too much weight. Just give up and select some smaller potatoes, man. Won't be too much weight then.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: To become a member of The Pinnacle, they test you on a scale. If you weigh too much, they exclude you.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: You won't make it unless you exclude something. The climb to the pinacle cannot be completed if you are carrying too much. You just have to decide what you can afford to exclude.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: Before entering The Pinnacle, one must be weighed on a scale. The authorities have to exclude anyone who is over 300 pds since their weight might damage the floor.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Officials at the Acropolis exclude access to vehicles that weigh too much. Some gate staff also apply this to people (generally Americans) who weigh over 250 lbs.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: (insert fat celeb here) is excluded at The Pinnacle because he/she weighs too much.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: You can't expect weight loss to happen overnight. You should limit going to the scale to weigh yourself to once a day or once a week, in order to observe the anticipated weight loss gradually.

hints.author: slats70
hints.mnemonic: I set up a column chart next to my scales so I could record my weight gradually changing.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Remember the urban legend of the ARMY COLUMN that weighed TOO MUCH with their rythmic marching that the bridge collapsed? Now ARMY COLUMNS will march GRADUALLY across so that they do not bear TOO MUCH on the bridge.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Flash didn't get fat overnight. He gradually added a pound on the scale here and there until finally he weighed too much to fit into his snazzy red costume. (Credit

hints.author: scout
hints.mnemonic: Ever since he's stopped doing Tours, Lance has been gradually gaining weight. See him cringe as he steps on a scale and sees it gradually go up!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Amazed at the weight of his crotch, they conferred every honor upon him. (Image

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: (This kanji stands for description in my kanji dictionary) "At first, I thought it was too little, but soon became too much", is the description that my girlfriend gave of my crotch.

hints.author: Christoph
hints.mnemonic: When you confer again 又 , you confer too much 余 !

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: When the fighter was weighed, the scales spun wildly. On closer inspection, it seems he is well-endowed and his crotch was pressing against the scales, adding vastly more amounts of weight. The judges then had to confer amongst themselves to consider what should be his real weight division.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: Having honours conferred on him proved to be too much! He overbalanced, so instead of kneeling at the queen's feet, he somehow ended up sitting cross-legged.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: On this route, all trucks have to check in at the scales before they can get on the road.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: There are too many roads, so you need to plan a route.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: When you’re spending too much time on the road, you’re always en route to somewhere.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: Truck drivers in the US have to drive the truck onto some massive scales at state borders, for tax reasons. They have to plan their route accordingly; there aren't scales on every road.

hints.author: tokyokanji
hints.mnemonic: Too much traffic on this road, lets take a different route!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The main bar of an old-fashioned scale(balance) will be very diagonal if you place a giant measuring cup on one side.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The scale tilts diagonally when a measuring cup filled with too much is set on one end.

hints.author: sacmaliyorsun
hints.mnemonic: The constellation of libra (meaning " scales" in latin) is diagonal to the handle of the big dipper.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: An old scale with measuring cups on both sides

hints.author: davidvance
hints.mnemonic: If you visit DiagonAlley, you'll find a lot of shops measuring out potion ingredients with scales and measuring cups.

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: If you add too much water to the paint it will drip onto the ground.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A true artisan mixes his own paint from water and soils on a scale in careful proportions.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: People ask why the ground of our backyard is entirely white. Well, my cheapskate dad wanted to add a fresh coat of white paint to our house. He bought the biggest, cheapest tub, placed it on a scale in our yard, and started diluting it with water. It was working fine, and he was adding water drop by drop and carefully checking the weight each time. However, his hand slipped, and he added too much water and the scale broke down violently, spilling the paint all over the ground.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: The paint was WATERed down and TOO MUCH dripped on the GROUND.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: If you put too much water in the PAINT mix in some soil to make it thicker.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Mnemonic

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Unlike in 杏 , this big mouth isn't content to wait for apricots to fall in his mouth, so he has climbed the tree and is taking them in bundles.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A bundle of some kind has been stuffed into the opening of a tree.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: This is an image of the monster Gojira (AKA Godzilla) that is so mad it has eaten all the trees. So a bundle of trees sticks out of Gojiras mouth as it rampages through Tokyo.

hints.author: epangelia2k2
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Hyland1
hints.mnemonic: We found a bundle of severed heads in your room, its difficult to trust you.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Don't Trust the press just a bundle of lies on every page!

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [trust; request] Do you trust anything? Actually we do, as long as a bundle of heads say the same thing. If a bundle of scientist's heads say we live in a 12 dimensions universe, why should we not trust them?

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: Even though the stork didn't drop its bundle when it crashed into the tree, I still don't trust it to deliver any more babies - the one I got isn't right in the head. Must be a result of the stork-tree collision (see also quick (#1669 速)).

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: 頼む、たのむ Godzilla requested a bundle of heads. If we give it, he will spare the rest. Can we trust him?

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: You need complete trust in your water guide to attempt Class 5 rapids.

hints.author: Hyland1
hints.mnemonic: You can never trust the water in the rapids, it will do everything it can to pull you under. Imagine a line of natives with bundles upon their heads all fighting the rapids to cross the river.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: The water in the rapids can't be trusted.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: When I saw a bundle of severed heads floating in the water, I didn't trust the rapids, or the guide for that matter...

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: The water of the rapids are not to be trusted.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: This is an imperial order for pizza. To deliver the huge bundle of pizzas to the emperor, the pizza boy needs huge muscles.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Imperial order carries quite a bundle of executive power.

hints.author: Okonomiyaki
hints.mnemonic: "Did someone have an imperial order for pizza?" says the muscular delivery boy with a large "bundle" in the new adult film, "The Emperor's Nude Groove".

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: The emperor makes an imperial order

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: A (written) imperial order

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: [True story] In Osaka the homeless (the alienated) live in large numbers around the city zoo. Picture them in winter all bundled up in rags trying to keep warm, alienated from the society, living literally worst than the animals in the zoo who at least are bundled in their natural furs and have pens to live in sheltered from the elements.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is so strange that it was alienated at the kanji zoo. The bundle of joy stork bundles this kanji up and takes it to a kanji foster home.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Think of a Kanji Zoo, where we bundle up all the bizarre and hard to remember kanji, to be ridiculed and alienated from the other more sensible kanji. This kanji definately belongs there!

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The cleaner at the ZOO felt ALIENATED by everyone. Granted, he was carrying around the BUNDLE of manure he cleaned from the ZOO cages. (Just picture a zoo cleaner carrying a bundle of dung with the crowd avoiding him).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Very rarely does this kanji appear in a word meaning "alienate." The better meaning is "sparse," such as not dense, very few, scattered, or spread irregularly. It also appears in words that have to do with "neglect." 疎ら 【まばら】 (adj-na,n) sparse; (P) STORY

hints.author: paasan
hints.mnemonic: bitter, spicy, bundle

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: The bitter taste was so awful that I put whole bundle of spice in my mouth to get rid of it.

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: I'm rather bitter that someone stole my spice bundle.

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: severe

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: Too many spicy things bundled in a meal will make anyone feel bitter towards the cook. 辛辣 ; 辛らつ 【しんらつ】 (adj-na,n) bitter; sharp; acrimonious 悪辣 ; 悪らつ 【あくらつ】 (adj-na) crafty; vicious; unscrupulous; sharp.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: If you find a bundle of money on the road, pick it up quick before anyone notices.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: Uh oh. The stork just dropped the bundle of joy in the middle of the road. Somebody save it, quick!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Jack be nimble, Jack be quick, Jack jump over the bundle in the middle of the road.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A bundle of optic fibers running along the road makes for quick internet access.

hints.author: zer0range
hints.mnemonic: I banged her quick, then bundled up and hit the road!

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Recycling in Japan, you have to make sure all your bundles are organized correctly otherwise the taskmasters won't accept them.

hints.author: Jasta
hints.mnemonic: When a bundle of taskmasters organize something chances are it won't be done correctly because they are constantly arguing.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Organize, def

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: At stork headquarters there is a taskmaster who organizes all the outgoing bundles of joy. It is very important to organize things so that the correct bundle goes to the correct place!!! (Just imagine if the crocodiles opened their bundle to find kittens!!!).

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: When you have a bundle of things to organize appoint a taskmaster to oversee it is done correctly.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: If it helps, make the awl primitive ice pick instead. They're basically the same thing. This kanji is an easy David vs. Goliath story of the icepick vs. the saber...

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Every self-respecting ninja knows the story of "The Awl and the Sabre". According to the legend, a woman once defended herself by using an awl against a sabre! She used to work all day with that awl. However, the bandit using the sabre had no skill. And thus the awl beat the sabre. And from there the saying goes

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: ICE PICK primitive

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: As a non-native speaker of English, I really couldn't work with the awl primitive, since I can't even imagine what kind of tool it would be. So, I had another look at the primitive and it practically screamed a different meaning

hints.author: diracbracket
hints.mnemonic: My light saber has an awl setting. When I toggle the switch, the beam shrinks down to a little spike. My light saber becomes a light awl.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The edge of The Pinnacle is precipitous, so they have a guard posted with an ice pick to poke people and keep them from the edge.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Well I have someone climbing an inflatable precipitous pinnacle. Once at the top it is so precipitous that the person is afraid to climb down and instead punctures the inflatable pinnacle with an awl to get safely and slowly back to the ground.

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: Frankenstein is chased by the villagers up to the precipitous edge of the pinnacle. (ref 1671 astridtops).

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The Ice Climbers enjoy precipitous climbs - and what better place to climb than the precipitous Pinnacle!

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: The rock climber trying to get up to the pinnacle is dangling from a precipitous edge, hanging only one with his icepick.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: You're giving a TREE an EXAMINATION. You take a wood sample from the TREE with an AWL (cmp exam (#1278 校)).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Don't confuse with exam (#1278 校), test (#354 試), evaluate (#1487 評). Think of examination as a doctor's examination. You're having problems getting wood in bed. You go in for a doctor's examination. The doctor shoves an icepick into your manhood as part of the examination.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: After intense cross-examination from the prosecutor, the tree confessed to murdering the wood-pecker with an awl... "He just kept at it, he kept poking at me with that beak, so I thought I'd see how HE liked it!!" The autopsy examination revealed at least a dozen puncture wounds, what a brutal case.

hints.author: kioku3
hints.mnemonic: The doctor gives a physical examination to Frankenstein's Monster. The monster is so big the doctor has to use a tree to hit his knee and check his reflexes. (I am using astridtops' primitive of Frankenstein's Monster (fit (together) and person) in place of "awl").

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Patient goes to see the doctor for an examination. he says "Everytime i walk i fart". Doc asks him to take a few steps and he farts constantly. Docs puzzled and has never seen this before. He asks him to repeat and it happens again. So the doc tells him to go to the examinatino area and take his pants off. He then gets out a giant wooden awl slightly hooked at the end. What the f*k are you going to do with that!? asks teh patient. "Open the windows, it fcking stinks in here!" replies the doc.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is as frugal as they come. He uses his one ice pick for everything

hints.author: stshores24
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is so frugal, he hires Frankenstein as a butler because he doesn't have to pay him.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Mr T is a frugal person in spite of his brash appearance. He brings an awl with him to fight for the A team, not wasting needless ammo and dynamite, since no one ever gets killed anyway in A team series.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Chuck Norris was once called frugal by a tailor working on his Texas Ranger outfit. He promptly roundhouse kicked the tailors awl onto the bullseye of his dartboard and walked out with his new suit and a 10% discount. || Picard buys an awl from a frugal Ferrengi.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Some n00b spent all the club's money, so Haruhi teaches him how to be frugal (see sabre/saber (#1671 剣).

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: The first computer in the world was as heavy as thousand computers are now.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: To me it looks like a car with two extra wheels, like a truck. As it is a very heavy vehicle I suggest an image of a huge mining truck, like the yellow Liebherr T282B. Remember that the first "wheel" is a bit bent. http

hints.author: yuriehoshii
hints.mnemonic: TRỌNG

hints.author: TsunamiEddi
hints.mnemonic: 1000（ 千 ）computers ( 里 )　are so heavy.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A heavy duty truck with four-wheel drive.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: Even though the furniture is heavy, it'll be easy to move with all the muscles that he has.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: His MUSCLES are so HEAVY, he barely can move...thats ironic.

hints.author: CaLeDee
hints.mnemonic: Heavy things can be moved with a bit of muscle.

hints.author: francajun
hints.mnemonic: To move something heavy, you need muscles.

hints.author: sskaggs
hints.mnemonic: Everyone knows that (Force x Mass= acceleration), and as is typical when converting western expressions to eastern expressions this kanji gives us the same equation in reverse order and pictorialized

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A tumor is a useless body part that is nothing but heavy.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: The world's heaviest tumor ever removed from a human body was a 300-pound stomach tumor, removed in 1991 in Stanford Hospital. Now that's a heavy body part!

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: When flesh clumps together and gets heavy, it forms a tumor.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: You've got a tumor on your flesh? That's heavy, man.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: The FLESH of a TUMOR is HEAVIER than normal FLESH.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A meritorious deed? Like moving a damsel in distress out of a fire, maybe.

hints.author: lunairejam
hints.mnemonic: Prometheus did a meritous deed for humanity by MOVING FIRE from the gods to us humans.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: Oskar Schindler is best remembered for his meritorious deed

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: (from Raichu) The classic meritorious deed is saving a damsel in distress from a burning building. You hear her sweet voice crying "help! help!" from inside. But when you get inside, you see that she's quite heavy... you'll need some muscles for this deed.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: You get a medal if you do some meritorious deed in combat. When the shooting starts, some freeze and cannot move. The normal ones can move under fire. But the REAL medal winners are the ones that move over flames!. Not that is a meritorious deed!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T's real line of work is for a moving company.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Mr T, move. Mr Ts new exercise video called "Work it suckaz". Here is shouting "move it work it move work it!".

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: A person who moves something is doing work, physically speaking.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Luke Skywalker had to work hard to become a jedi, being forced to move an X-Wing with his mind before leaving Dagobah.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In his poor days, Mister T, thanks to his healthy build, used to work as a (furniture) mover (Br. "removal man"). He worked 7/7 days, since when he wasn't moving furniture, he was working out !

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: After the whole low-carb craze, scientists developed a new low-carb species of wheat, so that dieters could eat it without getting heavier.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji also means "Seed." STORY

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The heavy wheat is a special type or species of wheat used to fatten livestock.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This is also the word for seed. Wheat seeds are sorted by how heavy they are.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: The hot chick from Species has been eating a lot of bread lately, and she's really gotten heavy.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Two heavy trucks in a game of chicken collide while racing toward each other on the boulevard.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Something heavy rolling down the middle of the boulevard is definitely going to end up colliding with something.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 衝 【しょう】 (n) (1) important point (e.g. on a route); (2) important role (responsibility, etc.); (3) (astronomical) opposition. STORY

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: Two heavy sumo wrestlers, in normal clothing while shopping, see each other at opposite sides of the boulevard and suddenly get in their stance and charge at each other until they collide, knocking everyone else out of the way.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: The LHC (Large Hadron Collider) is as wide as a boulevard and so heavy that machinery had to be used to assemble the pieces.

hints.mnemonic: Do you know how they make those FRAGRANT air fresheners? Well you take some FLOWERS, compress them with a HEAVY weight, and put them on an OVEN FIRE for a while... (cmp perfume (#493 芳)).

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: The heavier the flowers the stronger their fragrance when you burn them.

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: These flowers emit very heavy fragrance when burned over the fire (e.g. the fragrant jasmine flowers).

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (クン) Steve Jobs does it again. This heavy duty mac computer has a place for flowers on top. When the computer heats up (the fire on the bottom), the flowers release a beautiful fragrant smell.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: As the heavy duty truck smolders in flames, the fragrant smell of flowers is emitted from the pine tree air freshener still hanging from the rear-view mirror.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Caveman got ill after flying third class. The cabin air and food got to him. (Primitive

hints.mnemonic: If you hang around a third class hospital, you'll get ill with the sickness everyone else has.

hints.author: yorkii
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.mnemonic: I have this female friend who complains about third class type stuff a lot. She'll say stuff like ''That train ride made me ill. Seriously,'' and ''Oh my god, sitting next that dirty guy made me ill. Seriously.'' Sometimes I just want to kick her in the cunt.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Of course caveman is stupid. He doesn't know anything. He's a caveman!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This kanji shows stupidity as a "knowledge-sickness". Everybody can be stupid at times, and it usually happens because of a lack of experience. Hence the stupidity is a "knowledge sickness".

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Ever since reading dingomick's story, I've had this dialogue stuck in my head when I come across the keyword

hints.mnemonic: You mean you didn't know you'd get sick living in an icy cave? Are you stupid?

hints.author: ellasevia
hints.mnemonic: Stupidity is a common illness that afflicts everyone. It is said to cause a lack of knowledge.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Caveman has horrible pox. They look like edamame beans oozing bight green paste.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Pox is a sickness which symptoms include bean-shaped bumps on the skin.

hints.author: Tornadic_Indignation

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Pox is a very contagious sickness, you'll get it just by sitting at the same table as someone infected.

hints.mnemonic: The Geico caveman gets chicken pox. The doctor says the only cure is to take a bath in baked beans.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Once you have all the symptoms right, you have correctly  identified the sickness.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: A sickness can only be correctly diagnosed if the symptoms are identified correctly.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: One of the SYMPTOMS of being a CAVEMAN is you don't get much CORRECT in a test.

hints.author: samesong
hints.mnemonic: Doctor

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Checking the symptoms helps to identify the correct sickness.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: The witches piggy bank was cursed with a spell causing any thief who stole it's contents to fall ill. The illness would result in the victim being covered from head to toe in a mass of carbuncles. Crime doesn't pay!

hints.author: Asayoru
hints.mnemonic: Caveman has to open up his piggy bank to receive treatment for his monstrous carbuncle.

hints.author: Boy.pockets
hints.mnemonic: His sickness caused numerous carbuncles, which when emptied by the doctors also emptied his piggy bank.

hints.author: Puchatek
hints.mnemonic: In this kanji the Caveman has a piggy bank-shaped carbuncle under his skin. Hmm, well, at least it looks kind of unique.

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: There goes the lonely miser, all covered in CARBUNCLEs. The local lore says that his hideous ILLNESS is divine retribution for his avarice

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The sickness that only allows you to eat monkey crotch will surely make you lose weight.

hints.author: At0m5k
hints.mnemonic: Caveman want to lose weight... but not know how. He sees a lean monkey playing with its crotch. Ah! So that's how I lose weight, and he imitates the monkey.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: Simian Immunodeficiency Virus, the precursor to HIV, is a sickness that is transmitted by carnal knowledge of a monkey's crotch. Naturally, it causes one to lose weight. Cavemen used to catch it all the time.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The poor monkey obviously had a sickness. He was scratching his crotch the whole time and when he started to lose weight heavily, the caretakers knew they couldn't save him anymore.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The most horrific way to lose weight is from that devastating sickness that came from a monkey's crotch.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I picture a sick caveman, and two people rapidly blowing darts at him. One is blowing poison darts, the other is blowing antidote darts. Will the sick caveman live or die? Depends on how rapidly they fire.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If shot with a poison dart, sickness develops rapidly.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Hm, it's getting tougher to differentiate similar kanji

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The sick caveman is deteriorating rapidly from the rapid-fire gun that shot hime with sickening poison darts.

hints.author: bokuzukuri
hints.mnemonic: See book.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: If you go through women rapidly you will be the object of envy.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: Ah, puberty ... the girl that starts her journey towards womanhood the most rapidly will become the subject of envy from all her classmates.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: Envy (from FMA) is a boy homunculus (though a bit androgynous), but when they dubbed FMA to English, they somehow snipped his pickle and turned him into a girl. Wave of protests from hardcore fans emerged rapidly.

hints.author: Puchatek
hints.mnemonic: Women get envious very rapidly. Picture one woman walking into a party in a gorgeous dress, and all other women there rapidly getting envious of her beautiful dress.

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: WOMEN are full of envy. It's a Cupid thing-- when one is hit with a dart of love, another's hit with a dart of envy, a kind of sickness that RAPIDLY infects everything she does.

hints.author: nac_est
hints.mnemonic: For a country full of pay-per-use public toilets, sudden diarrhea is certainly the most profitable sickness!

hints.mnemonic: Caveman doesn't have any skills, so he sells his diarrhea as chili to peasant wheat farmers for an amazing profit.

hints.mnemonic: Diarrhea is a sickness that makes wheat go through me like a saber.

hints.mnemonic: Diarrhea is a sickness that makes wheat go through me like a saber.

hints.mnemonic: 1. Give Caveman diarrhea 2. ??? 3. PROFIT!

hints.mnemonic: Caveman sells his diarrhea to McDonalds so they can make shit burgers. The caveman turns a huge profit from his sickness.

hints.mnemonic: I suffer from silver-sickness, that is, if anything made of silver even touches my skin it leaves a scar.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Caveman has a scar because he was shot with a silver bullet when he was mistaken for a werewolf.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: I got sick and needed surgery, but the silver lining is that now I have these awesome scars I can show off!

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: silver nitrate will burn away sick tissue, but it will leave a scar. (http

hints.mnemonic: That silverware had cut my skin, it got infected and i fell ill and even when it healed it left a permanent scar.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I picture an exhausted sick caveman snuggling up in a comfy pelt blanket.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Your body feels tired when you have a sickness. All you want to do is wrap yourself up in a nice warm pelt and get better.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Caveman was tired after hauling mammoth pelts all day.

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: Being tired is a simple sickness that can treated by covering oneself with a pelt and resting well! (Thanks inuki).

hints.author: atarakushi
hints.mnemonic: I'm sick and tired of all these motherf~~ing pelts in all these motherf~~ing kanji.

hints.author: Chadokoro_K
hints.mnemonic: SICKNESS / MISSILE ** Hint

hints.author: delenir
hints.mnemonic: An EPIDEMIC is a SICKNESS that hits like MISSLES.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: When a sick caveman sneezes, the germs shoot out of his mouth like a missile. Ironically, this biological missile is much more deadly than any spear the caveman could throw, especially if it results in an epidemic.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: The CAVEMAN felt such a pain after his POGO STICK got stuck in his butt.

hints.mnemonic: When I was feeling sick my mum said I shouldn't go out to play on my pogo stick until I felt better. Well I wasn't strong enough to stay up on it and so fell over and have the pain to prove my mum right.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Caveman feels no pain (since he was frozen for so long his pain sensors are numbed). Here we see some kids using a pogo stick to jump on his hand.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Think of the phrase pain in the xxx. Then think of a pogostick up your xxx. That's painful, right? The real question is why a pogostick is up your xxx. That's sick, dude.

hints.author: cheechuan
hints.mnemonic: It causes me great pain to utilize my chopseal to pay for all of my wife's bills due to her shopping sickness.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Caveman has a bad mannerism of putting ketchup on everything he eats. I guess that's ok since raw mammoth can't be too good...

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: This mannerism is a sickness of the modern generation. It was only recently that we started putting ketchup on everything.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Building on inuki's idea

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Sufferer from OCD (a sickness involving mannerisms) places thousands of drops of ketchup on his food in intricate patterns.

hints.author: bizarrojosh
hints.mnemonic: A SICK MANNERISM is putting KETCHUP on everything.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Young kids likes to hide in cardboard boxes. (Primitive
