hints.mnemonic: This kanji doesn't really mean hide in the sense of hide and seek. It is more towards the meaning of hiding one's identity. --------------------------AKA anonymity----------- Schools are getting so strict now about personal identity, that they make young children keep anonymity by making them wear cardboard boxes over there heads.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: Primitive = Solid Snake. Solid Snake hides in a cardboard box so he wont be detected. He's loved hiding in boxes ever since he was young.

hints.author: ghinzdra
hints.mnemonic: When I was YOUNG I used to play to hide and seek ....Everything was good for that

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Most people don't know that one of the most revered artisans in Japan preserves the ancient art of cutting cardboard boxes with an ax.

hints.author: sarek05
hints.mnemonic: The axe murderer considered himself an artisan for how his tastefully chopped up his victims and arranged their remains artfully in boxes.

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: We here have the axe-man who's an artisan at making sculptures with his axe... The only thing is, he never shows anyone, keeping all his sculptures inside a box down in the basement. He doesn't want any attention.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The tool box of the artisan has an axe within.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The doctor puts the cardboard box on his head and throws a dart at a chart to determine his patients' illnesses.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: This DOCTOR prefers to use DARTS instead of syringes for injections. Here, he pulls out his BOX of DARTS, and the child on the examination table squirms.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: The doctor is tired of seeing one patient after another wanting vaccinations, so he steps into the waiting room with a big box full of darts loaded with the medicine. Bam, bam, bam, all done.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: A doctor is someone who keeps a box full of poison-dart-like syringes. (Careful not to mix up with Dr. (#47 博), from waaay back in lesson 3. This is "doctor" as a profession, where as "Dr." is a title.).

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: This doctor is carrying her syringes around in a nice portable cardboard box.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is used commonly as a counter for small animals. This is a pictograph of a SMALL ANIMAL'S view from inside a CARDBOARD BOX looking out at his masters HUMAN LEGS. He's probably hiding so the master does not COUNT him with the other animals which will probably be eaten (thus he avoids everyones EQUAL fate on the farm

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Put a box over everyone's heads, letting only the legs show, and we all look pretty much equal.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a magician doing that trick where he puts his assistant in a box and proceeds to saw her in half. Don’t the human legs sticking horizontally out of the box remind you of an equal sign?

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: Four minus one stroke is equal to..?

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: 4 - 1 = this kanji.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: That's the homeless ward of the city. Wolverine lives in a cardboard box there.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: In the ward office the sheaves of paper of the ward registration forms are kept in a box.

hints.author: dusmar84
hints.mnemonic: In the Akihabara ward, it is mandated that every resident own an X-BOX (well more like a PS3 but you get the point).

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: This is a special ward at the hospital for bad crops, where the farmers gently bring in their sheaves tucked away in little boxes for treatment, the poor things.

hints.author: henroski
hints.mnemonic: X man lives in a small BOX apartment in Shibuya WARD.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The hinge on Wolverine's cardboard box is made of wood because he doesn't have enough budget to buy metal hinges.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: You notice a hinge on a tree and realize there's a secret door. You open it up to find an Xbox!!!

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The hinge in this hospital ward was made of wood because they didn't have enough budget to buy metal hinges.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: I like using "X Box" as the primitive instead of ward. The first X Box had a lot of problems. I guess Microsoft was in a hurry to get it out. I even noticed that the hinges were made of wood... what the hell?

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Make sure you install the hinge the right way. If it opens treeward (= tree ward), you won't be able to get the fence open, make sure it opens houseward.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The city decides to disperse the homeless ward with a precision missile assault. They didn't know Wolverine was living in a cardboard box there though...

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: The biggest assault on Japan during WW2 is when the wards in Hiroshima and Nagasaki were wiped out by nuclear missiles.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In this hospital ward, the personnel is assaulted by missiles. Think of a ward where crazy old people assault the personnel because they don't like the food, they don't want to take their medicines, they want to go home, etc. The patients use whatever they can get their hands on as missiles.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: Kids these days are just assaulted by violent games. Just look at these X-Box games - they all have missiles in them! Even Barbie Horse Adventure!

hints.author: jmcanally
hints.mnemonic: Best game of the year award goes to.... MISSLE ASSAULT for the XBOX! What a great game

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: "Europe? Yawn... I've been to every ward(country/area)," says Wolverine interviewed from his cardboard box.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [Europe] X-Box was first released in America and Japan (the biggest videogame markets). Europe had an X-Box lack for a while...

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Do japanese consider Europe like just a ward, boring enough to make them yawn?? This kanji is offensive!

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: The EU lacks separate economic wards.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: The X-Box wasn't a big hit in Europe. They took one look at it and collectively yawned.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: A true stamp collecting nerd won't be able to repress the urge to get his fingers on the latest box of collector stamps!

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: They would repress dissents by cutting off their fingers and mailing them to relatives in small boxes (of course including stamps for proper postage).

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: A chikan (bus-molester) tries to repress his finger-groping desire by refusing to travel by bus anymore. Instead, he seals himself in a box, makes sure there are enough postage stamps on the outside, and mails himself. He's a good man at heart , you see... just a bit of a slave to his libido. (I suggest using this same Chikan as the primitive for the "box and stamp" combo on the right side of this kanji, which come up more than once later on).

hints.author: jajaaan
hints.mnemonic: I'm just gonna say what we're all thinking. Young women work hard to repress their urges to put their fingers in their boxes because if their mothers found out, they could be stamped with a big WHORE stamp across their faces for the rest of their lives. Such a stamping is avoided by severe repression.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The right side is a rabbit ( 卯 ) that has lost one ear. He (I'm thinking of a cartoony rabbit who has lost the ear in some battle with an enemy) has to repress (concretely, with his fingers!) his urge to revenge, which is hard to contain in his little head.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: All stamps in Mr T's collection box are lied carefully face-up.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Mr T with the post package at the post office

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Chuck Norris always plays poker with his cards face-up because he can't be beat anyway. Try and cheat and you'll end up the recipient of a roundhouse kick to the head and will leave the room in a box with a stamp addressed to the local morge.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: A person who is a stamp collector has all of the stamps face-up in their box.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: If you're using "chikan" for the small box + stamp primitive, here's a story for you

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Stamp-collectors sit and wait on the road to welcome new mail arrivals.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The stamp collector goes out to the road to welcome the arrival of his new stamp box.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: I found a small stamped box on the road, and figured it wouldn't hurt to open it. As I opened it, I pricked myself on a small needle. Thinking nothing of it, I unfolded a note that read "Welcome to the AIDS club!". Fuck!

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: I welcome the box from Amazon (a box with stamps on it) that has come a long way.

hints.author: rowdyphantom
hints.mnemonic: Even though she was homeless and living in a box along the road, she stamped her "home" with the word "welcome". Hospitality can be found in the humblest of abodes.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: When an American Indian warrior dies, his body is placed on a TABLE inside a TEEPEE, and a ritualistic ceremony is held to encourage his spirit to ASCEND to that big buffalo hunting ground in the sky.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: When I was a kid I went out camping in a teepee. I ate beans for dinner, and afterwards I produced so much gas that my teepee actually ascended in the air!

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Stroke order for teepee primitive is incorrect (in 4th edition), 3rd and 4th strokes should be reversed.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Mr Bean ascends a teepee, which then collapses, flattening the American Indians trapped inside.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The smell of a bean fart ascends up, up and out the top of the teepee.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Scuba divers know that when you ascend in the water, your lucidity increases (For non-divers, the deeper you go, the more you become mentally impaired by nitrogen narcosis, every 50 feet is like drinking one martini). Scuba divers also know that as you ascend in the water, the lucidity of the water improves, too.

hints.author: crayonmaster
hints.mnemonic: Lucid dreams allow me to control what is happening. In a drowning nightmare, I forced lucidity and allowed myself ascend to the surface.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A few drops of acid/peyote and the Indians obtain lucidity on their vision quest, as if they were floating in the lucid sky.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The keyword refers to limpid water, but also to something that is clear (as in "crystal clear"). In Buddhism the thinking mind is often compared to a pond

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is also used for CLEAR WEATHER. Imagine the RAIN/WATER ASCENDING back up into the sky, and the clouds floating away, giving you CLEAR WEATHER. (it's like hitting rewind).

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: I spent some time in her TEEPEE...just the TWO of us...but I looked between her HUMAN LEGS and I saw a nasty DISCHARGE...so I made my 出発 rather hastily.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: Two pairs of human legs poking out of a teepee

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The indian chief went into his teepee and found his wife sleeping with a cowboy. He discharged his gun at the two people, and left with their legs discharging out the door.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: The soldier was dishonorably discharged when his commanding officer saw two pairs of legs sticking out of a teepee designed for just one soldier.

hints.author: lanval
hints.mnemonic: Hier sieht man den Akt, der neues Leben hervorbringen kann

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: I think discharging nuclear weapons should be abolished. That includes underground tests in caves. You listening Kim Jong-il?

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Guns were abolished, so gun enthusiats left for the hills to discharge their guns in caves.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Discharging guns in caves was abolished because the ricochets were causing too many injuries.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: When slavery was abolished, defiant slave owners knew they had lost the war but as an act of spite herded up all their slaves into a remote cave and killed them all by discharging bullets into their heads. (The dead bodies then discharged various substances/fluids as voluntary muscle control was suddenly gone.).

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: Slaves have been discharged from the caves where they were kept thanks to the abolition of slavery.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: Trivia

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Some businesses allow pets in the office. Here, my colleague is Mr T and he set up a little pup tent for his minidog, then turns around and completes his TPS reports.

hints.author: the_marshal
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T began working in a japanese compagny. As he sees that his colleague accept to do some extra work during the week-end and even sleep at the office, he says to them

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (リョウ) When Ned (insert male person here) gets a pup tent (i.e. a woody), he calls it his "colleague." (again, sorry for the crudeness of many of my stories).

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: A colleague implies someone that you share work with, such as in your company or profession, etc. Here your colleague helps you to erect your pup tent during a company outing. Note

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: I paint a huge eye on the side of my pup tent. Why? – It’s obvious

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: RevTKers please, open your eyes!! That's not a puptent you see! It's kagaribi (尞), fuel used for sacrifices. I know it wasn't obvious at first, but I hope it's clear to you now!

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: It's obvious that the pup tent with a huge eye on the side belongs to the dark lord Sauron.

hints.author: fastgolfball
hints.mnemonic: It is obvious that you shouldn't be staring into sacred bonfires with your eyes.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Open your eyes, it's obvious that not all of us can fit into that small puptent!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This guy would rather use his pup-tent as a house, than sleep in the dormitory. So he effectively turned that pup-tent into a house by getting a postal address for it etc. (just to emphasize house).

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: All-male dormitories in Japan are really weird, and tend to have a little too much 男気 . Here is a trick they play where if they find that one dorm member has pitched a "pup tent" while sleeping, they make it into a house by putting a little roof on top of it -- complete with a lit cigarette for a chimney -- and wait for the "fun" to start (fun meaning...lighting their friend's genitals on fire).

hints.author: mfistik
hints.mnemonic: A dormitory room has the same characteristics of a pup tent, meaning that it's small and usually sleeps two people (you and your room mate), however you have an actual roof over your head.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: To please gods and pass next exams you set a whole dormitory (house) afire. Wow! What a sacred bonfire!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: A DORMITORY HOUSE has all the same characteristics as a PUP TENT; smelly, old, cramped, etc.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: In Final Fantasy 4, sleeping in a tent completely heals you and recovers all your HP and MP (and cures any sickness your characters may have).

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Sick caveman has to sleep in his pup tent. Not the cave because to humid and cold but a nice small pup tent in the sun will heal him from his cold.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: There’s nothing like a little getting away from it all, pitching a PUP-TENT in a scenic place, kicking back, relaxing and drinking in nature’s beautiful medicine. It’s a great way to HEAL the SICKNESSes of modern life that afflict us.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: The sick caveman asks gods to heal him (from a hangover) and sets a sacred bonfire in his cave.

hints.author: Delina
hints.mnemonic: On the battlefield, the only place to heal from your sickness is inside the medic's pup tent. Think of M.A.S.H.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Start with a circumference and carve away until you get the shape you want.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: [My primitive for shape is Mystique, the shape-shifter from X-Men.] Mystique the shape-shifter carves obscure markings around the circumfrence of her blue body.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: (Primitive

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: HINT

hints.author: Uncreativity
hints.mnemonic: HINT

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Everyone in the kindergarten came up with fun and interesting shapes made out of Play-Doh, except for the kid with the amputated arm. Seems like you really need both hands.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: With your two hands, outline the shape of a curvaceous woman. Is that a universally understood gesture? [Careful

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Mystique is in great shape! I wanna run my two hands over the shape of her body.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Of coure, a sculptor needs both hands to shape his works of art.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Two hands can make many shapes.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The sun over the capital cast a shadow with the same shape.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Mystique the shape-shifter blends into the scenery by transforming into a form that looks like little more than an animated shadow.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: You make some of the famous scenery of Kyoto out of play-doh, even going so far as to add some black play-doh to depict shadow.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: You're out hiking looking at the SCENERY, suddenly out of the corner of your vision you see a large SHADOW's indistinct SHAPE... could it be a grizzly? (cmp shade (#1592 陰)).

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Godzilla attacks! Tokyo's scenery is covered by the shape of Godzilla's shadow yet again.

hints.author: gibosi
hints.mnemonic: Cedar is an evergreen tree that keeps its SHAPE all year long. That is, it doesn't loose its needles/leaves in the winter.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Mystique leaning against a cedar tree for a photo shoot.

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Why do cedar trees keep their shape (don't lose their needles)? Because they're not real trees, they're made out of play-doh.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Mmmm, cedar-scented Play-Doh. Finally, a scent that doesn't make me want to vomit.

hints.author: aphasiac
hints.mnemonic: Mystique is leaning against a cedar tree for a sexy photo shoot, holding a lump of cheddar (it's for a cheese advert).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: In Sydney we occasionally get exotic birds. You first notice a colouring in a tree. You look more carefully and you make out the shape of a bird (here represented by its claws).

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Mystique the shape-shifter changes the coloring of her skin to camouflage tones and perches herself in a tree like a vulture waiting for her pray.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: warning

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: A little kid about age 3 is coloring something that his teacher can't quite make out. It's just kind of a blob... an unknown shape. She asks, "What's that?" Of course, the child expects the teacher to know what it is and is offended that she didn't recognize what the shape/blob was. "Don't you see it's a vulture in a tree!?" Obviously very upset by this, the child's next drawing is of the vulture flying down from the tree and pecking the teacher to death.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: When coloring something in you grab the crayon of choice to fill in the shapes.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The shape of a sheriff's badge makes it patent who he is.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Mystique the shape-shifter sneaks into the patent office easily after she steals an identity badge from a security guard.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: YOU have the patent for Playdoh? That's patently false. See here, I have the badge of proof issued from the patent office.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: It was patently absurd when the fellow tried to arrest me--his badge was the wrong shape

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: A young lad is standing atop a cliff, looking at the writhing shape of his fallen lass below.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A naughty young lad stands on the cliff and throws his Playdoh off the edge.

hints.author: kanjiknight
hints.mnemonic: A lad standing on the top of a cliff, looking into the far, and thinking how to shape his future.

hints.author: Terhorst
hints.mnemonic: Mystique sneaks up behind a young security guard foolishly standing by a cliff. All it takes is a little push, almost playful, and she's free to assume his form. You made it too easy, lad.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: (See my story for 産 "products".) Someone is standing at the top of a cliff and urinating. You can tell it's a lad by his shape.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The lad jumps off the cliff, breaks his head, and smashes his face.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: When I was a lad, a pretty face was all it took for someone to get in my head, and I'd fill pages of lovelorn letters to them.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Ee gads! Look at the face on that lad's head! http

hints.author: Raschaverak
hints.mnemonic: Normally, lads have a pretty face, but an empty head….

hints.author: elanlan
hints.mnemonic: The lad likes to get head from ladies with a pretty face.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: Why, I OUGHT to RESHAPE your HEAD...

hints.author: Airymon
hints.mnemonic: Since this Kanji is exceptional, the shape ought to be on the left side. Got that into your head?

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: You ought to like the shape of your head because you can't change it.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: A little kid decorates his sleeping grandpa's head with Play-Doh

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Mystique the shape-shifter [carve (#1710 彫)] ought to use her head after choosing a form, otherwise she might forget who she is.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: An injured body part may swell. It will begin to throb like a bass drum and will change shape.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: If a PART OF your BODY begins to SWELL and resembles the SHAPE of a bass DRUM, you’re either pregnant or in desperate need of a diet.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji does not mean swell as in a inflammation. There is a different kanji for that meaning ( 腫れる ). This kanji means swell as in, a tire swelling/expanding, your income swelling/expanding, dough swelling/expanding, etc. Johnskb's story is best b/c it does not involve swelling in the sense of inflammation, just general expansion of the stomach. STORY

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: Which part of your body can change shape and, when it does, swells up and throbs like a drumb? Hmmm...

hints.author: Terhorst
hints.mnemonic: Mystique's tummy swells into a big drum. Pounding on her flesh can be heard for miles around. *boom ba-ba-boom ba-ba-boom ba-ba-boom!*.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: I'm going to visit my grandpa in the hospital. He broke his elbow, and it became really big and contorted into a weird shape. I hope he will be all right!

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: Whenever the postman has to pay a visit to this place, he brings an elbow-shaped thingy that he throws to the St. Bernard.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: I paid a visit to my neighbour, but I forgot he had this huge St. Bernard dog. The doctor said my elbow will never be the same shape.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: I was a little nonplussed by the inappropriateness of this keyword, so I decided to use "the three kings" instead; they are a threesome, and they make a religiously-motivated visit, right? Anyway, they travel by night, so they're just these three shapes moving through the gloom. They can't see well, so a St. Bernard dog noses their elbows whenever they start to go the wrong way.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Whenever I have to visit the relatives... that puts me in one hell of a wretched state of mind.

hints.author: Spidercat
hints.mnemonic: Data feels wretched because he has no family to visit.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: I don't know about you, but it seems to me that whenever I'm in a wretched state of mind and just want to be left alone, that's the time that other people always seem to decide to visit me!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Your state of mind at the end of the previous frame.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Data felt wretched his visit to a "third-world" and seeing how wretched the people lived.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is a harsh taskmaster who will discipline you (beat you into shape) with his walking stick.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: You may not have known it, but Mr. T is into discispline. Not just self discipline, in order to get into shape, but what he really likes is when the Task master spanks him with her walking stick. Don't tell Mr. T I told you. I pity da fool, and da fool would be me!!!

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Compare with permanence/remote (#958 悠). Mr. T went to visit his old taskmaster who had a walking stick. Halfway on the way to that remote region, Mr. T was about to give up because of the long and difficult journey when he ran into Bruce Lee, who told him that discipline is needed to reach your goal.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T joins the X-men. When they catch mystique, he beats her with a walking stick like a true taskmaster to discipline her. But it turns out mystique has taken the shape of the walking stick, and she then beats him.

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: The king has a really rare umbrella, it can change shape.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: samesong
hints.mnemonic: Mystique stole the rare jewel-encrusted umbrella by simply morphing into a king, marching into the palace and taking it. "I'll be back, I'd like to take a quick stroll in the rain!' S/he said, and casually strolled off holding the umbrella (pictograph - you can see the umbrella over Mystique).

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: It's rare to see the king carrying his own parasol - typically he gets one of his attendants to do it for him (thanks to Katsuo for umbrella + shape = parasol and to Peppi for the story idea).

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The ancient jewel that is shaped like an umbrella is extremely rare, and so is hung from the chin (ちん) of the royal king of Mezura (めずら) to signify his importance.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: The doctor at my checkup was expressing words of concern about my umbrella shaped gut.

hints.author: jotun
hints.mnemonic: At a check-up the proctologist views an X-Ray. I say, is that shape an umbrella?

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: Mystique goes to get a check-up and the doctors words cut her to the bone, "I'm sorry Mystique but you've changed shape too many times, you'll be stuck as an umbrella forever".

hints.author: libsrone
hints.mnemonic: (Using Katsuo's umbrella+shape=parasol suggestion). The words giving the results of the STD ridden geisha's check-up are discreetly written on her parasol.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: Check-up result

hints.author: mhheie
hints.mnemonic: A twist on greenapple

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: The teacher in the tophat puts an X on all the grammatically incorrect sentences.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I celebrated finishing the Heisig books by buying myself a plaid top hat (top hat with criss cross pattern to symbolize the crisscrossing flashcards) and then I began the AJATT sentence method.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: It should not be a problem to see this as SENTENCE. For the primitive, think in a Scottish accent and say "PLAID kilt". Guess it can look like a Beret wearing scot.

hints.author: meredithcat
hints.mnemonic: I'm making sentence/plaid into a new primitive

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: When sitting vis-a-vis, Scots will glue their kilt down to avoid embaressment.

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: This is a character that is used in Japanese for "vs." (as in, "Alien vs. Predator").

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: This isn't plaid, it's tophat and sheaf. In the tophatted wheat cutting competition, one contestant gathered more sheafs than anyone else, he had an advantage vis-a-vis the rest because he had glued his tophat on, everyone else's hat kept coming off.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: The word vis-a-vis is like sentence glue, it kind of joins sentences together.

hints.author: netsplitter
hints.mnemonic: Wolverine has to glue a top hat to his head when sitting vis-a-vis on a train so no one recognizes him.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: Who knew that Spiderman was Scottish! He has sewn his family crest onto his uniform.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A family crest sown on to a garment with thread sometimes has a Latin sentence as a motto.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: If you look closely, you can see that on SPIDERMAN'S CREST, there is sown in his favorite SENTENCE, "with great power, comes great responsibility.".

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: On Spiderman's family crest reads the sentence "With great power, comes great responsibility"... in Latin of course.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The scotsmen proudly display the family crest threaded into their kilts.

hints.author: wonk2001
hints.mnemonic: The mosquito (an insect) knows only one sentence

hints.author: Okonomiyaki
hints.mnemonic: Mosquitoes are the insect who love Scots in plaid kilts because it makes for easy access to the best parts.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: How to tell a scottish mosquito? Easy. They are the insects with the plaid kilts on. (imagine a far side comic strip with a bunch of mosquitos at a house party).

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Just when I thought there was no effective mosquito repellent, I found out they seem to really hate plaid sweaters!

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: The west coast of Scotland is one of the most beautiful places in the world. Unfortunately, there is one thing which can really 'bug' you while you're there - midges (like a small mosquito). Imagine them getting under a Scotsman's tartan kilt and having a feast.

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Two kings, kilt

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: Wolverine was easily able to join the squad (#1229 班) when he was seen wearing a top hat speckled with jewels on the sides. (thanks mantixen).

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: The Scotsman's balls (squad (#1229 班)) were speckled like quail eggs.

hints.author: Apple_Head
hints.mnemonic: This squad speckles sentences all over town (graffiti).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Tenacious D (the two kings) speckled the death row inmate from both sides with their pearl juice.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Scotsman goalkeeper adjusted himself. He reached down and adjusted the two things between his skinny fencepost legs.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means "symmetry" not "adjusted." STORY

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: You are trying to stretch a plaid between two fenceposts. It's not easy, as for all wrinkles to go away posts' positions must be carefully adjusted.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: HINT

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+dingomick] The Scottish goalkeeper has lost both of his legs and was forced to replace them with two bent white picket fenceposts nailed together with two boards, but that hasn't stopped him from playing his favorite sport

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: When my medicine dose is way too large, I adjust it by cutting it into smaller pieces with my saber.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: We had to adjust his dose slightly, after he went on a rampage with a sabre.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The Scotsman goalkeeper took a dose of medicine injected by saber, like a real man.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: See my story for 1729. STORY

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The Scotsman in huge pain from a hangover demands his doctor adjust his pain killer dosage up and threatens him with a saber.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: When the goalkeeper finishes the game, he drinks a lot of water and adjusts himself.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: Finish him! Subzero adjusts the water in your body and crushes you into a few million pieces.

hints.author: aniseed
hints.mnemonic: After i've finished having a pee i adjust my trousers.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: After you finish exercising, be sure to drink some water and adjust your pace (cool down and stretch).

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: After the Scotsman goalkeeper gave someone a dose of poison [1730], someone from the opposing team engaged him in a match of Mortal Kombat. Uh oh, looks like the Scotsman lost - "Finish Him!!!" and as the finishing punch is delivered, drops of water (ala SNES) come out, not blood...pretty disappointing.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: A scottish priest in a tartan kilt has put his altar between a couple of fence posts and is now playing the bagpipes in a very Scottish purification rite.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: An exorcism, or "purification" of the soul. The possessed girl is tied to two posts next to the altar, her head spinning around and around. Then the priest says the required sentence

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Kind of vulgar, but here the SCOTSMAN got tired of adjusting himself so decided try PURIFICATION. Sadly, he did it by straddling the ALTAR with his skinny LEGS.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: The scottish priest in a tartan kilt is purifying his genitals. He's standing delicately atop two fence posts, and gingerly dipping himself atop the altar.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+fudo] The Scotsman goalkeeper is going all out to stop balls from crossing the goal line. Here he is in a purification ritual with a little mini altar on the goal line, throwing salt about and burning incense in order to purify the line. He prays

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Even though it's a maddening task, the monks stay solemn as they rake rice between the fenceposts.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: This is a zen rice garden. It is different from rock garden in only one aspect. Here you see raked white rice between the fenceposts. In solemn silence the monks rake rice every morning.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: I tie CONDI RICE in between two FENCEPOSTS and prepare for the SOLEMN task ahead....beating her over the head with a RAKE.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: The RICE thrown at the wedding must be RAKED up before the SOLEMN funeral procession enters between the FENCE POSTS.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Playing baseball in a rice field with sparklers stuck into the ground to act as bases.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The traditional New Year's baseball game in Japan is held at midnight in a rice field. They stick sparklers in the ground for the bases so they can be seen, and to be more festive.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Warning! warning! Base compromised initiating Computer on self destruct mode.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The surprise attack came from left-field! Somebody set us up the sparkler! How are we gentelmen? All your base are belong to us! But no, they stood their ground and sent out the ZIG! For great justice!

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This means bases as in baseball, otherwise a fort. The original form of this kanji is 壘, a pictogram of four bases, the home base marked specially.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Zelda

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: The most amazing new bird has been found

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: There we were at the concert...her voice was like a dove...her dress sparkled...then suddenly, a tree fell on her.....

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: I learned this as enjoyable (which is 楽しい -　たのしい） Music is - 音楽 - おんがく as in sounds that are enjoyable.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The most enjoyable kind of music is when the conductor conducts with a white sparkler while standing in a tree.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: New-age medicine involves using things like music and flowers (aromatherapy) as treatment.

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: Oh man, this medicinal marijuana is making me hear MUSIC and see FLOWERS everywhere...

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Flowers and music are the best medicine to make you happy.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: You go to the 薬屋 to fill the prescription for your medicine, and upon opening the jar, a flower pops up and music starts playing.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Medicine commercials these days don't even tell you what the medicine does! They just play some uplifting music and show people frolicking through fields of flowers.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Keep separate from proportion. Gandalf is trying to adjust the aspect ratio of his monitor from 4

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: It's quite mysterious how each sparkler gives of sparkles at a precise ratio of ten to one. Physicists have been studying this effect for decades, known as the Sparkler Effect, and using it to explain why stars look like sparklers in the night sky.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: A witches spell requires the proper RATIO of ingredients

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: When I first started downloading torrents, I thought that ratios were very mysterious. Now I keep a sparkling ten to one ratio!

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: When the world's ratio of women to men mysteriously changed to ten to one overnight, the men all lit sparklers in celebration

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: If you eat something astringent water will stop the sparkly sensation in your mouth.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: I think that Heisig meant this as the "slightly bitter but fresh" meaning that it can have to describe foods like lemons (しぶい). So imagine a guy trying a cocktail (water), feeling like he's been kicked in the face (footprint) and sparks are flying from his tongue. 'How did it taste?'. 'Hmm, yes, slightly bitter, but fresh".

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: An astringent is also a medical term for something that causes puckering of the flesh or can stop bleeding. An astringent is the liquid you'd need if you step on a sparkler.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Only astringent water is strong enough to stop a sparkler.

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: You ate something astringent? Quickly drink this water here to stop the sparkly sensation. (+meolox).

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Now that I'm a responsible adult, I have to get my vicarious thrills from watching stupid people put sparklers up to their ears and burn their fingers.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: I put my fingers in my ears to avoid going deaf while getting a vicarious thrill from watching kids light off sparklers and fireworks on Chinese New Year.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: 摂る 【とる】 (v5r) to take something into the body; to absorb nourishment. 摂取 【せっしゅ】 (n,vs) (1) intake; absorption; adoption; (2) assimilation; (P) STORY

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+mspertus] My friend is too afraid of loud noises, so while we go out to enjoy the sparklers and fireworks on New Years, he stays at home and watches everything on TV so he can have a vicarious experience. Just the sight of them freaks him out though, so he watches with the volume low and his fingers firmly planted in his ears.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Old southern joke. It was a VICARIOUS situation, the man lights a firecracker (SPARKLES), then stuck his FINGER in his EARS to prepare for the boom. Sadly, he was still holding the firecracker.

hints.author: pjhoover
hints.mnemonic: A person with a big mouth wants to be the center of attention.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Youve got the st bernard dead centre in your sights (the box).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: You must get the explosive into the center. The armor will protect him otherwise. The key is to wait for the mouth of the St. Bernard to be open, and then fling the dynamite into the center of it.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: For the primitive, I'll try a big boxy target - like the kind you use to line up your enemy in a videogame before you blow it up. Here, though - you're given the opportunity to finally kill that St Bernard from Duck Hunt - just make sure to line it up in the center of your target...

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: I see this as a modern-day pictogram for someone walking in carrying a big birthday cake, with one fat candle at its CENTRE (to remind me that the CENTRE vertical juts up from the "cake"), and to be placed at the CENTRE of a table, in honor of the person who's the day's CENTRE of attention. (I use the CENTRE instead of CENTER to promote the connection with England (#1741 英), 英 .).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The original great seal of the king of England had a very ornate flower in the center.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: England was once the flowering center of civilization.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: England is a country where people think they're the flower at the center of the world. (a description that would fit China much better.. 中華 ).

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: England, country of flower shows and big, fat dogs (I live in England, it's true).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In a rare display of class, the England supporters throw flowers at the center of the football stadium.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: In the solar system, the Sun is the central source of all light, everything else just reflects it.

hints.author: sacmaliyorsun
hints.mnemonic: A solar power plant consists of thousands of mirrors reflecting the sun's rays, concentrating the energy on a focal point at the centre. See here

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: You can build a very powerful camp stove just by using metalic mirrors to reflect the sun onto a cooking surface at the center.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the sun, at the center of our solar system, like a huge disco-ball (a ball made with hundreds of tiny mirrors), reflecting the light from the planets and stars around (instead of emitting light on its own). The kanji refers to images which are reflected, mirrored and also projected, as in the kanji compound 映画 (eiga)

hints.author: andresito
hints.mnemonic: 「えい」画 A movie reflects the central days of the person filmed.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: He was stabbed with a dagger, and little drops of red blood dropped onto the ground.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: There was red all over the soil after Little Red Riding Hood plunged a dagger into the wolf. Those two dots we see are wolfies animal legs we see, by the way (a la smithsonian).

hints.author: smithsonian
hints.mnemonic: (I prefer to use animal legs instead of little so as not to resort to combining it with dagger

hints.author: jmcanally
hints.mnemonic: This is a mass grave for animal and human legs. The serial killer is a Japanese guy with short legs and long-leg envy, so he cuts off legs that are longer than his and buries them here. Notice that since the legs have been cut off one-by-one and tossed in the grave randomly so the animal legs look a bit far apart and the human legs look a bit different than usual (direction of the curve of the right leg is opposite the usual). The ground is still RED with from all the blood spilled.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: The soil was red after the hunter used his dagger to cut off the animal's legs.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: The student blushed until his face was red, so the schoolmaster decided to pardon him.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: Blushing red while asking for a pardon from the taskmaster.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: Pardon the fart of the RED faced TASKMASTER.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: "Um... pardon me," says a very red taskmaster, after he lets one go.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Turning red with embarrassment, he appealed to the taskmaster for a pardon (compare with salvation (#936 救)).

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: It's quite unusual and abnormal to see an apple with walking legs running away from the person who wants to eat it!

hints.author: misha
hints.mnemonic: Imagine an apple on walking legs on stage singing "It's not unusual to be loved by anyone" (Tom Jones). Keyword can be confused with uncommon (#1797 異).

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: It is unusual in the obese US to eat apples or to walk.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, it's very unusual for people to eat whilst walking down the street. When Japanese people visit western countries and see someone eating an apple or a banana on the street, they find it very strange. This is true.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Sexual pervert 変態 （へんたい） Unusual behaviour?

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Pirate pokes the tip of his wooden leg into an apple to disguise his tracks.

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: To hide his distinctive wood-leg tracks, this pirate is throwing apples after his tracks in order for animals to come and confuse his tracks.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Leg + Red

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: Sir, these are definitely fake tracks. How do you know? One foot is a wooden leg, and the other is an apple.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: The barbarian picks an apple from above and eats it even though there is a worm (insect) in it.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Barbarians eat apples with worms still in them.

hints.author: Aikou
hints.mnemonic: Barbarian is derived from "barba rossa" which means red beard (true!). In this red beard live lots of disgusting insects.

hints.author: zaydana
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a barbarian choosing between two apples - one full of insects, and one without. The barbarian of course decides to eat the one with insects - "I need my meat for the day!".

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: The barbarian eats the red apple, insect and all!!

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The romance between Snow White and Prince Charming started when Snow White took a bite of poison apple and her heart stopped.

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: A childhood romance

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: You're the apple of my heart!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji does not mean "romance" such as romantic love. Here is a common saying

hints.author: fruitangel
hints.mnemonic: Romance is a big red heart.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In his most daring feat, William tell used his bow to shoot an apple off the head of his son across the water of the gulf.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: An army of archers must cross a gulf of water. Fortunately there are millions of apple trees growing in the cliffs above the gulf. The archers use their bows to shoot down apple after apple, which all fall into the water and slowly fill up the the gulf until the archer soliders can cross on foot.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: In the Gulf war Iraq troops fight back with water guns, rotten apples and bow 'n' arrows - so much for the 'weapons of mass destruction' !

hints.author: blurp76
hints.mnemonic: This is one beauty of a kanji! Looks like a painting of a sunset. You can see the sea (water), the coast shaped like a bow and the red sun (or some red apples trees planted nearby).

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Legolas shoots over the waters of the gulf into the apple on the other side.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The salad did not look very appetizing... The sprouts were yellow and there were animal legs sticking out of it.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: I order a salad with sprouts. I'm asked if I'd like to add chicken. Yes please. My salad then arrives . . . . topped with these horribly gnarled yellow things. Chicken feet! (animal legs) ugh.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: My face turned yellow when I watched my salad sprout animal legs and start scurrying across the table. Check please!

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: The salad goes yellow sprouts legs and runs off.

hints.author: GKKLJapan
hints.mnemonic: Anyone who's played Final Fantasy knows what a Chocobo is. Chocobos have YELLOW plumage and strong ANIMAL LEGS. They are also fond of eating SPROUTS, which has led to the promotion of various Chocobo SALADS.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A tree went all yellow. It died and fell down, ending up sideways.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In a horrible accident, a yellow schoolbus gets wrapped sideways around a tree.

hints.author: mr_hans_moleman
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a TREE that grows BANANAS that is so heavy that it made the TREE fall SIDEWAYS.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Guys only pee sideways on trees, never up and down.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The tree fell sideways and yellow fungis grew on it.

hints.author: msukovich
hints.mnemonic: Japanese censorship laws require pornos to use a mosaic screen, so you can't see what the porno chick is grasping with her fingers (but you can assume, neetch).

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Your fingers grasp the Rubic's cube... if only your brain could too.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Mosaic primative = rubic's cube. Here Shrek grasps his Rubic's cube trying to get a grasp on how it's done.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The Rubik's Cube keeps slipping out of my finger's grasp every time I try to turn it. One of the children must have been playing with it earlier...

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: To me, the 'mosaic' primitive looks just like a computer mouse. (Grasping your fingers around the computer mouse.).

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Bound up in the Rubik's cube are the 6 different colours.

hints.author: Haych
hints.mnemonic: Ever look closely at mosaics? They contain a bunch of images bound up into a larger one. It seems amazing until you realize that the only quality of the smaller images that really matters is their colour.

hints.author: Dragg
hints.mnemonic: A man and woman are BOUND UP in a colorful sex act. She bends over, legs tucked underneath, exposing her FULL MOON buttocks in order to be penetrated. *Heisigian liberties aside, this is what the kanji literally means. By reporting this story, you are reporting Japanese to be a naughty language in general.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: This kanji has a secondary meaning relating to sex (so stop reading now if you have issues) and originally showed a bending person (bound up) over another bending person (mosaic). This might help as an alternative to the mosaic primitive. (Say, doggy-style? Works ok for grasp (#1752 把) "grasp the love handles with your fingers during doggy-style", but I'm not sure about fertilizer (#1756 肥)...Oh, wait, how about "be careful with your flesh during doggy-style of you might fertilize her"? No? Oh well...).

hints.author: Radii
hints.mnemonic: If you look into a kaleidoscope it's like a bound up mosaic of color.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The Spider-man's multi-colored tie-dye costume comic book series was discontinued after only one issue because of poor sales and fan protests.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has decided to discontinue his red color suit in favor of the black one, it looks way cooler.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: As times move on and fashion tastes inevitably change, threads of certain colors often get discontinued.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man changed the color of his costume fearing if he didn't spice things up they'd discontinue his comic.

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman comics are only available in colour as black and white ones have been discontinued.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: To print something with bountiful colour, they use glossy paper.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: If you go to have photo’s printed, you may be asked if you would like a matted or GLOSSY finish. For nature shots, with BOUNTIFUL COLORS, I would recommend going with GLOSSY paper.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Similar to the previous frame. The glossy pages of many magazines are bountiful in "color".

hints.author: yLaguardia
hints.mnemonic: This a special edition of a comic book about the adventures of BENDER and Mr. BEAN (check sindikhara story on bountiful (#1443 豊) to see one of the adventures). It would normally be black and white on cheap paper, but being this one a special edition, it was printed COLORED on GLOSSY paper and BOUND UP in hard cover.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Bender thinks he is filthy rich with all his beans. He wont get away from it. Finally they found a way. The spray Bender and his beans with glossy(smooth and shiny) colours. Now Bender runs of an tries to find a way to get his manly, rusty colour back.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: PART OF YOUR BODY excretes something that is commonly used for FERTILIZER. Sometimes this process is slow, so you solve a RUBIK'S CUBE while you sit and wait.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: If you're sick, a part of your body may produce fertilizer that makes a colorful mosaic.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Japanese porn producers apply a mosaic to the part of the body most frequently responsible for making fertilizer - too bad they neglect to mosaic the fertilizer itself! Sick, sick stuff.

hints.author: fuaburisu

hints.author: dingomick

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: A poor, agrarian nation features on its NATIONAL FLAG a BUSHEL BASKET. The country is so poor, however, that the NATIONAL FLAG look more like a BANNER than a proper NATIONAL FLAG.

hints.author: Renaissance
hints.mnemonic: The national flag of the land in Hale Nochi Guu, is actually a banner with Pokute on it. (primitive explanation http

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The slowest remote chess game ever

hints.author: lifeflaw
hints.mnemonic: The slowest chess game ever

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: One BUSHEL BASKET full of rice is enough to sustain a small family for a PERIOD of one MONTH.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: A woman who doesn't want to throw harmful materials into the landfills might be found using a rook instead of a tampon when it's her time of the month. In other words, her period.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Go is chess played with stones.

hints.author: rtkrtk

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The two Go masters, playing on a gigantic stone Go board, take their stone playing chips from huge barrels.

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: Go needs a bushel basket full of stones to play it.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I wanted to play Go, so I wanted to set up the board. I went for my bushel basket, where I keep all of the stones, but they fall out of the bottom! This is the same bushel basket that Charlie used in his escape! Now, I have nowhere to keep my Go stones. raulir 30-4-2006.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Fundamentals of chess

hints.author: bigloui
hints.mnemonic: A Bushel-basket full of earth contains the fundementals of farming. i.e. earth.

hints.mnemonic: I took a course on the fundamentals of bushel basket-weaving. They teach you everything from the ground up. (sweetneet variation).

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: One doesn't become a grand master over night. Before he could graduate to using a real chess board, Garry Kasparov had to master the fundamentals of the game by drawing chess boards in a piledirt. (a pile of dirt that he was for some reason straddling, I might add).

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: It's a tremendous match between the two chess-players. They are clearly eachother's equal.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: These two bushel baskets are tremendously huge. But not only they are huge, they are also perfectly equal in size.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Losing both your rooks is tremendous. It's almost equal to having your queen's legs chopped from under her.

hints.author: baylin
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is tremendously difficult to remember because it is not equal to the other bushel baskets in this lesson. Their bushel baskets all have animal legs.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: Equal I remember as the counter for small animals. Remember Battle Chess? I just picture a tremendous rook from Battle Chess wandering around stomping on little animals. Those guys were sweet.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Intuition is a tremendously powerful resource of the mind.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: Using Zareon's story for the previous frame "tremendously"... The two chessplayers who are eachother's equals are so good at chess that they don't have to even move a muscle. Their brain power does it for them. Furthermore, they don't even have to think, really. Their intuition takes control. This is

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: A woman's intuition is TREMENDOUSLY POWERful.

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: I had an intuition of who would win this fight by judging the size of my opponents tremendously large muscles.

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: Intuition--tremendously powerful.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Because I hid myself behind a huge dirt barrier I dug, I was able to withstand the tremendous nuclear blast.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Plain old soil can withstand tremendous amounts of pressure.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: The two equal chessplayers from the last two frames are duking it out still. Part of this extreme chess match is when the judges dump a huge mound of soil onto them. Watch as they withstand the weight of the dirt and how their brainpower keeps all the chess pieces, rooks and all, on the board. Simply astounding.

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: The Japanese high-rise was built to WITHSTAND GROUND tremors of TREMENDOUS force!

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Though I had lost both rooks in chess, a tremendous loss, I was able to hold my ground on the chessboard and withstand my opponent's attacks.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Frodo kept the precious in the purse but did a switch with some worthless shells when he went to sleep. Heres gollum opening the purse "ahhh my preciousssssss.....why you m***** *****!!!!!.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Inside your purse is all of your money and your keys (き) etc. All of your precious valuables.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: You put your precious shells (money) into your purse for safekeeping.

hints.author: zodiac
hints.mnemonic: Frodo kept the precious in the purse. When he opens it, he sees... money! Someone's stolen the precious (and paid for it)! (thegeezer3).

hints.author: thekonfuzed
hints.mnemonic: Ahh, my precciouss... I keeps it in my purse. What, what's this? SHELSSES! THEY REPLACED IT WITH SHELSSES!

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: "Bequeath" is an odd old word, isn't it? Basically, it just deals with how I want my precious possessions dealt out, after I die, later down the road. "Being of sound, but antiquated, mind, I bequeath this to you!".

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: I'm crossing the road with my precious items and suddenly a huge Mac truck springs out of the fog. I know I'm an instant away from certain death, so I scream, "I bequeath these precious items to whoever picks them up!" and fling them onto the road as the truck runs me over.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If sometime down the road I happen to die, I bequeath you everything precious I have.

hints.author: cornrow
hints.mnemonic: When you're at the end of your ROAD, you BEQUEATH what is PRECIOUS to you.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Dispatch all cars and chase the maestro! He's gone crazy and stolen a ladies purse!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: Apart from meaning DISPATCH, this kanji can mean "to give (to someone lower than you)," "to do," and to even "have intercourse." STORY

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Small additions to dingomick's story

hints.author: tomtosh

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: Bond has stolen a lady spy's purse while she was asleep after their evening together. When she discovers it's gone, she dispatches some henchmen on the road after him to dispatch him, but Bond evades them and escapes with the purse.

hints.author: Steinway
hints.mnemonic: ...Faramir and Frodo watched the tiny creature far below. "Shall we shoot him?" Faramir asked. "This Gollum has defiled the waters of the Forbidden pond, looking for his Precious, and for that the penalty is death"...

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Don't defile precious water.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: So much for undefiled (#1548 潔). Not only did the poor girl get defiled, she also had her precious purse with money stolen from her. She ended up drowning herself in the water.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: The moment Precious was taken out of the water, it started to defile the soul of the new owner, turning him into Gollem.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means "smash" or "break" such as to smash or break something; or ”顔をつぶす” which means "loose face" or "break face" in the literal sense. STORY

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: The yakuza boss reclines in the oaken bathtub wearing his shades while his personal harem dances nakes for him.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: I learned nothingness (#1775 無) first because it is a very common kanji. Probably easier to think of this kanji in that context. Attractive dancers should dance wearing nothing but sunglasses.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: I imagine this big oaken tub as being full of grapes being squashed by the feet of the vinyard owners. Each wearing sunglasses and doing that Russian arms crossed dance and squishing all the grapes.

hints.author: spleenlol
hints.mnemonic: See jump (#1409 踊). Renamed this kanji interpretive dance. (readapated thegeezer3) The yakuza boss reclines in the oaken bathtub wearing his タキ(tacky) sunglasses while his personal harem does an interpretive dance for him.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: Heisig, let's get this straight

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When I enter the wooden tub heated by flames in the onsen, I can let all my worries slip away and be submerged into nothingness.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: In a hot tub you can relax and have your stress vanish into nothingness.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: As the heat/flames rises up through the oaken tub for a long period of time, all the water evaporates and what's left is nothingness.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: In the ancient days of Buddhism, philosphers were common. Each of them would deeply ponder the meaning of nothingness while reclining in their oaken tubs of hot water. Underneath, there were flames to keep the water from cooling, tended by the non-philosophers. Immacolata 8-5-2006. Nothing too good for pondering the meaning of nothingness!

hints.author: Yuta73
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The leader of the Spiderman association has tons of Spiderman figurines lined up on his shelf.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Watch this

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: Association means linking things together. This can be made literal by using a thread to bind (associate) stuff which belong on your shelf.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is part of an association which meets behind the secret revolving shelves (bookcase).

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Cat in the Hat for the new primitive. Spiderman forms an association with Cat in the Hat to promote literacy while fighting crime.

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: Refined rice [1535] can only be found in exclusive grocery shops. Coarse rice by contrast fills the supermarket shelves - don't go looking for anything else there.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Ugh, why does this shelf feel so coarse? Because it's made of rice, of coarse! Get it? Of coarse?? Hahahahahahahahahah god i hate my life.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: In America they sell coarse rice on the shelves. The Japanese are much more discriminating, as they eat rice all the time, so they want finer rice.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Japanese carpenters don't use sandpaper, they use rice-paper(rice glued on to some paper). Here the carpenter is using the coarse paper to smooth out the shelf he's making.

hints.author: firion1234
hints.mnemonic: "RICE is not nice," said the CAT IN THE HAT, "it is much to COARSE, like food for a horse.".

hints.author: felicitygreen
hints.mnemonic: The EU and US impose such high tariffs on food imports that third world wheat (the most basic of staples) never reaches first world supermarket shelves.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: According to Henshall, this kanji originally represented the harvested rice (the wheat primitive) that farmers paid as a tithe. Its meaning today would seem to be very similar. Imagine the farmer putting aside some of his harvested wheat on a shelf in order to pay the tariff to his lord.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: All the wheat imports sit on a shelf until the tariff is paid and it can be distributed.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Tax. (Heisig is trying to hard to come up with different words) The devil who has collected wheat taxes before, stores these taxes in shelves.

hints.author: firion1234
hints.mnemonic: "If WHEAT you'd like to eat," said the CAT IN THE HAT, "then you'll have to pay the sheriff a TARIFF.".

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: When her home was invaded by a pack of dogs, the little girl climbed on the shelf and aimed various items at the dogs below.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: I think the dogs purposely aim at your shelves to deal the most damage.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Like a pack of wild dogs, my children aim at the top of my bookshelf where I hide my porn.

hints.author: dancingblade
hints.mnemonic: There's this game at the carnival where you aim at prizes on a shelf. In this particular variant, you aim at pictures of wild dogs on a shelf. The more you knock down, the better the prize!

hints.author: kodorakun
hints.mnemonic: Out hunting with my wild dogs, i took aim at the beast and fired. now the beast sits on my shelf, taxidermed.
