hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: The urns of ancestors are kept on shelves next to the altar.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: At the partents of my wife's house (she is Japanese) they have a shelf with pictures of their ancestors. Its like a little shrine and they often pray to it.

hints.author: coverup
hints.mnemonic: An altar on the shelf to remember your ancestors.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Ancestors are revered in Japan. Some homes have large family altars ( 仏壇 (ぶつだん)) with several shelves to accommodate the name plaques (and these days photographs) of all the ancestors. 祖母 (そぼ)

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In a last ditch effort to thwart the invaders of The Pinnacle, they push glass shelves over the edge onto their heads below.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The shortness of the Japanese thwarts their attempts to reach the topmost (pinnacle) shelf without grabbing a chair.

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: The Pinnacle keeps its pantry shelves locked at nighttime, to thwart midnight snackers. No fatties allowed here!

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Keeping porn on the pinnacle of a bookshelf can thwart snooping kids (thanks bodhisamaya).

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: To thwart attacks on the Pinnacle, their shelves are always full of various magical weapons.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A whole team of cops is sent to investigate how a tree could grow on top of a shelf with no soil or water.

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: The result of the inverstigation of the missing Trees? Why, most of them had become shelfs!

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: Police suspected that some wooden shelves had come from illigaly lumbered timber in the Amazon. They launched an investigation in to the matter. "Trees are more important than shelves and therefore should be placed on top" A spokesman for the police said in an interview.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: Why the hell would a tree be growing on a shelf? Time to investigate. Also time to think up a story that makes more damn sense.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: I have a little potted tree sitting on my shelf, and I found a note in it that said "You will die in 3 days." So, naturally I try to figure out who put it there! Dave Chappelle did a comedy special way back (1997) where he does an impression of a white guy in a horror movie with just one line, 'I'd better investigate!' That would be me in this situation.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: HELP! Someone's pinned under this bookshelf and it's gonna take a lot of muscle to lift it off!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Can you help me move this shelf? I don't have the muscle to do it alone.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: To assemble an IKEA shelf, logic is sometimes not enough. You need help from someone with brute muscle strength!

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Anna doesn't have the power to reach the merchandise on the top shelf, so she asks a passerby - any old Jo (じょ) - to help her.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: While it's always the heroine that discovers the hidden passageway behind the shelves, they never have enough muscle power to open it on their own and they have to call for "Help!"...

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: It seems like every time my Japanese friends send me their best regards, they accompany them with a gift. Over time, I've gotten so many that I had to buy a second house which contains nothing but several fancy shelves. Each shelf is dedicated to a certain friend of mine and contains every last one of their presents.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Noone in japan will admit to this but every house has a secret "best regards shelf" hidden away somewhere. Its a shelf full of the tat they are constantly giving each other on return from holidays etc. Heres the house wife looking over her shoulder for the all clear to put another useless present on the best regards shelf. Happy Circumcision and best regards. Shelved.

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: The shelf your dad made for my house was fantastic. Give my best regards to him.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: When I brought my new IKEA shelf Billy into my house, the assembly instructions read

hints.author: Machine_Gun_Cat
hints.mnemonic: You are stepping over the threshold of you're new Japanese homestay house You're half way through delivering your best regards in REALLY crap Japanese " d d d どうぞう宜しく” When you accidentally knock over their shelf where they keep their valuable ornaments with a terrible CRASH, not the best first impression.

hints.author: DurablePants
hints.mnemonic: The king is peacefully sleeping on his new tatami mat when all of a sudden a shelf falls over and kills him. You can see his crown poking out and the brains splatter out the top of his head from all the pressure.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Making tatami mats from rice field waste was Japan's crowning achievement, but for some reason other countries just shelved the idea.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Rice Field + Crown + Shelf

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: To rest on the tatami mat, he puts his BRAIN and CROWN on the SHELF. Dont forget to put it on again, when you leave!

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: After a hard days work in the rice field, the humble king hung his crown upon his shelf, curled up on his tatami mat, and slept.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This is a simplification of 竝, a ideogram of two people standing in a row.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: bkvogel
hints.mnemonic: Roman numeral II with 2 rows of animal horns.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Full form

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of the standing row in a theatre. // Primitive

hints.author: Reikon
hints.mnemonic: People at Universal Studios wait in rows so long that the sun goes down.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: To me, row is way too close to file (#812 列), so I'm adopting Fab's meaning of rowboat from the previous frame. Universal Studios went through a number of logo animations before settling on the one they are most famous for

hints.author: redskatz
hints.mnemonic: It is a universal human desire to sit in rows to watch the sun go down.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: If every planet lined up in a row with the sun there would be a universal solar eclipse.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: A song universally known among the kinder, at least in the English-speaking world, is "Row, Row, Row Your Boat" - sung by a row of schoolchildren, tongues wagging in the mouth as in chant (#21 唱).

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Musical scores are in a universal language.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A musical score can be read, but not like ordinary words. Music is a universal language.

hints.author: bizarrojosh
hints.mnemonic: MUSICAL SCORES are not written in WORDS, but in a UNIVERSAL language called notes.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Small addition to Raichu's story

hints.author: happychair
hints.mnemonic: For a MUSICAL SCORE to be successful, the WORDS must have UNIVERSAL appeal.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: You first wash you clothes with water and wring them until they are just damp before hanging them in a row under the sun to dry. If you don't wring them damp first they will take days to dry!

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: When your things are damp, you line them up in a row under the sun.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: An image

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: I'll bet most of us have had this experience at a water park... You are gazing at the water hungrily while standing under the hot sun, waiting in a long row to get on the water slide. By the time it's your turn, you've been under the sun so long that you're not even all that wet anymore - just a little bit damp.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The row of penguins find themselves in the front row, right under the sun. It's very hot, so they spray themselves with cool water. This of course makes the entire theatre very damp!

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: One day a row of Suns appeared in the sky, turning everyone's heads upwards.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Clouds were covering the sky for months now. Rows upon rows of people spent whole days with their heads turned upwards, waiting for sun to appear.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: When the sun comes up, a row of severed heads appears on the castle wall. Think medieval times, they put the heads of dead enemies on show at each sunrise to intimidate.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: When a row of suns appears in your head, you are enlightened. (Note

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Get up early and watch the sun appear through a row of heads at Easter Island. (See photo at http

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has to stay slender, so during thanksgiving, he keeps away from the long row of food.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: At the time of Thanksgiving, there's a row of all sorts of food on the table, which you mustn't eat if you want to stay as slender as a thread.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is watching his weight and trying to become slender, so instead of eating a whole turkey for Thanksgiving, he decides to only eat a penguin.

hints.author: zodiac
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman has to stay slender, so during thanksgiving, he keeps away and rows a rowboat. (Zarxrax).

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: During Thanksgiving dinner, Spiderman is exercising on the rowing machine. He says he has to slender up so that he looks better in his Spidey-suit for Mary Jane.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: After raining for two days in a row, you plead with the SPIRITS for some relief. (Adapted from johnskb,21-5-2006).

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: When it rains, two worlds come together and spirits can be seen in the forest, dancing in a row.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: When it rains, the spirits have to cross between the two worlds in a rowboat.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Under a rainy sky Two rows of spirits wait one for heaven and one for hell.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: After praying to the spirits for two days in a row, it finally rained. See! The rain spirits really do exist!

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: A truly gruesome profession

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: My profession is taking unfinished rowboats and waterproofing them. Customers come in all the time asking if I've finished, and I point to their upside-down rowboat, still wet with sealant, and say, "not yet".

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: The oldest profession

hints.author: testoman
hints.mnemonic: My life is ruined. All my businesses went upside down in a row. I'm not yet ready to change professions though.

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: Taking this upside down in a row world and placing it upright is a profession that this world is not yet ready for.

hints.author: guidedog
hints.mnemonic: After a row husbands take their wives upsides down over the knee and slap them with their fingers on the bottom (if that doesn't get me banned…).

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Here we have badly behaving HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. Each wife approaches her HUSBAND, berates him, gives him a sharp SLAP in the face and, Three-Stooges style, pokes him in the eyes with her FINGERS.

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: A couple in a rowboat. The wife slaps the husband so hard with her fingers that the entire boat flips upside-down.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: I'm the husband. I told my wife to lay upside down so I could have an easier time fingering her. Needless to say, I got a slap in the face.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: The wife immediately regretted giving her Berserker husband the finger after he slapped her half way across the room. See row (#1785 並).

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Building on johnskb

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T also finds himself as one of the HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. But when his wife comes up to punish him, he pleads, “It’s ME, Baby. I wasn’t behaving badly like these other foo’s.”.

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: Me awaken to discover meself upside down over Mr. T's knee getting slapped. Does this make Mr. T me husband??

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Row of upside down husbands all begging Mr T to set them free..."ME! ME ME!".

hints.author: matticus
hints.mnemonic: Mr T. watches the rowboat-overturning slap (#1793 撲) from the shore and says, "I'm sure glad that ain't me".

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: The character for deluge (#1799 洪) gave me the idea to use together as a primitive for Noah's Ark. Noah kept plenty of salad on board to entice the animals with their animal legs to scurry on board together, two by two.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The conjoined twins, who are always together, have trouble eating together because one is a vegetarian, eating salad and the other is a avid meat eater, eating chicken legs.[Thanks fuaburisu!].

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Imagine yakitori with animal legs and salad skewered on together.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Salad and animal legs just go together. This primitive means chicken caesar salad. http

hints.author: kusterdu
hints.mnemonic: After I put animal legs in my vegetarian girlfriend's salad as a joke, she said, "We can't be together anymore.".

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: It took over 600 frames for Mr T to make (#1142 作), the Ark, but when he was finally done, he cast his saw aside and submitted the Ark to Noah for his approval. "I pity the foo who doesn't climb aboard this ark," said Noah to his friend.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T submits a resume together with his application. "I pity da foo don't got no resume!" he says.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: When people are together and form a group, they suddenly submit their personal responsibility to the mob mentality.

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T (person) submits to the police all strung together the criminals that he has captured.

hints.author: karmatheif
hints.mnemonic: Person + Together

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Noah's Ark is so uncommonly large, he can even fit a rice field on top to feed the animals.

hints.author: TalkTalk
hints.mnemonic: _potentially offensive (sorry)

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Brains together with beauty is an uncommon combination.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: It's uncommon to find a pair of together twins who are connected at the brain! When such a set does turn up, they are inevitably showcased on TV.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Finding brains in a chicken caesar salad is uncommon, unless you eat at McDonald's.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: The thing about feathers is that they usually cover the entire bird. A creature with feathers only on its wings would be very uncommon.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: WINGS without any FEATHERS would be an UNCOMMON site. Well, unless you like to eat chicken WINGS alot.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: This is つばさ. To make a distinct image you can think about aircraft wing for which this kanji is also used. Feathers would be extremely uncommon to use in design of an aircraft wings.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: When we talk about wings and feathers we usually talk about 羽 , but the more uncommon form is つばさ for larger wings- like angels - quite uncommon beings.

hints.author: rich_f
hints.mnemonic: Reki's wing feathers were an uncommon color among haibane--they were black instead of white.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: At Thanksgiving, it’s uncommon for people to accept humbly the food

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: You're invited to a Thanksgiving party in Japan! Awesome! You're so happy that your Japanese friends are trying to make you feel at home (you've been homesick recently). You sit down to the table, and they bring out some..uh...uncommon food. Really uncommon. Like just imagine the most uncommon Thanksgiving food ever, and that's what you're given (i don't know, a frisbee or something?). Of course, you have to be Japanese and accept humbly their food.

hints.author: Yozora
hints.mnemonic: As THANKSGIVING is an American holiday, it is UNCOMMON to say いただきます! before eating.

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: "ACCEPT HUMBLY" is a translation for 頂戴する (chōdai-suru), a Japanese expression of THANKS-GIVING that shows an UNCOMMON degree of respect and formality, and is reserved for the most UNCOMMONly solemn occasions. Ironically, 戴 also appears in 戴きます (いただきます), which is also a form of THANKS-GIVING, but is anything but UNCOMMON. In fact, it is so commonplace to that it borders on formulaic and meaningless. (NB

hints.author: Puchatek
hints.mnemonic: During Thanksgiving it is uncommon to see Americans accept humbly their meal. Usually they're more like "Turkeyyy!!! Give me my turkeeeey, bitch!".

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: Water plus Noah's Ark equals deluge.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Lots of water coming together is called a deluge.

hints.author: elmaestrokgb
hints.mnemonic: Even as the water was rising, somehow Noah got together all the right animals before the deluge began in earnest.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I downed my chicken caesar salad with a deluge of water, and it was delugious!

hints.author: jonusbalonus
hints.mnemonic: The deluge of water was expected, and all were safe together aboard Noah's Ark.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: During a deluge, all the poor snakes get washed into the harbour.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: All throughout the deluge Noah had been kicking himself for forgetting to bring any snakes onto the Ark. It wasn't until the deluge had finished, and Noah had brought the Ark safely back to the harbour that he realised that the snakes had been under the Ark all along.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: The Office of Film and Literature Classification advises that this story is rated M due to moderate horror violence, moderate coarse language, sex scene and incidental drug use. "Enough is enough! I have had it with these motherfucking snakes on this motherfucking Ark! Get it to the harbour now!" (thanks rgravina and uragi).

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: While edited for consistency and more family oriented viewing, the Office of Film and Literature Classification still advises that this story is rated M due to moderate horror violence, moderate coarse language, sex scene and incidental drug use. After weeks of water getting in and snakes sliding under his feet, Noah proclaimed "Enough is enough! I have had it with these motherf•••ing snakes on this motherf•••ing Ark! Get it to the harbour now!" (thanks cangy rgravina and uragi).

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When the cargo ship from Africa unloaded it's cargo onto the harbor, a deluge of snakes came pouring out of the cargo hold.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: Having spent all day stringing together grains of rice he suddenly had an outburst, "I can take it any longer!".

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: Noah was having an outburst after being at sea for 40 days and 40 nights and running out of rice grains to eat. Then the sun suddenly burst out in an outburst over the Ark and there was an outburst of cheering.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: Another freakin' day on this freakin' Ark, all there is to eat is freakin' rice! Aaaaaaaaaaarrrrrrrrrggh! ............His time on the Ark seemed to be getting to Noah (the hot sun overhead didn't help).

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: One day on Noah's Ark, Noah's eldest son throws down his chopsticks and has this outburst

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Actually means explosion, like an outburst of fire.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: Bombs make fiery outbursts. It's almost too logical, this one.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: An outburst of fire explodes outside Noah's Ark. "What happen!?", Noah shouted. "Somebody set up us the bomb!", came the Lord's reply.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: Bombs=a fire outburst.

hints.author: bihzad

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: If you wanna stay together you have to show your valentine respect.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: As I like Aretha Franklin's song "R-E-S-P-E-C-T", I cut out each of the letters from pieces of card, then string them all together and send it to her as a valentine.

hints.author: samuize
hints.mnemonic: If you respect your girlfriend you will definitely spend Valentine's day together.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: As a sign of respect for all those who did not make it onto the Ark, Noah hung valentines on the underside of the Ark.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: There were so many snakes on the road to Noah's ark so they had to elect which two would represent the snake species.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: You're driving on the road and you see two snakes together. You can't avoid both, so you have to elect which one gets run over.

hints.author: nakome
hints.mnemonic: Isn't this how the US presedential election works? You are given a choice between two snakes. Their politics are actually strung together but you get to feel as though you chose which one you want to lead you down the political road for the next four years. So which snake are you going to elect?

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: There isn't quite enough room on Noah's Ark for all the animals. So they decide to elect which two animals to kick out on to the road. Suprise, Suprise, they chose to get rid of the two snakes.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Who am I going to elect, both the candidates are two snakes who together both promise a road to better government, you know what I think I'll stay home on election day.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Mr. President! We all stand here together under a national flag. One thing is certain

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: (+synewave) Noah looks on in disbelief as Mr. and Mrs. Smith board the Ark, start waving their flag everywhere and blasting everything in sight with a missile launcher.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Mr. Bush is has sullied the reputation of the US flag, this tragedy together with the countless missiles that have killed innocent people have sent the worlds opinion of America the lowest it has ever been.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Only in Hollywood. The new NOAH's ARK movie had the FLAG raised over the ARK signifying it's about to leave. Crowds come to board but Noah aims MISSILES at them to hold them away. His catch phrase "They Call me MISTER Noah!!!" Well, better than Evan Almighty I guess.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: This is the Mr. (との) used when addressing someone at the start of a letter. How letters were delivered to the ark was intersting. Noah would wave a big flag and the post man would fire a flag-seeking missile full of letters for Mr Rhino and Mr Giraffe etc.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I nearly died by falling in a well. Actually, on two separate occasions. I'm glad to see they've added these fence posts. Now the well will be much safer.

hints.author: alantin
hints.mnemonic: Have you ever seen an old fashioned japanese well? == http

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: This is a picto of the grate over top of the well at 大阪城 , so no one falls in.

hints.author: Tornadic_Indignation
hints.mnemonic: Two people jammed in the well.

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: Tic Tac Toe is the only game I can play well.

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: A little one is eating a domburi while standing over, looking down into, a WELL. He drops it, and it falls down & down until it looks like nothing more than a DROP, landing at the bottom of the well!

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I drop a domburi down into the well for the goblin living there.

hints.author: enryu
hints.mnemonic: (thx mantixen) I DROP Domburi into the WELL to feed Sadako (Ring).

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: A donburi is rice bowl, with drops of food (other than rice) and garnish on top. The steep-sided shape of the typical donburi bowl is depicted in the kanji as a well, which is not a bad comparison. Picture

hints.author: CasualTatsumaki
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of a Yoshinoya beef bowl with a drop of raw egg in the center (thanks Chadoro_K).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The village surrounded the well with a wall so kids wouldn't fall in.

hints.author: nite_run
hints.mnemonic: You get good surround sound when your pent-up in well.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: Tweaking dingomick's story

hints.author: thairob
hints.mnemonic: The best SURROUND sound I ever heard was when I was PENT IN a WELL and they lowered a microphone and speaker so we could communicate. (thanks nite_run).

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Pent in by the enemy they were surrounded and then pushed down a well.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: If you just grow your christmas tree in a well, there will be no need to till the soil.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: A man was tilling a new plot to plant xmas trees but his tractor hit an old covered-up well and fell halfway in, he's asking for a new tractor for xmas..

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Plant a Christmas tree to mark the location of the well, so that those who are tilling the soil won't fall in.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: I kept drawing a complete blank every time this Kanji would come up, so I started thinking of the phrase "don't open till Xmas" that you often see on Christmas presents in cartoons and things. This brought the image of the Christmas tree to my mind, and from there I could use one of the other stories.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In Asian countries, people use II chopsticks to get things into their mouths. Just imagine someone shoving a piece of sushi into their mouths with chopsticks.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: A mouth barred up and not aloud to speak freely is the sign of asia (korea, China, pakistan etc).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: In the Roman Empire there were signs marking where you were about to enter Asia. This was a dangerous place for Romans, so the sign consisted of a picture of two Romans (= Roman two) being eaten by a mouth.

hints.author: sabretou
hints.mnemonic: China ( 中 ) taken two times should be about the total landmass of Asia.

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: There are 'II' things I love about ASIA

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Because Asian people started to eat Western food, their hearts became bad and they started having heart attacks.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Asian hearts are bad and evil. They invented so much martial arts

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In the chinese version of the music video for Michael Jackson's "BAD", the performers are dancing in sync in eighties music video fashion, wearing leather jackets, chains, bad jeans, dark glasses etc. Each time Michael Jackson sings "I'm bad, I'm bad ... you know it!" they open their jackets and on their bare chests you can see a black tattoo of a heart. Which brings us to the mnemonic... asian hearts are BAD ! You know it !

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: Sanosuke sagara ( るろうに剣心 ) is not evil, he is just a BADass. http

hints.author: enryu
hints.mnemonic: (Counter Filips Argument) All human beings (Asians, Whites etc) are capable of doing bad or good its in the heart of human nature, whites are hated for invading peoples counties and stealing their lands, spreading their diseases, massacring their people almost to the point of genocide stealing the land for themselves on Australia, America, Pacific Islands, India, China etc. The crime against humanity for dropping a nuclear bomb.. unforgivable. (did i shatter some people's ideas on Whites? my bad).

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The shape of a Yen coin.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A poor old man is almost killing himself trying to lift a huge glass hood with his cane (using it as a lever), to get to just one yen coin. Note

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A pictograph of a bank teller's window. The circles are the coins which are passed back and forth for deposits and withdrawls.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Sometimes I wear my top hat under my hood and it makes my head look like a circle.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: You may wonder why this character is pronounced 'en' yet is said 'yen' in the west, well this is because when it was first romanized the obsolete ゑ character was used and as such became yen in the west.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: A museum display of two walking sticks bound together under a glass canopy, showing the first device used to measure an angle.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: [+nuke] As a primitive, a boomerang. This boomerang is used to grab a bunch of meat, or flesh, lying around on the ground at a farm. First, you throw it straight at a walking stick, then it makes a right angle and goes to walking stick number two, and wraps around that. A quick tug, and you've got all the flesh flying toward you contained in that triangle. Hooray for free (stolen) food!

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [angle; corner; square; horn; antlers] I needed to measure an angle, so I improvised a rudimentary protractor by bounding up a walking stick to some body part of mine.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: The ANGLE of a Boomerang? BOUND UP, thrown by the BODY, but is not a WALKING STICK thanks to that 90 degree ANGLE in each one. So as a primitive, use Boomerang.

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: If you bind up a circle with a rope, tied tightly it will have angles.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: For insects to get in contact with each other, they need to place their antennae at just the right angle.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Wow, he threw that BOOMERANG with such skill, it made CONTACT with that INSECT in mid flight.

hints.author: wrightak
hints.mnemonic: This is commonly read as 触る （さわる）, meaning to touch or feel something. An insect's version of horns are its antennae (see contact (#1813 触)). They are it's prime source of contact with the world and it uses them to touch and feel its way around.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Th e physics professor explains that, depending on the contact angle, the bugs hitting your windshield may splatter really good!

hints.author: thairob
hints.mnemonic: In the movie CONTACT, Jodie Foster has to turn the radio telescope at just the right ANGLE in order to pick up the alien signal. Unfortunately, just as she's found the perfect ANGLE, a huge INSECT lands on the receiver and scrambles the signal. Jodie has to bust ass and call her friend in Australia to pick up the signal.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: Did you know that you can unravel a cow? If you stick the dagger in at exactly the correct angle, the whole cow will just unravel.

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: Unravel the mystery by determining at what ANGLE the SWORD went into the COW.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: I tossed the BOOMERANG, which stuck like a DAGGER into a COW that I targeted. Now I watched the COW's insides begin to UNRAVEL from the cut.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: To unravel this mystery, you have to consider it from the right angle. Remember the most important clue

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Think

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The king has eaten too much and has to get a new belt again. See his fat rolls hanging over?

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This is a belt with a non-adjustable jeweled buckle. Everytime you go back to the leathersmith telling him to move the buckle because you've packed on a few pounds (but that this is the last time!), he says "Again?!? Weren't you just here last month?".

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: (I thought this was easier to remember as king with a belt) As the king gets fatter, his belt needs to be adjusted again and again.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I craft yen to buy things again and again.

hints.author: fiminor
hints.mnemonic: Have jewelled belts come back into fashion again? I just can't keep up with the times!

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I have a funnel attached to my laptop that takes my prof's lecture and puts the words into a text file. The bigger the funnel, the more accurate the conversion, so picture a bunch of laptops with large, unwieldy funnels attached to the USB port.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Image

hints.author: tenricefieldsglue
hints.mnemonic: FUNNEL primitive

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: At a lecture words are funneled into students.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Socrates is giving a lecture. He's using a funnel as a megaphone but also pours some celery in there between words. // Primitive

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Subscription is like a money funnel, because the receiving end is small (just one company) and the other end is wide (the whole country).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: My subscription to Money magazine came with a free coin funnel.

hints.author: SKlepJr
hints.mnemonic: My subscription to Money magazine came with a free funnel.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: You put your shells into a funnel at the newsagent to buy your subscription to Better Kanji Writing magazine. It spins around the funnel many times before finally falling down the hole.

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: I had to cancel my subscription to that "special" magazine when my wife found out where i was funneling all our money.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Trees with good posture look like funnels. For example, http

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: A farm girl uses a wooden funnel as a corset to improve her posture.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The old maple syrup farmer developed horrible posture because she had been bending over for years to tap the maple trees and funnel out the maple syrup and carrying the syrup back to the shed .

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: I fell out of a tree and broke my neck. So they put one of those white funnels around my neck to correct my posture.

hints.author: Schwingy
hints.mnemonic: In Aikido, you must have good posture (or 構え ）. Be as a strong as a tree and funnel that energy into controlling your opponent's attacks.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: A gutter funnels water.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: A gutter takes the water that falls as rain and funnels it off to where it can be dealt with appropriately.

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Water + funnel == gutter. But really, if you need help with this one, how did you make it this far?

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Instead of a normal gutter, the city is cutting costs by just putting a huge celery funnel on the side of the road every few hundred yards. While this is actually a bit more efficient than standard gutters and quite cheap, it'sa bit dangerous (as there's a rather nasty juicing mechanism attached to the bottom of each one). Imagine telling some kids to stay out of the gutter on a rainy day, and one of them not heeding you (kids love splashing in them!) and falling to her doom.

hints.author: jeebus101
hints.mnemonic: [using 'diet' as right hand primitive] Alcoholics will land in the gutter if they keep up their liquid diet consisting of only alcohol.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Right part

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: It's very difficult to present a good argument if you don't bring along a scrapbook with some key words jotted down to the meeting.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: Words must he chosen methodically to make a good argument. Note

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: For scrapbook I used the image of a Panini sticker album, and thus the meeting of scrapbooks becomes a "Panini sticker album convention" (like a comics-con, only with collectors of Panini sticker albums). Pretty much all the words you can hear at the scrapbook meeting are arguments between geeks about which album is better.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: Picture a bunch of ladies at a scrapbook convention engaging in a heated debate/argument with their words. "You call that a scrapbook!" "Psh! Puh-lease! You ain't got the first thing about a scrapbook!" "That ain't no scrapbook! That's a crapbook!".

hints.author: scout
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T talks about ethics at the academic conference. "I pity the fool who gets caught plagarizing someone else's stuff!".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T has no ethics at the scrapbooking convention. He'll do whatever it takes to beat all those ladies.

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: One small change from dingomick to make it memorable to me

hints.author: taikura
hints.mnemonic: 侖 = think or be methodical. A person who thinks or acts methodically has ethics. 五倫 【ごりん】 (n) the 5 Confucian filial-piety relationships; 社内不倫 【しゃないふりん】 (n) adulterous affair with someone at work; 人倫 【じんりん】 (n) human relations; humanity; 精力絶倫 【せいりょくぜつりん】being of unbounded energy or sexual stamina; 沈倫 【ちんりん】sinking into obscurity; 破倫 【はりん】 (n) immorality; incest; 比倫 【ひりん】.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here Mister T discusses ethics at a Panini sticker album convention (see previous frame). See, according to Mister T, there is so much "double" stickers when you buy the pack of stickers, that it creates a lot of waster paper and such, and it contributes to pollution, and a waste of resources. Now most people nowadays would think of embryos and stem cell research when thinking about ethics, but hey, this is Mister T.

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: Someone stole all the wheels off the ladies' cars at the scrapbook convention.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: During a talk at the academic conference, speaker shows an introductory slide depicting the structure of car, and then moves on to the more narrow topic of wheels.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: At an academic conference many thousands of years ago, the uses of the wheel were discussed--eventually leading to the invention of the car. I sort of imagine a TED conference with cavemen discussing the wheel with a 2001 Space Oddesy-esc transition to Henry Ford also at a TED conference. (www.ted.com A seriously good website).

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: You have to be methodical. Before you invent the car, you'll need to invent the wheel.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: It's a strange scrapbook meeting with albums full of cars and wheels.

hints.author: ikmys

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is partial to konbini hentai. He reads them for hours every day after work at his local konbini. (Primitive

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Comic book is a nice idea. It's a sort of scrapbook that is like a door to a different kind of reality. Person is always partial (unfair) on the subject of comic books, because (s)he doesn't like them.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Right side

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This reminds me of those PARTIAL/BIASED religious PEOPLE who come to your DOOR trying to shove the biblical SCRAPBOOK down your throat.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Go down the road in Japan and you will find comics EVERYWHERE, newpaper stands, 7-11, Tsutaya, even the supermarket. Comics are everywhere here along the road.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Go down any road in Japan and you'll find konbini hentai everywhere.

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: A scrapbook is a door that takes you down the road to everywhere you've ever been.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: You take the kanji poster on the road! Damn, you take it everywhere!(See partial (#1823 偏) for kanji poster).

hints.mnemonic: 遍 【へん】 (ctr) (See 一遍 , 回 ) number of times. 何遍 【なんべん】 (n) how many times; how often; (P) (see my story for 1824) STORY

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: I took the compilation of covers of all my Spider-Man comics that I had saved in a scrapbook and glued them on my door.

hints.author: DeKleft
hints.mnemonic: My Spiderman comic book compilation is almost complete...only one left, and I may have to kill for it...

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: Whereas Mr.T was partial to KONBINI HENTAI, SPIDERMAN likes to wait for the COMPILATION. He finds it more convenient to have his hentai compiled in one volume to read on the loo.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: Spidey has the kanji poster. A compilation of all RTK 1 kanji(See partial (#1823 偏) for kanji poster).

hints.mnemonic: Did you hear about the new Black Widow konibini hentai compilation?! I'm going to 7-11 right now to buy it. She's so hot!

hints.mnemonic: A pallisade is made of wooden tree-trunks laid side by side like the pages of an ancient tome.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Wooden tomes form palisades at the library.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Coding is a tool which you can use to bend the computer to your will.

hints.author: vileru
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means a code of law, not a secret language or symbolic language (such as programming code) ... Story

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Think "codex" (mnemonic help) or "code of laws", or even Leonardo Da Vinci's code. Here I see a codex as a tool used to bend the masses into submission. Picture a huge codex book lifted down on crowds to bend them down in submission. Another

hints.author: jotun
hints.mnemonic: Bender can be used as a tool for bending. But only if you know the right code (He never does want you want to).

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Code/rules can be bent with the correct tool... (usually money).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Looks a bit like Ft => Family title => Family name.

hints.mnemonic: This box is full of arrows. Arrows are special

hints.mnemonic: Hook, is both Hook's (from Peter Pan) first name and family name. So he's called Hook Hook. But he thought that was a bit silly so he droped the second hook and only uses one.

hints.author: Jasta
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman doesn't have a single paper with his family name on it (because he doesn't want to reveal his identity).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: I imagine a ridiculously expensive, and rather pointless, Japanese type of paper for writing letters, with one's family name woven in fine thread somewhere in a corner.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman regrets getting drunk last night. Peter Parker hands in his paper with the name Peter Spiderman--wrong family name. Oops!

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman is very careful not to leave any piece of paper lying around with his family name on it (because he doesn't want to reveal his identity) .......[thanks Jasta].

hints.author: randomkrazy
hints.mnemonic: Peter Parker's original name was Peter Paper, but they decided to change it before the comic was released.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Marriage is the day in this woman's life where she gets a new family name.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.mnemonic: My goodness, between this story and surname and matrimony.. Ouch. I apologize in advance for this one, ladies, but if I don't make this story memorable this kanji will haunt me forever. Ok, here goes

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Most japanese find it impossible to resist pushy businessmen in Japan when they push their damned business cards into your fingers.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: Japan business etiquette tip

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: You have to resist using your fingers to present your business card the correct etiquette is to present it with both hands.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: How do resist someone giving your their business card? Give them the finger.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Fingers, the thief, wouldn't have been caught. But he was unable to resist leaving his business card. Now his only choice is whether to resist arrest.

hints.author: uberstuber
hints.mnemonic: I put all those useless business cards at the bottom of a cave.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: At the bottom of the cave you find a meishi

hints.author: joxn_costello
