hints.author: Weber
hints.mnemonic: Its unlikely for you to have a card if you're low in society. People living in caves must be at the bottom of society, so they sure as hell don't have one.

hints.author: faded
hints.mnemonic: You know you've hit rock bottom when you have to operate your business out of a cave. All you have left are a few business cards, and you're desperately hoping someone calls and offers you business.

hints.author: burento5
hints.mnemonic: How many of you know what "vox populi" means?

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: All the people of the world with all their family names shouting with their big mouths.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Once they'd learned to properly utilize their mouths to form a language, the people of the world all adopted family names, regardless of their race, culture etc..

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [people; nation; subjects] Somehow I remember this kanji as the People's Republic of One family name. It resembles an R with one striking it through.

hints.author: narazumono
hints.mnemonic: In a government of the people, by the people, and for the people one's mouth is more important than your family name. 民主主義 - (みんしゅしゅぎ Democracy).

hints.author: PepeSeco
hints.mnemonic: In an Orwellian sense, the eye watching the people never sleeps.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: People need to close their eyes and sleep.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The little boy from The Sixth Sense couldn't sleep because before his very eyes he saw a dead crowd of people everywhere.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I sleep with one eye open, because the people are dangerous and may revolt at any time, you can't trust the unwashed masses.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: (inspired by PepeSeco's) The Orwellian-style government has a mysterious floating eye that floats silently through the night, looking in windows, watching the people while they sleep.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: I was retreating from the battlefield. In the chaos, my friend threw his dogtags at me to give to his family. I managed to catch them with my fingers as the chopper was lifting off.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Dog tag

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: "Dog tag" appears later as a kanji on its own

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: In some countries when they catch a thief, they cut his fingers and put a sturdy RFID dog tag on him. (I made this all up of course).

hints.author: Joyo1945
hints.mnemonic: Its easy to catch a dog if it has dog tags because you can just use your fingers to take it by the collar.

hints.author: gfb345
hints.mnemonic: The extremely efficient (military veteran) wet-nurse keeps track of which infant has been SUCKLEd already by marking each MOUTH with a DOG-TAG. (Cf. suck (#689 吸)).

hints.author: Henkka
hints.mnemonic: This mom of a dozen babies put dog tags on the ones whose mouthes she had already allowed to suckle her.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: The mouth of an offspring suckles. 哺乳・ほにゅう lactation, suckling.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 哺乳類 , 哺乳動物 , 哺乳 =ほ乳, 哺育 =保育 suckle (#3027 哺), ホ( 甫 ) ... Parts

hints.author: to_nihon
hints.mnemonic: The scaredy-cat soldier puts his dog tags in his mouth and suckles them nervously. It sounds like he's a suckling infant.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The water of the bay washes all the dog tags up after the battle.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: Imagine the opening scenes of baywatch....beautiful water and the dog tags of the cast jumping up and down as they run along the beach.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Otis Redding is sitting on the dock of the bay, looking over the water while clutching the dog tags of his fallen friend from Vietnam.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Unwanted offspring are often dumped in the waters of a bay.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: My aibo dog [catch (#1836 捕)] fell in the water and stopped working, so I sold it on eBay.

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: Bulrush was the flower that you could see near almost all bays in japan before the japanese started putting concrete everywhere. Just check how many percent of Japan's coastline that is concretised... you'll be surprised.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The bulrush is a flower that grows around bays. http

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: I sell bulrush flowers on e-bay.

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Pharoah's daughter is walking along the bay picking flowers among the bulrushes. To her surprise, she sees a baby floating in the water on a primitive little boat made of bulrushes. After her servants swim out and retrieve the boat, they learn the baby's name by looking at his wrist bracelet dog tag. "Moses," huh. Sounds Hebrew. We'll just call him Bulrush Kid for now.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Weeds that grow in a bay.

hints.author: AryllWind
hints.mnemonic: A shop in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Normal cottages ( 舎 actually means a building) don't have tags advertising their names, but shops do.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Soldiers used to go the "lady-shop" at the edge of town. It was a little cottage stocked with women. All you had to do was show your dogtags to be admitted.

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: In Vietnam there is a little cottage industry of shops producing and selling fake US dog tags. These shops are starting to appear in Iraq and Afghanastan too.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: This cottage is a shop that sells Aibo dog tags.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: I usually hear supplement in "dietry supplement". So you're given a cloak for extra fibre and dogtags for extra iron. Keeps you regular and stops you feeling tired and run-down.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: The name and number printed on a soldier's cloak is a supplement to his main I.D. tag; his dog-tag, in helping identify the soldier.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Ah yes, this dog tag perfectly supplements my cloak!

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Cloak + Dog Tag

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: These days, many have to supplement their income to cloak their offspring.

hints.author: QuackingShoe
hints.mnemonic: So fed up am I, I've finally built city walls around my residence to keep these Japanese from soliciting me with their business cards.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: The business card says his residence is just to the left of the city walls. Can you find it? Yep, got it.

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: Suggestion- since we have the pinnacle on the left(which had a great potential for imaginative stories as we explored the ultimate society), the right side will be the pinnacle's opposite - the slum. It's so dangerous that a steep menacing city wall has been erected to keep its denizens in(and protect those outside). story

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: There are so many places of residence inside the city walls, I put a calling card outside mine so I can find my way home.

hints.author: Odieone
hints.mnemonic: My business card shows that my residence is within the city walls.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The city finally received the enclosure that it desperately needed, city walls to protect it against attacks from the tall kids.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Even the tall kids can't get out of the enclosure that is the city walls.

hints.author: zwarte_kat
hints.mnemonic: As you can see, the tall kid peaks over the enclosure of the city walls to see the red light district (one of the meanings of the kanji).

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: (primitive city walls - slum. See residence 1841) in the slums, the city walls enlose everyone within. Some of the tall kids reckon they can clamber over the enlosing city walls, but even they fail.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: This Kanji also has the meaning of red-light district (probably an abbreviation from licensed quarters (#2235 廓)). Only tall kids are allowed to go there and leave the enclosure through the city wall to receive what they need so desperately.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: County cricket. "I say old boy, you've hit that ball clear over the city walls. That's six and out!".

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: You can take the good old boy out of county (and into the city walls), but you can't take the county out of the good old boy. Is that how the saying goes?

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A ぐん is smaller than a prefecture so you can see the city walls. It sounds like 君 (くん).

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: The old boys don't venture out into the county. They stay cooped up within the safety of the city walls.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: The old boy had never been outside of his own county because he couldn't get over the city walls.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: The country folk and and the city folk mingle at the outskirts of town, just past the city walls.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: The city walls mark the outskirts of the inner city, where it begins to mingle with the suburbs.

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: The city folks don't like to mingle with people from the outskirts. That's why they built such big city walls.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: Many of the girls from the slums come to mingle near the outskirts of the slums--in the hopes that they can find a more wealthy guy to get them out of the hell hole.

hints.author: violetize
hints.mnemonic: (primitive city walls - slum. See residence 1841 - scotty28) On the outskirts of the community is the slum, where you dare not mingle with the slum dwellers - it's too dangerous.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: Within the city walls, this section of town was so noisy that we had to muzzle them up.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: "Section 8 housing" is a way to muzzle the impoverished people who are unable to pay rent but want to live inside the city walls.

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: (primitive city walls - slum. See residence 1841) A riot happens in one section of the slum. Rioting about the poor living conditions and treatment by the authorities. That section of the slum have muzzels fixed on them. Such demeaning treatment is typical in the slum.

hints.author: liosama
hints.mnemonic: The illegal israeli settlement has already muzzled the fuck out of all the land, so in order to further claim their (unwanted) presence. They muzzle the land (200m on both sides) of the Apartheid wall to section and part the land.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Sectioning is a term used in the UK that refers to putting a muzzle on someone and taking them inside the city walls to a mental hospital.

hints.author: Howdoken
hints.mnemonic: A vision of a futuristic METROPOLIS

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: In a huge metropolis, it's hard not to feel like just someone within the city walls.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In the movie Metropolis by Fritz Lang, a robot puppet is used by the evil mayor to manipulate the poor part of the city. Picture the puppet robot on the city walls, giving a speech.

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: [my primitive for someone is ninja]A ninja must be able to scale the city walls of the Metropolis without being seen.

hints.author: scotty28
hints.mnemonic: (primitive city walls - slum. See residence 1841) A futuristic metropolis, and within it's city walls it still has the problems of slums and new problems of citizens whose only human connection is to AI love dolls.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The drooping citywalls was generating a lot of angry mail for the city officials.

hints.author: tomusan
hints.mnemonic: The city walls droop down in one spot so that the mailman can throw the mail over.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Droopy Dog delivers the mail by walking along the city walls and throwing it to the people below.

hints.author: coverup
hints.mnemonic: The drooping citywalls was generating a lot of angry mail for the city officials. Hint

hints.author: swiftman
hints.mnemonic: Mail never gets delivered correctly in the slum ... the mailman is too busy drooping down so he doesn't get shot.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: He reminisced about his home country

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: In -my- home country, we'd like to put up walls to keep Bush -OUT-, thank you very much.

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: It's easier if you think of the USA as the HOME COUNTRY. To the northern border you have it protected by BUSHES, while to south you have it protected by CITY WALLS (or a 800 mile long fence).

hints.author: QuackingShoe
hints.mnemonic: In my home country, all we had for city walls was bushes!.

hints.author: violetize
hints.mnemonic: (primitive

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: If you arrive with two swords at the city walls, expect some interrogatives before they'll let you in.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: Interrogation at the city walls

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Phonetic ナ. If a trespasser attempts to cross the city walls, the guards will likely employ the interrogative approach of pointing a double-edged sword at them. Sort of shorthand for "Who goes there?". Note

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Mix of Katsuo and Gavmck

hints.author: mirnkaya
hints.mnemonic: (thanks Katsuo) If you arrive with two swords at the city walls, expect some interrogatives before they'll let you in, unless your the master of the armory that is... (this character is used chiefly now for its sound ナ. only common word using this kanji 旦那 (だんな) -- master/patron).

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Your hometown is where you broke out of your cocoon (born), and where you left when your hair was silver (died), your whole life was spent inside the city walls.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: Your home town is where you earned enough silver to enable you to break out of your giant cocoon (leave home) and explore outside the city walls.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: He never left his hometown, from the day he crept out of the family cocoon till the day his hair turned silver-gray, he never once crossed the city walls.

hints.author: itsumo45
hints.mnemonic: It's about time I leave my HOME TOWN...break out the cocoon, grab all my silver, and say goodbye to these city walls.

hints.author: QuackingShoe
hints.mnemonic: This always makes me think of Haibane Renmei, and the Home. They come in a cocoon, and can't pass the huge silver city walls.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: People's voices are like echoes of sounds from their hometowns....you can always tell where they're from by how they talk.

hints.author: Balaam
hints.mnemonic: My hometown is a ghost town, any sounds echoes and echoes.

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: Whenever I call long-distance back to my hometown, the sound on the line has a terrible echo!

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: The sound of your hometown always echoes in your ear when you travel abroad.

hints.author: nac_est
hints.mnemonic: You go back to your hometown after a long time, and you find out that's been destroyed! The only sound you can hear as you walk among the ruins is the echo of your footsteps...

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The daughter is a good girl that grows up to be a woman. The son is a good boy that grows up to defend the city walls.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Just like a daughter ( 娘 ) is good woman, son is good too, and stays safely inside city walls so as not to give his parents reason to worry.

hints.author: nath04
hints.mnemonic: Twin sons that were switched at birth.. the bad son lived in The Pinnacle, while the good son lived in the slums.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Jesus, God's son, comes down to the Wailing Wall wearing a halo to preach to the hassids, but the they're too busy praying to notice anything out of the ordinary.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: In the story of the Prodigal Son, the good son stays within the city walls.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Your son plays in the corridor pretending he's exploring a cave.

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: A corridor is a bastard son of a cave. Corridors dream too, hoping one day they'll be as great as their father, the cave.

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (ロウ) I think of the corridor found in the cave that Yoda made Luke Skywalker walk through as part of his Jedi training in Empire Strikes Back. It was in this corridor that Luke met Darth Vadar, cut off his head and found himself behind Darth Vadar's mask. An early little hint that Luke was Darth Vadar's son.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: When I hear corridor, I think of a long, lonely hospital corridor. Imagine a war scene. Bombs are dropping from overhead. The good sons, who defended the city walls, are dropping like flies. The wounded sons are taken to the underground bomb shelter and hospital, in a cave. There are too many wounded sons for the hospital, so the wounded lie sprawled in the corridor, as the cave is still rocked by overhead bombs.

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: It would sure piss off superman if he found his son playing in the corridor pretending he's batman.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This is a magic shield with ten eyes which have the power to drag the victim towards it.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: You paint 10 huge eyes on your shield to scare the enemy, but consequently your shield is so big and heavy that you have to drag it.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: From Wikipedia

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: TEN EYES = BEHOLDER. You use your SHIELD to block the BEHOLDERS rays and bounce them back on him. You DRAG his head home victorious.　.

hints.author: Renaissance
hints.mnemonic: Girls are being taught that if someone tries to drag them away, they should poke the harasser's eyes out with a needle. This type of precaution is well known, so harassers nowadays prepare themselves by carrying eyeshields, in order to deflect the needles.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is mostly used in the word 循環 , "circulation" (of buses through their routes, of blood, etc). So I think of a column of little Roman soldiers with their shields marching sequentially through the veins of a person, as an anthropomorphization of the immune system.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: A column of shielded soldiers advancing sequentially to avoid revealing the size of their army (Think "Sandpeople always ride single file to hide their numbers" from Star Wars).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Flash can defeat the protection of the shield. The ten eyes open momentarily, but one after the other. He can blind them in a sequential fashion, and then attack an effectively blind opponent who cannot then drag the shield to meet the attack.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: An army's column of marching sheilds, are lined up in sequential order.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: The adventurers go in sequential order, with the shield bearing warrior in front to shield the other party members.

hints.author: revenantkioku
hints.mnemonic: Drag + rag gave me trouble until I came up with zombie for it. The zombie population became more diverse, separating into different factions. One of them being the water Zombies.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The radical faction is almost eliminated, sir. They're living in the sewers dressed in rags and dragging their supplies.

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: The right hand side means tributary, and the rag part of it doesn't have the usual overlap with the first stroke. Factions split off from the main group like tributaries do from the main water course. Veins are the tributaries of your body.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: WAter drag rag. The red faction must live underground in the watery sewers to avoid persecuption. They drag their supplies with them through the tunnels, each and every one clad in dirty rags.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: DRAG + RAG = ZOMBIE (walking around slowly, dragging feet, tattered rages...) In "Left 4 Dead" there are "normal" zombies and also some FACTIONS of specialized zombies

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: The vein is the part of the body most lusted after by the flesh hungry zombies (drag & rag - see revenantkioku frame 1855).

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: To get blood drawn from a vein you present the part of the body to the nurse, and they drag an alcohol swab (rag) across the vein.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: The part of the body zombies hunger for is the brainzzz, not the veinzzz!

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: Japanese zombies have trouble pronouncing v/b and r's, so they sound like they're saying "Veeeeiiinns..... Veeeeiinnns...." instead of a completely different part of the body.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: To poke a vein, the nurse asks you to expose some flesh. It's the way she asked that aggravated---"drag that rag up a bit!" she said.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Masses of zombies, splattered with blood. (any zombie movie).

hints.author: volfy
hints.mnemonic: The stroke order is tricky. Draw the first two strokes of rag and then draw drag and then the last two strokes of rag, or at least so says WWWJDIC.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: When the masses are hurt, say in a natural disaster like an earthquake, they can be seen everywhere dragging their bloody rags.

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: There was a lot of blood over the masses of squashed zombies I use 'squashed zombies' for the form of rag/drag with the two lines at the left.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The masses are a lynching mob. They're dragging a bloody victim in rags behind them.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: (I prefer 2 towels over cornstalk and belt) - Have you ever wondered why your parcels always end up in such bad condition when you get them? Or why you never get them at all? That's because you've never looked at how they're actually delivered - each postman is given a load of parcel post and 2 towels to drag them down the road on.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: In the ancient parcel post, they just would drag the packages behind them tied to cornstalks woven into a long belt down the road. It was a wonder than anything arrived intact.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: People complained about the delivery methods of UPS after finding out that they loaded parcel post onto a towel and dragged it down the road. As a result, UPS have completely revamped their delivery system. Now they use two towels. (thanks Virtua Leaf).

hints.author: bexinkyushu
hints.mnemonic: According to Jim Breen (whom I'm always inclined to trust more than Heisig) the keyword for this kanji should be relay (as in to send something). Story

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: In the days before UPS and suchlike the parcel post had to walk on the long country roads from town to town. This one is dragging behind him a sled full of packages and for himself he has a cornstalk hanging from his belt, as supplies.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: This is a military-grade staple gun! It can be loaded with real missiles.

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: In order to get your 1st grade, or first-dan (だん) black belt, you have to learn hand to hand combat with new weapons - first the grapple involving the staple gun, and then the missile deployment technique.

hints.author: Nuriko
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a really mean teacher who grades papers with a staple-gun that shoots out staples (in a missile-like fashion) onto the paper to form the letter "F". She even uses such an opportunity as target practice. She gets way over to the other end of the class and shoots the little "staple missiles" onto the paper, cackling all the while.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: When you are first dan, your punches hurt like a staple gun. When you are 10th dan, like a missile. So 1st grade is staple gun, 10th grade is missile. OR The first dan fellas are training with staplers. The 10th dan are whirling around rocket launchers (trick is not to set it off when you are doing all kind of fancy tricks. That is why there are so few 10 dans).

hints.author: Jasta
hints.mnemonic: First graders in the army can use staple guns. Only when you are of high rank can you fire a missile.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: As a discriminating metalsmith, I use the highest grade metals when forging such precision devices as staple guns and missiles.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Metal has to be forged many times over in order to reach a high grade.

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: Metal is graded depending on how it was forged.

hints.author: LordGolem
hints.mnemonic: Gassan Sadatoshi uses only high grade metal to forge his swords. http

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: You must use only the highest grade metals when you forge missile-loaded stapleguns.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The empress is cruel. Normally she'll violently pull her servants by the ear when they've failed to follow orders. But one time she dragged this one guy around the palace by the mouth. She must have been really angry—ever since that moment, he's never been seen again.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The F word often comes out of the mouth of the empress.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: This is ax with the last stroke replaced by a mouth, thus forming a pictograph of someone about to have his mouth chopped off for spreading rumors about the empress. "Off with his mouth!" [Thanks raulir!].

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: The empress can have you dragged out of the room with just one word from her mouth.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: We know the empress is really a drag queen because she only has one mouth Think about it….

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: After the play, The Phantasm of the Opera hangs up his cape on a clothes hanger and returns to his cocoon to sleep.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: You open your closet and find strange, glowing cocoons sitting on your clothes hangers... definitely a phantasm!

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: The mother who has undergone a back-street abortion using a clothes hanger is having phantasms (hallucinatory visions) of her dead baby hatching from a cocoon. The cocoon looks like the facehugger eggs from the original Alien movie poster.　まぼろし; hallucination/vision/mirage.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: After the opera, The Phantasm hangs up his tuxedo on a clothes hanger and returns to his sleeping bag (cocoon) to sleep. (Didn't want to start sticking cloak in there by mistake). 幻 まぼろし phantom, vision, illusion, dream; 幻影 げんえい phantom, vision, illusion; 幻怪な げんかいな strange or mysterious and troubling.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: The cocooned phetuses from back-alley clothes-hanger abortions turn into phantasms.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The porn director has one big mouth. "Don't bother putting your clothes on a hanger, just get started.".

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The director sticks a clothes hanger in each actor's mouth and hangs them from the ceiling until he needs them.

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: I think of this one as a pictograph of a guy talking on one of those headsets with a microphone attached - he's directing a movie, so he has to be constantly in touch with everyone!

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: Every director is the same( 同じ ). But this director, this one, he's different.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This director is filming an ad for some washing powder. A bunch of kids are hanging from a clothes line, on clothes hangers. They aren't quiet and are making a lot of noise. Only one of them, at the center, is facing the camera and needs to deliver a line. The director becomes hysterical and using his megaphone yells at them "SHUT UP! I WANT TO SEE ONLY ONE OPEN MOUTH !".

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is the director. You better pay respects to him!

hints.author: paramausi
hints.mnemonic: If Mr. T gets a role in a film, he doesnt pay respects to the director, the director pays respects to Mr. T.

hints.author: saizen
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T pays repsects to the porn director for casting him in his first movie role in 15 years.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Mr T always wanted to be in an Alfred Hitchcock film, but by the time the old bean passed on in 1980, Mr T wasn't a big enough star to warrant working on a film with. Here, we see Mr T paying respects to an effigy of Alfred Hitchcock.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: He may have turned out to be a lousy director, but you have to pay respects to George Lucas for having come up with the idea of Jedi in the first place. 伺う (うかがう)

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The big mouthed diretor is even picky about the parts of speech you use, shouting, "More verbs! Less adjectives!" and such all the time.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: A Grammar is basically a word director that tells us what part of speech each word is.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is the ending of lots of parts of speech like noun, verb, adverb

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: This director speaks very fast. So fast that you can understand only parts of his speech (some of the words). To make it even more memorable, imagine that this director speaks in Japanese and you are his interpreter. All you can understand at your current level is only parts of speech. You think to yourself

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: A lot of the keywords in this book are a little difficult to figure out because you don't know the actual part of speech. Imagine a new edition with a friendly, chubby little Alfred Hitchcock holding a sign up telling you exactly which part of speech each word is.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: After a pride of hungry lions ate the director, the producer decided to tone down his documentary and film domesticated cats instead.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: When you DOMESTICATE a animal, you are the DIRECTOR of it's life and what it EATS.

hints.author: ReNka
hints.mnemonic: We thought that the lion was domesticated but it ate the Director !!!

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Alfred Hitchcock really thought the pigeons in Birds were domesticated, that was before they swooped down, carried of his star to Mc Donalds and ate him...

hints.author: kaeru
hints.mnemonic: In the film "Grizzly Man" the DIRECTOR tries to DOMESTICATE the bears but ends up being EATEN alive.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The director's mouth dropped open as he flipped through the scrapbook of properties he was about to become heir to.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Careful with inherit (#1370 継). The egoistic director leaves instructions about what shall be handed down to his heir upon the director's death. First, the director's mouth should be surgically removed and preserved, to be handed down to his heir. Second, a scrapbook of the director's proudest scenes should also be handed down. The mouth reminds the heir that the director must be a loudmouth; the scrapbook reminds the heir of how to be a good director.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: This kanji must be referring to Harry Potter. Is he the heir to Slytherin? Who knows? His mouth speaks parseltongue though, and Voldemort is trying to kill him from a magical scrapbook.. (or was that a diary? haha). Oh, and the director of the potions department hates him. Poor harry!

hints.author: pazustep
hints.mnemonic: The director's son will be heir to a big mouth and a scrapbook full of directing instructions.

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: The heir opened his mouth in shock when the director of the estate told him he was only getting a scrapbook.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks.

hints.author: jajaaan
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of a boat seen from above. The middle line is the oars. The drop on top is the rudder (at the back of the boat). The two drops inside represent the passengers

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Cinnabar ( 丹 ) colored boat, the extra drop signifying that the paint hasn't dried yet. The stick represents the oars.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: I dropped a boat on your mom.

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: New Primitive

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: The most famous LINER is the Titanic, which struck an iceberg and sunk. Just imagine that huge LINER strucking an even huger mass of white ice.

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A liner is to boat as an emperor (#261 皇) is to a king (#255 王), or a chief (#967 伯) is to a person (#951 人)

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Cruise Liners are huge boats that always seem to be white.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: Titanic was a big boat built by the White Star Line.

hints.author: DeKleft
hints.mnemonic: Noah's Ark was probably the first boat ever that might be considered a liner. Hey! there's the white dove that Noah sent out, and he has an olive branch in his beak!

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: To navigate a "boat" through a "whirlwind" takes a skilled navigator.

hints.author: thermal
hints.mnemonic: In Legend of Zelda

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Forrest Gump, being the fool that he is, decides to navigate his shrimping boat into the whirlwind instead of around it. Though through his perpetual dumb luck, he manages to be the only boat that survives the whirlwind....

hints.author: Viking101
hints.mnemonic: The Titanic had a GPS Navigation system. The device saved the boat from a whirlwind, but it directed it towards an iceberg instead.

hints.author: At0m5k
hints.mnemonic: "Sir, the possibility of successfully navigating through a whirlwind in a boat is approximately 3,720 to 1!" "Never tell me the odds.".

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: The gunwale is perhaps the most mysterious part of a boat for it is neither a gun nor a whale.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Gunwale (rhymes with "tunnel") is the top edge of the side of a boat, for example the widened lip on the sides of a canoe. The mysterious origin of this part of a boat comes from the strengthened sides of warships that used artillery (it means "gun ridge").

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Boat, gandalf

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Gandalf always hangs out on the boat's gunwale, it's a mystery how the old bastard manages not to fall off.

hints.author: Norman
hints.mnemonic: The meaning of GUNWALE is MYSTERIOUS for everyone, except BOAT enthusiasts.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Carrier?! This means "general" (as in the general public or generally). OK.. Carriers, i.e. boats with missiles, are not available to the general public.

hints.author: PrettyKitty
hints.mnemonic: In general, carrier boats have missiles.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: For those who have the greasemonkey script, this kanji's keyword should be changed. I use run of the mill to avoid conflict with general (#1366 総). Story

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: Generally speaking, aircraft carriers are boats with missiles.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Be sure to protect the carrier. It's the boat with all our missiles, so if the enemy strikes it, it will explode VERY easily.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: What do you call a "CARRIER" of DISHes? A TRAY.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a restaurant set in Disney's Fantasia or maybe in Harry Potter's university, where dishes are magically landing and taking off of a carrier tray.

hints.author: SimHuman
hints.mnemonic: "This, my friend, is no run of the mill dish! Look at its finely crafted handles, its size great to hold dishes itself! No, my friend, THIS is a TRAY!" [See Cheesemaster64 for carrier (#1871 般)].

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: (see 1871) GENERALLY, TRAY'S are used for carrying DISHES/PLATES, but sometimes, poor kids use them a sleds.

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: And What do you call a "general purpose dish"? A tray! (johnskb).

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the conveyor belt, which looks like a 'finger carrier' in that case.

hints.author: Ikeda_kat2007
hints.mnemonic: During WWII, morse code was the primary means of communication from sea. The morse code specialist was the conveyor of messages to and from the crew of the carrier, using his fingers to tap out the secret messages. (This works especially well for 搬送周波数 carrier frequency and 搬送波 carrier wave, being the radio waves/frequencies used in morse code).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Fingers take food from the sushi carrier, a conveyor belt.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This is not used in kaitensushi. It means more like, "carry out/in, delivery." STORY

hints.author: Balaam
hints.mnemonic: A conveyor belt carries sushi to your waiting fingers.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A boy floats his toy boat in a gully and imagines it as an immense ship.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Aargh, hard to keep this separate from boat. How about this

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: A ship is a boat so big, it makes a river look like a gully.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: A boat in a gully looks like a huge ship.

hints.author: yuriehoshii
hints.mnemonic: THUYỀN

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: The warship towers over the smaller benign boats, overseeing their safe path from port to port.

hints.author: lawton992
hints.mnemonic: A warship is a boat that oversees the seas. Think of it as the patroller of the ocean.

hints.author: cbogart
hints.mnemonic: On a normal boat, you do what you want

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: On the warship (antique one) there are slaves, the losers of battle. They are overseen by the slave master in a reclyner who oversees the slaves eating all from one plate. As soon as the slaves have finished eating from the one plate, back to work again.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: A boat  that oversees destruction is a warship.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: In venice, the boat used by the courts to transport criminals is a rowboat.

hints.author: Weber
hints.mnemonic: Courts in olden times would often punish convicts by sentencing them to a life of being the rower crew for large rowboat ships (there were no engines or boilers back then)... Yo ho, Yo ho....

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: "Row, row, row your boat.....". Imagine someone who goes to court, claiming they wrote this song first.

hints.author: foodcubes
hints.mnemonic: Sometimes abstract imagery works very well. Imagine someone showing up to court in a rowboat. Really imagine them rowing it across the floor and you won't forget this Kanji.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: There's a phrase in English to "send you up the river," meaning to be sent to jail. If you think of this then all you have to do is picture the courts sending you up the river in a boat... a rowboat to be precise. If it helps, you can also think of your state then as being "up the creek without a paddle.".

hints.author: yorkii
hints.mnemonic: 何これ ???? ok, sorry to be crude... if you claw at a girls melons, she is gonna give you the elbow.

hints.author: Christoph
hints.mnemonic: M for melon. 瓜 elon.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Joan of Arc ("arc" also means "bow" in french) is practicing with a bow, shooting at melons in a distant field.

hints.author: nest0r

hints.author: johnzep
