hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: You'll make a very short, steep arc if you shoot a melon from a bow. And then the melon will break, which is sad. And then your mouth will likewise be an arc (of sadness)--frown.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Both a bow and a melon are arc-shaped.

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: An orphan will never know the joys on sucking on his mother's melons........

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Unlike the celebrated story of Momotaro the peach boy, no one knows the story of the melon boy who was left an orphan.

hints.author: Crowfoot
hints.mnemonic: This is the happier version of Oliver Twist. Here the orphaned children are served fresh melon with every meal. "Please, sir, may I have some more melon?" "Why, of course, help yourself!".

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: The orphan CHILD popped out of the MELON.

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: Adopt an orphan child today and receive a free melon.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (insect). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon.

hints.author: eightyd
hints.mnemonic: I dont like lesson 51 so far.

hints.author: gdaxeman
hints.mnemonic: The magic flower is the reason why Spider-Man ended up miniaturized and confined inside a hood-like cocoon together with an insect. Now, only a walking stick separates them both.

hints.author: Alucard
hints.mnemonic: See book, one of the good stories you can remember from there.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Spider-Man bent over to pick up a pretty flower when a giant glass hood dropped over him- it's a trap! Now he's stuck inside, fending off a swarm insect with his walking stick as they try to wrap him in a cocoon. Could this be the end of Spider-Man?!

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: The benefit of having sharp horns and fast legs is that an animal can get to the food dish first.

hints.author: QuackingShoe
hints.mnemonic: The benefit of being an animal with horns and fast legs is in keeping it from becoming a dish for the other animals! (shaydwyrm).

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: The resturant I worked at had no real benefits (vaction time, sick leave, etc), except for one-free meals. However, the meals sucked. Basically, we were given left overs, consiting of animal horns, and animal legs, on a plain dish.

hints.author: mr_hans_moleman
hints.mnemonic: Friends with BENEFITS, is basically a HORNY friend who spreads their LEGS and offers themselves on a silver PLATE.

hints.author: lisbet
hints.mnemonic: ( ノಠ益ಠ )ノ彡┻━┻ THEESH KANJI HAS NO BENEFIT TO ME!!!!!!!!! RAGE!!!!!!

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: Some jackass-like people have way too much spare time. You can find video's of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all day. You see them stapling their mouths shut, or throwing eachother upside down in boxes or kicking each other in the crotch.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: snallygaster
hints.mnemonic: I avoid using "mouth" here because it makes me mess up the stroke order. Instead I use a flag/staple combo. Hopefully you've seen the Justin Timberlake "dick in a box" spoof. Someone has a lot of spare time, so he decides to spend the day making an especially elaborate dick in a box. There's a flag stapled to the box as decoration (like wrapping paper). He rigs it up so he can instantly flip the box inside-out to reveal his crotch. Well, it's a vivid image once you get it. He's my hero.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: A pervert's hobby (see Katsuo)

hints.author: inaka_rob
hints.mnemonic: WARNING EXPLICIT!!! In my spare time, basically all DAY long, I STAPLE a few things to the wall. a picture of a woman's mouth and outward facing "box". I think you know what I do with my crotch.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to find them all using a compass.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Instead of being glued to one specialty (#46 専) 専 , I decided to spread my attention in many directions 方 , and be a taskmaster at none.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Gory story

hints.author: sarek05
hints.mnemonic: I assasinated the taskmasker. When the arrowhead hit his brain, bits and pieces spread out in all directions.

hints.author: karmatheif
hints.mnemonic: This is the （しき）used in ふろしき 風呂敷 , which is when the Japanese bundle something in a large cloth, then gather the ends togther and tie it at the top to carry it around. Story

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: You horny bastard, don't come, at least not yet!

hints.author: volfy
hints.mnemonic: When I come home, there's nobody and no dinner waiting for me. Sigh...rice for one again.

hints.author: dilandau24
hints.mnemonic: Here I see, of all things, Bambi. His animal horns have not yet come out. (As we can see in the kanji, the animal horns are not at the top, not "poking through". ) Remember

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: Last words of the Bible

hints.author: baylin
hints.mnemonic: One bowl of rice comin' up.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Captain Hook, his spirit crushed, is lying on the ground cursing Wolverine who has defeated him with his far superior claws.

hints.author: Balaam
hints.mnemonic: You're reclining on the floor trying to hook a sheaf with a small hook through the cracks. That you've been doing this for seven hours without success shows your burning spirit.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Wolverine has a fighting spirit, and even while reclining on the floor sharpens the hooks on his claws.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: Someone is lying on the floor, a huge x ripped into their stomach with a fishhook. A passer by says "Genki desu ka".

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Water vapor almost looks like a spirit but has no soul.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Wolverine disappears into water vapor, seemingly his spirit dissipating into nothingness.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: In this scene, Captain Hook is RECLINING on the FLOOR with his HOOK in the air in the desert. He is drying up dying, you can even see the WATER VAPOR being sucked right out of him.

hints.author: narazumono
hints.mnemonic: Vapor is the water's spirit with no x, the unknown quantity for soul.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Captain Hook enjoys nothing more than to lie on the floor of his ship while the cool water vapor from the ocean waves sprays his face.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to fly away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for?

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Two hummingbirds flying to feed at a measuring box filled with sugar water. This kanji is famous for having hard-to-remember stroke order.  Try it this way

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Captain hook flying in a measuring box with two propellers.

hints.author: tharvey
hints.mnemonic: (To keep the stroke order) Flying by, you see a hummingbird land on a walking stick. The bird looks around and sees a person nearby bending over, and gives the signal to attack. In swoops a second hummingbird, poking it's beak right into his back. Ouch!

hints.author: ktcgx
hints.mnemonic: I learnt this Kanji a long time ago, when I was a kid, and the image I had for it is so vivid it's served me well, and I thought I'd share it. This Kanji is two hummingbirds flying over a field of asparagus stalks. But one flew too low, and got its beak stuck through two stalks.

hints.author: jreaves
hints.mnemonic: (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she sinks. She shouldn't have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend's schemes.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the crown sink in the water, Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city (human legs distorted from running) yelling "Eureka! Eureka!" See http

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A mob of peasants throws a noble into the waters, his human legs stuck into the crown he was wearing proudly just a minute before (this later image for the special primitive combo on the right). The poor guy sinks to his death, unable to swim back up. Sunk by his crown!

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a heavy crown to make sure she sinks.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: If you're in the water and your legs are squeezed together inside a tight crown you won't be able to swim properly - you'll just sink.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: The guy who was thrown into the river to sink was given one last request. "If I'm gonna be sleeping with the fishes," he said, "can I at least have a pillow? I'm real sensitive." The mafia bosses laughed. "Look, my doctor said I can only use wooden pillows, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his pillow. They tossed him the river and drove off...and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating wood pillow.

hints.author: oregum
hints.mnemonic: WOODEN PILLOWS do not sink (#1888 沈) in water.

hints.author: Corodon
hints.mnemonic: (Mature audiences only) As my wood began to sink into her, she moaned into the pillow, not wanting to awaken the neighbors with screams of ecstasy.

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: Some Japanese people sleep with a pillow made of wood, in case there's a flood in the middle of the night. Because pillows made of wood do not sink, they need never fear falling asleep without a flotation device nearby.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: (Mature audiences only) As my wood began to sink into her, she moaned into the pillow, not wanting to awaken the neighbors with screams of... pain. It was her first time, and she wasn't wet!! (Thanks Corodon).

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Ten rakes woman. your wife digs her fingernails into you and it feels like 10 rakes when she finds you ontop of another woman.

hints.author: TheSleeve
hints.mnemonic: (I'm really not sexist, this just helps me remember the kanji)

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: Your wife's fingernails are like ten rakes clawing into you. What a savage woman.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I have multiple wives. Ten to be exact. It makes it mighty easy to rake leaves in the fall.

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: Your wife hit you 10 times with a rake when she found you on top of another woman!

hints.author: danie115
hints.mnemonic: Sugoi! Sugoi! Ice Wife Sugoi!

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: His wife has a nifty way of making all types of ice cream in her home freezer.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: I prefer keyword "terrific" for this as the Japanese meaning can be either "great" or "dreadful". Story

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: A word like nifty makes you think of the 50's, and a housewife so impressed with the new freezer that she says "oh, how nifty!".

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: My ice-cold wife would beat me down if I ever insulted her, so I often tell her she's 凄い (sugoi), which she takes to mean amazing but what I actually mean is dreadful. ------------------------- (I use すごい (sugoi) as a keyword because I already know it, but if you wanna use an English keyword, I like herman's suggestion of "terrific.").

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven't seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. Note that the mouth is closed only after the stick goes in, as is only logical.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: My kanji writing ability has declined so much even my one looks pathetic.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven't seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, allowing people to rent him and play catch with him for money!

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: One pathetic decision after another led to the decline and fall of the Roman Empire.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Ever since the guy from pathetic (#401 哀) got a declined by a girl and a walking stick rammed in his mouth sideways, his life has been in decline; a downward spiral.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The guy from pathetic (#401 哀) shared his inmost feelings with a girl and she rammed a walking stick down his throat. It ruptured his inmost organs.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Besides making money from acting like a dog (see decline), the pathetic man has risked his inmost internal organs by becoming a cane swallower!

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I'm going with 9 strokes

hints.author: cangy
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: The pathetic emo guy is always talking about his inmost feelings. Sometimes I want to shove a walking stick in his mouth to stop him talking.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When Jim Carrey puts on The Mask, he can make it seem like he has 100 eyes popping out of his head.

hints.author: phauna
hints.mnemonic: If you're wearing a mask, a hundred eyes can look at you but none of them will know who you are.

hints.author: Monkeys_Spiders
hints.mnemonic: I see this as the comb primitive combined with the kanji for 3 giving the same stroke order

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: A mask with one big eye in the middle. (and a funny haircut on top).

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: A mask with a hundred eyes.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: There is a certain restaurant in West-Shinjuku that serves its noodles made of BARLEY in a MASK instead of a plate. I love these theme-restaurants!

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: I always eat barley noodles with a mask on - it stops them splashing in your face.

hints.author: Aerin
hints.mnemonic: Don't be fooled! That's just barley masquerading as noodles.

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 素麺 , 老麺 , 麺 (麵)noodles (#2752 麺) メン ... Parts

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A mask made entirely of barley noodles.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: You can feed twenty mouths for a year for the price of ten leather coats.

hints.author: jesslawnz
hints.mnemonic: I asked the street vendor the price of the LEATHER jacket. He said TWENTY, but with my MOUTH, I talked him down to TEN. (correct stroke order).

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: This kanji depicts a leather jacket wearing gang of 20 people. To make themselves look even tougher, they all have needles in their mouths (i.e. piercings, but here of a specific kind).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: My leather belt has twenty openings for the needle of my buckle to go through.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: In this leather belt there are 20 ( 廿 ) small holes or openings ( 口 ) made with a needle ( 十 ) to compensate for increases in girth.

hints.author: shaydwyrm
hints.mnemonic: Leather shoes are nice because they change shape to fit your foot.

hints.author: xiaoma
hints.mnemonic: Leather is often changed into shoes.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: If you buy leather shoes, you have to "break them in" - wear them so that they change shape to fit your foot.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: I wear my nice leather shoes whenever I go out dancing. I hate wearing too much in my pockets when I dance, so if I ever need change, I just reach into my shoes where I've stashed a bunch of spare change.

hints.author: channi
hints.mnemonic: SHOES used to be made out of LEATHER, but that has CHANGED.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In the Old West, cowboys had hegemony OVER the Indians despite their leathercraft and ability to navigate by the moon.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete hegemony over them. All your base are belong to us.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: In the Old West, hegemony over Indians was ensured by binding and whipping the Indians' flesh with leather straps.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Leather + flesh = scalping. It's commonly believed that the Indians invented scalping but in fact it was the American colonists that created the practice of cutting off a dead Indian's hair + skin as proof of the kill. In response the Indians started doing the same to them, but history is written by the winners so most people blame the Indians for this barbaric practice. (true story) In the Old West, colonists exercised their hegemony by scalping the Indians.

hints.author: CasualTatsumaki
hints.mnemonic: In the Old West, the colonists asserted hegemony over the Indians by killing all the bison and depriving the Indians of their much needed leather and meat.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: When an enemy's flag is raised, a true samurai can split it in half with just his voice.

hints.author: bananarama
hints.mnemonic: Having lost his voice, the samurai comunicated to his troops with a striped flag.

hints.author: LazyNomad
hints.mnemonic: The lower element is easier to remember as

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The samurai stepped on his Rubik's Cube and bent it. His voice of pain and grief rang out.

hints.author: jcdietz03
hints.mnemonic: In ancient Japan, after winning a battle, a SAMURAI might rip the opposing FLAG down the middle (represented by the vertical line of flag) and bellow a victory cry in his loudest VOICE.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The eyebrows hover over the eyes like a divided flag.

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph

hints.author: dancingblade
hints.mnemonic: (+astridtops) Eyebrows are like flags that are raised above your eyes. The flag is divided because otherwise that would be a monobrow.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The venetian mask with stick covers the eyes but I can recognize his bushy eyebrows above it.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: She painted Japanese flags above her eyes as eyebrows.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: As a present, I gave my dentist a hand-crank tool for spreading mouths. He was so happy since it makes his job easier.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: I see this as a pictograph of an old-style phonograph - a stand, record, crank and bell (the mouth). Even the primitives work out - a tool with a crank which plays music out of the bell mouth. Imaginge giving one of these old and beautiful phonographs to a classical or jazz music buff!

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: This kanji does not mean "give" as in "give to someone." It means "give" in the sense that someone gave you something, or did something for your benefit when combined with a gerund (-te/-de form) of a verb. STORY

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Some dude is changing a flat tire. He opens his mouth to say, "GIVE me that tool,...what was it called again? Oh yeah, a tire iron." (The forth stroke looks like a tire iron to me.).

hints.author: hunchbag
hints.mnemonic: I was going to give you a hand-crank tool but I eated it.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: A man from a less enlightened society comes for a visit, and asks the host to give him a woman for some recreation.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: While at the dentist's office giving him his hand-crank tool, one of the assistant's asks me if I'd like to join her in the back for some recreation.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: A woman gives up her recreation time in order to raise a family.

hints.author: jackwarne
hints.mnemonic: God gives Adam a woman for recreational purposes...

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: "Give me a woman ( 女を呉れ！ ) for my recreation!".

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: It is a rookie mistake to believe the words when your sweetie says "You don't have to give me anything for my birthday." Trust me, your sweetie wants something, something shiny, and if you disappoint, you will suffer.

hints.author: thermal
hints.mnemonic: You must give words of apology when you make a mistake.

hints.author: Tobberoth
hints.mnemonic: "I GIVE you my WORD that I won't make the same MISTAKE twice".

hints.author: cjon256
hints.mnemonic: In a debate the smallest mistake (even a slip of the tongue) makes your words into a gift to your opponent.

hints.author: kame3
hints.mnemonic: When the dentist makes a mistake in your mouth with his hand-crank tool, you scream out words of pain.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is used in compounds for the steaming of food and also for smoking/fumigation. Here we have the Japanese once again trying to replicate the French cuisine, only with a twist, steaming food with flowers (think of flower-smoked ham for example). Flowers must first be completely soaked in water, and then poured over a thin piece of flooring under which there is an oven fire.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: crystalcastlecreature
hints.mnemonic: (EASY KANJI!) At the top we see hot steam forming FLOWERS. At the bottom we see the STOVE FIRE heating the bottom of a pan. So what's in the middle causing all this steam? Its all COMPLETELY WATER.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I keep forgetting this primitive, so completely/water for me will be a sort of water sprite or elemental, a child-like creature completely made of water. -------- It used to be thought that to create steam, you had to trap the water sprite (using some sort of magical flowers as a lure), and place them over a thin piece of flooring under which there's an oven fire. The steam then flowers from the water sprite (re

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: When you want to steam some flowers/vegetation you don't cover them completely with water, rather you have just a little at the floor of the saucepan and then heat.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: To get someone to completely acquiesce it takes 3 dunks in the water before they give.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: To get someone to acquiesce, duck them completely in aqua (=water) three times. (variation on dingomick's).

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Warning, Obscene!! I finally got my girl to acquiesce to a lewd act.. But it took 3 times to get it in completely and lots of water to clean up afterwards.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: You must ask the trapped water sprite not once, not twice, but thrice (a line from Samuel Taylor Coleridge's "Kubla Khan" comes to mind) before it will acquiesce to your requests. It's not for any mystical reasons, it's just that it hates being asked the same thing three times, like that character from Austin Powers.

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Waterboarding

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Damn racoons ill show them. I put a snare in the bin as well as a few phosphorous sparklers so as to scare the shit out of the buggers as they rummage through my bin.

hints.author: smujohnson
hints.mnemonic: (thegeezer3) Damn racoons... I'll show them. I'll put a SNARE in the BIN as well as a few SPARKLERS so as to scare the shit out of the buggers, then hit them with a SHOVEL.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: A typical German apartment has five different kind of trash bins

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: (Reformatted from erikkusan) The Windows Recycle Bin is like a snare holding onto your trash. When you empty it, a window displays little sparkles as the files are shoveled off of your hard drive.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is alternative way of writing 箱 , used in e.g. 函館 (はこだて) and sometimes as is. This bin is actually a snare with a powerful sparkler in it that kills rats that enter it, the remains of which are then shoveled away (to a "recycle bin" perhaps).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Can simplify this using decay (#1243 朽). Then

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: (modified Katsuo) Can simplify this using decay (#1243 朽). You travel to the poles, a frozen wasteland. In desperate need of food you try to set up a snare but the tree is decayed (see story for decay (#1243 朽)) so you catch no prey. The brutal cold first attacks your mouth as your lips turn blue, then your crotch also gets cold as your body fails; finally you fall to the floor.

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Santa Claus (from the North Pole, of course), has a wooden sled led by reindeer snared at the mouth. One unfortunate night, he jumps down a chimney and burns his crotch on a piece of coal as he hits the floor.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The diverging magnetic fields at the poles actually attract cosmic radioactive decay, particularly the kind that causes cancer in the lips or the testicles. But don't worry, you can protect either your mouth or your crotch by digging a hole in the ground and covering it up. Which part do you protect? Imagine coming back home with cancer in the other, unprotected part.

hints.author: Aeryon
hints.mnemonic: I remember sharing this joke on the playground back in 1986. "Did you ear about the dumb polak who climbed a tall tree to see both poles? On the way up, stepped in his own snare, fell to the floor and ended up with his crotch in his own mouth. Then he said seeing his own crotch in his mouth... that's not the pole I wanted to see!".

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: The kanji looks like an elephant with tusks. the box is the elephant's eye. The final stroke is the tusk.

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: He stored the tusks into a box, along with the broken halberds.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: You can save yourself a lot of trouble because Heisig is correct on tusk (#1904 牙) (4), bud (#1905 芽) (8), wicked (#1906 邪) (8) but not gracious (#1907 雅) (5th edition says 12, but WWWJDIC says 13). So

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The waitress was charged by the elephant who skewered her legs with its tusks. As a result her right leg had to be amputated (missing right leg), her left leg is crippled, stiff, and limp (straight left leg), and the tusk is still embedded in her left leg (final stroke attached to waitress's crippled left leg).

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: This actually reminds me of waitress more than anything, but that doesn't help much.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Zoo keepers are baffled as to why the tips of the elephant's tusks keep budding into flowers.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Buds while they're still small tend to be tusk-shaped.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: An elephant places a big flower on the other elephant's tusks, to show they're best buds.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: Unfortunately, this must be a sad story. Poachers lure the elefants with buds (of flowers) so they can kill them to get their ivory.

hints.author: eightyd
hints.mnemonic: Lets smoke some flower bud out of my tusk bong.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The wicked queen builds her city walls out of menacing tusks.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: As everyone knows, rhinoceroses and elephants are often killed for the value of their TUSKS. Here we see a WICKED city mayor who has had countless elephants killed just to make his CITY WALLS out of TUSKS.

hints.author: Biene
hints.mnemonic: The battle of Pelennor Fields (Lord of the Rings)

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: You can see this is the city of the wicked just by the huge tusks adorning the city walls.

hints.author: jmcanally
hints.mnemonic: Considered a WICKED trade by most of the modern world, the TUSK trade is still often carried out in the SLUMS, outside of the influence of the police and government.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: "Goodness gracious! Such an elegant turkey with a tusk." This mnemonic is meant to join RtK's keyword with a better proposition. Heisig could have used "elegant" here, which is not confounded so easily with graceful (#721 淑), and accurately represents the character's meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha's Kanji Learner's Dictionary).

hints.author: Zareon
hints.mnemonic: To not confuse it with grace (#606 恩) or graceful (#721 淑), think of the phrase "Goodness gracious." Like

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Be gracious around the large-tusked turkey. They're emotional at the best of times, so don't excite them with a big weapon like that.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: "Goodness gracious! A turkey with tusks!" screamed the elegant lady walking through the GM farm.

hints.author: torida
hints.mnemonic: WARNING

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Mrs. Badger follows the animal tracks to the den where she finds her husband getting a blowjob from a fox. "I have a good explanation for this. Really!".

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Animal track primitive

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The magical shakuhachi can easily give explanation for any animal tracks, just like it can be used to translate words ( 訳 ).

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Mrs. Badger follows the animal tracks to the den where she finds her husband getting shakuhachi from a fox. Now, I don't speak badger but judging from the screeching and the gestures, my interpretation of the situation is that Mrs. Badger is not pleased. (thanks dingomick! Just trying to use this new keyword).

hints.author: furrykef
hints.mnemonic: An interpretive dance of some kind where somebody follows animal tracks, a shakuhachi providing the soundtrack, suggesting the tracker's thoughts and intentions.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: The famers take it in turns to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field.

hints.author: Biene
hints.mnemonic: (modified thegeezer3) Animal tracks were found in the rice field, now the kids of the farmer take it in turns to keep watch and hinder the animals to make more animal tracks in their precious rice field. They roll the dice to decide in what order they have to keep watch and when everyones turn is.

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [turn; number in a series] Ok, I'm done - now it's your turn to count the drops of rice in the rice field...

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: I find "turn" alone is too generic to remember, so I add an additional keyword, numerical order. This is perhaps the most common context in which this kanji is found, e.g. 1st, 2nd = 一番、二番 . Story

hints.author: jimitha
hints.mnemonic: (I use animal droppings instead of animal tracks to avoid confusion.) Story

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: At your divorce hearing the judge tells you to roll dice to see who keeps the house. ("I can't believe what I'm hearing!" you say).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In the courthouse the judge decides your hearing with a roll of the dice.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The hearing was quite informal. We had it at the judges' house. Each party took a turn relating their side of the issues, then the judge concluded the hearing with his decision.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: In the house of law, both sides take turns during the hearing.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: If you operate a house of dice, you can expect to end up in front of a Judge at a hearing.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Don't play dice with birds. When you're not looking, they'll flip the dice with their feathers.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: When the birds out the back are playing dice, they flip their feathers (not their finger) at their opponents.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: According to my books, this flip is related to flipping food in a frying pan or something like that. To flip an omelette, you need first some eggs. But you said it aloud, and when you go to the field, you find it empty except for some animal tracks and some missing feathers. The chickens have escaped!! (music from "Chicken Run").

hints.author: torabi
hints.mnemonic: It's your turn to flip the chicken wings on grill.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: These are crooked dice, modified using the latest robotic technology. To flip right in flight, they momentarily stick out tiny feathered wings to perform few deft flaps.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This character refers to feudal clans that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures ( 廃藩置県 ), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落 , flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that clans' location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: In the particular clan depicted by this character, each member has to take his or her turn watering the flowers.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Each member of the clan has to take his turn at watering the flowers. The order they do it in is decided by a roll of the dice. (tweaked Matthew's story).

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: This yakuza clan controls the "flower" trade, the 'water business' ( 水商 ) and the dice gambling.

hints.author: erikkusan
hints.mnemonic: This is what members of Ku Klux Clan is doing when not meeting

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: I've heard of people having hair on the back of their hands, but this is ridiculous! That's not hair, that's fur!

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: Be careful not to pet a cat the wrong way - most cats don't like you rubbing your hand backwards over their fur.

hints.author: shirish
hints.mnemonic: Reverse stroke of hand disturbs the fur.

hints.author: usis35
hints.mnemonic: I touch the FUR of the animals only with the reverse of my HAND . Be careful, strokes are not horizontal.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: I have a lot of fur on the back of my hand.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The amount of "fur" (needles) on a Christmas tree decreases, until it doesn't look all that good.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: Real fur coats and real christmas trees are dereasing the last couple of years. Plasctic chrismas trees and fake fur it is nowadays.

hints.author: kusterdu
hints.mnemonic: A marketing survey shows that there has been a decrease in Christmas trees sales. It turns out, many very stupid people confused a fir tree with a "fur" tree, and because "fur is murder" stopped buying the trees.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: Christmas Tree + Fur

hints.author: dtstutz
hints.mnemonic: Sorry, decrease is too generic to remember... I bought my sister a de-creaser (a clothing maintenance device similar to an iron) after she complained about her fur coats getting all creased and wrinkled. But it was only November, so it had to sit for a while under the Christmas tree in a wrapped box waiting for someone to open it up and use it to de-crease something.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: A dog waves its furry tail like a flag.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: A FLAG of FUR is a TAIL.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: I taught my dog to use the toilet. Great, right? Problem

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Animals wave their furry tails like flags, indicating their mood.

hints.author: peacemik
hints.mnemonic: A flag-loving nationalist paints the fur on the tail of his furry dog in the colors of the national flag, and together they go to watch the military parade. The nationalist waves his flag, while the dog wags his furry tail. 尾 (お)

hints.author: naniwa
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is, of course, pronounced "taku", and it seems the owner of this home is a little bit otaku himself. He has hung up locks of hair suruptitiously obtained from various females all over his house. A veritable hair fetishist, and certainly someone whose home you wouldn't want to visit.

hints.author: Terhorst
hints.mnemonic: "Home is where the hair is".

hints.author: Copycatken
hints.mnemonic: At home, all the drains in my house are clogged up with locks of hair.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: I'm very paranoid when I finally call my house a home, so whenever I leave, I cut a lock of hair, divide it into strands, and place it at all the entrances. If one is displaced, then I know someone has been there! Saw that in a James Bond movie.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: House and locks of hair (goldilocks) = goldilocks broke into the bears house and treat it like her own home the selfish bitch.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: When you consign a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).

hints.author: ivandiaz
hints.mnemonic: In "The Lord of the Rings", Galadriel consigned a lock of her hair to Gimli the dwarf, along with some wise words.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: Through words and a lock of hair the voodoo priestess consigns you to a life of pain.

hints.author: delbertmon
hints.mnemonic: ENGLISH DEF.

hints.author: Thora
hints.mnemonic: Found at a consignment shop

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: In this kanji, you can see 3 katakana characters

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: Do me from behind, says the bird, as she shakes her tailfeathers.

hints.author: Alunalun
hints.mnemonic: Tell a story - a reluctant magician is asked to do a trick. The audience chant 'Do it, do it!', so eventually he does one. He takes a drop of water (stroke 1), drops it on the ground where it runs down and smears out (stroke 2). It drops down two steps (strokes 3 and 4) (imagine some nice setting with steps), growing and becoming multicoloured, like a petrol drop, as it goes. Then at the bottom the magician touches it with his wand and you see it has turned into a set of peacock's tail feathers.

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: The keyword "do" is just too generic for me, so I use "for the sake of", which is perhaps a more common reading; for those familiar with the phrase ために, I believe this is the kanji for ため.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: "I do!" says the bride before tripping over a spear, falling down the stairs and into the flames.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T doesn’t "DO" FALSEHOOD. It goes against everything he stands for. “I pity da foos who revel in FALSEHOODs!”.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: "It depends on what your definition of do, uh, is," says Mr. T giving falsehood about his affair with a peacock.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Not really a story but I believe that giving special attention to a kanji is also a good way to remember it and this one was selected as "Kanji of the year 2007". http

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [falsehood; lie; deceive; pretend; counterfeit; forgery] A person who claims to have seen a living Dodo bird is telling a falsehood. (based on astridtops,17-10-2006).

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: A person who claims he didn't do something while he actually did, is telling a falsehood.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: The man being tortured was apprehensive as he saw his tormentor approaching with a hairpin poised to pierce his brain!

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: I’m feeling apprehensive because I’m wading barefoot in a paddyfield and I've just dropped my hairpin.

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: I was a little apprehensive before brain surgery, and when the surgeon took my brain out and stuck it atop a hairpin, my apprehensions were confirmed! Put my brain back right away, I bellowed. 畏まりました！ said the surgeon. (thanks Meconium).

hints.author: Meconium
hints.mnemonic: My brain was exposed when they were about to perform conscious brain surgery on me. I started to get a little apprehensive when the neurosurgeon approached with a long hairpin and a maniacal look in his eyes... 畏まりました。 かしこまりました。.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: "Dear Heisig, if I see you misname another kanji I'm going stab you repeatedly in the brain with a hairpin. Your's truly, a pissed off member from RevTK".

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The Geisha with long hair uses an ornate lacquered hairpin to bundle it all up.

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: The top of this one reminds me of the staple primitive. So here's my story

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: As a primitive I use the image of (very) long hair. Let this kanji represent a "Swiss Hairpin" (similar to a Swiss army knife)

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: HAIRPIN

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: The long haired Geisha staples on an ornate hairpin so it won't slip. (Thanks to Zactacular for the idea.).

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The longbow is follows the design of a standard bow, only it has been lengthened.

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: Legolas recieves spam telling him that his can lengthen his "bow"...he smirks...he know's it's already long enough.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Wanna lengthen the distance you can shoot? Use a longbow!

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In desperation, after the Geisha (see long) broke the string on her bow, she lengthened out one of her own hairs and strung the bow with it.

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: To make your bow into a longbow, just lengthen it.

hints.author: nac_est
hints.mnemonic: In ancient China books were rolled-up scrolls of paper. So notebooks were nothing more than long towels.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Students, for this class, your notebook will be a towel. Make sure it's extra long though, we'll have a lot of writing.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is the notebook computer to bring when you're going on a (really!) long trip (Also, used by long haired hippy type galactic hitchhikers). Don't forget to bring your towel!

hints.author: jrkester
hints.mnemonic: What an unusual student, that person is using a long towel for a notebook. Guess it would be convenient for studying after a shower.

hints.author: felwiz1602
hints.mnemonic: The movie the notebook was so long and full of crying that by the end of it you had soaked through an entire towel 手帳：てちょう 帳 / とばり

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: Taking Viagra let's your blood vessels dilate...resulting in a body part getting long.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Staying out in the dark moonlit sky for a long time, your pupils dilate.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: Your girldfriend's pupils dilate. She's never seen a piece of flesh that long!

hints.author: eightyd
hints.mnemonic: My dick is dilated.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: When the moon comes up, your pupils dilate--they become longer on all sides--because the moon produces less light than the sun.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Japanese teenage girls consider the style of the hair of the head very important. If a particular style is trendy, soon they all want their own hair in the same shape as that of their friends.

hints.author: kodama
hints.mnemonic: Friends influence the length and shape of each other's hair.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: When Rachel from Friends hair got popular, even Mystique changed her hair of the head to that style. Didn't need to cut it of course....

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: My daughter has long hair which she shapes in various ways depending on which friend she's going out with.

hints.author: Tzadeck
hints.mnemonic: I put Play-Doh in the hair of my friends. I learned that the hair of the head does not go well with Play-Doh.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: You use an American flag to wrap up a salad for a picnic and bind it with a hairpin. Now imagine unfolding it to open up the bounty you've fixed up for yourself.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Unfold flag, take out the salad, pin the flag down with hairpins and have a picnic.

hints.author: ivantolearnkanji
hints.mnemonic: You unfold the Stars and Stripes flag in order to hoist it high, but there's a problem! One of the stars has fallen off! With some quick thinking, you pin a flower to the flag using a hairpin, and you're all set. Good thing you don't have to refold the flag once unfolded.

hints.author: esaulgd
hints.mnemonic: The farmer girl has made some ready-to-eat salad packs, but has no way to take it to the market. She takes down the flag, wraps the salad packs and ties the bundle with her own hairpin. So she arrives at the market and unfolds the bundle to exhibit her goods. (Based on "darg_sama"'s story).

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The flag had been used for a picnic so when I unfolded it, bits of salad and hairpins fell out of the folds.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves. CAREFUL

hints.author: tristanthorn
hints.mnemonic: Ten days ago, our two mouths met for the last time... then she gave me her hairpin as a sayounara gift. How I miss my Geisha girl...

hints.author: laxxy
hints.mnemonic: This kanji means miss as in "miss a (dearly departed) person", not as in "miss a target". Here the dearly departed has been buried in the ground, with her favourite hairpin in place of a gravestone, and two mourners stand around crying with open mouths.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The miner misses his miss (his sweetheart). So much soil is separating his mouth from hers (working as a miner deep below the ground). She left him a hairpin as a good-luck trinket.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: We tried to kiss ten times but our 2 mouths MISSED every time. She got upset and threw her hairpin at me.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Owls only nest in fruit trees.

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: The wise old OWL makes her nest out of FRUIT, carving out the middle for her chicks, because then it's less work

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: If only there had been a wise owl nesting in the tree of forbidden fruit to warn Eve about the snake.

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: The owl with the biggest brain will nest at the very top of a tree.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: All the little forest creatures bring fruits to the owl's nest so they don't get eaten.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Owls are smart...for this owl everything is simple coz his brain is ten times more powerful than mine.

hints.author: nekoyaki
hints.mnemonic: For owls, finding a needle in a rice field is simple (much better eyesight than us humans).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A girl who was working at Hooters thought she was going to be fired because her breasts were too small. She went to an acupuncturist who convinced her that planting needles into her brain would increase the size of her breasts. Of course, all that did is she was fired and although she wasn't very smart to begin with, now she's simple-minded for life. As a primitive let this kanji be "simple-minded blond girl" (ex-Hooters Girl). Keep the image distinct from "Hooters Girl" (top 3 strokes).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Careful

hints.author: Django
hints.mnemonic: "How do you perform a labotomy, Owl?" Pooh asks one day. In his characteristically supercilious tone, Owl replies, "Simple, my simple friend. I shall show you by performing one on myself. You see one just has to remove one's brain, like so, and put it on a needle and then...oh, Pooh, I don't feel very well...." Alas, Pooh is no longer paying attention, because he's currently watching The Simple Life, the primitive reading for this kanji.

hints.author: Dragg
hints.mnemonic: George W. Bush's plans for war were so SIMPLE. To him, its all just a big FIESTA.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: What started out as a simple fiesta, turned into a full-scale war after arguments about whose potato salad was the best.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: So there's this fiesta in downtown Compton. It's a simple party, but someone invited people from the wrong gangs and the simple fiesta turns into an all-out turf war.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Simple-minded blond girl (see previous frame) is going to a fiesta, and boy... is this war ! She may be simple-minded but she could easily have written The Art of War. Only, the woman's version. She has just arrived at the fiesta, she has quickly apprehended the battlefield, taking note of the other competing girls who may pose a threat, and where the good looking guys are. Just watch her dividing the girls, and conquering the boys. I told you, this is war !

hints.author: dshill99
hints.mnemonic: Think Iraq war - Rumsfeld thought it would be simple, but it was no fiesta. セン 戦争 せんそう.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Knowing ZEN’s emphasis on “nothingness,” it’s not hard to envision a ZEN ALTAR being quite clean and SIMPLE.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Simple-minded blond girl (see frame 1928) is very good at Zen, which isn't surprising since she doesn't think much. She has this bad habit of meditating perched on the main temple altar, which infuriates the Zen buddhists. When they get up to her and tell her rudely to step down the altar, she just smiles and teases them

hints.author: mairov
hints.mnemonic: The Zen altar is really simple.

hints.author: jonny_wonny
hints.mnemonic: Because Zen is so simple, you don't need an alter, just a quiet place to sit.

hints.author: Hoticehunter
hints.mnemonic: Guys, if you're just going to make your story some variation of "Zen altars are simple", do you really need to share it publicly? There's 100 other stories saying exactly the same thing. You don't need to check the "share this story" box for every story you make. Don't make people wade through 100 stories that are exactly the same just to find the one that's different and works for them.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Hunting with a bow is too complicated. I'm switching to something simpler--using a bullet.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The bow was a weapon for simple times, but nowadays it has been replaced by bullets.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Give a bow to simple-minded blond girl (see frame 1928), and she'll try to shoot bullets with it ! When she joined this local archery club she was told she needed some equipment, and guess what she did ? She went to the grocery store and bought some bullets.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Bows are rather simple devices compared to things that use bullets.

hints.author: icamonkey
hints.mnemonic: Bullets make bows look simple and obselete.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: I was taking a picture of my girlfriend under the cherry tree during 花見 , when an owl happened to poop on her at the exact moment the shutter snapped. It's really my favorite picture , just don't tell her that.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: The tree in Japan that represents both wisdom (the owl) and femininity (the woman). This is a sakura (さくら), or cherry tree.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: Athena seating against a cherry tree with her owl on her shoulder. She is picking cherries and feeding her owl.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The woman has trained her pet owl to fly to the tree (a cherry tree) and bring her back cherries.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: "There is a tree," said the wise owl, "where a woman may regain her virginity

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: The owl looks for its prey in the rice field. It sees so many potential animals to eat but since it only has one mouth, it decides that the tasty looking chihuahua will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006).

hints.author: zazen666
hints.mnemonic: I have a strange story for this one but it works. I imagine a owl getting into a rice field which serves as a boxing ring. His opponent is a little chihuahua. The fight starts, the owl takes one punch to the mouth and is out cold. In the chihuahua's corner is that coach from Rocky saying "Your an ANIMAL!!". A vivid image of this story works pretty well for me.

hints.author: Copycatken

hints.author: nolusu

hints.author: adhmm

hints.author: rowdyphantom

hints.author: dukelexon

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Every full moon the owl swoops down on villains, tearing out their brains.

hints.author: darg_sama

hints.author: vosmiura

hints.author: samueruht

hints.author: Balaam

hints.author: genbaku

hints.author: radical_tyro

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: The stern OWL parent throws his young off the CLIFF to test their DARING.

hints.author: Raichu

hints.author: Corodon

hints.mnemonic: The biggest CHAIN restaurant manager makes tons of GOLD by taking a LITTLE MONEY from each restaurant of the CHAIN.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: By word of mouth, owl-luring tool (raise (#1938 挙)) gained a reputation of amazingly effective and reliable device.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Stephen Hawking has a reputation of being as smart as an owl but using a tool to speak.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The wise owl earns its reputation not by its use of tools but by its famous words

hints.mnemonic: A pack of wild dogs chases an owl gliding on the wind, who drops cornstalks on them. It's hard to tell who's doing the game-hunting.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The right side is also used in 蝋 , meaning "wax" (used in e.g. candle, 蝋燭 , and wax doll, 蝋人形 ). The lower right is 用 with wind instead of canopy. The true meaning of the right side is "many gathering together", and meaning for 蝋 comes from bee nests (bee wax). So, right side

hints.author: radical_tyro

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: The BIRD let loose a WHITE ONE from it's TAIL FEATHERS...right on my new car!

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: A white bird with one massive tail feather.

hints.author: thegeezer3
hints.mnemonic: Dove one tailfeathers. there is only one bird with such beautiful white tail feathers - the dove.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: A chirp is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is not limited to the chirp of a bird, but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its mouth (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals

hints.author: wilsoncb
hints.mnemonic: Just 100 left to go! 頑張れ！ .

hints.author: testoman
hints.mnemonic: Addition to DrJones' story

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The crane was the only bird allowed to sleep in the coop (the turkey house). See, the old turkeys deemed the chicken and most of the other birds inferior... but they wouldn't mess with a majestic crane.

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: During the construction of the Turkey house, there was a mistake and instead of ordering a metal crane, they got a bird crane! Nonetheless, it was happy to help wherever it could.

hints.author: raulir

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: A crow is a bird, but not a white one. MEANING

hints.author: to_nihon
hints.mnemonic: The crow is a bird with a big mouth (caw! caw!) and no white feathers to be seen.

hints.author: Nick65765
hints.mnemonic: Crows are not white birds. brilliant.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Christoph

hints.author: Talka
hints.mnemonic: "I heard it through the grapevine" and "a little birdy told me" are actually the same metaphor, linked together by a proverbial flower that's since dropped from both expressions! Or so a bird on a flower grapevine told me...

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: The flowery vine is the one that birds gather around.

hints.author: BigAmish

hints.mnemonic: A pigeon is a baseball-bird. You probably all now the "pigeon explosion", don't you? http

hints.author: bananarama

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: The vulture's husband is a chicken...heck...who am I to judge their interspecies love? They're both birds so its cool.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: A continuation of mountain stream (#840 渓) (which happens to have the same chinese pronunciation)

hints.mnemonic: Ever since that eagle attacked my husband from above, he acts like a chicken whenever he sees a bird, fearing that it might be the eagle who has come back to finish the job.

hints.mnemonic: Homer Simpson circles like a vulture around Marge when she's preparing his favourite bird, chicken.

hints.mnemonic: Mnemonic for migrating ducks

hints.author: tuuli
hints.mnemonic: "Aiding and abetting

hints.author: Cheesemaster64
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is in the word 援助 (えんじょ) which means to support or assist. The word abet suggests that you are helping or supporting something that is morally wrong. Support is a much better choice for this kanji. Story

hints.author: coverup
hints.mnemonic: Abet? Nobody uses that word. Abet is an onomatopoeia for when you stick your fingers down migrating ducks' throats. That's the noise they make as they gag

hints.author: Dustin_Calgary
hints.mnemonic: Bird Criminal!! Wanted for

hints.author: jamiemw

hints.mnemonic: [slacken; loosen; relax; lessen; be moderate; ease] The thread in this story is a cable line, something like a power or phone line. The thread was tense with all the migrating ducks perched on it, but got back to being slackened when the entire flock flew away. (darg_sama-modified,2-11-2005).

hints.mnemonic: When Daffy and Spiderman go rock climbing, Spidey slackens the rope too much, so that when Daffy falls, he slams on the ground. "Your desp-p-p-picable!", he yells.

hints.mnemonic: This kanji is often used like this

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The commando gnats entrusted their mouths to the translators and what came out was "All your base are belong to us!".

It doesn't belong there!" (try to make a vivid picture of whatever object you decide the baby is chewing on - pen, razor blade, drill, Picasso painting, whatever... but be careful so that it doesn't get confused with another primitive.).

hints.author: vengeorgeb
hints.mnemonic: Entrust is to confer trust in someone else. My mouth belongs to you and your secret is safely entrusted with me.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T accidentially stepped on Jiminy Cricket (a brainy insect, with a belt sort of sash to hold his "conscience" badge).

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T accidentally steps on Jiminy Cricket. // Primitive

hints.author: jrkester
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T accidentally the whole Jiminy Cricket.

hints.author: nakome
hints.mnemonic: 禺 is actually a kanji itself, albeit a rarely used one. Despite its several meanings, the most common seems to be a red-eyed, long-tailed, big-headed monkey. Since we already have a primitive that means monkey, I'm going to call this one the long-tailed, talking monkey (borrowing from Heisig a little). STORY

hints.author: findus
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T accidentally Jiminy Cricket.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I was finally able to score an interview with the wisest being around

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: On the road to my interview I accidentally bump into Jiminy Cricket who gives me some good advice.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: I see Jiminy Cricket standing on the side of he road, holding out his thumb. "Where are you going?" I ask. "To a job interview!" he says. Even conscience's are losing their jobs lately!

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: JIMINY CRICKET is on the ROAD doing a promotional tour. He's doing lots of impromptu INTERVIEWS, smoking lots of dope, and having lots of chance encounters with hot groupie bitches.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: "Don't be foolish!" says Jiminy Cricket as he lashes you with his belt. Follow logic, like me, not your heart.

hints.author: redskatz
hints.mnemonic: It'd be foolish to follow Jiminy Cricket's advice in matters of the heart. After all, you never see him around any girl crickets, do you?

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: I know you think it was foolish of me to give my heart to a long tailed monkey 禺, but we have a healthy relationship based on mutual love and trust! ... Okay, maybe we're both just idiots.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Jiminy Cricket has a favorite corner he likes to slip into at The Pinnacle for a long drink.

hints.author: Angrybeez
hints.mnemonic: Oh how the pious fall from their lofty pinnacles! Jiminy Cricket now deals drugs on the street corner.

hints.author: zanzibar
hints.mnemonic: If you behave badly at THE PINNACLE, JIMINY CRICKET will send you to sit in the corner.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Long-tailed monkeys are showing up in every nook and corner of the Acropolis. Thanks to laxxy for the following distinction

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In the corner of the Acropolis lives the famous sooth sayer Jiminy Cricket, who people from all over come to visit to hear their fortune.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: There's a road that's been inverted- it's gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: This reminds me of a cartoon I saw once, perhaps it was with Donald Duck. he is startled and furious when he chases this mountain billygoat further and further up the mountain road, untill the angle is so steep that he finds himself inverted. And falls down, while the goat stands solidly placed inverted and laughs a goaty laughter as Donald plumments and makes that typical Donald shaped cartoon crater at the bottom.

hints.author: lankydan
hints.mnemonic: Mountain goat inverted. Horns stuck in road.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: You see a mountain goat on the road. Suddenly it is hit by a vehicle. The mountain goat somersaults through the air and lands back on the road inverted.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: The mountain goat had been hit by a car and lay inverted on the road.

hints.author: samueruht
hints.mnemonic: A legend says that if you model a mountain goat (with tail and everything) from dirt and leave to the light of the moon on the first day of the month (#2846 朔), the dirt will became flesh. (blackstockc).

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: If you model a mountain goat from "soil" and leave it under the full "moon," it will come to life.

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: Think of a Chia Pet. One of the very first models was a mountain goat made entirely of soil, but it wasn't stable at all. The soil would crack and dry up in sunlight, so the only way to give a soil-based Chia Pet some light was to leave it in the soft glow of the full moon. They were spectacular, but the clay models soon proved to be easier to sell.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Neobeo
hints.mnemonic: The mountain goat, who has the cow as its role model, also tried to jump over the moon. Unfortunately it couldn't even lift itself off the ground.

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: On the first day of the month, all the salmon go upstream, up the road, to the mating grounds.

hints.author: paasan
hints.mnemonic: You accidentally ran over and killed the holy mountain goat on the road. Frightened by the view of the dead body and to save your own body from the angry villagers, you decide to run away from your bloodstained vehicle, jump into the river, and go upstream to hide your tracks.

hints.author: manubear
hints.mnemonic: You decide to go salmon fishing, so you ride a mountain goat to the top of the road. Under the light of the moon, as it's illegal, you catch the salmon going upstream.

hints.author: Puchatek
hints.mnemonic: In this kanji we see a mountain goat that decided to go upstream along a road, but for some reason it will only go upstream when the full moon is up. It's actually stubborn like a mountain goat about not going upstream along the road at any other period of time. The road itself is also very confused about this.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: On the first day of the month the road to go upstream is opened for salmon fisherman.

hints.author: ghinzdra
hints.mnemonic: White mount , Fuji mount , olympus mount whatever ....The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir

hints.author: brose
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This has the same meaning as 丘 , so my "Mount" is a hill with mountain goats on it under a glass canopy. It's obviously an effort by the locals to add some Mount atmosphere to their hill. As a primitive, it has the meaning "sturdy" (really), which Heisig has not used for some reason, but I will. The glass canopy must be pretty sturdy to keep the goats inside (bulletproof glass, I'm sure).

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Goat + belt = S&M goat. Don't think too much on the image or you'll regret it forever. The goat loves the mount and it also loves to mount.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: My Mount is the Mount in Dun Morogh where the dwarven capital of Ironforge nestles inside. At the gates to Ironforge you see a bronze mountain goat guarding the entrance, in glass canopy for visitors to watch. This particular goat is the first goat of king Magni Bronzebeard.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Mount Fuji is completely made up of a metal known as steel.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Sturdy metal is obviously steel (see previous frame).

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: On the trail up Mount Fuji, the curators have put up metal railings for safety in some of the otherwise hazardous parts of the climb. The particular metal they used was stainless steel, so that it wouldn't rust in the rain and snow.

hints.author: nexirae
hints.mnemonic: Steel is the METAL forged in the fires of MOUNT DOOM.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: A giant steel Mecha-Godzilla, made entirely of metal climbs atop Mt. Fuji and lets out a furious roar.

hints.author: Terhorst
hints.mnemonic: Spiderman saves Japan from floating away by tying Mt. Fuji to mainland Asia using a hawser made of web.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: A sturdy thread is equally obviously hawser (heavy rope). (see previous frame).

hints.author: burento5
hints.mnemonic: Easy. In order to climb Mount Fuji you're going to need a strong type of thread, a hawser (heavy rope).

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: After Spiderman landed his ship in Japan and used his webbing as a hawser to tie the boat to the dock, he looked p and caught his first glimpse of the majestic Mt. Fuji.

hints.author: mistamark
hints.mnemonic: Using a thread to climb that Mount. isn't a good idea, you need a hawser.

hints.author: adhmm
hints.mnemonic: Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble.

hints.author: samusam
hints.mnemonic: Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with Mount Fuji. Perhaps this is because it's symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand sabers with Mount Fuji engraved on the blade.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: This is the full character for sturdy, to which saber is added as an example of a sturdy thing. (the true etymology of 岡鋼綱剛 is a bit more messy, but I don't really care, this way it's easy to remember, and isn't far from the truth anyway).

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: Remember the sword in the stone. This is the saber in the top of Mt ---. It's so sturdy almost no one can pull it out.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The most sturdy sabers are made on sturdy Mount Fuji.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this tin can would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The starving horse, stranded on the mountain, is forced to eat a tasty tin can.

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: Mountains can be pretty rough on horses' hooves so it might help to put tin cans on each hoof as an extra horseshoe.

hints.author: Mary_K
hints.mnemonic: By noon, the mountain is covered with tin cans.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: At The Pinnacle, traditional pottery is done by binding up a bunch of tin cans into whatever pot shape desired.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In order the get clay up to the Acropolis for the pottery class, clay is packed into tin cans, bound in huge loads, and lugged up there by some unfortunate soul.

hints.author: dukelexon
hints.mnemonic: Pottery is an obsolete art up in the super-modern Utopia of The Pinnacle ... instead, they bind up everything they need to preserve in high-tech tin cans.

hints.author: jamiemw
hints.mnemonic: At The Pinnacle they refuse to use tin cans and so they have been bound up, they will only use pottery.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This chinese man was making the best china pottery in all of ... China. For some reason he insisted on working at the top of a pinnacle, away from the distractions of the world. He kept in touch with the local people, and took orders, through bound tin cans (tin cans bound with rope, the children's version of the telephone).

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: For the condor primitive

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: I keep swinging gleefuly on the talons of the soaring condor until he slices off my fingers and sends me plummeting.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: I don't recommend using king as a primitive for condor, the stroke order is wrong. Vulture Dry Mountain or even Vulture Two Mountains should work better.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is for tremors and shakes. It perfectly illustrates the good ol' joke of shaking a beverage tin can in your fingers. And then laugh when another person opens the can with his/her nails (claws) and gets totally soaked! (Tin can loses the left stroke because it has no pull tab).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: I am sure you have heard this on the trains in Japan

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Noh chanting?!? I meant "NO CHANTING!" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don't you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting.

hints.author: herman
hints.mnemonic: Picture guy dressed in a condor mask up on stage during Noh performance chanting some words nobody understands.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: In the Andes flies the mythical Noh Chanting condor. You can barely spot this king of birds high up in the sky yet you hear its chanting words flow down to the ground.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: Noh chanting is simply words which sound like that a vulture would make.

hints.author: colinsky
hints.mnemonic: noh chanters chant their words in masks that look like condors (condor = the vulture king of the mountain.).

hints.author: mcbainpc
hints.mnemonic: I'm depressed that this kanji has 29 strokes.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: In the middle of the GROVE you find a TIN CAN. There's a CROWN inside! You are very excited with your finding, but then a figure appears behind you

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: A popular mnemonic device for this character is

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: thecite
hints.mnemonic: Sulky

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: In the capital they have been having hearings concerning bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a chihuahua with one human leg.

hints.author: BigAmish
hints.mnemonic: Ahem...CONCERNING your recent science fair project, it was a CAPITAL idea, but the CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG is freaking out the other contestants!

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Tornadic_Indignation
hints.mnemonic: OBVIOUSLY IT'D BE CONCERNING IF SOME GUY CUT OFF ONE OF HIS CHIHUAHUA'S LEGS AND TRADED IT WITH ONE OF HIS OWN AND THEN POSTED THE PICTURES ON SOME INTERNET FORUM USING ALL CAPITAL LETTERS LIKE THIS WHILE TYPING. I WOULD BE VERY MUCH AFRAID. YES.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In Concerning Hobbits, Tolkien writes about Hobbiton, which is sort of the capital of the Shire. Understandably, they keep chihuahuas as dogs, and one of them has a human leg. Magic, probably.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The soccer player was concerned that his peg leg would affect his ability to kick.

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: It wasn't kick boxing at its finest, me in one corner with my wooden leg and my opponent the chihuahua with one human leg in the opposite corner. Understandably the hoi polloi were fascinated, but how we got a venue in the capital I'll never know.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: We are here concerning your animal cruelty. Because you kicked all the chihuahuas in the capital, we are going to remove your foot as punishment.

hints.author: kumakuma
hints.mnemonic: I kick with my FEET in the CAPITAL of all the ONE LEGGED CHIHUAHUAS. It is such a great fun, since they cannot kick me back! lol.

hints.author: halfdam
hints.mnemonic: The pirate was reading the manual for his new wooden leg, and there was a whole section concerning how to use the wooden leg for kicking.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love).

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver.

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (コン) Skunk and silver appear together in a few kanji so I combined them to make a silver skunk character. This skunk, due to a random fluke, is not black and white, but actually silver colored. Which means this skunk can pass, say for, a cat (aka Over the Hedge). When the skunk realized the odd coloring wasn't a curse but actually a blessing, it realized in it's heart that it could be sociable with all sorts of animals that normally would run away from smelly skunks.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The skunk is very sociable at the party, telling everyone all about his silver heart. // Primitive

hints.author: mentat_kgs
hints.mnemonic: I'm using the top of the kanji as a lawyer

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: It was the groundbreaking of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous skunk, the one with the familiar silver stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the soil very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the groundbreaking was a great success.

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the groundbreaking of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine!

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (コン) The sociable (#1970 懇) silver skunk might not look like a skunk, but when it lets it smell fly, it's so bad it actually leaves craters. That's right - it's groundbreaking.

hints.author: sgrant
hints.mnemonic: Pepe Le Pew's groundbreaking idea to fertilize soil with skunk fumes didn't really take off - the crops grew better than ever before, but nobody could stand the smell.

hints.author: meolox
hints.mnemonic: The silver tailed skunk has discovered a groundbreaking way to make skunks not smell, maybe that's explains why he's so sociable (#1970 懇).

hints.author: abaddon
hints.mnemonic: Skunk, white, human legs

hints.author: Megaqwerty
hints.mnemonic: He counters, "Your legs are so white, all I would have to do is apply some black and they would be the perfect countenance of a skunk!".

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: The shocked countenance on girl's face when Pepe started to hump her white legs.

hints.author: ghinzdra
hints.mnemonic: Anyone who watched a looney tunes cartoon know those kind of scene

hints.author: koohiikun
hints.mnemonic: Pepe LePew's countenance isn't so bad; it's the smell that makes everyone turn white and dash off on their human legs!

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in rabbit (#2093 兎).

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: What is the rabbit's excuse for being such a jerk? Well he was bound up for a whole day while being stepped on by peoples human legs in some make-up labratory. Yeah I think I can excuse him after knowing that.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: ''Excuse me.'' Jessica Rabbit walks past you, bound up in a red sequinned dress in which her voluptuous tatas are sublimely complemented by her long legs.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: The rabbit always thinks that "Trix are for kids!" is a terrible excuse for stealing his breakfast.

hints.author: tinonet
hints.mnemonic: This is a Bugs Bunny with bound up ears and big teeth in the mouth. As you know, he has kinda human legs as well....So he says

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Bugs Bunny eludes Elmer Fudd by pretending to be roadkill.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Word play to differentiate elude/evade

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: I like to maintain the primitive as excuse. Here a speedster is caught trying to elude the police. He stands outside his car bowing over and over saying ご免なさい、ご免なさい、ご免なさい。 | Note

hints.author: b0ng0
hints.mnemonic: A rabbit on the road has a hard time eluding cars.

hints.author: nolusu
hints.mnemonic: At nightfall the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep.

hints.author: Asriel
hints.mnemonic: This is EASY!!! Japanese people see a RABBIT ON THE MOON (http

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Imagine Bugs Bunny halfway sticking out of a rabbit hole, somewhere in Japan, taking in the sun, when all of a sudden, night falls. Our "sun-loving rabbit" burrows his way into the earth and pops out on the other side of the planet (say somewhere in America) and there it is, the sun high and bright in the sky! Thus, whenever it is nightfall you can be sure our "sun-loving rabbit" is taking in the sun somewhere else accross the globe.

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: Bugs Bunny watches the sun go down at nightfall. "Eeeeh...That's all folks!".
