hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Mr. Rabbit watches the sun go down. Nightfall is coming and he hasn't made it to the queen's yet!

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: Notice how BUGS BUNNY's legs (hint about stroke extension) are starting to get big MUSCLES? It must be because he's always EXERTING himself on the run from Elmer Fudd (or from kicking the shit out of Elmer Fudd when he catches up!!).

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: The energizer bunny's exertion of power keeps going and going...

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Bugs Bunny spares himself the exertion of muscle power. Instead, he studies and tricks Fudd every time.

hints.author: Zarxrax
hints.mnemonic: The trix rabbit's latest scheme to get the trix

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow.

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: An animal with huge ears like a rabbit, and a body fat like a pig... ¡An ELEPHANT! For the "phenomenon" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the "elephant man") ( http

hints.author: Thunderball
hints.mnemonic: With huge rabbit ears, and a body fat like a pig, the elephant has an image problem for sure (しょう)! NOTE

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: See book.

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: An elephant has the head and ears of a hare and the body of a pig, at least in proportion.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: The statue of liberty is being replaced by a statue of Mr. T riding an elephant.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: In India, you see a lot of statues of the Hindu god Ganesha. Easy to recognize

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Mr. T is shocke of this bizarre statue of an elephant with rabbits floppy ears and the tails of a sow. I pity da fool who made this bullshit statue. What is it supposed to look like?

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Haruhi made a statue of her riding an elephant for Indian people to worship.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: The famous hachiko statue ( ハチ公像 ) has been replaced by a statue of [insert your person here] riding an elephant causing the outrage of millions of japanese.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: FINALLY!! Geeeeeeeeeez!!!.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 ("noon").

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: 4 dots = 4 limbs, the hook = tail, top part = manes.

hints.author: jotakami
hints.mnemonic: This kanji needs no mnemonic, really. It's used often enough as a primitive that you would have to have Alzheimer's to forget it. If you write each kanji once, as Heisig recommends, then the stroke order will also come naturally.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: The cute little innocent-looking plastic pony on the desk of a student is in fact a trojan horse, hiding phrases in its belly which are used for cheating during an exam. No pony will be permitted on desks during tests!

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: A particular My Little Pony has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like "I love you".

hints.author: Balaam
hints.mnemonic: A phrase used to insult horses - is pony. They hate that.

hints.author: WithLoveFromExIA
hints.mnemonic: Lisa Simpson often utters the phrase "Can I have a pony? Can I have a pony? Can I have a pony?". Finally Marge snaps "No, not until you're older!" "But mum, it will be a horse by then.".

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The Pony Express was a quick mail delivery service in old America. It actually used horses, not ponies, but the phrase "Pony Express" sounded better than "Horse Express", and so they chose the better-sounding phrase as a marketing gimmick.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: We just verification that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan horse. We're just gonna stab it in the belly with this awl to check.

hints.author: raseru
hints.mnemonic: The verification proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here we have a French trojan horse undergoing verification by the British police, or immigration, or other authority. The British police are punching into the trojan horse 's sides with anawl, to try and find if it is concealing people. Of course they aren't going to find much by using an awl for that purpose (the awl having such a short tip), but the sillyness of it should be enough to remember it.

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: Verify the horse is genuine by poking it with an awl.

hints.author: to_nihon
hints.mnemonic: They finally came up with a verification system to make sure that giant wooden horses weren't trojan horses. Frankenstein comes up and slaps the hell out of the side of each wooden horse. If it's hollow and soldiers are discovered inside, the verification process is complete and the trojan horse is destroyed before it's brought into the city.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: If the equestrian team used trojan horses, it would be really strange.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Equestrian events are where you get horses to do strange things.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Equestrian is a strange word that just means horses.

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: I always thought it was STRANGE that EQUESTRIAN was in the Olympics. Why don't we give the HORSES medals? They do all the work.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: The St Bernard with his mouth nailed shut is ready to participate in the equesterian race. But he is sitting on a Torjan horse that wont budge.

hints.author: ithil
hints.mnemonic: Parking in the dark may be difficult...specially if you're parking a trojan horse. To lend you a tiny bit of help, take this candlestick with you, and at least you'll have some light.

hints.author: sweetneet
hints.mnemonic: In the olden days parking lots used to have reserved spaces for where the lord (of the set of houses, shops, whatever) could park his team of horses. nowadays it's pretty much the same...reserved parking in front for the big bosses' cars....

hints.author: laner36
hints.mnemonic: (Heard inside the belly of the trojan horse) "But the sign says No Trojan Horse Parking, m'lord ." (Think monty python skit).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A lord gets valet parking for his horse.

hints.author: zodiac
hints.mnemonic: In the olden days you had to park your horse next to a candlestick, a primitive parking meter that you start by lighting a fire and tracks the time by burning down.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: You have to be craaazzzzyy to drive a buggy led by a team of horses through a ward of Tokyo!

hints.author: cords
hints.mnemonic: Wolverine drives his box by having a horse drag him around. He seems to really be losing it after coming to the homeless ward...

hints.author: Ricardo
hints.mnemonic: [drive; run; gallop; advance; inspire; impel] You thought you were downloading a driving game into your X-Box harddrive, but it was actually a trojan horse!

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: The kiddie uses a mini Trojan horse to drive around the hospital ward.

hints.author: melchan
hints.mnemonic: In this new Xbox game you have to drive a trojan horse through the wards of Tokyo.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Anyone living in Japan knows that train stations play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when horses and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his shakuhachi to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next station.

hints.author: jreaves
hints.mnemonic: This reminds me of those infamous Mexican porn movies in which shakuhachi is performed on a horse. Here the deed is being done at a train station. As the passengers get off, so does the horse.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: I got off at the station and saw a trojan horse getting a shakuhachi (blowjob).

hints.author: melchan
hints.mnemonic: In this train line the wagons are trojan horses and at each station the driver plays a little melody on his shakuhachi to let the passengers know they arrived at the next station. [thanks rtkrtk].

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: A homeless horse playing the flute at the station to make a dime.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The hidden Greeks inside the Trojan Horse are getting boisterous as one of them is bitten in the crotch by a nasty insect. If they don't shut up, the Trojans will hear them...

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: Or more precisely

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: My horse was boisterous because of nasty bugs in his crotch.

hints.author: blackstockc
hints.mnemonic: When a man is hung like a horse his love life often becomes so boisterous that he gets crabs (crotch insects).

hints.author: Apple_Head
hints.mnemonic: You'd be boisterous too if you had a horse-sized bug up your crotch!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The Greek warriors inside the Trojan Horse are complaining about this burdensome plump warrior who is not helping at all (say, just eating candies and watching). - "You know you're such a burden!". Note

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: If a passenger is too plump and heavy, its too burdensome for the horse.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: 太っちゃた馬は駄目だよ！ .

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: HORSES find PLUMP riders BURDENSOME.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: This is going to be burdensome! This Trojan Horse is so plump that it'll never fit thru the front gate! We're going to have to demolish part of our gate to be able to get it inside...It's too burdensome! I say, let's leave it on the beach.

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: You stand in AWE at the 8th WONDER of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: This is another word for surprise. 驚く＝おどろく = surprise. The Trojans stood in awe of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their surprise (wonder) when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed

hints.author: genbaku
hints.mnemonic: The horse wonders why it is being addressed in keigo 敬語 after all it is only a horse.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: A lowly farmer is staring in wonder at a prince and a team of horses who has appeared before him, and uses the flowery phrases beaten into him by a taskmaster ( 敬語 , honorifics) to avoid being beheaded for rudeness.

hints.author: blaked569
hints.mnemonic: I stood in awe as Wonder Woman revealed that she was hung like a horse.

hints.author: DurablePants
hints.mnemonic: A fervent horse doesnt need to be whipped with a bamboo stick during a race, it will go fast by itself.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: A fervent history otaku rebuild the the Trojan Horse. But since he was Japanese, he used bamboo instead of normal wood.

hints.author: ziggr
hints.mnemonic: The fervent soldiers used bamboo for vents to breathe while crammed inside the Trojan horse. —— Using punnery to avoid confusing with ardent (#814 烈).

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Careful

hints.author: SammyB
hints.mnemonic: Imagine a guy in a horse race, the gates go down and all the horses start galloping... except for this one guy, who is sitting on a trojan horse, hitting it fervently with a bamboo stick but it just wont move.

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: In ancient Japan, the most grievous insult was to poke a rival's horse in the eye (consider how rare an expensive a steed was in those days). It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death.

hints.author: SexyMexicanMaid
hints.mnemonic: This time the Trojans take one look at the Trojan horse and say 'ha! the eyes are wonky.' They throw insult after insult at it until a voice from within is heard saying 'we tried our best!'.

hints.author: alucardchuu
hints.mnemonic: In Japan, is is considered insulting to look at someone from atop your horse. You have to step down and face people properly.

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: Slant eye! Horse's ass!

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: "Haha, your eyes are all sideways and your face looks like a horse!" -- how insulting.

hints.author: radical_tyro
hints.mnemonic: Every quarter moon, the cost of a trojan horse rises one quarter by inflation.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: Flesh+quarter=McDonald's quarter pounder. Due to inflation, McDonald's has had to start making quarter pounders out of horse meat.

hints.author: squeaky_lill_mk
hints.mnemonic: Inflation is rampant

hints.author: ikmys
hints.mnemonic: Since antiquity, the rate of inflation has been constant - every month the cost to build a Trojan Horse has risen exactly one quarter. No wonder Trojan Horses are so rare these days!

hints.author: thermal
hints.mnemonic: Due to inflation a quarter of the team of horses had to be sold for meat.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt ( 皮 ) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn't like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a tiger pelt - but things go awry when the tiger promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard).

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Tigger, the tiger, (from Pooh stories) is happy to have found a magic wand. Using it he can bounce up to a the top of a cliff, seven times as high as some human legs could bounce. Tigger thinks "Its great to be a tiger!

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: The 7 very smart magicians were standing on top of a cliff. The 7 very smart magicians wanted to create a tiger. The smart tiger ate 6 and a half magicians, leaving a pair of human legs as a snack for later. The smart tiger hang the pair of human legs on a tiny hook, so that no other predator could reach it. Moral of the story

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: This kanji is symbolic of the tiger Hobbes

hints.author: mezbup
hints.mnemonic: The magic wand on top of the cliff spawned 7 tigers that ate human legs.

hints.author: Piitaa
hints.mnemonic: Captive men are thrown to the tigers. I think you can imagine something else is done to captive women...

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Captive men are thrown to the tigers. Captive women are thrown to the men. (thanks, Piitaa).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: The CAPTIVE men in the movie "Gladiator" were forced to fight TIGERS in a Gladiator Arena.

hints.author: stehr
hints.mnemonic: A capitive tiger in San Francisco leaps out of his pen and kills a man and attacks two others.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Ending up in a tiger's stomach is not good for your skin, as it's full of stomach acids.

hints.author: thairob
hints.mnemonic: TIGGER only has visible SKIN on his STOMACH. The rest of his body is covered in orange fur.

hints.author: fergal
hints.mnemonic: They say, "there's more than one way to skin a cat", but if you try to skin a tiger you might end up in its stomach.

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: Take the stomach (and guts) out of a tiger and you're left with the skin (to use as a rug etc.).

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: When the tiger was autopsied, they cut open his stomach and pulled out a human with only his skin left. It sort of looked like a deflated blow up doll.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: In Japanese folklore there is no hell, but there is the void. There, a row of tigers waits in the blackness to devour those souls who have failed in their spiritual life.

hints.author: Peppi
hints.mnemonic: If you stand in a row of tigers (tiger - you - tiger) there will soon be a void (tiger - void - tiger).

hints.author: inuki
hints.mnemonic: Warning to Sigfreid and Roy

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: When a row of tigers surrounds you, life will feel hollow and void.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: In the book "The Life of Pi", Pi and the tiger are shipwrecked on a rowboat for 227 days. Pi keeps as large a void as possible between them.

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: This is a story about the end of the universe. The universe is turning into a featureless void. There's nothing we can do about it except for throw a fiesta and frolic a little bit before it's all over.

hints.author: nerdjnerdbird
hints.mnemonic: Sigfreid and Roy's contract having been voided, the tiger is free to frolic about at the fiesta.

hints.author: Holmes
hints.mnemonic: The fiesta was void. you go on a frolic of your own.

hints.author: lasercorn
hints.mnemonic: This fietsa has been voided. You'll have find somewhere else to frolic.

hints.author: pm215
hints.mnemonic: 'frolic' to me implies something essentially empty and meaningless. It might look like a fiesta on the surface but somehow there's a void at its centre. (and there's even an 'o' in the middle of the word...).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The dentist couldn't help but feel uneasiness as he used his hand crank mouth tool on the tiger in his chair.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: My dear friend, a Bengali merchant, gave me a tiger as a birthday present. I felt uneasiness, knowing that I'll have to reject it. Or was it horror?

hints.author: Johnnyltn
hints.mnemonic: A tiger overhead would give anyone a feeling of uneasiness.

hints.author: ericjurotich
hints.mnemonic: Tigers give me a feeling of uneasiness.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: I feel a sense of uneasiness about giving this HUGE tiger a steak.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: Real meaning

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: You have to think with prudence about approaching a tiger. If not, it will eat your brains and heart. Thanks raulir.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Dear Prudence, think carefully before you come out to play with the tiger waiting for you ...I know it looks beautiful.

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: You are inside a tiger's stomach. In retrospect, you think maybe you shouldn't have poked the tiger with a stick. Some prudence would have been a good idea. P.S. I think this is a good keyword, as it most often appears in 遠慮 えんりょ which basically means restraint or prudence.

hints.author: hissatsu
hints.mnemonic: To think before approaching a tiger is mere prudence.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A great Indian drama acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the tigers from his pigs using only a sabre.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: If you thought "The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe" was full of drama then you'll love "The Tiger the Sow and the Sword".

hints.author: wingedge
hints.mnemonic: A very sad drama about a little boy and his pigs. You see, a tiger showed up and ate up all his sows (his only source of income), and so the boy had to find the inner courage to go after the tiger with his dad's old rusty saber. Of course the boy dies, very tragic and all. It is a drama after all.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: The friends of 100 Acre Wood decide to put on a play and decide it will be a DRAMA. TIGGER and PIGLET (SOW) will be the stars and engage in a SABRE duel.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: Kermit the frog, in his new drama, "Muppets in Bengal", defends Miss Piggy from a tiger using only a sabre.

hints.author: Hyland1
hints.mnemonic: Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: The "E" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part

hints.author: ezmoreldo
hints.mnemonic: The way to tyrannize a tiger is to stroke it's fur the wrong way with a broom (you don't want to use a comb because he'll eat you.).

hints.author: akrodha
hints.mnemonic: The father tyrannized the kids by keeping a hungry tiger in a box. In fact, one of the kids has already been fed...

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: In "The Ghost and the Darkness", an evil tiger with an E on it's chest tyrannizes the railroad builders. Thanks Hyland1!

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Bambi wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what's the main course?

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: Santa's reindeer, Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a cave. It's popular with all the deer and reindeer in the world. The cave speciality is a salad w/ dressing on the side. There is no other deer club that can compare. How many other deer nightclubs are there?

hints.author: gavin.schultz-ohkubo
hints.mnemonic: See book. No, don't.

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: This is a deer from the Old West. Just compare it to European kind.

hints.author: Stian
hints.mnemonic: Congratulations, you can now spell バカ with kanji; 馬鹿 . ;).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Many deer can be found in the grove at the foot of a mountain.

hints.author: dihutenosa
hints.mnemonic: Deer are well known for frolicking in groves of trees. However, they are not well known for actually watching where the heck they are bounding about. Here we have a bunch of dead deer bodies that you find at the foot of a mountain. You are trying to figure why there are so many dead deer in one spot, and then you trace a line up the mountain - leaves and such are scattered all the way up...to a grove. Looks like they hopped through some leaves to their doom.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: The cave with the deer painting was found at the foot of a mountain hidden behind a grove. That's why it took centuries to discover.

hints.author: gavmck
hints.mnemonic: Deer live in the foothills of mountains where they can hide and shelter in groves of trees. Consequently, you won't find them ABOVE the 'tree line'. Note

hints.author: blannk
hints.mnemonic: Sacred deer live in the grove at the foot of the mountain, foliage so thick that one cannot see the mountain itself.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Picture an ad in which Uncle Jimbo (of "South Park" fame) recommends the latest craze in deer hunting

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: It is recommended that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head ( 白 ) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail.

hints.author: javiergakusei
hints.mnemonic: For tonight's dinner (says the waiter) I would recommend the Deer. It is very special because it has been fed with flowers all it's life, has been killed with a slingshot (so there is no gun powder in it) and right now it is in the cooking fire. The meaning

hints.author: errtu
hints.mnemonic: Wow 2000 baby, almost there doubly happy now.

hints.author: gdaxeman
hints.mnemonic: One deer hunter to another

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In this kanji, "deer" replaces the "head" primitive from the "melancholy" kanji. Poor Ned is feeling melancholy so Uncle Jimbo (of South Park animated series) suggests a good deer huntin' trip to fix that and turn that melancholy into jubilation.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: Bambi was melancholy at the death of his mother, but is now in jubilation as he's made friends with thumper.

hints.author: onsen_monkey
hints.mnemonic: This kanji shows the JUBILATION that accompanies the modern holiday of Christmas. Rather than focus on the MELANCHOLY events of Christ's crucifiction (as we do on Easter), on Christmas we focus on the arrival of RUDOLPH to bring us lots of presents. Oh yeah, I guess there's a small bit of JUBILATION about Christ's birth too, but fuck that shit, I just want presents.

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: Hamlet's melancholy turns at once to jubilation when he discovers that his head has transformed into that of a deer's. No more will human tragedy be his source of suffering!

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: The Jubilation of Haruhi Suzumiya. Here we have Haruhi, from melancholy (#616 憂) of Haruhi Suzumiya feeling so jubilant (for a change) she's wearing an absurd deer mask over her head. (she only needs some horse costume to go with it, and the image of 馬鹿 is complete).

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The anthropologist made an exact deer painting from the cave ceiling on the ceiling of his house. Too bad they're both mediocre. All his wife could say was, "How...lovely.".

hints.author: ghinzdra
hints.mnemonic: Lovely bambi.... pictographe

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: The deer painting is so lovely, when compared to the two mediocre paintings on two sections of ceiling above.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A crocodile with raised eyebrows eyes a lovely deer it might have for dinner.

hints.author: Hujis
hints.mnemonic: A creepy deerophile peers with his beedy eyes over the top of a deers back, and whispers lovely to himself.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Most don't know it, but bears have the ability to walk on fire. They're invincible creatures!

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: captal
hints.mnemonic: Bears have the ability to smell food cooking on a campfire from over 30ks away (true).

hints.author: cgillz34
hints.mnemonic: Smokey the Bear says

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Well, this is obviously the story of Goldilocks, who came to the bear house. She elbows her way in, throws her flesh into a chair, notices the porridge on the oven fire, takes one spoonfull from one plate, then another spoonfull from another plate.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The amputee has no hands but only stumps of flesh beneath his elbows. To give him the ability to eat he has two spoons implanted in his arm stumps, one in each side.

hints.author: Istvan
hints.mnemonic: Kid from the Oracle's place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special ability. When Neo asks to learn this ability the child replies, " Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon." Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. "That's right Neo," the child laughs, "there is no spoon...there are two spoons!".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: This man may have the dis-ability of no flesh below the elbows, but he can eat with 2 spoons, on in each foot.

hints.author: Terhorst
hints.mnemonic: I have the ability to use my elbow flesh to juggle two spoons.

hints.author: activeaero
hints.mnemonic: I have the ability to bend two spoons. I bend one spoon with my elbow and one with my body.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: This guy has an attitude problem – lots of ability, but his heart's not in it.

hints.author: redskatz
hints.mnemonic: Having a good attitude means believing in your heart that you have the ability to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example.

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: If you had the ability to read people's hearts (especially women's hearts), it'd be so easy to find out why they have such an attitude.

hints.author: morganandrew
hints.mnemonic: "It's an attitude problem I'm afraid," says the teacher at parents' evening. "He has the ABILITY to be a great but his HEART is not in it." "What should we do?" says the concerned parent. "Let's try this HEART, shall we?" says the coach, handing over a HEART that will give their child a better attitude.

hints.author: DrJones
hints.mnemonic: Hint

hints.author: chamcham
hints.mnemonic: If you draw the sign of the tiger on the ceiling of your house, you will sprout tiger's legs (animal legs) and be able to run and pounce like the big cats yourself.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: The sign of the tiger is that he's eaten all of the yellow (#1750 黄) salad in the house.

hints.author: skinnyneo
hints.mnemonic: I don't know why but when I read sign of the tiger I get the "eye of the tiger song" stuck in my head. So I see rocky training in his house. Hes hitting the ceiling (no punching bag) eating brussel sprouts to keep in good health and running with only the animal legs his dog.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The zebra, at the first sign of a tiger, jumped into mid-air (#1109 宙). Unfortunately, he was in his house, got stuck in the ceiling, leaving only his legs poking out.

hints.author: violetize
hints.mnemonic: Sung to the theme Survivor (Eye of the Tiger) from Rocky

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: That was some great performance! He caused the water to shoot up into the air and form the sign of the tiger in airborne droplets. You sure missed a great performance!

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: I remember seeing advertisements growing up with the sign of the tiger saying to "Put a tiger in your tank", meaning that it would increase the performance of the drops of gasoline you put in.

hints.author: spoonsman
hints.mnemonic: At the end of Rocky's performances, set to the Eye of the Tiger of course, he was quite exhausted and dumped water all over himself to cool down.

hints.author: ahuvia
hints.mnemonic: Tiger Wood's performance has been watered down by recent scandal.

hints.author: DrWarrior12
hints.mnemonic: You watch a tiger do a flip into a small pool of water at a circus. "What a great performance! I need to get my shirt signed by that tiger," you say to your friend.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee is such a badass he climbed a sheer vertical cliff using only 2 hairpins.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: The kid said "I don't believe you! Dragons don't exist!" so we made a little surprise for him

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: As a primitive I use the image of Bruce Lee .

hints.author: decals
hints.mnemonic: This is the image(sign) of a dragon carved into a cliff face. However, the dragon has no eyes. Legend has it that there are two magical hairpins that can be inserted into the eye sockets to make the dragon come to life.

hints.author: tryllid
hints.mnemonic: Cliff + two + Hairpins

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: During the shooting of one of his first movies in China, Bruce Lee fell through the cheaply built movie set, and into a barrel of glue. As you can imagine, to put Bruce Lee in that position must have caused great embarass to the chinese producer. Note the hints in the story for the position of the primitives.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee is embarrassed when he does a high kick and splits his pants. He has to glue them back together.

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: The sign of the dragon falls off the cliff, to our great embarassment (see sign of the dragon (#2008 辰)) We should have glued it there!

hints.author: Doodsaq
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee was embarrassed when his glue huffing addiction became public.

hints.author: cerulean
hints.mnemonic: Frieza has finally brought together all the Dragon Balls, but he doesn't know how to summon the Dragon.. He's tried everything now, including Gluing the Dragon Balls together, and is starting to feel Embarrassed about the whole thing.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee has magical abilities in his newest movie. He can conjure rain and earthquakes.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: A la Kung Fu Hustle, Bruce Lee descends from the storm and causes an earthquake by smashing the ground.

hints.author: Floatingweed5
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee looks up and sees rain clouds gathering, so he decides to abandon filming and play Quake III instead.

hints.author: Monkeys_Spiders
hints.mnemonic: It is said that earthquakes are caused when Bruce Lee gets rained on, he just hates it and punishes mother earth, punching the ground. The popularity of the legend lead to the kanji meaning anything that quakes.

hints.author: Harrow
hints.mnemonic: Instant mythology

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee shakes the confidence of his opponents by simply waving his fingers in front of them, they know that each of them is a deadly weapon in their own right. Hwwaaaa...

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: Your fingers will be crushed if you shake hands with Bruce Lee.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here someone shakes hands with Bruce Lee and then asks for his fingers back. Note

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee shakes his finger at an opponent who thinks they're a match for him.

hints.author: jabberwockychortles
hints.mnemonic: If you're talking to someone and notice that theirfingers are starting to shake, it's often a sign of the dragon being behind you where the other person can see him coming.

hints.author: adrianbarritt
hints.mnemonic: Any woman spending a night with the virile Bruce Lee is bound to end up with child.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: BRUCE LEE'S WOMAN was WITH CHILD and it really upset her stomach because little Brandon Lee was kicking ass from the inside.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: A woman who is with child can't be sacrificed to the dragon; virgins only need apply.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee can make a woman with child before they even know what happened.

hints.author: Elphalpo
hints.mnemonic: The woman hides the dragon from poachers under her shirt, pretending she's with child. "Seen any sign of the dragon?" ask the poachers. "Nope, haven't seen him," replies the woman.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: I love Bruce Lee dubbing. His lips move, but sometimes words don't come out of his mouth.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee says "Read my lips...", but when I try to, his mouth isn't moving with the dialogue.

hints.author: rich_f
hints.mnemonic: As I approached her lips, I began to sense the sign of the dragon breath coming from her mouth, and I almost fainted.

hints.author: stupiddog
hints.mnemonic: (Positioning) Bruce Lee prefers the lips of his girlfriend's mouth "down below". Lucky bastard!

hints.author: Aeryon
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee comes flying out of nowhere and kicks you right in the mouth... leaving you with fat lips.

hints.author: Immacolata
hints.mnemonic: The most unlikely persons in the world to take up agriculture must be Bender and Bruce Lee. An awkwared moment as they stare on the various farming utensils, hoe, plow. Both with straw hats on and blue overalls, and drawn in Groenigs irrevent style.

hints.author: greenapple
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee is tough. But so is agricultural work. If Bruce took it up, even he would hurt his back from all the bending.

hints.author: DavidZ
hints.mnemonic: (combine Immacolata & mattimus

hints.author: nest0r
hints.mnemonic: It's a good agricultural sign when, as the farmer is bending down, he discovers some plants arranged in the sign of the dragon. It means the weather and earth will be supportive of the crops.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Bruce Lee developed a bend in his back from doing agriculture.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The agriculture of Florida is concentrated on making concentrated orange juice. Just add water! Imagine a can of FCOJ, dumping it into a pitcher and adding water.

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Concentrated water is going to revolutionize the agriculture! Just add water... oh wait...

hints.author: jackhuddleston
hints.mnemonic: History has shown that agriculture usually is concentrated around bodies of water.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Those who work in agriculture like their coffee strong and concentrated to help them wake up at the crack of dawn. Almost any guest to their breakfast table will want to water it down. (adapted from darg_sama, because I like strong coffee).

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: Water extracted from agricultural products makes them concentrated.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: After worshipping the golden calf, God sent the Jews on a long road through the wilderness.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: The problem with the "gold calf" primitive is that the first vertical stroke of "heavenly" is shorter than the second stroke. But as we know, "heavenly" clearly has the FIRST stroke longer, not the second. The primitives we really have here are "animal horns (first 3 strokes)" and "big/dog (last 3 strokes)." What are the BIGGEST ANIMAL HORNS that you can think of? For me its a MASTODON. STORY

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: I couldn't stand the horny St. Bernard any longer, so I escorted it to the road and gave it a send off to go get neutered.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: (note

hints.author: slats70
hints.mnemonic: Primitive

hints.author: Rakushun
hints.mnemonic: The golden calf is sent to the gates of Hell for it's connection to false idols.

hints.author: szreter
hints.mnemonic: There's a weird connection between worshipping the golden calf and visiting the gates of Hell.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: See my story for 2016. The CONNECTION between the GATES OF HELL and MASTODONS is that the GATES were made out of MASTODON horns (b/c they so big and old).

hints.author: spoonsman
hints.mnemonic: At the airport, the woolly mammoth was too big. When he tried to go through his flight's gate he got stuck and missed his connecting flight.

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: Bill Gates and the woolly mammoth gazed longingly at one another. Bill squeezed her hand gently; "Do you feel it? The connection? It's... electric." The mammoth blushed, twinges of anticipation and fear coursing through her heart. Could they really start over? She didn't want to get hurt again, but the connection was still so deep; so real. She looked Bill in the eyes

hints.author: ayoung24
hints.mnemonic: Evil blossoms from the mouths of those who worship the golden calf. (Playing it safe and avoiding the image of a flower completely).

hints.author: spoonsman
hints.mnemonic: It's the circle of life. The woolly mammoth died, but the mammoth's body was able to provide nutrition to the new plants, blossoming out of the mouth of the dead mammoth.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: A horny St. Bernard so desperate, it tries to use the opening in a flower blossom.

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: See my story for 1016. Caveman magic

hints.author: Shibo
hints.mnemonic: Remember that TV show Blossom? It was about a girl with a big mouth and a nose the size of a mastodon's!

hints.author: Matthew
hints.mnemonic: A ghost, or oni, wandering slowly on its human legs, searching for brains to eat. What looks like an elbow here is actually a pictoral representation of the forked tail protruding out of its rear.

hints.author: rgravina
hints.mnemonic: Ghosts aren't very intelligent - they have but a drop of brains - so can't tell the difference between an elbow and a pair of human legs.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: Building on Matthew's excellent image, the drop can be the single horn sticking out of the oni's forehead.

hints.author: raulir
hints.mnemonic: 鬼 (おに) is not a ghost. An ogre or a troll would be a more fitting translation. Such a thing has but a drop of brains and uses its legs and elbows as deadly weapons (a concept which should be familiar from the license (#765 允) to kill). I'll use "ogre" for this.

hints.author: cameron_en
hints.mnemonic: This ghost had only a drop of brains, his legs and elbow were easily visible from under his sheet.

hints.author: Zactacular
hints.mnemonic: The ugly oni can't get a date so he drinks sake by himself at the bar.

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Drink enough whisky and not even an oni looks ugly any more...

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Drinking too much whisky can make you as ugly as an oni.

hints.author: torabi
hints.mnemonic: In the movie 'The Shining', Jack Nicholson is so drunk on whiskey that he doesn't realize the woman he's dancing with is an ugly ghost.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: A demon with a horn and a forked tail enters the bar. Everybody runs away, except one drunken fella who is drinking straight from the whiskey bottle. The demon apporaches him. The fella turns around. While sipping some more whiskey his famous last words

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: When we die, our soul rises up in a ghostlike rising cloud of mist up to heaven (we hope) (Adapted from darg_sama,28-10-2005).

hints.author: romanrozhok
hints.mnemonic: When you die, your SOUL either goes to the RISING CLOUDS (heaven) or to the ONI (hell, the devil).

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: There exists a soul within us all. When we die, our ghost rises up like a rising cloud out of our bodies.

hints.author: WithLoveFromExIA
hints.mnemonic: After death, your soul may go up like a rising cloud, or stay as a ghost.

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: Just as a sidenote, 魂＝だましい , from Katamari Damacy ( 塊魂 ).

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: The witch sold me some hemp that made me see ghosts don't do drugs.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: This modern version of the witch lives in some hippie community. She smokes a lot of hemp, and spends the day talking to ghosts, which not surprisingly appears only to her.

hints.author: shakkun
hints.mnemonic: The witch inhales her special HEMP herb which sends her into a trance state in which she can commune with ONI (or ghosts or demons whatever your fancy).

hints.author: Transtic
hints.mnemonic: This is a WITCH which is making a MAgic potion (this character is read ま and is heavily related to magic). The ingredients? Some hemp and an ogre's corpse. (yuck!).

hints.author: manubear
hints.mnemonic: The witch and the oni sit around smoking hemp. Getting high without a broomstick! ( 魔女 ).

hints.author: phauna
hints.mnemonic: Ghosts have not yet left the world, they must still have a deep fascination with their past life on Earth.

hints.author: bananarama
hints.mnemonic: Even in these modern times our fascination with ghosts has not yet ended.

hints.author: uberclimber
hints.mnemonic: The only people who have a fascination with oni are those that have not yet met one. 魅力 (みりょく)

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Here the "Ghostbusters" founder talks about his fascination for ghosts (picture Dan Arkroyd in the movie if that helps). He says he has a fascination for ghosts ever since he saw one as a teenager. Since then he's been scouring all of the world, trying to capture them on tape, on video... A journalist asks "When will it end ? Aren't you tired of chasing ghosts ?" "Oh no, not yet ! Not until I become a ghost myself anyway !".

hints.author: Green_Airplane
hints.mnemonic: Your fascination with ghosts is because you have not yet seen one. When you do, you'll do your best to get as far from them as possible...

hints.author: Raichu
hints.mnemonic: This word somehow reminds me of a golem... an oni made from soil.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Without any weapons, our only defense was to throw clods of dirt at the advancing zombie horde.

hints.author: joxn_costello
hints.mnemonic: 塊＝かたまり , from Katamari Damacy ( 塊魂 ). Imagine playing Katamari Damacy; on this level you start with a clod of dirt, and roll up demons into it.

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: Easy

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: Remember the whole ghost of Mars debate? When they first took pictures of the Martian soil, the picture looked like it contained a ghost. But later photographs showed it was a mere clod of soil.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for "dragon". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji "imperial dragon". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a slingshot (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot-snake" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor attacked neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment.

hints.author: jackswitch
hints.mnemonic: Fuaburisu's story is incredibly good, but I made it a bit simpler

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: You attack an old dragon 龍 and take his clothes. REF

hints.author: mattimus
hints.mnemonic: You attack the Ancient Chinese dragon 龍 with the help of your fire-proof garment. Ref

hints.author: plumage
hints.mnemonic: Legend of Zelda

hints.author: billyclyde
hints.mnemonic: To upbraid someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tip

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: Halpern's dictionary goes with intimidate, so I'll stick to menacing. The kanji for red ( 赤 ) is usually only fully formed when it is on the left, as in 赦 , so as a primitive, fully red on the left = commie. This kanji is unusual in that the commies (2 of them!) have moved over to the right and taken over this entire kanji. The little mouth on the left is protesting what can only be a pictoral representation of the red menace.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: A father upbraids his daughter for the red lipstick and little red dress. "You're not going out like that!".

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Kanji meanings

hints.author: dwhitman
hints.mnemonic: The king says "Only We are allowed to partake of the flesh of the golden calf.".

hints.author: mspertus
hints.mnemonic: The golden calf is about the difference between monotheism (one king) and paganism (majestic plural). By giving a flesh offering to the golden calf, the rebellious Israelites showed they still believed in the majestic plural.

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: ( 朕はおもしろうない。 We are not amused.) A jester does an act with meat in front of royalty and their pet, the Golden Calf. After a short while, the Calf looks at the royalty and then back at the jester

hints.author: Rooboy
hints.mnemonic: The queen is not happy. "We (majestic plural) are not amused that the hunger for the flesh of the wooly mammoth has caused it's extinction. Poor Charles is particularly upset.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: God and Moses take one look at the masses who are engaged in sinful activities, such as bearing their flesh and worshiping the golden calf, and say, in the majestic plural, "We are not amused.".

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: (This is atmosphere as in ambiance, mood). Rain is only part of the atmosphere for a romantic porch date. Food, music, and candles are the rest.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: The part of the sky that is responsible for weather and rain is known as the atmosphere. It only occupies part of the sky though.

hints.author: bihzad
hints.mnemonic: The rain isn't a bad thing--it provides a part of the romantic atmosphere.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Rain plays a big part in the atmosphere of an event.

hints.author: igordesu
hints.mnemonic: Our rain only comes from part of the atmosphere at the bottom called the troposphere.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: You've entered in a chinese shop where apparently the only item in sale is old, dusty, hardened bamboo (for construction for example). It looks like these items have been there forever. Asking the clerk if anything else is available, he doesn't understand and instead asks - "Two items? Three items?" (the kanji is a counter for items) - thinking you want to buy something.

hints.author: Virtua_Leaf
hints.mnemonic: Dragon Quest - You find a hardened bamboo stick, perfect for a weapon, but you can't pick it up because your items are full.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: When I checked the items on the shopping list my wife gave me, I did a double take when i saw hardened bamboo. What the hell kind of item is that and what could she want with it?

hints.author: dtcamero
hints.mnemonic: When she saw my BAMBOO HARDEN we became an ITEM.

hints.author: BooBooQ88
hints.mnemonic: Bamboo ITEMS will become hard and brittle over time.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Tempering should be done with the metal facing east. (If not, the metal may pick up the earth's magnetic field).

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: In the East, especially Japan ...there are masters of tempering metal to great strength....on the Spring of Trivia show in Japan I saw how a Japanese sword ...actually split flying bullets...all because of special Eastern tempering techniques.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: The old sword smiths of the East were rightly famous. The secret of course was in how they tempered the metal.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Tempering metal in the East... sounds like Pittsburgh to me! After all, Pittsburgh is a city in the eastern region of the US and is famous for steel working, or tempering of metal.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: The tempering of metal was mastered in the East for the making of swords.

hints.author: Weber
hints.mnemonic: You must abide by the revered rules of the road! No devil's brew and stay glued to your lane in the road!

hints.author: furrykef
hints.mnemonic: Even the most revered person must still abide by the rules of the road -- no exceptions are granted to anyone.

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: The revered sins of horniness, whiskey, and sniffing glue must be discarded if you are to abide by the righteous, but difficult, road.

hints.author: chibimizuno
hints.mnemonic: The revered chieftain says to abide by his rules or hit the road!

hints.author: richcoop
hints.mnemonic: Abide by the rules of the REVERED one as you make your pilgrimage on the ROAD.

hints.author: thermal
hints.mnemonic: Hey, screw you! Don't you look down on me! I have the ability to quit anytime I want!

hints.author: takoman
hints.mnemonic: (no important on yomi) When I gamble, my mind's eye has the ability to "know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em, know when to walk away." That last bit is the most important part for any successful gambler - knowing when to quit.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Clint Eastwood as Dirty Harry

hints.author: dtcamero
hints.mnemonic: I won't QUIT studying until my EYES have the ABILITY to read kanji!

hints.author: johnzep
hints.mnemonic: sauron doesn't have the ability to quit being evil.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The game characters from Worms sleep in their barracks at night.

hints.author: wingedge
hints.mnemonic: Earthworm jim sleeps in a barracks because he is a soldier... apparently.

hints.author: taijuando
hints.mnemonic: drop your shovels and put them neatly on the hooks...it's time to head back to the barracks ...now move it!!!!!!!!

hints.author: Codexus
hints.mnemonic: Obviously, the barracks are where the maggots are

hints.author: kanjihito
hints.mnemonic: The barracks were crawling with earthworms.

hints.author: jaresty
hints.mnemonic: Moreover is a literary term to shelve what you had just been talking about, to come back to it later.

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: Same as darg_sama. Play on words. I imagine visiting someone who has an impressive collection of medals and trophies (chess champion, for example). After spending an hour showing you all the trophies in the glass shelf, you think "Whew! It's over." ... but the person says "... and wait, there's "moreover" !", pointing at more trophies lined atop the glass shelf.

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Shelves are useful for storing things, and moreover they are responsible for splattering the brains of monarchs on tatami mats.

hints.author: Boeso
hints.mnemonic: I love Ikea SHELVES. "MOREOVER here please!" I shout to the assistant at the store so I can put all my new Japanese texts into them!

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: Imagine an impossibly pedantic rulekeeper (e.g. a judge, or a teacher, or a parent) who is lecturing you about everything you have done wrong. He stands before the bookshelf of rule books and starts at the bottom, pulling out a book. "First of all, you did this wrong," he says, pointing at a rule in the first book. "Moreover," he says, pulling out the next book, "you also did this wrong." Moreover, and moreover, and moreover, he continues, pulling out each rulebook in turn and pointing out your errors.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Let wooden goods = furniture. Then

hints.author: vosmiura
hints.mnemonic: Take seaweed (water + flower) and hang it to dry in a tree to produce nori goods.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: Seawood is the flower of the ocean. When you pile as goods on a pallet they drip water.

hints.author: darg_sama
hints.mnemonic: Goods + wood = paper. You know how nori, ie

hints.author: MeisterLlama
hints.mnemonic: Real seaweed serves as furniture for all the sea creatures.

hints.author: dingomick
hints.mnemonic: The samurai sits on the altar and watches the slave rake rice all day.

hints.author: joesan
hints.mnemonic: The samurai from goodwill (#1097 款) maintains his good mood on his wedding day. He tells his slave that he can keep all rice (used for confetti) that he rakes up after the ceremony. Generous Man!!

hints.author: playadom
hints.mnemonic: The samurai sits on the altar and watches the slave sieve rice through a sieve all day.

hints.author: woelpad
hints.mnemonic: This is what happens if you anger the gods by jumping up and down the altar (see goodwill (#1097 款)). The samurai is apprehended (apprehend (#1160 逮)), turned into a slave and made to sieve grains of rice all day, as a punishment for losing his sanity (ease/sane (#1159 康)).

hints.author: Nukemarine
hints.mnemonic: Hmm, SAMURAI and ALTAR makes a good primitive called PALADINS (or Knights Templar if that's your thing). SIEVE was already set up. So, the PALADINS went on a quest to the holy land, there they caught in a SIEVE set by the moors and became SLAVES in the holy land (picture Costner at the beginning of Robin Hood).

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: At the butcher's meeting, all the butcher's who have a heart disease attend the faith healing workshop.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: Note

hints.author: Hinode
hints.mnemonic: (Think rpg!) We were in dire need of healing. Our party was fighting the cavemen, but we didn't fare too well. It was more like a butcher's meeting than a fight... just as they were about to pierce my heart, luckily a priest came along and used his healing spell in the nick of time (#2433 愈).

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: Healing from sickness often comes just in the nick of time (#2433 愈), especially during boss battles.

hints.author: theasianpleaser
hints.mnemonic: A caveman healing butchers with heart disease by pulling their hearts out.

hints.author: mantixen
hints.mnemonic: If you find a jewel with the imperial seal on it, just let it be. You wouldn't want to be accused of stealing the royal family jewels.

hints.author: CharleyGarrett
hints.mnemonic: This aquatic mammal belongs to the emperor, so it's an imperial seal. Nobody is allowed to mess with it. They have to let it be wherever it wants to go. You can spot it from the other seals by the jewel studded collar around the neck of the imperial seal, but above all, remember to let it be.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: You might not like the imperial seal but the boss man designed it himself so it's a jewel that you should just let be. This is apparently the only 常用漢字 not included in RTK1.

hints.author: astridtops
hints.mnemonic: The imperial seal is carved from a big jewel. The emperor uses it to seal new laws, while positioned over it, saying "Let it be".

hints.author: kapalama
hints.mnemonic: 剣璽 , 璽符 , 御璽 , 国璽 , 玉璽 , imperial seal (#2075 璽)ジ( 爾 ) ... Parts

hints.author: RoboTact
hints.mnemonic: Right part

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: The top right primitive appears in Remembering the Kanji, Volume 3

hints.author: rtkrtk
hints.mnemonic: In an effort to appease the hideous monster from the black lagoon, nearby villagers grind up tail feathers of local birds in a mortar and sprinkle the powder in the water, in a primitive magic ritual that they hope will appease the monster. Note the first drop before the tail feathers, as the hook stroke of tail feathers always requires a vertical-like stroke to attach to (compare with do, bird).

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: While visiting Niigata ( 新潟 ) I come across a lagoon and notice big splashes of water occurring every few seconds. It is their mortar-throwing contest where they bind up a mortar with tail-feathers (to make it fly better) and then see who can throw it furthrest across the lagoon.

hints.author: ellasevia
hints.mnemonic: PRIMITIVE

hints.author: ergerg
hints.mnemonic: How about a rusty cinnabar colored dilapidated boat, found abandoned somewhere. The smoke-stack and the keel have fallen off...

hints.author: CountPacula
hints.mnemonic: Rusty old boat with the bottom and top missing.

hints.author: harusame
hints.mnemonic: I always remember Cinnabar Island from Pokemon. Ash finds himself stranded on Cinnabar Island. He comes across an abandoned, rust-colored boat (#1868 舟) on the beach which is clearly falling apart

hints.author: aircawn
hints.mnemonic: Under a glass canopy, one drop of cinnabar is shown to the young chemists. Cinnabar is a source of mercury and should not be exposed to the same air that we breathe.

hints.author: synewave
hints.mnemonic: Inspired by Philip K Dick (and Immacolata) - Stay inside the Glass canopy (Total Recall) and don't risk breathing one drop of Mars (the cinnabar planet) "air". Also there is a milk factory near me called 丹那 （たんな）and we all know that they put various たんins (tanin makes me think of a rust colour) and other various chemicals into the milk we drink!

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: Pictograph of a stanchion, which includes two vertical posts to restrain cows so they can be milked, with a horizontal stroke showing the number of cows per stanchion

hints.author: Filip
hints.mnemonic: 77 cows behind a fence.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: There's no sign of the cow. She saw those daggers – two of them – and ran off.

hints.author: furrykef
hints.mnemonic: (Slight adjustment of raseru's story.) You pull out two 二 daggers 刀 and carve this sign of the cow into the poor cow. Hint

hints.author: Perry
hints.mnemonic: No sign of the cow, because the 7 Samurai ate her.

hints.author: FooSoft
hints.mnemonic: The sheep is ashamed of it's sheepish nature, and dons the sign of the cow as a disguise.

hints.author: NeoGlitch
hints.mnemonic: Once I 到 to this 所 (TWICE!!) I 思 that Heisig and Sienko would 賀 and 擁 me, that Fabrice would 呉 me a 賞 , and that 皆 would 祝 with 楽 and 鮨 ... but 却 these 三 guys 結 me up 中 a wool 俵 stamped with the sign of the 牛 , and 孟 to 舞 and 歌

hints.author: eri401
hints.mnemonic: They said the woolen sweater I donned made me look like a cow - like I was the very sign of the cow (#2040 丑). I've never been so humiliated in my life. 恥ずかしい (P); 羞ずかしい 【はずかしい】 含羞 【がんしゅう】 (n) shyness.

hints.author: HolyKotor
hints.mnemonic: [+melchan] The sheep was humiliated by being branded with the sign of the cow (which is a major insult to anyone, even sheep) and tries to cover it up with it's wool.

hints.author: johnskb
hints.mnemonic: You know how missing childrens' pictures often appear on milk cartons? Well here we have a missing hare. His concerned family is having his picture printed on the backs of receipts and even on stamps. So far, however, there has been no SIGN OF THE HARE.

hints.author: FudoMyo
hints.mnemonic: rabbit ears.

hints.author: mcfate
hints.mnemonic: Identical to egg, without the "yolks." Both hares and eggs are used for Spring celebrations because they are symbols of fertility.

hints.author: TheSlakey
hints.mnemonic: The sign of the hare is an Easter Bunny, with it's eggs that have no yoke (instead, they have candy).

hints.author: fuaburisu
hints.mnemonic: In this version of the story of the "Turtle and Rabbit Run a Race", the rabbit stops on his way to a shop where they sell stamps, just meters away from the finishing line. In the shop, the rabbit quickly forgets about time and spends hours looking at stamps, finally after choosing a good hundred stamps to buy, he receives a very long receipt, and pays for them. He leaves the shop with stamps in one hand and the receipt in the other, and you guessed it... the turle won the race.

hints.author: phauna
hints.mnemonic: Haha! If you are reading this then I beat you. You went too slow, browsed the forum too long, or stayed out too late with your Japanese girl/boyfriend, whilst I, Kanji Master (you may call me 'sir'), sat alone in my room with a leaky pen and a clawed grip. All your kanji are belong to me, Heisig. And just remember; I beat you.

hints.author: Sleepyhead
hints.mnemonic: The 巳 nd!!! =D.

hints.author: Katsuo
hints.mnemonic: The snake likes stealing pieces from mosaics, so if you notice your mosaic has a piece missing, that’s a sign of the snake.

hints.author: andresito
hints.mnemonic: From now on THE SIGN OF THE SNAKE means YOUR SUCCESS on staying until the end, no matter difficulties or headaches, enjoyed more creative dreams, became a close fan of Mr. T and being accomplished. The journey of mastering the kanji begins here. Add a +star to everybody here ^^.

hints.author: wasurenaide
hints.mnemonic: I was kinda expecting balloons to fall from the ceiling when i got here...
